bill_summary: The bill grants civil immunity to school staff members who intervene in student altercations or disturbances, protecting them from liability unless their actions are grossly negligent or intentionally harmful.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: School staff members, students, schools
innovative_summary: The bill provides legal protections to school staff for intervening in student conflicts, which is a standard legal immunity action, not an innovative technology-based approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may improve school safety and environment.

Title: Landlord and Tenant - Notice of Utility Bills in Residential Leases - Gas and Electric Services
Synopsis: Adding gas and electric utility services to the types of services for which landlords of buildings that contain six or more residential units are required to provide a written notice to a tenant, before the initiation of a lease and each term thereafter, notifying the tenant of the total utility costs billed to the landlord in the immediately preceding year, disaggregated by utility type; and applying certain requirements relating to payment of utility services to landlords of buildings that contain five or fewer residential dwelling units.
bill_summary: This bill requires landlords in Maryland to accept financial assistance from the Office of Home Energy Programs for tenants' utility costs, provide tenants with utility cost information, and provide utility bill documentation to tenants upon request. It applies to buildings with five or more units and aims to ensure tenants receive proper notice and support regarding utility bills.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Tenants in Maryland, especially those in multi-unit buildings receiving utility assistance
innovative_summary: The program employs data sharing and assistance models to improve utility bill transparency and access to financial aid, incorporating a proactive approach from landlords.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by helping low-income tenants manage utility costs and prevent utility disconnections.

Title: Condominiums - Sales Contracts - Asbestos Disclosure
Synopsis: Establishing the unenforceability of contracts for the sale of condominium units that do not contain a statement by the vendor or unit owner as to whether the vendor or unit owner has actual knowledge of the presence of asbestos in the condominium, including a description of the location of the asbestos, whether abatement has been performed, and the date of any abatement.
bill_summary: The bill requires condominium sale contracts in Maryland to include notices about the presence of asbestos, including details about asbestos location, abatement, and whether the condominium or unit owner has actual knowledge of asbestos. It also establishes the unenforceability of sale contracts that lack these disclosures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or relevant real estate regulatory agency
stakeholders: Condominium unit owners, prospective buyers, real estate agents, and condominium associations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific asbestos disclosure requirements into condominium sale contracts, ensuring transparency and safety information for buyers, which is a targeted legal transparency measure rather than employing new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on real estate disclosures related to asbestos in condominiums; it does not directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: Public Employee Relations Act â€“ Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of the Public Employee Relations Act, including adding the definition of interested employee organization, altering the timing of exclusive representative access to new employees, clarifying the responsibilities of certain deputy directors, and clarifying the process for certain investigations of unfair labor practices.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to the Public Employee Relations Act in Maryland, including updates to definitions, procedures for notices related to collective bargaining, and the roles of deputy directors responsible for labor relations in various sectors.
responsible_party: Public Employee Relations Board (PEER)
stakeholders: Public employees, public employers, employee organizations, and the Public Employee Relations Board in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing procedures and definitions within the state's public employee relations framework; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty, focusing instead on labor relations procedures.

Title: Health Occupations Boards â€“ Reciprocal Licensure and Certification
Synopsis: Authorizing certain health occupations boards to adopt regulations establishing reciprocity for individuals licensed or certified in another state.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes health occupations boards in Maryland to establish reciprocal licensure and certification processes for individuals licensed or certified in other states with similar requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland health occupations boards
stakeholders: Licensed or certified health professionals seeking reciprocity in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formalized reciprocity process, simplifying licensure for out-of-state professionals, which is a relatively new approach in licensing regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty as it pertains to professional licensure processes.

Title: Tobacco Tax Stamp Refunds - Loss Due to Theft
Synopsis: Authorizing a claimant who buys tobacco tax stamps to receive a refund for tobacco tax stamps affixed to stolen property; requiring the claimant to provide the Comptroller with certain documentation when making a claim for a refund; and providing for a fine for making a false claim of double the amount of any tax refund in addition to any other authorized penalties.
bill_summary: The bill allows claimants who purchase tobacco tax stamps to receive refunds if the stamps are stolen, provided they submit police reports and affidavits, and if they return any recovered stolen stamps. It also establishes penalties for false claims.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Tobacco tax stamp purchasers and law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new process for claiming refunds for stolen tobacco stamps, incorporating police reports and affidavits to validate claims.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting tax stamp purchasers and law enforcement procedures.

Title: Medical Records - Destruction - Notice and Retrieval
Synopsis: Extending the time period from 5 to 7 years during which a health care provider is prohibited from destroying medical records and laboratory and X-ray reports; requiring that the notice required to be provided regarding the destruction of medical records be made to the last known e-mail address of the patient or the parent or guardian of a minor; requiring a health care provider to make a medical record available for retrieval by a patient or a parent or guardian of a minor within a certain time period and at a certain location; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the time period during which health care providers are prohibited from destroying medical records and reports, requires notification and patient access procedures for record destruction, and clarifies regulations and penalties related to record destruction.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Patients, guardians, health care providers, medical facilities
innovative_summary: The program mainly updates legal and procedural rules for record destruction, with some emphasis on notification and access, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's scope is primarily administrative and legal, with minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Charles County Board of Education - Vacancy Procedures - Timing and Video Streaming and Archiving
Synopsis: Requiring the Charles County Board of Education to fill a vacancy on the county board within 90 days after the vacancy occurs; authorizing the Board to choose not to fill a vacancy that occurs in an election year for a seat that is vacant; and requiring the county board to make publicly available through its website live video streaming and complete video recordings of public meetings during which the county board conducts interviews of applicants for a vacancy on the county board.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Charles County Board of Education to fill vacancies within 90 days, unless it's an election year, and requires the board to publish information about applicants and meetings online, including live streaming and archived videos.
responsible_party: Charles County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, residents of Charles County, educational community
innovative_summary: The bill employs transparency measures like live streaming and online archives of interviews and meetings, modernizing public access to board processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on transparency and timely appointment processes can improve responsiveness and accountability, indirectly supporting children and students.

Title: Medical Records - Fees - Attorneys Representing Patients
Synopsis: Adding an attorney representing a patient to the list of individuals to whom a health care provider is prohibited from charging a fee for providing copies of a medical record that will be used for the purpose of filing a claim regarding or appealing a denial of Social Security disability income or Social Security benefits.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits health care providers from charging fees for copies of medical records requested by an attorney representing a patient when the records are used to file or appeal Social Security disability claims or benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or healthcare providers
stakeholders: Patients, attorneys, legal representatives, and individuals applying for Social Security disability benefits
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific exemption from medical record copying fees for attorneys representing patients in Social Security disability claims, providing a targeted legal aid-related benefit.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could indirectly help impoverished individuals by making legal access easier when dealing with Social Security benefits, which are crucial for low-income families.

Title: Homeowners' and Homestead Property Tax Credits - Application Filing Deadline - Extension
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to accept an application for the homeowners' property tax credit submitted by a homeowner within 3 years after April 15 of the taxable year for which the credit is sought if the homeowner is enrolled in the Homeowner Protection Program; and providing for the calculation of the homestead property tax credit for certain homeowners under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill extends the deadline for homeowners enrolled in the Homeowner Protection Program to apply for the Maryland homeowners' property tax credit, especially targeting seniors over 70 who were eligible in previous years but failed to file timely applications.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Homeowners over 70, especially those enrolled in the Homeowner Protection Program, and eligible senior homeowners
innovative_summary: The bill employs a broad interpretation of eligibility for prior year claims, allowing certain seniors to retroactively qualify for property tax credits and adjusting taxable assessments, thus providing a new approach to tax credit application deadlines.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may have an indirect impact on child poverty by reducing financial burdens on seniors, potentially freeing resources for families and children.

Title: Common Ownership Communities - Electric Vehicle Recharging Equipment (Electric Vehicle Recharging Equipment Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Altering certain requirements for procedures relating to electric vehicle recharging equipment; establishing requirements and procedures relating to an application to the governing body of a cooperative housing corporation to install or use electric vehicle recharging equipment; and requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to publish information on its common ownership community website regarding requirements, contractor information, certain points of contact, and resources on dispute resolutions.
bill_summary: This bill updates rules and procedures for installing electric vehicle recharging equipment in common ownership communities such as condominiums, cooperatives, and homeowners associations. It requires the Department of Housing and Community Development to provide information online and clarifies approval processes, insurance requirements, and responsibilities for members and owners.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents of common ownership communities, electric vehicle owners, communities' governing bodies
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies existing legal and procedural frameworks to accommodate electric vehicle recharging infrastructure, with some emphasis on online resources and transparency. It does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly focusing on infrastructure and legal procedures related to electric vehicle recharging.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Driver's Licenses, Learner's Instructional Permits, and Identification Cards
Synopsis: Exempting certain applicants for identification cards who present certain documentation from the issuance fee for the identification card; extending the term of certain learner's instructional permits from 180 days to 1 year after the date of issuance; and establishing that certain driver's licenses issued to certain holders by the Motor Vehicle Administration remain in full force and effect during an absence from the State.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's vehicle and identification laws, including exempting some applicants from ID card fees, extending learner's permit validity, and allowing certain drivers' licenses to remain valid during military or federal service absences.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Applicants for Maryland identification cards and drivers, especially military and federal employees, young people participating in state programs, and individuals with disabilities or certain qualifying conditions.
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates existing laws; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a limited but positive potential to impact child poverty by easing access to identification for certain vulnerable groups.

Title: Local Government â€“ Annual Audit Reporting Requirements â€“ Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring 20% of certain State aid for highway user revenues and disparity grants to be discontinued if a county, municipality, or special taxing district does not submit a certain audit report within 2 calendar years after the deadline for the report, subject to a certain condition; and applying the Act beginning with the fiscal year 2024 audits that are required to be submitted under certain provisions of law.
bill_summary: The bill modifies reporting requirements for local governments in Maryland, including deadlines for financial reports and audits, and specifies that failure to comply can result in discontinuation of certain types of state aid until reports are submitted.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Legislative Services and Maryland Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Counties, municipalities, and special taxing districts in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing reporting rules and enforcement mechanisms for local government audits and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but could indirectly impact public services funded through state aid.

Title: Department of State Police - Professional Occupations - Application Process
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of State Police to determine the manner and format for applications for certification as a private detective, security guard, security systems technician, and railroad police officer and for a license to provide security guard services; altering the application requirements related to security guard agency, private detective agency, and security systems agency licenses and commercial general liability insurance; requiring an applicant for a special police commission to submit two sets of fingerprints; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modernizes the application and renewal processes for various professional credentials related to private security, detective, and police officers in Maryland, including fingerprinting, background checks, and insurance requirements, and sets rules for staggered license and certification terms.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police
stakeholders: Private security professionals, security agencies, police officers, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs technological enhancements like electronic notifications and digital fingerprint formats, but primarily updates procedural rules without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty, as it mainly updates licensing procedures for security and police roles.

Title: Vehicle Towing or Removal - Insurer of Record - Electronic Notification
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who undertakes the towing or removal of a vehicle from a parking lot to notify the insurer of record electronically if that form of notice is agreed to by the tower and the insurer of record in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes tow companies to notify insurers of record electronically after towing a vehicle, if both parties agree in writing or electronically.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant towing regulatory agency
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, insurance companies, towing companies in Maryland
innovative_summary: Allows electronic notification of insurers of record, increasing flexibility and efficiency in communication.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily involves procedural updates for towing and insurer notification.

Title: Hospitals - Care of Infants After Discharge (Safe Sleep Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring a hospital, as soon as practicable before discharging an infant after the birth of the infant, to provide oral and written resources to the parent or legal guardian; requiring a hospital, before discharging an infant, to ask the parent or legal guardian to describe the sleep environment that will be provided at home; requiring, by January 1, 2025, each hospital to establish a process for providing resources and information about safe sleep environments to parents and legal guardians of infants;  etc.
bill_summary: The Safe Sleep Act of 2024 requires Maryland hospitals to provide educational resources and obtain confirmation from parents or legal guardians about safe sleep practices for infants before discharge. It also mandates the development of resource lists and record-keeping to promote safe sleep environments for infants after hospital discharge.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Parents and legal guardians of infants, hospitals, newborns in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive educational and resource provision program for safe infant sleep, including confirmation processes and resource lists, employing a structured approach to reduce infant sleep-related deaths.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has some potential to impact child poverty by promoting safe sleep environments, which may reduce health disparities associated with infant mortality.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Disabled Veteran Registration Plates - Issuance
Synopsis: Authorizing the Motor Vehicle Administration to issue certain special disabled veteran registration plates to disabled veterans who are between 50% and 99%, inclusive, service-connected disabled as designated or classified by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs; prohibiting the Administration from charging certain persons the fee required for replacement registration plates under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to issue special disabled veteran registration plates to certain qualifying disabled veterans and limits fees for replacement plates.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Disabled veterans and vehicle owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program provides specialized registration plates for disabled veterans but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Human Services - Food Supplement Program and Human Services Careers Scholarships - Alterations
Synopsis: Making technical and clarifying changes to the administration of certain food supplement benefits for children; authorizing the Department of Human Services to use certain funding to provide certain matching funds to a county to supplement certain benefits and to offset certain administrative costs; altering certain eligibility and certain requirements for the Pilot Program for Human Services Careers Scholarships; and authorizing the Maryland Higher Education Commission to prorate scholarship repayment under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill makes changes to the administration of food supplement benefits for children and the Pilot Program for Human Services Careers Scholarships. It increases funding for food supplements, allows the use of funds to provide matching benefits to counties, and modifies scholarship service obligations and repayment rules for students in human services careers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Children receiving food supplement benefits, students pursuing careers in human services, Maryland families
innovative_summary: The bill introduces collaborative funding mechanisms and extends scholarship service obligations in the human services sector, employing a coordinated approach across agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly reduce child poverty by increasing access to food benefits and supporting careers in human services.

Title: Eastern Shore Code Counties - Maximum Hotel Rental Tax Rate - Alteration
Synopsis: Increasing, from 5% to 6%, the maximum hotel rental tax rate that counties in the Eastern Shore class of code counties may impose.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the maximum hotel rental tax rates that certain counties in Maryland, especially on the Eastern Shore, can impose. It establishes new limits for these rates and updates the rules based on county classifications.
responsible_party: Local Government agencies in Maryland
stakeholders: Tourists, residents, and local businesses in Maryland counties, especially those affected by hotel tax rates
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a standardized adjustment of maximum hotel rental tax rates based on county classifications, streamlining how local governments set these rates.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily adjusts tax rate limits without explicitly funding social programs.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Personal Care Aides - Wage Reports
Synopsis: Requiring residential service agencies to submit certain reports to the Maryland Department of Labor regarding wage rates for personal care aides on or before September 1 each year, beginning in 2025; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to report to certain committees of the General Assembly by the 180th day after the release of the final federal Ensuring Access to Medicaid Services rule on an overview of the final rule and plans or steps that the Department will take to operationalize the rule.
bill_summary: The bill requires residential service agencies to annually report wage data for personal care aides to the Maryland Department of Labor and mandates the Maryland Department of Health to analyze reimbursement rates, compare them to actual costs, and report findings and recommendations to legislative committees every two years, to improve Medicaid personal care services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Personal care aides, residential service agencies, Medicaid recipients
innovative_summary: The bill employs regular reporting and data analysis to inform policy adjustments, integrating workforce wage reporting with reimbursement rate assessments and federal rule compliance, representing a data-driven, adaptive approach to Medicaid services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty by improving wages and benefits for personal care workers, potentially leading to better healthcare and economic stability for families.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Speed Limits - Establishment
Synopsis: Authorizing Anne Arundel County and municipalities in Anne Arundel County to decrease the maximum speed limit to not less than 15 miles per hour on highways after performing an engineering and traffic investigation; and prohibiting Anne Arundel County and municipalities in Anne Arundel County from implementing a new speed monitoring system to enforce speed limits on highways on which the speed limit has been reduced under the Act.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Anne Arundel County and its municipalities to reduce speed limits on highways after conducting an engineering and traffic investigation. It also prohibits the use of speed monitoring systems to enforce these reduced limits.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Department of Transportation or local municipal transportation agencies
stakeholders: Residents and drivers in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted approach to speed regulation by allowing local agencies to reduce speed limits based on engineering investigations and explicitly bans the use of speed enforcement cameras on these lowered limits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on traffic regulation does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Public Safety - Missing Persons - Purple Alert Program
Synopsis: Establishing a Purple Alert Program to disseminate information to assist in locating a certain missing person who has a cognitive impairment, mental disorder, intellectual or developmental disability, or brain injury; requiring the Department of State Police to adopt guidelines and develop procedures for issuing a Purple Alert; and authorizing the Department to consult with relevant stakeholders representing citizens with disabilities to develop procedures for the program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Purple Alert Program in Maryland to help locate missing persons with certain cognitive impairments, mental disorders, developmental or intellectual disabilities, or brain injuries, who are at risk and not covered by the existing Silver Alert system.
responsible_party: Department of State Police
stakeholders: Individuals with cognitive impairments, mental disorders, intellectual or developmental disabilities, brain injury, their caregivers, law enforcement agencies, and the general public
innovative_summary: The program leverages rapid dissemination of information through alerts and involves collaborations with media, volunteer groups, and educational institutions, employing a multi-sector approach to locating at-risk missing persons.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may assist vulnerable children if they are within the at-risk groups targeted by the program.

Title: Unemployment Insurance - Work Search Requirement - Exemption for Federal Civilian Employees During a Federal Government Shutdown
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of Labor to exempt a federal civilian employee who has been furloughed from the requirement to be actively seeking work for unemployment insurance benefits eligibility if, during the furlough, the employee remains able to work, available for work, and work-attached.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Secretary of Labor to exempt federal civilian employees from the work search requirement for unemployment insurance benefits during a federal government shutdown, provided they remain able and available to work.
responsible_party: Maryland Secretary of Labor
stakeholders: Federal civilian employees affected by government shutdowns and Maryland unemployment insurance recipients
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a flexible exemption for federal employees from work search requirements during shutdowns, leveraging the state's administrative authority to adapt unemployment benefits policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential for a moderate impact on child poverty by supporting unemployed families affected by federal shutdowns and reducing economic hardship.

Title: Transportation - WMATA Operating Assistance - Alteration (Maryland Metro Funding Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Repealing, for certain fiscal years, the requirement that the Secretary of Transportation withhold 35% of the State's share of annual operating grants for the Washington Suburban Transit District if the State's operating assistance provided in the approved Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority budget increases by more than 3% over the total operating assistance provided in the prior fiscal year.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the funding rules for the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA) in Maryland. Starting in fiscal year 2028, it introduces a requirement for the Maryland Secretary of Transportation to withhold 35% of the state's annual operating assistance for WMATA if the total Maryland operating assistance increases by more than 3% over the previous year, with certain exclusions and conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Maryland residents who use WMATA transit services, WMATA, Maryland transportation authorities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a financial withholding mechanism based on year-over-year increases in statewide assistance, linked to specific conditions and exclusions, which is a novel approach to regulating transit funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on transit funding adjustments.

Title: Community Schools - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain requirements for community schools and community school coordinators; requiring the Director of Community Schools to create a common needs assessment tool and an evaluation form; requiring a community school coordinator to complete a needs assessment and an evaluation in a certain manner; requiring the State Department of Education to provide feedback on the needs assessment before granting approval; and requiring the coordinator to review and modify the plan implementation periodically.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Education to support the development and evaluation of community schools, requiring the creation of needs assessment tools, evaluation forms, and the implementation of wraparound services to improve student achievement and family engagement.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, families, community organizations, school staff, and educators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a holistic, community-based approach that integrates various services and stakeholder engagement with data-driven tools, fostering innovative collaboration for student success.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly reduce child poverty by providing targeted services and support to families and students in need.

Title: Education â€“ Coaches â€“ Mental Health Training
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to develop guidelines for public schools and the Maryland Higher Education Commission to develop guidelines for public institutions of higher education to train coaches to recognize indicators of mental illness and behavioral distress in students who participate in athletic programs in public schools and public institutions of higher education; requiring public schools and public institutions that offer athletic programs to provide a certain training to coaches; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Education and the Maryland Higher Education Commission to develop guidelines for training coaches in recognizing indicators of mental illness and behavioral distress among students and athletes. It mandates public schools and higher education institutions that offer athletic programs to provide mental health training to their coaches.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Coaches, student athletes, students in schools and higher education institutions
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a mental health training program for coaches at both K-12 and higher education levels, focusing on recognizing mental health indicators, which is a proactive approach to student and athlete well-being.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving mental health support for students, potentially reducing long-term adverse effects associated with untreated mental health issues.

Title: Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission
Synopsis: Establishing the Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission to develop recommendations relating to education and its impact on the criminal justice system; and requiring the Commission to submit an interim report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by June 1, 2025, and a final report by January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission to develop recommendations on how education impacts the criminal justice system, including strategies to increase public safety and reduce recidivism.
responsible_party: Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals, criminal justice system, education providers, community organizations, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill proposes to create a comprehensive, data-driven statewide framework for prison education, incorporating stakeholder input and best practices, with a focus on reducing recidivism and promoting public safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to significantly impact child poverty by reducing incarceration rates and providing educational opportunities to justice-involved individuals.

Title: Business Regulation - Contractors, Subcontractors, and Brokers - Prohibited Conduct
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from serving or acting as a contractor, a subcontractor, or a broker between a contractor and subcontractor during the 5-year period immediately following the date the person was convicted of an offense constituting criminal malfeasance, misfeasance, or nonfeasance under any federal or State law.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits individuals convicted of certain criminal offenses from acting as contractors, subcontractors, or brokers in Maryland for five years after their conviction.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Business Regulation
stakeholders: Contractors, subcontractors, brokers, and construction industry in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill establishes a new legal restriction on individuals with certain criminal convictions from working in contractor-related roles for five years, enhancing regulatory oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Noise Abatement Monitoring Systems - Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing a pilot program to authorize the use of noise abatement monitoring systems in Montgomery County and Prince George's County to enforce certain motor vehicle noise requirements; requiring a county, before activating a noise abatement monitoring system, to publish notice of the locations of the systems on its website; requiring a county that authorizes a noise abatement monitoring program to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025, on the implementation and costs of the program and revenues collected; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a pilot program utilizing noise abatement monitoring systems in Montgomery County, Prince George's County, and Anne Arundel County to enforce motor vehicle noise regulations and other vehicle-related violations through automated systems and civil penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, law enforcement agencies, local governments, and residents in Montgomery, Prince George's, and Anne Arundel Counties
innovative_summary: The program employs automated noise abatement monitoring technology, including sensors, cameras, and noise measuring devices, integrated into the vehicle enforcement process, which is relatively innovative for noise enforcement programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily focuses on vehicle noise enforcement through automated systems.

Title: Human Services - Attendant Care Program - Ongoing Additional Supports
Synopsis: Altering the purpose of the Attendant Care Program to include the provision of financial assistance for ongoing additional supports that increase an individual's independent performance of essential daily activities and is requested by an eligible individual.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Attendant Care Program to include financial assistance for ongoing additional supports that increase an individual's independence in daily activities, and sets requirements for program participation and priorities.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with severe physical disabilities aged 18-64 requiring attendant care services
innovative_summary: The program expands support services by providing ongoing additional supports to help individuals increase independence, utilizing tailored financial assistance and prioritization.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by supporting disabled adults in maintaining independence and employment, though the direct impact on children is indirect.

Title: Condominiums - Common Elements - Clean Energy Equipment
Synopsis: Authorizing the board of directors of a condominium to grant certain interests affecting the common elements of the condominium for the installation and use of leased clean energy equipment.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes condominium boards to grant interests for the installation and use of leased clean energy equipment, such as electric vehicle recharging, solar energy, and energy storage systems, affecting the common elements of condominiums.
responsible_party: Condominium boards of directors
stakeholders: Condominium residents and owners, especially those interested in clean energy equipment
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by allowing condominium boards to lease clean energy equipment on common property with a majority vote, facilitating clean energy adoption in condominiums.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but could support broader community benefits through clean energy access.

Title: Correctional Services - Division of Pretrial Detention and Services - Facilities
Synopsis: Altering the composition and authority of the Division of Pretrial Detention and Services within the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services; altering the authority of the Commissioner of the Division; establishing the Youth Detention Center in the Division; establishing the facility administrator and authorizing assistant facility administrators for the Youth Detention Center; and repealing authorization for the Baltimore City Detention Center.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Youth Detention Center within the Division of Pretrial Detention and Services in Maryland, clarifies the authority and structure of this division, and repeals the Baltimore City Detention Center.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Juvenile inmates under 18 charged with crimes as adults in Baltimore City, staff working at the detention facilities, and the justice system
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the creation of a dedicated Youth Detention Center for juvenile offenders and enhances medical treatment procedures and facility management, employing modern detention management approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential to significantly impact children by providing specialized detention services and improving conditions for juveniles.

Title: Sustainable Growth Subcabinet and Repeal of the Office of Smart Growth
Synopsis: Repealing the Office of Smart Growth; repealing the position of Special Secretary for Smart Growth; renaming the Smart Growth Subcabinet to be the Sustainable Growth Subcabinet; altering the membership of the Subcabinet; requiring the Subcabinet to review State assistance programs, promote interagency consensus and cooperation, provide advisory and technical assistance to local jurisdictions, and gather and disseminate information to the public related to the State's sustainable growth policy; etc.
bill_summary: This bill discontinues the Office of Smart Growth, renames the Smart Growth Subcabinet to the Sustainable Growth Subcabinet, and revises its membership, duties, and operations to focus on sustainable growth policies in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning and related state agencies as part of the Subcabinet
stakeholders: Maryland residents, local governments, developers, and community organizations involved in growth and development projects
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a comprehensive, multi-agency subcabinet tasked with coordinating and implementing sustainable growth policies and practices, promoting interagency cooperation and public engagement using an integrated governmental approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to impact child poverty by fostering sustainable, equitable, and resilient communities that support economic stability and access to resources for families.

Title: Natural Resources - Maryland State Parks - Funds and Plan Alterations
Synopsis: Extending the date by which the Park System Critical Maintenance Fund must be expended to before July 1, 2029; authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to expend up to $400,000 from the Park System Critical Maintenance Fund under certain circumstances; authorizing the Park System Capital Improvements and Acquisition Fund to be used for State projects on lands managed by the Department for public purposes; authorizing the Great Maryland Outdoors Fund to be used for promoting outdoor environmental education in the State; etc.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funds for the maintenance, improvement, and expansion of Maryland State parks and outdoor recreation, including critical maintenance, infrastructure, land acquisition, and outdoor education, and extends deadlines for expenditure and planning requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Public park visitors, local communities, and populations seeking outdoor recreation and environmental education in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a strategic allocation of funds across multiple aspects of outdoor recreation and environmental initiatives, including climate change mitigation and outdoor education, representing an integrated approach to park management and outdoor sector growth.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by expanding access to parks and outdoor recreation, providing recreational and educational opportunities for underserved communities.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Motor Vehicle Insurance Companies - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring motor vehicle insurance companies to participate in the Motor Vehicle Administration's online verification program for vehicle insurance policies for law enforcement and administrative purposes; and requiring motor vehicle insurance companies to provide certain customer information details.
bill_summary: The bill requires motor vehicle insurance companies to participate in an online insurance verification program and provide detailed customer insurance information to the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to improve enforcement and record accuracy.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration in collaboration with the Maryland Insurance Administration and the automobile insurance industry
stakeholders: Motor vehicle owners, insurance companies, law enforcement, and government agencies involved in vehicle registration and insurance verification
innovative_summary: The bill adopts a real-time, online verification system for motor vehicle insurance policies, leveraging technology to ensure compliance and improve enforcement of insurance requirements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is minimal as it mainly focuses on insurance enforcement and verification procedures.

Title: Motor Vehicle Administration and Local Health Departments - Death Certificates - Issuance of Copies
Synopsis: Authorizing the Motor Vehicle Administration and local health departments to access electronically from the Maryland Department of Health a copy of a death certificate and, on request, provide any person authorized by regulations with a certified or abridged copy of a death certificate; and authorizing the Administration and local health departments to set and collect a fee for processing and issuing death certificates, subject to certain limitations.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration and local health departments to access and issue copies of death certificates electronically from the Maryland Department of Health. It also sets rules for fees for various vital records and specifies exemptions from fees for certain individuals, such as military members and homeless individuals.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and local health departments, Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Individuals requesting death certificates, health departments, government agencies, and underserved populations such as homeless and military members.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces electronic access to death certificates for relevant agencies, streamlining the process and potentially reducing delays in obtaining vital records.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty, but improving access to vital records could support health and social services indirectly.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Special Registration Plates - Gold Star and Next of Kin Families
Synopsis: Authorizing the recipient of a U.S. Department of Defense Next of Kin lapel button to apply for special registration plates; and waiving the initial vehicle registration fee associated with special registration plates issued to the recipient of a Gold Star or a Next of Kin lapel button.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes recipients of the U.S. Department of Defense Gold Star and Next of Kin lapel buttons to apply for special vehicle registration plates, and waives the initial registration fee for these plates. It also requires the plates to include an emblem or logo indicating the recipient's status and the name and rank of the deceased service member.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Recipients of Gold Star and Next of Kin lapel buttons, military families, and vehicle owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a formal recognition initiative by creating special registration plates with symbols and information that honor military service members and their families, but does not involve new technology or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is not directly targeted at reducing child poverty, as it mainly involves special vehicle registration processes and honorific symbols.

Title: Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Protection Program â€“ Climate, Equity, and Administrative Provisions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Critical Area Commission to adopt regulations governing the transfer of development rights, fee in lieu payments, the assessment of and adaption of the critical area for climate resiliency, enhancing resilience in the critical area, and environmental justice and equity initiatives; establishing certain considerations of climate change, climate resiliency, and equity as general principles and minimum elements of local programs; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates and enhances Maryland's Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Protection Program by integrating climate resiliency and environmental justice considerations, revising program standards, expanding local jurisdiction responsibilities, and establishing new regulations and procedures to better protect natural resources from climate change impacts and ensure equitable distribution of environmental benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Critical Area Commission, Department of Natural Resources, Department of Environment
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, especially underserved and overburdened communities, local governments, environmental groups, and wildlife habitats.
innovative_summary: The program employs innovative approaches by incorporating climate resiliency measures, environmental justice initiatives, and advanced mapping and data collection technologies to adapt natural resources management to climate change effects.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to impact child poverty positively by promoting equitable access to environmental benefits and reducing environmental hazards in underserved communities.

Title: Department of Natural Resources - Pay-For-Success Contracts - Procurement Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting pay-for-success contracts negotiated or entered into by the Department of Natural Resources from certain provisions of the General Procurement Law.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain pay-for-success contracts negotiated by the Maryland Department of Natural Resources from specific procurement laws, allowing the department to use this innovative financing method for environmental and conservation projects.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Environmental conservation projects, public environmental programs, investors in social and environmental impact investments, and the general public benefiting from improved environmental outcomes
innovative_summary: The bill promotes the use of pay-for-success contracts, a financing model that shifts performance risk to contractors and links payments to successful environmental outcomes, fostering innovative approaches for environmental and land conservation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: While mainly focused on environmental and conservation outcomes, the program could indirectly benefit children through improved environmental quality and community health.

Title: Commercial Northern Snakehead License â€“ Gear
Synopsis: Repealing certain buffer zones within which a commercial northern snakehead licensee may not fish using bowfishing gear; and requiring a licensee who fishes for northern snakehead to comply with Department of Natural Resources regulations governing the use of gear.
bill_summary: The bill amends regulations on commercial fishing for northern snakehead fish in Maryland, removing certain buffer zones for using bowfishing gear and require licensees to comply with Department of Natural Resources gear regulations.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Commercial fishers, recreational fishers, environmental regulators
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates existing regulations on gear use and buffer zones without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing on fishery regulations.

Title: Public Health - Clean Indoor Air Act - Revisions
Synopsis: Prohibiting vaping in certain indoor areas and places of employment and certain mass transportation; requiring that certain signs be posted in each public indoor area and each public entrance to an indoor area where smoking or vaping is prohibited; requiring the convening of a workgroup to study the issuance of alcoholic beverages licenses to tobacconists; and prohibiting the issuance of a local alcoholic beverages license to a tobacconist from July 1, 2024, to July 1, 2026, both inclusive.
bill_summary: The bill revises Maryland's Clean Indoor Air Act to ban vaping in certain indoor public and work spaces, requires signage for smoking and vaping restrictions, and establishes a review of licensing for tobacconists; it also creates a workgroup to study alcoholic beverage licenses for tobacconists.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Public health, smokers, vapers, tobacco and cannabis-related businesses, employees, general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach including signage requirements, a study workgroup, and licensing restrictions, but uses standard regulatory measures without employing new technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program likely has minimal to no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Just Community Designation
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor, on the recommendation of the Secretary of Housing and Community Development, to designate certain areas as Just Communities based on certain criteria; and providing for the prioritization of State funding for Just Communities to increase racial, economic and health equity in the State.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Governor to designate certain areas as 'Just Communities' based on specific historical, social, and economic criteria. These designations will be used to prioritize state funding to promote equity and address past injustices within these communities.
responsible_party: Maryland Secretary of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Historically underserved communities, residents in priority funding areas, minority groups, and communities affected by past segregation and disinvestment
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to address historical injustices by designating communities for prioritized funding based on specific social and historical data, integrating equity considerations into state funding decisions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by directing resources and investments to underserved communities, addressing social determinants of poverty.

Title: State Amusement Ride Safety Advisory Board - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Amusement Ride Safety Advisory Board in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board to July 1, 2027; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee by July 1, 2025, with certain information regarding the State Amusement Ride Safety Advisory Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the termination date of the State Amusement Ride Safety Advisory Board from July 1, 2024, to July 1, 2027, and requires the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee by July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Operators and users of amusement rides in Maryland, the Department of Labor, and regulatory agencies
innovative_summary: This bill primarily focuses on extending an existing advisory board's operations and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Maryland Occupational Safety and Health Act - Civil Penalties - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain civil penalties for violations of the Maryland Occupational Safety and Health Act; and requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry to annually increase the maximum and minimum civil penalties, beginning in 2025, by the percentage increase, if any, in the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers or a successor index published by the federal Bureau of Labor Statistics.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Occupational Safety and Health Act to increase civil penalties for violations, with annual adjustments based on the Consumer Price Index starting in 2025. It sets new limits for fines for various violation types, including willful or repeated violations.
responsible_party: Commissioner of Labor and Industry, Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employers and workers in Maryland, particularly those subject to occupational safety and health regulations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a typical approach of inflation adjustment for penalties and does not introduce new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Financial Institutions - Third-Party Service Providers - Examinations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to examine a third-party service provider as to services and activities performed on behalf of an entity licensed or chartered by the Office of Financial Regulation; requiring the Commissioner to notify a certain licensed person of any examination of any third-party service provider who performs activities relating to financial services on behalf of the licensed person; authorizing the Commissioner to accept the results of an examination by certain entities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill grants the Maryland Office of Financial Regulation the authority to examine third-party service providers that perform financial activities on behalf of licensed entities, including the power to scrutinize services, collect fees for examinations, and enforce compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Financial institutions and third-party service providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enhances regulatory oversight by explicitly allowing examinations of third-party providers, employing existing examination procedures in a new context.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct immediate impact on child poverty.

Title: Unemployment Insurance - Covered Employment - Employees of Governmental Entities or Charitable, Educational, or Religious Organizations
Synopsis: Specifying that certain limitations on the payment of benefits to employees of governmental entities or charitable, educational, or religious organizations do not apply with respect to service in other covered employment, including covered employment for a for-profit employing unit, even if the service is provided exclusively for a governmental entity or a charitable, educational, religious, or other organization.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies that employment limitations for unemployment benefits do not apply to certain service in covered employment for employees of governmental, charitable, educational, or religious organizations, unless specified exceptions apply. It also adjusts rules related to unemployment benefits for employees of educational institutions, especially regarding academic year transitions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees of government, charitable, educational, and religious organizations, and educational institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies and updates existing unemployment insurance rules without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting unemployment benefit eligibility for certain workers in organizations serving children and communities.

Title: Insurance - Holding Companies - Group Capital Calculation and Liquidity Stress Test
Synopsis: Requiring certain controlling persons of certain insurers in an insurance holding company system to file an annual group calculation as directed by the lead state commissioner of the insurance group; requiring certain controlling persons of certain insurers in an insurance holding company system to file the results of a liquidity stress test for specific data years; providing that certain information is confidential; and authorizing and requiring the Commissioner to take certain actions related to certain information.
bill_summary: The bill requires controlling persons of certain insurers in Maryland to file annual group capital calculations and liquidity stress test results, while ensuring the confidentiality of the information and specifying the roles of the Maryland Insurance Commissioner and the lead state commissioner. It also sets rules for sharing information between agencies and prohibits public disclosure of sensitive data.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Insurers and insurance holding company systems operating in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs new regulatory protocols for stress testing and capital calculation reporting, incorporating NAIC standardized frameworks and confidentiality safeguards, representing an advanced approach to insurance supervision.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is limited, primarily focusing on insurance regulation and financial stability without direct interventions affecting children or families in need.

Title: Cannabis Reform - Alterations
Synopsis: Making alterations and clarifications related to the duties of the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission, the Office of Social Equity, the Advisory Board on Medical and Adult-Use Cannabis, and the Maryland Cannabis Administration; altering the membership of the Commission; requiring the Advisory Board to elect a chair and removing the Director of the Administration as chair; authorizing processors to provide cannabis to cannabis licensees; providing that certain violations may be charged by a citation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill alters Maryland's cannabis laws by changing the structure and duties of the Maryland Cannabis Administration, establishing a Cannabis Business Assistance Fund, updating licensing and registration rules, enhancing social equity programs, and addressing advertising and enforcement issues related to cannabis.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Cannabis industry businesses, social equity applicants, medical and adult-use cannabis consumers, minority and women entrepreneurs, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces modernized regulation for cannabis including seed-to-sale tracking, social equity programs, and flexible licensing, with enhanced oversight and community investments, employing strategic use of funds and new regulatory approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by supporting social equity and minority-owned cannabis businesses, creating job opportunities, and stimulating economic growth within affected communities.

Title: Waterway Incident Notification System (WINS) - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Emergency Management to study issues and factors regarding the feasibility of establishing a Waterway Incident Notification System to notify members of the public of certain waterway emergencies; and requiring the Department to submit an interim report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024, and a final report on or before December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill creates a study by the Maryland Department of Emergency Management to assess the feasibility of establishing a Waterway Incident Notification System (WINS) to alert the public about waterway emergencies. It also explores potential partnerships with federal and nearby state agencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Recreational boaters, watermen, emergency management agencies, general public interested in waterway safety
innovative_summary: The bill proposes studying the possibility of a new notification system that could involve advanced communication and partnership strategies to improve waterway safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential for a moderate impact on child poverty by improving safety and emergency response on waterways, which could benefit vulnerable populations.

Title: State Personnel - Collective Bargaining - Supervisory Employees
Synopsis: Providing collective bargaining rights to certain supervisory State employees; and requiring that certain supervisory State employees have separate bargaining units.
bill_summary: This bill grants collective bargaining rights to certain supervisory state employees in Maryland by establishing and recognizing separate bargaining units for them.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or relevant State Agency responsible for labor relations and implementation
stakeholders: Supervisory State employees, State government
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured approach to collective bargaining for a specific category of supervisory employees, including the establishment of following new bargaining units.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may have an indirect impact on child poverty by potentially improving employment conditions for supervisory employees.

Title: Unemployment Insurance - Benefits - Election Judges
Synopsis: Prohibiting a payment to an individual as compensation received for serving as an election judge for a local board of elections in the State from being included when computing the wages required to be subtracted from an eligible claimant's weekly benefit amount; and prohibiting an individual from being denied unemployment benefits for failure to meet certain requirements due to service as an election judge in the State.
bill_summary: The bill exempts payments received by election judges for their service from being counted as wages when calculating unemployment benefits, and simplifies the rules so that election judges are not denied unemployment benefits due to their service.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Election judges and unemployment benefit claimants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted exception to the unemployment benefits calculation, specifically addressing payments to election judges, which is a specialized approach within unemployment policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could have a modest impact on reducing child poverty by potentially increasing unemployment benefits for election judges, who are often volunteers or part-time, thus providing greater financial stability.

Title: Consumer Protection - Consumer Reporting Agencies - Information in Consumer Credit Reports
Synopsis: Altering the items of information that a consumer reporting agency is prohibited from including in a consumer credit report.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the types of information that consumer reporting agencies are prohibited from including in credit reports, reducing the time frames for certain adverse information, and raises thresholds for exceptions such as high-value credit transactions, life insurance underwriting, and high-salary employment.
responsible_party: Maryland Consumer Protection Agency (implied) or equivalent overseeing body
stakeholders: Consumers in Maryland, credit reporting agencies, lenders, employers, insurance companies
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies and shortens the time limits for adverse credit information and adjusts thresholds for certain financial and employment transactions, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit consumers by improving credit reporting fairness and accuracy.

Title: Insurance - Producer Licensing Requirements - Education and Experience
Synopsis: Repealing the requirements for education and experience for licensing of certain insurance producers, including producers for property and casualty insurance, life insurance, health insurance, annuities, and related products.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the education and experience requirements for licensing insurance producers in Maryland, including various lines such as property, casualty, life, health, and related products.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Insurance producers and applicants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill significantly relaxes licensing requirements, reducing barriers for insurance producers without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting licensing regulations for insurance producers.

Title: Cannabis Licensing and Registration - Use of Straw Ownership - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from applying for or holding a cannabis license or registration under certain circumstances if an ownership interest in the license or registration is for the limited purpose of satisfying certain requirements of registration or licensure; and requiring the Maryland Cannabis Administration to deny a certain application or revoke a cannabis license or registration if the applicant, licensee, or registrant is determined by the Administration to be in violation of the Act or convicted of a violation of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill bans individuals from holding or applying for a cannabis license or registration if they have an ownership interest that is only for satisfying registration requirements, such as straw ownership, without genuine ownership rights. It authorizes the Maryland Cannabis Administration to deny or revoke licenses or registrations if such violations are found.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Cannabis license applicants, licensees, and regulators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces strict regulations to prevent straw ownership in cannabis licensing, which is a new approach to ensuring genuine ownership and control in the industry.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty, but promoting a transparent and legitimate cannabis industry may have broad economic impacts.

Title: Frederick County - Local Gaming and Authorization for Electronic Tip Jar Dispensers
Synopsis: Authorizing, subject to certain provisions of law, a person that operates a tip jar in Frederick County to operate an electronic tip jar dispenser that does not connect to the Internet or to a server; altering certain obsolete language in provisions of law governing gaming in Frederick County; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Frederick County residents to operate electronic tip jar dispensers that do not connect to the internet or a server, for the benefit of certain nonprofit organizations, and updates legal language related to gaming in Frederick County.
responsible_party: Frederick County Department of Permits and Inspections
stakeholders: Charitable and nonprofit organizations, local residents, and businesses in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces digital, electronic tip jar dispensers that do not connect to the internet, providing a modern approach to fundraising within the legal framework of county regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is limited, focusing mostly on regulatory changes for fundraising activities.

Title: Local Government - Condominium and Homeowners Associations - Repair and Rehabilitation Funds
Synopsis: Authorizing a county or a municipality to establish a certain fund for the purpose of providing support for the repair of infrastructure in a community subject to a condominium association or a homeowners association; and requiring that certain property tax revenues be assigned to a fund created under the Act.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to establish funds supported by property tax revenues to help repair infrastructure in communities governed by condominium and homeowners associations, especially those with aging infrastructure and limited financial capacity.
responsible_party: County or municipal government agencies responsible for establishing and managing the funds.
stakeholders: Residents of condominiums and homeowners associations, local governments, local taxpayers, and community infrastructure.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach where local governments allocate property tax revenues to dedicated funds specifically for infrastructure repairs in community associations, leveraging property tax revenue for targeted infrastructure funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly benefit children by improving community infrastructure and property values, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Affordable Housing - Identifying Suitable Property
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the Department of Housing and Community Development identify certain property as suitable for use or redevelopment; prohibiting the Department from identifying certain property for use or redevelopment as affordable housing; and requiring the Department to consider certain factors when identifying whether a  property is suitable for use or redevelopment as affordable housing.
bill_summary: The bill revises the process the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development uses to identify and list properties suitable for use or redevelopment as affordable housing. It removes restrictions on identifying certain properties and specifies factors to consider when determining suitability.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Potential residents seeking affordable housing, government agencies involved in land and property management
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more flexible approach for identifying suitable properties for affordable housing by removing some existing restrictions and considering additional factors, but does not employ new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing the availability of affordable housing.

Title: Education - Provision of Maryland Youth Crisis Hotline Telephone Number - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the requirement that each county board of education provide certain students with the telephone number of the Maryland Youth Crisis Hotline by instead requiring that each county board of education provide certain students with the telephone number of the 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland county school boards to provide students in grades 6-12 with the telephone number for the 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline, replacing the requirement for the Maryland Youth Crisis Hotline.
responsible_party: Maryland county boards of education
stakeholders: Students in grades six through twelve in Maryland public schools
innovative_summary: This bill shifts the crisis hotline information from a state-specific hotline to a national 988 Lifeline, emphasizing a modernized, streamlined approach to crisis intervention communications.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a significant impact on child and youth mental health crises, which are often linked to poverty, by providing immediate access to crisis support.

Title: Task Force on Property Appraisal and Valuation Equity - Alterations
Synopsis: Moving from October 31, 2023, to October 31, 2024, the deadline for the reporting requirement for the Task Force on Property Appraisal and Valuation Equity; and extending from June 30, 2024, to December 31, 2024, the termination date for the Task Force.
bill_summary: This bill extends the deadline for the Task Force on Property Appraisal and Valuation Equity to report its findings from October 31, 2023, to October 31, 2024, and extends the duration of the Task Force until December 31, 2024.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Minority property owners, appraisal industry, governmental agencies, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves extending deadlines and the duration of an existing task force; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty; it focuses on property valuation fairness for minorities.

Title: Property Tax - Renters' Property Tax Relief Program - Assets Calculation
Synopsis: Excluding the cash value of any qualified retirement savings plans or individual retirement accounts from the definition of "assets" for purposes of certain property tax relief provided to certain renters; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the calculation of assets for the purpose of determining renters' property tax relief, specifically excluding the cash value of qualified retirement savings plans and individual retirement accounts from the assets considered.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Renters in Maryland applying for property tax relief
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies and clarifies existing rules for determining assets, with a specific exclusion for retirement savings, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a modest potential to impact child poverty by improving housing affordability and relief for eligible renters.

Title: County Boards of Education - Bid Advertisement Threshold and Electronic Posting of Hearing Notices and Bid Advertisements
