Synopsis: Requiring county boards of education to post on the websites of certain local school systems hearing notices related to preliminary approval of a school site and advertisements for bids for school buildings, improvements, supplies, or equipment that exceed $100,000; increasing, from $25,000 to $100,000, the threshold amount of costs of school buildings, improvements, supplies, or equipment that trigger the requirement for county boards to advertise for bids; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires county boards of education in Maryland to post hearing notices and bid advertisements on their websites, increases the bid advertisement threshold from $25,000 to $100,000, and updates the platform for electronic posting.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education or County Boards of Education
stakeholders: County Boards of Education, local school systems, residents, vendors participating in school bids
innovative_summary: The bill enhances transparency by requiring electronic posting of notices and bid advertisements on school websites, and increases the bidding threshold, streamlining the procurement process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may indirectly impact child poverty by potentially improving access and transparency in school funding and construction processes.

Title: State Procurement - Maryland State Board of Contract Appeals - Attorney's Fees
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Contract Appeals to award an interested party reasonable costs of filing and pursuing a protest, including attorney's fees, if an appeal is sustained and there is a violation of law or regulation; and authorizing the Board of Contract Appeals to award a contractor under any State contract the reasonable costs of filing and pursuing a claim, including attorney's fees, if the unit processing the claim acts in bad faith, without justification, or in violation of law.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Contract Appeals to award reasonable costs, including attorney's fees, to interested parties who file protests or claims related to state procurement contracts if their appeal or claim is upheld and there is a violation of law or regulation, or bad faith conduct by the state.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Contract Appeals
stakeholders: Interested bidders, offerors, and contractors involved in Maryland state procurement contracts
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a process for awarding attorneys' fees and costs to parties involved in protest and claim proceedings related to state procurement contracts, promoting fairness and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Low potential for direct impact on child poverty as it mainly addresses procedural and legal aspects of procurement disputes.

Title: Family Law - Marriage Ceremony - Designation of Deputy Clerk
Synopsis: Transferring, from the county administrative judge of the circuit court for the county to the clerk of the circuit court for the county, the authority to designate a deputy clerk to perform a marriage ceremony.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the clerk of the circuit court to designate a deputy clerk to perform marriage ceremonies in Maryland.
responsible_party: Clerk of the circuit court for the county
stakeholders: Individuals seeking marriage ceremonies and circuit court staff
innovative_summary: The bill expands and formalizes the authority for court officials to delegate marriage ceremony officiating responsibilities, utilizing existing legal infrastructure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Economic Development - Workgroup on Independent Innovation in Prince George's County - Establishment PG 402-24
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Independent Innovation in Prince George's County to promote innovation and technology in the county; and requiring the Workgroup by January 15, 2026, to report on recommendations regarding strategies to support investments in industry opportunities and potential areas of innovation to the Prince George's County Delegation and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Workgroup on Independent Innovation in Prince George's County to promote innovation and technology, creates the Prince George's County Venture Capital Fund to support startups and small businesses, and sets up various programs like innovation places, entrepreneurs-in-residence, and industry-specific workgroups to foster economic development.
responsible_party: Prince Georgeâ€™s County and Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Startups, entrepreneurs, local businesses, higher education institutions, and residents of Prince Georgeâ€™s County.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, multi-faceted approach that includes establishing a venture capital fund, designated innovation zones, and collaboration with various stakeholders, leveraging technology and partnerships to boost economic growth.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by fostering economic growth, supporting startups, and creating jobs within the county.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Nonprofit Organizations PG 304-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to issue a Class C (fraternal/sororal/service organization) alcoholic beverages license for use by an independent and nonprofit fraternal or sororal organization that meets certain requirements; authorizing the Board to revoke or suspend a license if a license holder is found guilty of certain violations; and providing for an annual license fee of $910.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the issuance of a new Class C alcohol license for use by nonprofit fraternal and sororal organizations in Prince George's County, Maryland. It sets specific membership requirements, licensing terms, and sale regulations, with a focus on supporting these organizations in serving alcohol at social events.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Prince Georgeâ€™s County
stakeholders: Nonprofit fraternal and sororal organizations in Prince Georgeâ€™s County, Maryland
innovative_summary: This program introduces a specialized alcohol license tailored specifically for nonprofit fraternal and sororal organizations, facilitating social and community activities with clear licensing regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly pertains to alcohol licensing for organizations.

Title: Cooperative Housing Corporations - Dispute Settlement
Synopsis: Altering procedures for the dispute settlement mechanism under the Maryland Cooperative Housing Corporation Act; applying the dispute settlement mechanism established by the Act to apply to any complaint or demand formally arising on or after October 1, 2023, with a certain exception; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates the dispute settlement procedures for cooperative housing corporations in Maryland, including timelines and requirements for notices, hearings, and appeals, and clarifies enforcement rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Cooperative Housing Corporation oversight and enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Members of cooperative housing corporations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes and clarifies dispute resolution procedures, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns dispute resolution procedures.

Title: Regulated Firearms - Maryland Judiciary - Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Repealing and altering a reporting requirement to require the Maryland Judiciary, instead of the State Commission on Criminal Sentencing Policy, to report on the number of charges, convictions, and sentences for certain regulated firearm violations; and requiring by October 1, 2024 and each October 1 thereafter, that the Maryland Judiciary submit its report to the Governor and the General Assembly and include information disaggregated by jurisdiction, race, and gender.
bill_summary: This bill changes reporting requirements for firearm violations in Maryland. It requires the Maryland Judiciary instead of the State Commission on Criminal Sentencing Policy to report annually on charges, convictions, and sentences related to certain firearm violations, disaggregated by jurisdiction, race, and gender.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Individuals involved in firearm violations, law enforcement, policymakers, and the public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a centralized and disaggregated data reporting approach to inform policy, enhancing transparency and specificity in firearm violation data.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty since it primarily concerns reporting requirements around firearm violations.

Title: Environment - Commission on Climate Change Membership - Addition
Synopsis: Adding the Secretary of Emergency Management, or the Secretary's designee, and the Chair of the Public Service Commission, or the Chair's designee, as members of the Commission on Climate Change.
bill_summary: The bill adds the Secretary of Emergency Management and the Chair of the Public Service Commission to the membership of the Commission on Climate Change in Maryland.
responsible_party: Department of Environment (or equivalent Maryland State agency overseeing the Commission on Climate Change)
stakeholders: Government agencies involved in climate policy and management, including emergency management, public service, environment, agriculture, natural resources, planning, education, transportation, energy, and the wider community interested in climate change mitigation and adaptation.
innovative_summary: The bill mainly expands the advisory body's membership but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects the membership of an environmental advisory commission.

Title: Maryland Uniform Transfers to Minors Act - Transfers as Custodian for the Benefit of a Minor - Authorization of Court
Synopsis: Increasing, from in excess of $10,000 to in excess of $25,000, the threshold amount for certain transfers by a personal representative, trustee, or conservator as a custodian for the benefit of a minor to require authorization by a court.
bill_summary: The bill increases the court authorization threshold for certain transfers made by personal representatives, trustees, or conservators for the benefit of minors under the Maryland Uniform Transfers to Minors Act from $10,000 to $50,000.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and estate/trust officials
stakeholders: Minors, estate administrators, trustees, conservators, legal professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill primarily updates legal thresholds for estate transfers and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may streamline estate handling involving minors.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Interested Person - Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "interested person" for purposes of provisions of law governing the estates of decedents, guardians of persons and property, trusts, and powers of attorney.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of "interested person" in estate and trust law to clarify who qualifies, including provisions related to spouses who file an election and caveators. It updates legal definitions concerning estate proceedings.
responsible_party: Maryland State Legislature / Department of Justice or equivalent legal authority
stakeholders: Persons involved in estate, trust, or guardianship proceedings in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates legal definitions through legislative amendments without employing new technologies or radically different approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little to no direct impact on child poverty as it mainly clarifies legal definitions in estate law.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Appointment of Personal Representative - Objections
Synopsis: Authorizing only an interested person or unpaid claimant, rather than any person, to file an objection to the appointment of a personal representative of an estate of a decedent.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland estate law to specify that only interested persons or unpaid claimants, rather than any person, may file objections to the appointment of a personal representative of an estate.
responsible_party: Maryland Register of Wills or equivalent estate probate authority
stakeholders: Individuals involved in estate administration and probate processes in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill makes a procedural change to limit who can file objections in estate proceedings, without employing new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal potential to directly impact child poverty.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Board of Community College Trustees - Membership Alterations and Appointment Requirements
Synopsis: Increasing by two members the membership of the Board of Community College Trustees for Anne Arundel County; and requiring the Governor to consider the geographic and ethnic representation of Anne Arundel County when making appointments to the Board.
bill_summary: This bill increases the membership of the Anne Arundel County Board of Community College Trustees from 8 to 10 members, requires the Governor to consider geographic and ethnic diversity when appointing members, and establishes rules for the student member position.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland and the Anne Arundel County Board of Community College Trustees
stakeholders: Residents of Anne Arundel County, students at Anne Arundel Community College, and the local community college system
innovative_summary: The bill primarily alters governance rules and diversity considerations for a local advisory board, which is standard practice and not highly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may contribute indirectly through improved educational governance.

Title: Hospitals - Financial Assistance Policies - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the required contents of a hospital's financial assistance policy by removing the requirement that the provision of reduced-cost medically necessary care and payment plans be in accordance with the mission and service area of the hospital; authorizing hospitals to consider only household monetary assets in excess of $100,000 when determining eligibility for free and reduced-cost care under the hospital's financial assistance policy; and requiring that certain retirement assets be excluded from consideration.
bill_summary: The bill revises hospital financial assistance policies by allowing hospitals to consider only household monetary assets exceeding $100,000, excluding specific assets such as retirement accounts and primary residence equity, when determining eligibility for free or reduced-cost care.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Low-income hospital patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an asset-based eligibility criterion for hospital financial assistance, with specific exclusions for certain assets, which is a moderate innovation in assessing financial need.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may indirectly impact child poverty by affecting access to hospital care for low-income households.

Title: Out-of-State Motor Vehicles - Improper Registration - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration, in consultation with Baltimore City and other interested jurisdictions, to prepare a report on motor vehicles owned by Maryland residents that are improperly titled or registered in another state; requiring the Administration to submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Baltimore City to tow, remove, or impound vehicles owned by new residents who do not register their vehicle within 60 days of residency and requires the Motor Vehicle Administration to prepare a report on the issue of Maryland residents improperly registering their vehicles in other states.
responsible_party: Motor Vehicle Administration (Maryland Department of Transportation)
stakeholders: Maryland residents, Baltimore City Government, Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
innovative_summary: The bill's approach mainly involves legal enforcement and a reporting requirement, with no mention of new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly addresses vehicle registration enforcement.

Title: Election Law - Election Disinformation and Improper Influence Related to Voting
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections to maintain a portal on the State Board's website that the public may use to report election misinformation and election disinformation; requiring the State Board to conduct a periodic review of material submitted by the public through the portal and, to the extent necessary, issue corrective information or refer submissions to the State Prosecutor; and defining "influence" for purposes of certain provisions of law prohibiting improper influence related to voting.
bill_summary: The bill requires large social media platforms to monitor and report election disinformation within Maryland, establishing a reporting portal for the public and authorizing civil penalties for noncompliance. It also updates definitions related to election misinformation, disinformation, and influence, and addresses illegal voting activities.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, social media companies, election officials, general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs technology and regulatory measures to combat election misinformation on large social media platforms, including public reporting portals and mandatory reporting requirements with penalties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing primarily on election integrity and misinformation.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - B-D-7 Licenses - Hours of Sale
Synopsis: Altering a geographic boundary in the 45th alcoholic beverages district of Baltimore City within which a holder of a B-D-7 alcoholic beverages license must operate in accordance with certain hours.
bill_summary: The bill alters the geographic boundaries within Baltimore City for certain alcohol license sale hours and specifies the operating hours for those licenses in these areas, taking effect on June 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Department
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, residents and businesses in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates geographic boundaries and operating hours for existing alcohol licenses; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: It has minimal potential to directly impact child poverty.

Title: Maryland Achieving a Better Life Experience (ABLE) Program - Materials for Individualized Education Program, Individualized Family Service Plan, and 504 Plan Meetings
Synopsis: Requiring a local school system to provide to parents at certain individualized education program, individualized family service plan, and 504 plan meetings for children with disabilities certain written informational materials regarding the Maryland ABLE Program; requiring the State Treasurer to develop informational materials about the Maryland ABLE Program that may be distributed electronically or by hand; and requiring the State Treasurer to provide informational materials to the State Board of Education and county boards.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland local school systems to provide parents with informational materials about the Maryland ABLE Program during IEP, IFSP, and 504 plan meetings for children with disabilities. It also directs the State Treasurer to develop and distribute these materials. The purpose is to inform parents about the ABLE Program when they engage in these educational planning meetings.
responsible_party: Maryland State Treasurer and Department of Education
stakeholders: Parents of children with disabilities and students participating in special education programs
innovative_summary: This program introduces a structured way to inform parents about the Maryland ABLE Program during existing IEP, IFSP, and 504 plan meetings by providing written materials, utilizing new development and distribution processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could significantly help families of children with disabilities, potentially reducing child poverty by increasing access to financial planning resources through the ABLE Program.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Bike Lanes and Shoulders - Yielding Right-of-Way (Sarah Debbink Langenkamp Memorial Act)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from committing a violation of a certain provision of law governing the right-of-way of a bicycle, a motor scooter, or an electronic personal assistive mobility device lawfully in a designated bike lane or shoulder that contributes to the serious physical injury or death of a person riding a bicycle, EPAMD, or motor scooter; and providing that a person convicted of a violation of the Act is subject to imprisonment of up to 2 months or a fine not to exceed $2,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill enhances laws regarding yielding the right-of-way to bicycles, electric personal assistive mobility devices (EPAMDs), and motor scooters, especially in bike lanes and shoulders. It establishes penalties for violations that contribute to serious injury or death.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Bicyclists, EPAMD riders, motor scooter riders, drivers, and pedestrians in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing traffic laws to explicitly address the safety of vulnerable road users and introduces penalties for violations contributing to serious injury or death, but it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on traffic safety laws, which have limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Criminal Procedure â€“ Facial Recognition Technology â€“ Requirements, Procedures, and Prohibitions
Synopsis: Establishing requirements, procedures, and prohibitions relating to the use of facial recognition technology by a law enforcement agency;  requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to  administer a training program regarding the use of facial recognition technology by June 30, 2026; requiring the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to report to the General Assembly by October 1 each year the information reported by law enforcement agencies using facial recognition technology; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes regulations on the use of facial recognition technology by law enforcement in Maryland. It details definitions, restrictions, data handling, oversight, and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies and the general public, particularly individuals subject to facial recognition analysis
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive regulatory framework for facial recognition technology, including oversight, transparency, and restrictions, which reflects a modern approach to biometric data use in law enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty but may improve civil rights and privacy protections.

Title: State Procurement - Prompt Payment of Suppliers
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions requiring prompt payments for State procurement contracts apply to payments owed by a contractor to a supplier.
bill_summary: The bill mandates prompt payment for suppliers providing labor or materials on state contracts, outlining procedures for resolving payment disputes and penalties for delayed payments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of General Services and procurement officers
stakeholders: Suppliers providing labor or materials for state projects, contractors, and subcontractors
innovative_summary: The program introduces structured dispute resolution processes and penalties for delayed payments, employing administrative procedures to ensure timely payments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce child poverty by ensuring timely payments to suppliers, which could improve funding and employment opportunities.

Title: Environment - Dredged Material - Containment, Redeposit, and Oversight
Synopsis: Requiring the Cox Creek Oversight Committee to provide input to the Maryland Port Administration regarding management of dredged material at the Cox Creek Dredge Material Containment Facility; authorizing the Department of the Environment to approve contained areas at a large redevelopment site for the redeposit of certain dredged material; establishing the Hart-Miller-Pleasure Island Citizens Oversight Committee to monitor the area water quality, and the future development and use of the Hart-Miller-Pleasure Island chain; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the membership and duties of citizen oversight committees related to dredged material management at Cox Creek and Hart-Miller Island in Maryland. It establishes new rules and requirements for dredged material redeposit locations, community benefit agreements, and oversight responsibilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and Maryland Board of Public Works
stakeholders: Communities near Cox Creek and Hart-Miller Island, environmental groups, dredging companies, local residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces community benefit agreements and stricter oversight requirements for dredged material redeposit, incorporating community input and targeted environmental management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on environmental oversight and dredging policies.

Title: Fish and Wildlife - Endangered and Threatened Species - Definitions, Petitions, and Regulations
Synopsis: Requiring certain petitions to review the listing or unlisting of endangered or threatened species to contain certain information regarding the distribution, life needs, habitat requirements, and status of the species; requiring the Secretary of Natural Resources to review and, if warranted, update certain regulations listing endangered or threatened species on or before July 1, 2026, and every 5 years thereafter; and altering the definitions of "fish" and "wildlife" for certain purposes.
bill_summary: The bill requires reviews and updates of regulations concerning endangered and threatened fish and wildlife species in Maryland, defines key terms related to these species, and sets procedures for petitions and assessments of species' statuses.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Fish, wildlife, and ecological ecosystems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a systematic review process for species protection regulations and updates to species lists, employing scientific data and public petitions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on species conservation does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - 2-1-1 Maryland - Oversight
Synopsis: Defining the term "Health and Human Services Referral System" for the purposes of certain provisions of law governing the System to mean a certain coordinated system for health and human service resources that is accessible to State residents, rather than a certain telephone service; repealing the requirement that the Maryland Department of Health evaluate the performance of certain call centers and make certain recommendations regarding the quality of service provided by call centers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill redefines the "Health and Human Services Referral System" as a coordinated system accessible to all residents, clarifies the role of 2-1-1 Maryland as the administrator of the statewide information and referral system, and revises oversight and program requirements, including establishing a mental health opt-in call program and expanding the 2-1-1 Maryland board.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health in collaboration with 2-1-1 Maryland
stakeholders: Mary Maryland residents seeking health and human services
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes the integration of a coordinated health and human services system accessible via modern technology, including establishing a mental health call program and expanding board representation, which are relatively innovative approaches to public service coordination.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to health and human services for families in need through better information and referral systems.

Title: Prince George's County - Workgroup on Health and Wellness PG 409-24
Synopsis: Establishing a Workgroup on Health and Wellness in Prince George's County to review and evaluate health and wellness practices, programs, services, and resources in Prince George's County and make recommendations regarding best practices in health and wellness community programming in the county; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Prince George's County Executive, the Chair of the Prince George's County Council, the Governor, and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Workgroup on Health and Wellness in Prince George's County to review health practices, recommend community programs, and promote healthy eating and physical activity, with a report due by December 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Prince Georgeâ€™s County Department of Health and the Prince Georgeâ€™s County Health Officer
stakeholders: Residents of Prince George's County, health and wellness practitioners, local businesses, community organizations
innovative_summary: The bill promotes an integrated approach to health and wellness, including the idea of creating health and wellness hubs and incentivizing community and employer programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to health, nutrition, and wellness resources in the community.

Title: Caroline County - Alcoholic Beverages - Barbershop and Beauty Salon License
Synopsis: Establishing a barbershop and beauty salon beer and wine license in Caroline County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Caroline County to issue the license to a holder of a certain barbershop or beauty salon permit; establishing a licensing fee of $100; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a license in Caroline County that allows barbershops and beauty salons to serve small amounts of beer and wine to customers receiving barbering or cosmetology services, with specific provisions on licensing, service limits, and training.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Caroline County
stakeholders: Customers of barbershops and beauty salons, local businesses, and service providers in Caroline County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach allowing alcohol service within personal care settings like barber shops and salons, integrating alcohol service with existing beauty and grooming services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to indirectly benefit children by supporting local small businesses and improving service quality, but it is not directly aimed at reducing child poverty.

Title: Caroline County â€“ Alcoholic Beverages â€“ Beer, Wine, and Liquor Tasting License
Synopsis: Altering the 1-day beer and wine tasting (BWT) license in Caroline County to be a 1-day beer, wine, and liquor tasting (BWLT) license; altering certain qualifications for the license; and altering the amounts of alcoholic beverages an individual may consume at a tasting.
bill_summary: The bill modifies alcohol tasting licenses in Caroline County to include liquor, increases the allowed consumption quantities per individual, and changes licensing details, including the license type and fee.
responsible_party: Caroline County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol tasting license holders and consumers in Caroline County
innovative_summary: The program mainly updates licensing rules for alcohol tastings; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific measures targeting it.

Title: Prince George's County - Stop Sign Monitoring Systems - Authorization PG 301-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the use of stop sign monitoring systems in school zones in Prince George's County, if authorized by local law; providing that the owner or driver of a motor vehicle recorded failing to obey a stop sign is subject to a citation and a certain civil penalty under certain circumstances; establishing certain defenses to a charge of an alleged violation recorded by a stop sign monitoring system; requiring the Prince George's County Department of Public Works and Transportation to make a certain report by December 1, 2025; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of stop sign monitoring systems in school zones in Prince George's County, establishes civil penalties for failing to obey stop signs recorded by such systems, and sets forth procedures for citations, defenses, and reporting on their use.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Department of Public Works and Transportation
stakeholders: Residents and drivers in Prince George's County, especially in school zones
innovative_summary: The program employs automated stop sign monitoring technology, including cameras and recorded images, to enforce traffic laws and improve road safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve child safety and reduce violations in school zones, potentially reducing related injuries and hazards.

Title: Community Colleges - Contraception - Access Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring on or before certain dates each community college to develop and implement a plan to provide students with access to over-the-counter contraception; requiring each community college to submit a certain report to the Maryland Higher Education Commission by September 1 each year; requiring the Commission to submit a certain report to the General Assembly on or before October 1 each year; and authorizing the Maryland Department of Health, on request, to provide certain assistance to a community college.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland community colleges to develop and implement plans to provide students with access to over-the-counter contraception by August 1, 2025. It also mandates annual reporting to the Maryland Higher Education Commission and the General Assembly regarding the progress and methods of providing access.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Students at Maryland community colleges
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach to increasing access to contraception on college campuses, including providing 24-hour access through various methods such as vending machines and on-campus retail establishments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce barriers to contraception, which may indirectly impact child and teen pregnancy rates and related child poverty issues.

Title: Election Law - Recounts - Procedures
Synopsis: Requiring a petitioner for a recount to select the method for conducting the recount; limiting the methods from which the selection must be made; and requiring a local board of elections to preserve and store certain voter-verifiable paper records and conduct a recount in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill updates procedures for election recounts in Maryland, including a requirement for petitioners to choose a recount method and for local boards to preserve and match voter-verifiable paper records with duplicate ballots.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters and election officials in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured method for recounts, including the use of duplicate ballots and detailed record preservation, which enhances transparency and accuracy in election recounts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it pertains to election procedures.

Title: Montgomery County and Prince George's County - Rent Court Workforce Solutions Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Rent Court Workforce Solutions Pilot Program in Montgomery County and Prince George's County to provide residential tenants who are facing eviction for a failure to pay rent with information on workforce development and employment opportunities; and requiring by January 1, 2026 and each January 1 thereafter, a designated organization to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on the number of individuals that were connected to workforce development programs or employment opportunities through the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Rent Court Workforce Solutions Pilot Program in Montgomery County and Prince George's County, providing resources and information on workforce development and employment opportunities to individuals involved in rent court cases.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Office of the County Executive and Prince George's County Office of the County Executive
stakeholders: Individuals involved in failure to pay rent cases in Montgomery County and Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach by integrating workforce development resources directly into the rent court process, connecting tenants to employment opportunities during legal proceedings.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by helping tenants secure employment and stabilize housing.

Title: Port of Baltimore - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the Port of Baltimore to be the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Port of Baltimore to the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore, formalizes its designation in state law, and makes related organizational, operational, and administrative adjustments to recognize Bentley's contributions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Port of Baltimore, Maryland transportation sector, local residents, shipping and maritime industries
innovative_summary: The bill primarily focuses on legal recognition and organizational adjustments, not on innovative technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not explicitly address child poverty directly or indirectly.

Title: Study on the Feasibility of Relocating the Prince George's County Public School System Headquarters PG 501-24
Synopsis: Requiring the Prince George's County Board of Education to hire an independent consultant to study and make recommendations on the feasibility of relocating the Prince George's County public school system headquarters and to report its recommendations by June 1, 2026; and requiring the County board to cover the cost of the study.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Prince George's County Board of Education to hire an independent consultant to study the feasibility of relocating the county's public school system headquarters, including site analysis, financial and environmental assessments, stakeholder engagement, and community input, with a report due by June 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Board of Education
stakeholders: Prince George's County public schools, residents, community organizations, local and state officials
innovative_summary: The program employs comprehensive site and community analysis, stakeholder engagement, and environmental assessment for a facility relocation study, leveraging multi-disciplinary evaluations and public input.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on a facility relocation study; its direct impact on child poverty is minimal.

Title: State Board of Dietetic Practice - Dietitian-Nutritionists - Application Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring that an individual shall have received at a minimum a degree from a college or university accredited by an educational accrediting association as required by the Commission on Dietetic Registration to be licensed as a dietician-nutritionist.
bill_summary: The bill updates the licensing requirements for dietitian-nutritionists in Maryland, including educational qualifications and certification, and clarifies waiver policies for applicants qualified in other states or with certain certifications.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Dietetic Practice
stakeholders: Aspiring and practicing dietitian-nutritionists, educational institutions, licensing authorities, and the public seeking nutrition services.
innovative_summary: The bill makes moderate updates to licensing standards, aligning requirements and facilitating the licensing process for qualified candidates from other regions, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is likely indirect, through improved access to qualified nutritional professionals and better public health.

Title: Wildlife - Traveling Animal Acts - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from allowing for the participation of a bear, a cougar, an elephant, a jaguar, a leopard, a lion, a nonhuman primate, a tiger, or a hybrid of any of these animals in a traveling animal act; and providing a civil penalty of $2,000 per violation.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the participation of certain covered animals, such as bears, big cats, nonhuman primates, and hybrids, in traveling animal acts in Maryland, and establishes penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources or local law enforcement
stakeholders: Animals involved in traveling acts, animal rights advocates, and the entertainment industry
innovative_summary: This bill employs a legal ban on a specific type of animal performance, focusing on animal welfare and wildlife protection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Emergency Medical Services Board - Licenses and Certificates - Application Requirements
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Emergency Medical Services (EMS) Board from requiring an applicant to provide proof that the applicant is lawfully present in the United States or have a Social Security number or Individual Taxpayer Identification Number as a condition for licensure or certification; and requiring the EMS Board to require applicants for a license or certificate to disclose certain information or provide alternative documentation and record the information in the applicant's file for a certain purpose.
bill_summary: This bill amends the licensing rules for emergency medical services (EMS) personnel by prohibiting the EMS Board from requiring proof of lawful presence, Social Security numbers, or Taxpayer Identification Numbers for licensure or certification applications. It also mandates data sharing of applicant information, including Social Security or TIN details, with child support enforcement agencies.
responsible_party: Maryland State Emergency Medical Services Board and the Maryland Department of Family Law (Child Support Enforcement)
stakeholders: Emergency medical services personnel and applicants, child support enforcement agencies, and the general public.
innovative_summary: The bill employs new data sharing practices and removes barriers by not requiring proof of lawful presence for EMS licensure, thus potentially facilitating more inclusive access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on licensure requirements and data sharing.

Title: State Board of Examiners in Optometry - Criminal History Records Checks
Synopsis: Requiring an applicant for a license to practice optometry and certain applicants for the renewal of a license to submit to a criminal history records check obtained from the Criminal Justice Information Central Repository of the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services; and providing that information obtained from the Central Repository is confidential, may not be redisseminated, and is to be used only for licensing purposes.
bill_summary: The bill requires optometry license applicants and license renewal applicants in Maryland to submit to criminal history records checks as part of the licensing process.
responsible_party: State Board of Examiners in Optometry
stakeholders: Optometrists and applicants for optometry licenses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs criminal background checks using fingerprinting and federal checks as part of the licensing process, integrating technology into professional licensing protocols.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting licensing procedures for professionals.

Title: Criminal and Civil Trespass - Professional Land Surveyors - Exception
Synopsis: Establishing exceptions to certain criminal prohibitions against trespass on property and the civil tort of trespass for professional land surveyors, and agents and employees of professional land surveyors, who enter the property of another to practice land surveying.
bill_summary: The bill provides legal protections for licensed professional land surveyors, agents, and employees when they enter private property to perform land surveying, by establishing exceptions to criminal and civil trespass laws.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board for Professional Land Surveyors
stakeholders: Licensed professional land surveyors and property owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates specific legal exemptions for professional land surveyors, which is a targeted legal clarification rather than an innovative technological approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty, as it addresses legal protections for land surveyors.

Title: Cosmetology Licensure Compact
Synopsis: Entering into the Cosmetology Licensure Compact; establishing criteria for participating states; authorizing an individual practicing cosmetology to practice in a party state under certain circumstances; establishing the Cosmetology Licensure Compact Commission and its duties and powers; and providing for the amendment of and withdrawal from the Compact.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Cosmetology Licensure Compact, which facilitates interstate practice of cosmetology by creating a multi-state licensing program, a commission to oversee its administration, and provisions for licensing, discipline, and cooperation among member states.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Licensed cosmetologists, regulating agencies, and the public seeking cosmetology services in member states
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a multi-state licensure compact with a centralized data system, rulemaking authority, and dispute resolution mechanisms, employing a coordinated interstate approach to licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing workforce mobility and access to cosmetology services, which may support economic stability for families.

Title: Wage Payment and Collection - Pay Stubs and Pay Statements - Required Information
Synopsis: Requiring that a notice containing certain information provided to an employee at the time of hiring be written; requiring that the statement regarding earnings required to be provided to employees by employers be written on the physical pay stub or online pay statement and include certain information; requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry to create and make available to an employer at no charge a pay stub template that may be used by an employer to comply with the Act; and establishing a certain administrative penalty.
bill_summary: The bill requires employers in Maryland to provide written notices of employment terms at hiring and detailed pay stubs or online pay statements that include specific information such as employer details, pay period, hours worked, pay rates, gross and net pay, deductions, and other pay components. It also establishes a process for the Commissioner of Labor and Industry to create a free pay stub template and authorizes penalties for non-compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Industry
stakeholders: Employees and employers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program standardizes and digitalizes pay information, ensuring transparency and consistency through a government-provided template, enhancing compliance and employee understanding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly benefits low-income workers by improving pay transparency, which can aid in fair compensation and financial stability.

Title: Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program - Alterations (Maryland Meals for Achievement Flexibility Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Clarifying that secondary schools participating in the Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program may serve breakfast in any broadly accessible part of the school; and authorizing elementary schools participating in the Program, subject to certain approval and allowances, to serve breakfast in any broadly accessible part of the school, including from "Grab and Go" carts.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that secondary schools participating in the Maryland Meals for Achievement In- Classroom Breakfast Program may serve breakfast in any broadly accessible part of the school, including 'Grab and Go' carts. It also authorizes elementary schools, with approval, to do the same. The bill outlines program details, funding, and implementation requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students in Maryland public and eligible nonpublic schools, school staff, and administrative entities involved in school meal programs.
innovative_summary: The program employs flexible service locations such as 'Grab and Go' carts and broad accessibility, representing a modern approach to increasing student participation in school meals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to significantly increase breakfast participation among students from lower-income families, thereby directly impacting child poverty.

Title: Public Information Act â€“ Surveillance Images â€“ Illegal Dumping in Baltimore City
Synopsis: Altering a requirement that a custodian deny inspection of certain surveillance images of illegal dumping in Baltimore City to allow inspection by an employee or agent of the Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development; and authorizing the Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development to publicly disseminate a surveillance image as part of an investigation.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the rules around surveillance images of illegal dumping in Baltimore City, allowing certain city employees or agents to access and publicly disseminate these images as part of investigations.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents and officials involved in illegal dumping investigations and enforcement in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy change allowing public dissemination of surveillance images related to illegal dumping, improving transparency and enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's primary focus is on environmental enforcement and transparency, with no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Commission on African American History and Culture - Museum Name Change
Synopsis: Altering the name of the museum operated by the Commission on African American History and Culture in certain provisions of law from the "Banneker-Douglass Museum" to the "Banneker-Douglass-Tubman Museum".
bill_summary: The bill changes the name of a museum operated by the Commission on African American History and Culture, and allocates $1,600,000 annually for its operation, along with authorizing the commission to seek additional funding and accept donations.
responsible_party: Commission on African American History and Culture
stakeholders: Public interested in African American history and culture, museum visitors, local community
innovative_summary: The bill primarily reallocates funds and renames an existing museum; it does not introduce new technology or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct focus on child poverty or economic issues affecting children.

Title: Human Relations - Commission on Civil Rights - Appeal of Final Orders
Synopsis: Providing that a certain final order of the Commission on Civil Rights on a complaint alleging a discriminatory act is appealable in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act.
bill_summary: The bill expands the appeal process for final orders issued by the Maryland Commission on Civil Rights concerning complaints of discriminatory acts, allowing such orders to be appealed in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission on Civil Rights
stakeholders: Individuals filing complaints of discrimination and the general public interested in civil rights enforcement
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes the appeal process for civil rights complaints in line with the Administrative Procedure Act, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Sales and Use Tax on Energy and Fuel - Use of Revenue PG 407-24
Synopsis: Altering a certain provision of law relating to the use of certain revenue from the sales and use tax on energy and fuel in Prince George's County by allowing the revenue to be used to meet certain education funding requirements for the county; and repealing a requirement that the county appropriate a certain amount of local money to the school operating budget each fiscal year.
bill_summary: This bill alters the use of revenue from the sales and use tax on energy and fuel in Prince George's County, allowing the revenue to be used to meet education funding requirements instead of solely funding ethics provisions, and repeals the requirement for the county to appropriate a certain amount of local money to the school budget each fiscal year.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government and the Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, teachers, and residents of Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill redirects existing tax revenue to fulfill education funding requirements, streamlining resource allocation and potentially improving local education funding efficiency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential to reduce child poverty by increasing or ensuring stable funding for public education.

Title: Public Utilities â€“ Thermal Energy Network Systems â€“ Authorization and Establishment (Working for Accessible Renewable Maryland Thermal Heat (WARMTH) Act)
Synopsis: Requiring gas companies serving at least 75,000 customers in their distribution territories and authorizing gas companies serving fewer than 75,000 customers to develop a plan for a pilot thermal energy network system or systems on or before October 1, 2024; requiring certain gas companies to submit a certain proposal or proposals to the Public Service Commission for approval on or before July 1, 2025; authorizing certain entities or a community organization to submit neighborhoods for consideration as part of a pilot system; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the development and implementation of pilot thermal energy network systems by gas companies, with a focus on serving low and moderate income neighborhoods, and includes provisions for funding, community participation, and evaluation of the pilot projects.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration and Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Low- and moderate-income residents, community organizations, local governments, and gas companies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs innovative approaches such as pilot projects for thermal energy networks, integration with federal funding sources, and community benefit agreements, along with data collection and workforce development initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential for a direct impact on child poverty by prioritizing low and moderate income communities and providing affordable heating and cooling solutions.

Title: Prince George's County - Taxes on Telecommunications Services - Use of Revenue PG 406-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the Prince George's County Council to impose an excise tax on certain telecommunications service in Prince George's County in addition to, or instead of, a sales and use tax; altering a certain provision of law relating to the use of certain revenue from a certain tax on telecommunications services by allowing the revenue to be used to meet certain education funding requirements for the county; requiring the county to submit an annual report detailing the expenditure of revenues generated by a tax imposed by the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to impose an excise tax on telecommunications services, and specifies that the revenue generated from this tax, at least 90%, will be used to fund public schools in the county, including specific programs such as for disruptive and low-performing students and bilingual education.
responsible_party: Prince Georgeâ€™s County Council and County government
stakeholders: Students, schools, and residents of Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The program uses a new local tax mechanism to generate dedicated funding for education programs, integrating telecommunications revenue with education funding priorities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly support programs that could reduce child poverty, especially through targeted education initiatives for disadvantaged students.

Title: Public Safety - Wellness Checks - Requirements (Gabriel's Law)
Synopsis: Requiring a law enforcement agency that receives a certain request for a wellness check of an individual to conduct a wellness check or submit a request for the relevant law enforcement agency to conduct a wellness check without unreasonable delay; and requiring a fire, rescue, or emergency medical services entity to conduct the wellness check simultaneously with the law enforcement agency if the request concerns a life-threatening condition.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that law enforcement and emergency medical services respond immediately to qualified requests for wellness checks, especially when there is a concern for a life-threatening condition, and requires coordination across jurisdictions to ensure timely action.
responsible_party: Maryland State law enforcement agencies and emergency medical services
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland needing wellness checks, law enforcement, and emergency services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a requirement for immediate and cross-jurisdictional responses to wellness check requests with a focus on life-threatening situations, streamlining communication and action protocols.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve safety and well-being, which may indirectly reduce child poverty by ensuring timely assistance for vulnerable individuals.

Title: Mental Health Law - County Mental Health Advisory Committees - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of a county's mental health advisory committee by including an individual with experience with mental health care for veterans or individuals serving in the military on the list of groups from which individuals may be appointed to the committee by the governing body of the county.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to include individuals with experience in mental health care for veterans or military personnel on county mental health advisory committees.
responsible_party: County governments and health departments of Maryland
stakeholders: Mental health service users, veterans, military personnel, families, community organizations, and county health systems
innovative_summary: The bill's inclusion of veterans and military mental health experience in advisory committees is a targeted policy change, not employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Minimal direct impact on child poverty, as the bill focuses on advisory committee membership.

Title: Maryland Technology Development Corporation - Equitech Growth Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Specifying that the Equitech Growth Fund in the Maryland Technology Development Corporation may be used only to make certain awards and to pay the costs of administering the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Equitech Growth Fund within the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to support emerging and advanced industries through workforce development and infrastructure projects, with annual funding of $5 million.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Businesses, workforce, higher education institutions, and communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a strategic, multi-source funding approach focusing on fostering industry competitiveness, inclusive growth, and leveraging private and federal investments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty through economic growth and job creation in the state's industries.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Reports on Standing Orders and Opioid Overdose Reversal Drugs
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on current opioid overdose reversal drugs and, for any current opioid overdose reversal drug approved by the federal Food and Drug Administration, whether the Department has added the drug to a standing order and, if not, the reasons why the drug has not been added; and requiring the report to be submitted by December 1, 2024, December 1, 2025, and December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to report on the approval and addition of opioid overdose reversal drugs to standing orders by specific dates, and clarifies that licensed health care providers issuing standing orders for these drugs must allow individuals to choose any formulation approved by the FDA.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals at risk of opioid overdose and healthcare providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill clarifies and expands the options for opioid overdose reversal drugs available through standing orders, ensuring individuals can choose any FDA-approved formulation, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has an indirect potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to opioid reversal drugs, thus potentially reducing overdose deaths affecting families.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Administration - Clarification and Technical Correction
Synopsis: Clarifying that the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System may pay certain incentive compensation to the Chief Investment Officer for the State Retirement and Pension System if the Chief Investment Officer retires from the Investment Division of the State Retirement Agency in a certain manner; and correcting a certain incorrect reference of an age restriction applying to certain members of the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System who participate in the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP).
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the conditions under which the Chief Investment Officer of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System can receive incentive payments upon retiring, and allows certain members of the State Police and Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System to extend their participation in the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP) until a specified date, with a focus on extending participation for members of the State Police Retirement System.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Members of the State Police Retirement System and Law Enforcement Officersâ€™ Pension System, notably those participating in the DROP and Chief Investment Officer
innovative_summary: The program employs a technical extension of the DROP participation deadline and clarifies incentive payout conditions, which is fairly standard administrative clarification without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The billâ€™s provisions for extending retirement program participation may indirectly benefit law enforcement personnel, but it does not specifically target reducing child poverty.

Title: Public Schools - Active Shooter Safety Drills or Trainings - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Center for School Safety to collaborate with an institution of higher education or a designated federal or national research entity to study the effectiveness and impact of active shooter safety drills or trainings by researching and analyzing data collected by local school systems; requiring the Center to identify best practices for active shooter safety drills or trainings on or before October 1, 2024; requiring local school systems to provide parents with the annual schedule of active shooter safety drills; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates research, best practice identification, and regulation updates for active shooter safety drills in Maryland public schools. It requires collaboration with research entities, development of trauma-sensitive practices, and dissemination of firearm safety information to parents.
responsible_party: Maryland Center for School Safety and Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, parents, school personnel, and local education and law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces research-based assessment and trauma-sensitive approaches to active shooter drills, including collaboration with higher education and federal research entities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The billâ€™s focus on safe school environments and informed emergency response can indirectly reduce child poverty impacts by promoting safer, supportive learning settings.

Title: Grant Applications and Reporting - Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council by removing the Director of the Governor's Grants Office or the Director's designee and adding the Comptroller or the Comptroller's designee; requiring the Council to study and make recommendations to the Department of Budget and Management regarding the creation of a State Grants Ombudsperson by July 1, 2025; altering certain reporting requirements; and extending the termination date of the Council to June 30, 2029.
bill_summary: The bill reforms and extends the activities of the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council, including studying and recommending improvements to grant processes, creating a State Grants Ombudsperson, and reporting on implementation efforts.
responsible_party: Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Grant applicants, grant recipients, government agencies, nonprofits, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes creating a centralized, standardized grants management system and establishing a grant ombudsperson to improve efficiency and support for grant processes, which is a relatively new approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by streamlining grant access and support for social services.

Title: State and Local Parks - Play Area Accessibility - Recreation Communication Boards Pilot Program
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources and local governing bodies to construct communication boards in certain newly constructed public play areas; defining "communication board" as a device that displays photos, symbols, or illustrations to enable individuals with limited language skills to communicate; establishing the Maryland Recreation Communication Boards Pilot Program, subject to funding, to improve play area accessibility by covering the cost of purchasing and installing communication boards at State and local parks; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Recreation Communication Boards Pilot Program, requiring the construction and installation of communication boards in public play areas to improve accessibility for individuals with limited language skills or disabilities. It allocates funding through the Park System Capital Improvements and Acquisition Fund and provides grants to local governing bodies for purchasing and installing these boards, with reports due to the General Assembly assessing the program's effectiveness.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities and limited language skills, children and families using public play areas, local governments, state parks users
innovative_summary: The program uses technology (communication boards) and a pilot approach to improve accessibility in public play areas, which is a relatively new approach for government services in this context.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly impact child poverty by increasing inclusive recreational opportunities, but its primary focus is accessibility rather than economic factors.

Title: Montgomery County - Housing Opportunities Commission - Alterations MC 3-24
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement that the Housing Opportunities Commission of Montgomery County hold public hearings on assisted family housing proposals; and repealing the requirement that the Montgomery Commission publish a summary of the Montgomery Commission's annual financial report in certain newspapers.
bill_summary: The bill reforms the operations of the Housing Opportunities Commission of Montgomery County by removing requirements for public hearings on assisted family housing proposals and eliminating the obligation to publish financial report summaries in newspapers, instead mandating online publication of financial reports and audits.
responsible_party: Housing Opportunities Commission of Montgomery County
stakeholders: Residents of Montgomery County and prospective assisted family housing residents
innovative_summary: The bill promotes digital transparency by replacing newspaper publication requirements with online publication of financial reports, streamlining access to information.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could have an indirect impact on child poverty by improving transparency and community trust in housing initiatives, but it does not establish direct programs targeting child poverty.

Title: Places of Public Accommodation - Motion Picture Houses - Captioning
Synopsis: Requiring all motion picture houses to offer closed movie captioning for each screening of a motion picture, with a certain exception; and requiring, if a motion picture is produced and available to motion picture houses with open movie captioning, a place of public accommodation that controls, operates, owns, or leases a motion picture house with eight or more screens in the State to provide open movie captioning for at least two screenings for each motion picture it screens each week.
bill_summary: The bill requires motion picture houses in Maryland to offer closed captioning for each screening of a movie. Larger theaters with eight or more screens must also provide open captioning for at least two screenings each week, and these requirements commence after the first three weeks following a movie's premiere.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant state agency overseeing public accommodation regulations
stakeholders: Individuals with hearing impairments who watch movies in public theaters
innovative_summary: The bill employs existing captioning technology requirements but extends them specifically to public cinemas and establishes a phased approach for open captioning implementation for large theaters.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing primarily on accessibility for individuals with hearing impairments.

Title: Community Schools - Rental Assistance for Community School Families Program and Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Rental Assistance for Community School Families Program to provide rental assistance to eligible student households; requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development, in consultation with the State Department of Education, to administer the Program; establishing the Rental Assistance for Community School Families Fund; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $10,000,000 in the annual budget bill for the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Rental Assistance for Community School Families Program and Fund in Maryland, designed to provide rental and utility assistance to eligible student households at community schools, aiming to reduce housing insecurity and support student success.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development in coordination with the Department of Education and the Governor's Office for Children
stakeholders: Students and their families who are enrolled in community schools and are at risk of homelessness or housing instability in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted rental assistance initiative integrated within community schools, combining educational and housing support with a dedicated fund and collaboration among state agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by providing essential housing support to vulnerable student households.

Title: Department of Veterans Affairs - Renaming and Deputy Secretary of Military Family Policy and Programs
Synopsis: Renaming the Department of Veterans Affairs to be the Department of Veterans and Military Families; renaming the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to be the Secretary of Veterans and Military Families; requiring the Secretary to appoint a Deputy Secretary of Military Family Policy and Programs; and providing that the Department of Veterans and Military Families is the successor of the Department of Veterans Affairs.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs to the Department of Veterans and Military Families, creates a new Deputy Secretary of Military Family Policy and Programs position, and updates related legal references and organizational structures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Military families, veterans, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a dedicated department and executive role focused explicitly on military families, strengthening government support for this group.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential for high impact on child poverty through improved support for military families, which often include children in poverty.

Title: Courts and Judicial Proceedings and Criminal Procedure - Technical Corrections - References to Intellectual Disability
Synopsis: Replacing references to mental retardation with references to an intellectual disability in certain provisions of law.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland law by replacing references to 'mental retardation' with 'intellectual disability' in various legal provisions related to juvenile competency, involuntary commitment, and criminal responsibility, to reflect current terminology.
responsible_party: Maryland judiciary and health departments
stakeholders: Individuals with intellectual disabilities, juvenile and criminal justice systems, mental health professionals
innovative_summary: The bill mainly clarifies terminology within existing legal frameworks; it does not establish new services or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty, as it updates terminology and legal references.

Title: Persons Providing Lobbyist Compensation â€“ Statement of Political Contributions â€“ Exemption for Nonprofits
Synopsis: Exempting nonprofit organizations qualified under Â§ 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code from the requirement for a person providing lobbyist compensation to file a statement of political contributions with the State Board of Elections.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain nonprofit organizations from the requirement to file a statement of political contributions when providing lobbyist compensation, specifically those qualified under Â§ 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations and lobbyists in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies lobbying disclosure requirements for nonprofit organizations by exempting specific nonprofits from reporting statements of political contributions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes reporting exemptions for nonprofits engaged in lobbying.

Title: Child Support - Incarcerated Obligors
Synopsis: Authorizing a court, if an obligor becomes incarcerated, to determine that a material change of circumstances warranting a modification of child support has occurred, provided that the party's ability to pay child support is sufficiently reduced due to the incarceration.
bill_summary: This bill makes changes to child support laws in Maryland, specifically affecting how support is calculated and modified for incarcerated obligors. It allows for the suspension of arrearages during incarceration and clarifies that incarcerated parents cannot be considered voluntarily impoverished, impacting how potential income is determined for support calculations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services or similar child support agency
stakeholders: Incarcerated parents, custodial and non-custodial parents, children receiving support
innovative_summary: The program includes a specific approach to adjusting child support obligations during incarceration, including suspending arrearages and excluding incarcerated parents from being considered voluntarily impoverished. It employs legal clarifications to ensure fairness in child support calculations for incarcerated individuals.
