child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce child poverty by adjusting child support obligations during incarceration, which can prevent the buildup of arrearages and avoid financial hardship for families.

Title: Maryland Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council - Membership
Synopsis: Codifying provisions relating to the Maryland Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council; altering and clarifying the composition of the Council to include certain public and private sector members; requiring the Council to submit interim reports of its work to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024, and December 1, 2025; and requiring the Council to submit a final report of its work and recommendations by June 30, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council to develop strategies and standards for integrating zero emission vehicles into the state's transportation network, including infrastructure planning, consumer outreach, and policy recommendations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation with assistance from the Maryland Energy Administration and Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Zero emission vehicle manufacturers, electric utility companies, government agencies, environmental organizations, fleet operators, vehicle dealers, and the general public interested in electric vehicles
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach to promote zero emission vehicles, including infrastructure development, policy recommendations, and public awareness campaigns, utilizing stakeholder collaboration and systematic planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by promoting cleaner transportation and supporting green jobs in infrastructure and manufacturing sectors.

Title: Income Tax Credit - Venison Donation
Synopsis: Allowing an individual, subject to certain requirements and limitations, to claim a credit against the State income tax for certain qualified expenses if the individual harvests an antlerless deer and donates the deer meat to certain organizations; limiting the amount of credits an individual may claim to a maximum of $300; and requiring by January 31 each year each venison donation program that received certain donations to report certain information about each donor who intended to claim the credit to the Comptroller.
bill_summary: The bill allows hunters to claim a state income tax credit of up to $75 for qualified expenses related to butchering and processing an antlerless deer for human consumption, provided they donate the meat to a qualified venison donation program. It also provides legal immunity to those donating food to nonprofit organizations, and requires venison donation programs to report the name, address, and donation details of each donor. The program is temporary, lasting for 5 years starting from July 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller and relevant enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Hunters, venison donation organizations, and food-insecure populations who benefit from donated deer meat
innovative_summary: The bill employs a combination of tax credit incentives and legal protections to promote hunting and donation of venison to combat food insecurity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing access to nutritious food through venison donation, especially for food-insecure children.

Title: Comprehensive Flood Management Grant Program - Funding for Underserved and Overburdened Communities
Synopsis: Requiring at least 40% of funding provided under the comprehensive flood management grant program to be used for projects located in or directly benefiting underserved or overburdened communities; and authorizing the Governor to include in the annual State budget an appropriation of up to $20,000,000 for the comprehensive flood management grant program in fiscal year 2026 and each fiscal year thereafter.
bill_summary: The bill establishes funding and guidelines for the comprehensive flood management grant program in Maryland, including specific provisions to allocate at least 40% of funds to underserved or overburdened communities starting in fiscal year 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Communities affected by flooding, especially underserved and overburdened communities, local governments, emergency management agencies
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted funding allocation to underserved communities and sets detailed standards and regulations for flood management projects, integrating community needs into flood risk mitigation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to reduce child poverty by protecting vulnerable communities from flood risks and associated economic hardships.

Title: Tax Assistance for Low-Income Marylanders - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, beginning in fiscal year 2025, to distribute a certain amount of abandoned property funds to the Tax Clinics for Low-Income Marylanders Fund; requiring the Governor to include $800,000 in the annual budget for the CASH Campaign of Maryland to award grants for providing certain tax assistance through on-demand and mobile tax clinics; and requiring certain tax clinics to interact with the CASH campaign to ensure sufficient access to tax preparation services for low-income Maryland residents.
bill_summary: This bill allocates funding to support tax assistance programs for low-income Marylanders, including grants for tax clinics and increased funding for the CASH Campaign of Maryland to provide free tax preparation and financial education services.
responsible_party: Maryland State government, specifically the Comptroller and the Governor's Office
stakeholders: Low-income Maryland residents, especially seniors, rural communities, under-resourced communities, and new Americans
innovative_summary: The bill enhances coordination between tax clinics and the CASH Campaign through regular engagement and increases funding for mobile and on-demand tax clinics, employing technological outreach approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by improving low-income families' access to tax credits and financial resources.

Title: Individual Tax Preparers - Code of Ethics, Notification of Actions, Enforcement, and Penalties (Stop Scam Tax Preparers Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Individual Tax Preparers to publish on the Board's website a certain code of ethics and rules of professional conduct by January 1, 2026; requiring the Board to notify the Comptroller and the Field Enforcement Bureau of a violation within 5 business days after the Board determines that the violation has occurred; granting certain employees of the Bureau certain powers, duties, and responsibilities for enforcing laws pertaining to income tax preparation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new code of ethics and rules of conduct for individual tax preparers, requires the publication of these rules, improves enforcement and oversight by the Maryland State Board of Individual Tax Preparers and the Comptroller's Office, and enhances penalties for fraudulent tax preparation. It also creates a fund to support low-income tax clinics and increases enforcement powers for law enforcement employees.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Individual Tax Preparers and Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Individual tax preparers, low-income Maryland residents, the Maryland tax agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs new technology for online publication of ethics codes and enhanced enforcement mechanisms, including reporting and compliance tools among state agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by ensuring more accurate tax filings and supporting low-income tax clinics.

Title: Income Tax â€“ Technical Corrections
Synopsis: Repealing certain obsolete provisions of law concerning the distribution of income tax revenue; and correcting a certain erroneous cross-reference.
bill_summary: The bill makes technical corrections to Maryland's income tax law by repealing obsolete provisions, correcting references, and clarifying distribution processes of income tax revenue. It also updates rules for tax credits related to revitalization projects.
responsible_party: Maryland State Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Taxpayers, municipal governments, nonprofit organizations, and businesses involved in revitalization projects in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates and clarifies existing tax laws; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly involves technical corrections to tax law and distribution, with some support for revitalization projects.

Title: Disclosure of Tax Information - Tax Compliance Activity and Binding Data Use Agreements
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "tax information" for purposes of law governing the confidentiality and disclosure of tax information; authorizing, subject to certain limitations, the disclosure of certain tax information to certain tax compliance organizations and governmental entities to assist the Comptroller in tax compliance activity; requiring the Comptroller to require the party to whom the information is to be disclosed to enter into a written, binding agreement regarding the use and security of the tax information; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Comptroller to disclose certain tax information to tax compliance organizations and governmental entities for assisting in tax compliance activities. It establishes legal safeguards, including binding data use agreements and supervision, to protect the confidentiality of tax information.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Tax authorities, tax compliance organizations, government agencies, and taxpayers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new process of sharing tax information with third-party organizations under strict supervision and data security agreements, enhancing cooperation and enforcement in tax compliance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly supports child poverty reduction by improving tax compliance and revenue collection, which can fund social programs.

Title: Comptroller - Electronic Tax and Fee Return Filing Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring, for periods beginning after December 31, 2026, that returns for certain taxes and fees collected by the Comptroller be filed electronically, subject to certain exceptions; altering certain requirements for electronic filing of returns for certain taxes; prohibiting a certain tax return preparer or software company from charging a separate fee for the electronic filing of certain tax documents; and prohibiting a software company from selling different versions of the same tax software under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that various Maryland state tax and fee returns be filed electronically beginning in 2026, including taxes such as tire recycling, water restoration, admissions and amusement, alcoholic beverages, digital advertising, motor carrier, income, sales and use, and tobacco taxes. It also prohibits certain fees and sales practices related to electronic filing and establishes penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Taxpayers, tax preparers, software companies, government agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program emphasizes the digitization and automation of tax return processes, encouraging the use of electronic filing to improve efficiency and compliance. It also includes regulations on software practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but could improve administrative efficiency and compliance, indirectly benefiting government service delivery.

Title: Environment - Synthetic Turf - Disclosure and Study
Synopsis: Requiring a producer or seller of synthetic turf to disclose to a customer typical maintenance practices and costs for removing, replacing, and disposing of synthetic turf; and requiring the Department of the Environment, in consultation with representatives of the industry, local environmental and community stakeholders, and synthetic turf producers, retailers, and users, to conduct a study on the synthetic turf industry in the State and report its findings to certain committees of the General Assembly by July 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a tracking system for the installation, removal, and disposal of synthetic turf in Maryland, including reporting requirements for custodians and industry disclosures, as well as a study on synthetic turf industry practices and disposal methods.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Synthetic turf industry, sports facility owners, local governments, schools, and community members
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive tracking and reporting system for synthetic turf, including a publicly accessible website, and mandates a study to improve recycling and waste management practices, integrating data collection with industry input and public outreach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit communities through improved environmental management.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Protection of Identity of Minor Victim
Synopsis: Providing that a court or a party in a criminal or juvenile delinquency case may not disclose or allow inspection of an electronic or paper court filing to a nonparty to the case unless the court or the party disclosing or allowing inspection of the filing redacts all identifying information relating to a minor victim that appears in the filing, unless the court finds by clear and convincing evidence that there is good cause to order otherwise.
bill_summary: The bill enhances the protection of minor victims' identities in criminal and juvenile cases by requiring redaction of identifying information from court filings, unless court discretion applies, and allows for unredacted copies to be filed under seal.
responsible_party: Maryland Supreme Court and Maryland Courts
stakeholders: Minor victims of crimes and juvenile delinquency cases, legal parties, courts
innovative_summary: The bill employs data privacy measures within legal filings, specifically requiring redaction and sealing of sensitive information, utilizing technology to protect minors' identities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is primarily on legal privacy protections for minors and does not directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: Health - State Advisory Council on Quality Care at the End of Life - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the State Advisory Council on Quality Care at the End of Life to be the State Advisory Council on Serious Illness Care.
bill_summary: The bill renames the State Advisory Council on Quality Care at the End of Life to the State Advisory Council on Serious Illness Care and makes related organizational updates.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Aging and Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: People with serious or end-of-life illnesses and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily renames and reorganizes an existing advisory council; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Health Occupations â€“ Practice Audiology â€“ Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "practice audiology" for the purposes of certain provisions of law governing the licensure and regulation of audiologists to include certain procedures that do not require anesthesia.
bill_summary: This bill updates the definition of practice audiology in Maryland law, clarifying the scope of audiologists' activities and explicitly excluding surgical procedures and certain surgeries involving implantations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Audiologists, individuals with hearing or vestibular conditions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies and specifies the scope of audiology practice, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not include direct programs aimed at reducing child poverty.

Title: Workplace Fraud and Prevailing Wage - Violations - Civil Penalty and Referrals
Synopsis: Increasing, from $5,000 to $10,000, the maximum civil penalty for the knowing failure of an employer to properly classify an individual as an employee; and requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry, on a showing by clear and convincing evidence that a violation has occurred,  to refer to the Comptroller, certain State's Attorneys, the U.S. Department of Justice, the U.S. Department of Labor, and the U.S. Department of the Treasury complaints that allege a violation of certain tax laws.
bill_summary: The bill enhances penalties and enforcement mechanisms for employers violating wage laws and misclassifying workers, including civil penalties, fines, and increased referrals to authorities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and related agencies
stakeholders: Employers, employees, labor enforcement agencies, state government entities
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies penalties and referral processes; it does not establish new services or initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly impacts child poverty by strengthening wage law enforcement, but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Commission to Advance Lithium-Ion Battery Safety in Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Advance Lithium-Ion Battery Safety in Maryland to study and make legislative, regulatory, programmatic, or other recommendations regarding certain best practices, standards, and guidelines; requiring the Commission to submit an interim progress report to the Legislative Policy Committee by December 1, 2024; and requiring the Commission to submit a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Commission to Advance Lithiumâ€“Ion Battery Safety in Maryland, tasked with studying best practices and making recommendations on preventing lithium-ion battery fires, safety standards, recycling, and public education.
responsible_party: Office of the State Fire Marshal
stakeholders: Consumers, transportation and utility sectors, recycling facilities, first responders, and battery manufacturers in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program employs a specialized commission to address lithium-ion battery safety through collaborative study and recommendations, integrating safety standards and public education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The billâ€™s focus on safety standards and education may indirectly benefit children by reducing fire risks and promoting safety, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Election Law - Postelection Procedures
Synopsis: Altering the records and documents that a board of canvassers is required to investigate under certain circumstances; altering the responsibilities of the State Administrator, the State Board of Elections, and the Board of State Canvassers regarding the certification of election results; authorizing the members of the Board of State Canvassers to appoint certain designees to serve on the Board of State Canvassers; and altering the responsibilities of the Governor regarding election results.
bill_summary: The bill modifies postelection procedures in Maryland, including how election records are investigated, verified, and certified, and how election results are reviewed and finalized by the Board of Canvassers and the Governor.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections and the Governor's Office
stakeholders: Voters, candidates, election officials, and the general public involved in Maryland elections
innovative_summary: The bill introduces clearer guidelines and processes for verifying and certifying election results, including designee appointments, but does not employ new technologies or fundamentally new approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily concerns election processes and does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Education - School Mapping Data Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the School Mapping Data Program in the Maryland Center for School Safety; providing that the purpose of the Program is to provide funds to local school systems to produce school mapping data for each public school and public charter school in the county to assist first responders in responding to emergencies at a school; authorizing the use of the Safe Schools Fund to provide funding to local school systems for the program; and requiring a certain custodian of records to deny inspection of school mapping data.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the School Mapping Data Program within the Maryland Center for School Safety, providing funding for local school systems to produce detailed school mapping data to aid emergency responders. It sets standards for the data, creates a grant fund to support school safety initiatives, and defines access and confidentiality rules for school mapping and safety data.
responsible_party: Maryland Center for School Safety and the Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, school staff, emergency responders, and local law enforcement agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs advanced digital and geographic information technologies to improve school safety and emergency response through detailed, standardized school mapping data.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to significantly enhance school safety and emergency preparedness, which can indirectly improve conditions for children in vulnerable communities.

Title: Education - Open-Source Phonics Matching Grant Program - Establishment (Open-Source Phonics Matching Grant Program Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Open-Source Phonics Matching Grant Program within the State Department of Education to provide free, open-source phonics learning materials to be used by adults to tutor students; requiring the Department to periodically review the open-source phonics learning materials to ensure the materials are consistent with best practices in literacy education, including the science of reading; and requiring the Governor each fiscal year to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $150,000 to the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Open-Source Phonics Matching Grant Program within the Maryland Department of Education, which provides matching funds to organizations producing free, open-source phonics materials for adult tutors to assist students in literacy.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Adult learners and organizations providing phonics education in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program leverages open-source materials and government funding to enhance literacy education through accessible resources, incorporating best practices and the science of reading.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve adult literacy, which can contribute to reducing child poverty indirectly by empowering parents and caregivers with literacy skills.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Forensic Genetic Genealogical DNA Analysis and Search - Applicability for Deceased and Missing Individuals
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions of law regarding the use of a certain forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis and search (FGGS) do not apply when the FGGS is conducted solely for the purpose of identifying an individual who is deceased or the subject of a certain missing person report and whose whereabouts are unknown.
bill_summary: This bill specifies that certain forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis and search (FGGS) procedures do not apply when used solely to identify deceased individuals or those who are the subject of a missing person report with unknown whereabouts.
responsible_party: Maryland Law Enforcement Agencies and Forensic Laboratories
stakeholders: Deceased individuals and missing persons in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill clarifies the scope of FGGS applications, excluding its use solely for identifying deceased individuals or missing persons; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty as it pertains to forensic DNA analysis procedures.

Title: Natural Resources - Antlerless Deer Hunting Programs - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to receive a raffle ticket for each antlerless deer hunted by the person during a certain raffle program that has as its objective the hunting of antlerless deer.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes a raffle program that allows hunters to receive a ticket for each antlerless deer hunted during specific January raffles that have targeted antlerless deer and have been held at least once between January 1, 2020, and January 30, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Hunters in Maryland, wildlife management authorities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a raffle-based incentive for hunting antlerless deer, leveraging a promotional approach to wildlife management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on wildlife management incentives.

Title: Residential Property Sales - Contract Disclosures - Superfund Sites
Synopsis: Requiring the seller of residential real property located within 1 mile of a National Priorities List (NPL) Superfund site to provide the buyer with an addendum to the contract for the sale of the property that contains the identification of the Superfund site, the definition of an NPL Superfund site, web addresses for certain websites, and a notice that the buyer may void the contract of sale within 5 days after signing and dating the contract of sale.
bill_summary: The bill requires sellers of residential properties within 1 mile of a Superfund site to include an addendum in the sales contract that discloses information about the Superfund site and the buyer's rights to void the contract within 5 days.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment or applicable real estate authorities
stakeholders: Homebuyers and sellers of residential property near Superfund sites in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new disclosure requirement linking environmental issues to real estate transactions, employing digital resources for transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification for Donations to Diaper Banks and Other Charitable Entities - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the termination date applicable to a subtraction under the Maryland income tax for certain donations to diaper banks and other charitable entities; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2020, but before January 1, 2027.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for a Maryland income tax subtraction modification for donations made to diaper banks and other charitable entities, allowing taxpayers to subtract up to $1,000 in donations for qualifying organizations.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Taxpayers making charitable donations to diaper banks and related organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing tax benefit for donations; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By supporting organizations that provide hygiene products to children and families in need, the program could help reduce child poverty.

Title: Education - Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission - Publishing and Meetings Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission to publish the names of the candidates for appointment to the Baltimore County Board of Education on the Commission's website before interviewing the candidates; requiring meetings of the Commission that involve action on a candidate for appointment to the county board to be public; and requiring certain meetings of the Commission to be held without the public in attendance and recorded and for the recording to be provided within 48 hours of receiving a request for the recording.
bill_summary: The bill enhances transparency and public access for the Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission by requiring the publication of candidates' names, live streaming of meetings, recording and public accessibility of meetings, and disclosure of records, including application materials and interview recordings.
responsible_party: Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission
stakeholders: Candidates for Baltimore County Board of Education, residents of Baltimore County, public interested in school board appointments
innovative_summary: The program employs modern technology by live streaming meetings, recording sessions for later access, and publishing candidate information online to increase transparency and public participation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions are not specifically targeted to impact child poverty directly but could improve governance and decision-making affecting educational resources.

Title: Criminal Law - Sexual Crimes - Definition of Consent and Repeal of Force
Synopsis: Requiring certain facts to be considered when determining whether a lack of consent exists for the purposes of determining certain sexual crimes; altering the elements of second-degree rape to remove the requirement of use of force or threat of force; and requiring the Maryland Judiciary to report to the General Assembly, beginning October 1, 2024, and each October 1 thereafter, certain data for the preceding calendar year, disaggregated by county and offender age, race, and sex.
bill_summary: This bill revises Maryland's laws on sexual consent by stating how consent should be interpreted, removing the requirement for documentation of consent, and changing elements of second-degree rape. It also mandates annual reporting of sexual crime data by the Maryland Judiciary.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Victims of sexual crimes, legal authorities, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal definitions and reporting requirements, with a focus on legal and procedural improvements rather than the introduction of new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Hunting - Nonresident Sika Deer Stamp - Fee Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the fee for nonresident sika deer stamps from $25 to $200.
bill_summary: This bill increases the fee for a nonresident sika deer stamp from $100 to $200.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Nonresident hunters of sika deer in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill does not introduce any new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Real Property - Access to Counsel in Evictions Program - Mandated Reports
Synopsis: Altering the information relating to the Access to Counsel in Evictions Program required to be reported by the Maryland Legal Services Corporation each year to include disaggregation by case type, the amount paid to attorneys for each case managed, the geographic distribution of cases, the disposition of cases decided, the amount of State and federal funds allocated to each designated organization, and the number of individuals provided legal representation for multiple cases.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for the Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC) to report annually on the Access to Counsel in Evictions Program, including the number of cases, payment data, case outcomes, geographic distribution, and funding details. It also defines terms related to the program.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC)
stakeholders: Tenants facing eviction, legal service providers, and the Maryland state government
innovative_summary: The bill introduces detailed annual reporting requirements for legal representation in eviction cases, enhancing transparency and accountability of the program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a potential to reduce child poverty by providing legal aid to low-income households facing eviction, potentially preventing homelessness.

Title: Health Occupations - Private Dental Offices - Infection Control
Synopsis: Requiring each owner of a private dental office to designate a licensed dentist to be the supervising dentist for the private dental office; requiring a supervising dentist to complete the registration required by the State Board of Dental Examiners and be responsible for all infection control activities within the private dental office; authorizing the Board to charge a fee for the registration of a supervising dentist under the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires private dental offices in Maryland to designate a licensed dentist as the supervising dentist responsible for infection control activities, mandates registration with the State Board of Dental Examiners, and limits the number of offices a supervising dentist can oversee.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Private dental office owners, licensed dentists, dental patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured regulatory approach to ensure infection control oversight in private dental offices through designated supervising dentists.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Charter Counties - Enforcement of Local Laws
Synopsis: Increasing from $1,000 to $5,000 the maximum amount of a civil or criminal fine that may be imposed by a charter county to enforce certain local laws enacted by the county.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum civil and criminal fines that a charter county in Maryland can impose to enforce local laws from $1,000 to $5,000, and clarifies enforcement provisions for fair housing laws and employment or public accommodations discrimination laws.
responsible_party: Charter counties in Maryland
stakeholders: Residents and local governments in Maryland, particularly those enforcing local laws
innovative_summary: The bill primarily adjusts legal fine limits and enforcement rules for local laws; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Department of Planning - Maryland Humanities Council - Appropriation to the Marilyn Hatza Memorial Strengthening the Humanities Investment in Nonprofits for Equity (SHINE) Grantmaking Initiative
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $1,000,000 each year to the Department of Planning to be used as a grant to the Maryland Humanities Council for the Marilyn Hatza Memorial Strengthening Humanities Investment in Nonprofits for Equity (SHINE) Grantmaking Initiative; and requiring the Maryland Humanities Council to select, award, and report on grants to qualifying nonprofit organizations under the SHINE Grantmaking Initiative.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Governor of Maryland to allocate $1,000,000 annually to the Maryland Humanities Council to support a grant initiative called SHINE, which provides operating grants to small and mid-sized nonprofits in the humanities, arts, cultural, and educational sectors, promoting diversity and transparency in grant awards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning (via the Maryland Humanities Council)
stakeholders: Nonprofit humanities, arts, cultural, and educational organizations in Maryland, especially small and mid-sized nonprofits and communities benefiting from grants
innovative_summary: This program encourages diversity and transparency in grant allocations and supports a broad range of nonprofit organizations through general operating grants, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to positively impact child poverty by supporting community-based nonprofits that may serve children and families and preserving or creating jobs within these organizations.

Title: Sexual Harassment Prevention Training - Morgan State University and St. Mary's College of Maryland - Training Format
Synopsis: Providing that a certain required sexual harassment prevention training for employees of Morgan State University and St. Mary's College of Maryland may consist of webinar, computer-based, or online training if the training includes a certain evaluative component.
bill_summary: The bill updates sexual harassment prevention training requirements for employees of Morgan State University and St. Maryâ€™s College of Maryland, allowing online formats such as webinars and computer-based training, and mandates evaluation components for such training.
responsible_party: Maryland State Personnel and Pensions Department or relevant university administration
stakeholders: Employees of Morgan State University and St. Maryâ€™s College of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill permits online and webinar-based training methods for sexual harassment prevention, incorporating evaluation components to ensure engagement and comprehension.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill likely has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on employee training within universities.

Title: Allegany and Garrett Counties - Property Tax - Credit for Construction of Housing
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing bodies of Allegany County and Garrett County and municipal corporations located in Allegany County and Garrett County to grant, by law, a property tax credit on certain newly constructed dwellings; prohibiting the tax credit from exceeding $10,000; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes property tax credits for newly constructed, unoccupied residential dwellings in Allegany and Garrett Counties that have specific safety or connectivity features, and provides income tax credits to developers for constructing middle-income homes in these counties, aiming to incentivize housing development.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Homebuyers, developers, residents of Allegany and Garrett Counties, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill combines property tax incentives with state-level income tax credits, including features for safety and connectivity, to promote new housing development with innovative multi-level financial support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce child poverty by incentivizing new housing and development, which may improve housing availability and economic stability in the counties.

Title: Children - Labor Trafficking
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "abuse" to include labor trafficking of a child by any individual for purposes of provisions of law governing children in need of assistance cases and child abuse and neglect reporting; expanding provisions of law relating to the Safe Harbor Regional Navigator Grant Program to apply to child victims of labor trafficking; and requiring the Department of Human Services to include labor trafficking in its annual report on child sex trafficking to the Governor and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill expands Maryland law to include labor trafficking of children as a form of abuse, and establishes programs and services to support victims, including a regional navigator grant program, and requires reporting on child trafficking incidents.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and local departments of social services
stakeholders: Children victims of labor trafficking and their families, child advocacy organizations, social services, and legal agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs trauma-informed, victim-centered approaches and establishes a regional navigator network to coordinate responses for child trafficking victims, integrating multiple agencies and services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by providing targeted services and support to trafficked children, helping them stabilize and reintegrate.

Title: Business Facade Improvement Program - Eligible Funding Recipients
Synopsis: Expanding the eligible recipients of funding provided by the Department of Housing and Community Development under the Business Facade Improvement Program to include community development organizations that serve at least one sustainable community and apply for funds.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Business Facade Improvement Program to include community development organizations as eligible recipients of funding, in addition to political subdivisions, with the goal of supporting sustainable communities and improving the appearance of local businesses.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Businesses located in sustainable communities, community development organizations, and residents of those communities.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new funding channel for community development organizations to participate in the facade improvement efforts, integrating local government and community organizations in urban revitalization initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has medium potential to impact child poverty through community revitalization and improved local economies.

Title: Natural Resources - Fish and Fisheries - Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring certain persons licensed or regulated with respect to fish and fisheries by the Department of Natural Resources to submit reports in accordance with regulations adopted by the Department.
bill_summary: This bill requires individuals and entities involved in fishing and dealing with fish resources in Maryland to submit reports to the Department of Natural Resources according to regulations, and updates existing reporting and licensing requirements for fishing activities.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Fishermen, fish dealers, and individuals involved in fishing of Maryland waters
innovative_summary: The bill primarily formalizes reporting requirements for fishing activities and updates licensing regulations, using existing government structures without introducing new technology or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct or immediate impact on child poverty.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Work Zone Speed Control Systems - Revisions (Maryland Road Worker Protection Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Altering the distribution of revenue from civil fines collected through the use of work zone speed control systems; altering the highways on which a work zone speed control system may be used; clarifying that a system operator does not need to be present when a work zone speed control system is in use; altering the maximum penalty for a civil citation issued as a result of an image from a work zone speed control system; requiring the State Highway Administration to make a certain report; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises Maryland's regulations on work zone speed control systems, including their usage, enforcement, fines, and revenue distribution. It allows for multiple systems, clarifies enforcement procedures, increases penalties, and mandates reporting on pilot programs and fund allocations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration and Department of State Police
stakeholders: Motorists, workers in work zones, and the Maryland transportation infrastructure
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of automated work zone speed control systems with real-time speed displays and requires pilot programs testing new technologies, reflecting innovation in traffic enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on highway safety and enforcement.

Title: Workgroup to Study the Fiscal and Operational Viability of Public-Private Partnerships for Calvert County Public Schools
Synopsis: Establishing a Workgroup to Study the Fiscal and Operational Viability of Public-Private Partnerships for Calvert County Public Schools; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Board of Calvert County Commissioners, the Calvert County Board of Education, the Interagency Commission on School Construction, and the Calvert County Delegation on or before December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Workgroup to study the feasibility and implementation of public-private partnerships for financing, constructing, maintaining, and operating Calvert County Public Schools. It aims to explore ways to reduce costs for new school construction and renovations.
responsible_party: Calvert County Board of Education and other specified members of state and local agencies
stakeholders: Calvert County Public Schools, students, local government, and taxpayers in Calvert County
innovative_summary: The bill promotes exploring public-private partnerships as a potentially innovative approach to funding and managing school infrastructure, which is not yet a common practice across all districts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential to impact child poverty by potentially reducing costs and improving school infrastructure, thereby benefiting student learning environments.

Title: State Real Estate Commission - Complaints - Advertising Violations
Synopsis: Providing that a complaint filed with the State Real Estate Commission alleging an advertising violation may be made anonymously but must be accompanied by documentary or other evidence.
bill_summary: This bill allows complaints filed with the Maryland State Real Estate Commission regarding advertising violations to be made anonymously, provided they are accompanied by evidence, and modifies procedures for handling such complaints.
responsible_party: Maryland State Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate professionals and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by allowing anonymous complaints with required evidence, which could encourage more reporting of violations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it addresses complaint procedures for advertising violations.

Title: Public Schools - Student Telehealth Appointments - State Guidelines, Policies, and Access
Synopsis: Requiring, by December 31, 2024, the State Department of Education and the Maryland Department of Health jointly to adopt certain State guidelines for school health services regarding student access to telehealth appointments during the school day on the premises of public middle and high schools in the State; and requiring each county board of education to adopt and implement a certain student telehealth policy before the start of the 2025-2026 school year.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland Department of Education and the Department of Health to jointly develop guidelines for implementing student access to telehealth services in middle and high schools. It requires each school to designate private spaces for telehealth appointments and to establish policies facilitating access and privacy, with implementation starting before the 2025-2026 school year.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Public middle and high school students in Maryland, school personnel, healthcare providers, parents, and communities
innovative_summary: The program introduces a structured approach to integrating telehealth services into public schools, including developing state guidelines, designated private spaces, and policies to enhance access and privacy, leveraging telecommunication technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to improve access to health services for students, which can reduce health disparities and impact child poverty positively.

Title: Orphans' Court Judges - Restriction on Practicing Law
Synopsis: Altering a prohibition on judges of the orphans' court acting as attorneys to prohibit a judge of the orphans' court from acting as an attorney in matters related to the administration of an estate or a guardianship of a minor within the jurisdiction of the court in any county or Baltimore City, or the preparation of an estate plan or estate planning documents that might come within the jurisdiction of the court in any county or Baltimore City following the death of any individual.
bill_summary: This bill restricts orphans' court judges in Maryland from acting as attorneys in matters related to estate administration or guardianship of minors within their jurisdiction.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or the Office of the Chief Judge of the Maryland Court of Appeals
stakeholders: Judges of the orphans' court in Maryland, estate and guardianship parties, and related legal professionals
innovative_summary: The bill focuses on legal restrictions for judges to prevent conflicts of interest without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may improve the integrity of guardianship proceedings affecting minors.

Title: Correctional Services â€“ Parole Supervision Fees and Drug and Alcohol Abuse Test Payment â€“ Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement for the Maryland Parole Commission to assess a fee against an individual on parole and supervised by the Division of Parole and Probation under certain circumstances; and repealing  authorization for the Division of Parole and Probation to require a supervisee of the Division who is on parole to pay for certain drug or alcohol abuse testing under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement for the Maryland Parole Commission to assess supervision fees against individuals on parole and the authorization for the Division of Parole and Probation to require payment for drug and alcohol testing.
responsible_party: Division of Parole and Probation
stakeholders: Individuals on parole and their families, parole supervision agencies, and the criminal justice system
innovative_summary: The bill mainly changes legal requirements and does not establish new services or use new technologies; it removes existing fees and testing costs from parole supervision.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is likely minimal as it primarily deletes certain fees imposed on parolees, which may indirectly benefit parolees' families but does not create targeted programs to reduce child poverty.

Title: Community Development Administration - Live Near Your School Program - Extension
Synopsis: Extending the termination date for the Live Near Your School program and a related homebuyer program from September 30, 2024, to September 30, 2030.
bill_summary: The bill extends the Live Near Your School program, a community development initiative providing grants to help students and recent graduates buy homes near their educational institutions, and allocates $200,000 annually from 2026 to 2030 for this program.
responsible_party: Community Development Administration
stakeholders: Students, recent graduates, families, and communities near schools in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach using grants and financial assistance to support students and graduates in home buying near educational institutions, which is an innovative method to encourage community development and educational retention.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting families of limited income in affordable homeownership near schools.

Title: Land Use â€“ Affordable Housing â€“ Zoning Density and Permitting (Housing Expansion and Affordability Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing the Historic Property Revitalization Director as a position in the Department of Housing and Community Development; prohibiting a local legislative body from prohibiting the placement of certain manufactured homes or modular dwellings in a zoning district that allows single-family residential uses under certain circumstances; requiring local jurisdictions to allow an increase in density of certain qualified projects in certain districts or zones for certain properties; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Historic Property Revitalization Director within the Department of Housing and Community Development, and implements new rules allowing increased density and easing restrictions for affordable housing projects, especially those on former government-owned sites, near rail stations, or involving middle housing types. It also prohibits certain restrictions on manufactured homes and modular dwellings in single-family zones and modifies review processes for affordable housing.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Affordable housing developers, local governments, residents seeking affordable housing, and communities near former government sites or rail stations.
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates innovative zoning approaches by increasing allowable densities, requiring public health impact assessments for certain projects, and streamlining review processes to promote affordable housing development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to impact child poverty by facilitating the development of affordable housing options.

Title: Public Institutions of Higher Education - Student Withdrawal Policy - Reimbursement of Tuition and Fees (Cameron Carden Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring each public institution of higher education to adopt a policy to authorize a student to withdraw from the institution under extenuating circumstances and to refund the student for tuition and fees paid by the student for a certain semester under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill requires public higher education institutions in Maryland to adopt policies allowing students to withdraw due to extenuating circumstances such as illness, injury, hospitalization, or mental health issues, and mandates refunds for tuition and fees paid for the affected semester.
responsible_party: Public institutions of higher education in Maryland
stakeholders: Students at public colleges and universities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy change to allow withdrawals with refunds under specific extenuating circumstances, which is a policy update rather than an entirely new program or innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce child poverty by alleviating financial and educational disruptions for students facing health issues.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Student Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Educators - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Anne Arundel County Student Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Educators to assist in the repayment of certain student loans owed by educators who meet certain eligibility requirements; providing that the purpose of the Program is to attract, recruit, and retain a diverse cadre of qualified educators in the County's schools that is reflective of the student population; establishing requirements for applicants for assistance in the repayment of a commercial loan; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Anne Arundel County Student Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Educators, which helps eligible educators in Anne Arundel County pay off their student loans.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Public School System
stakeholders: Educators employed by the Anne Arundel County Public School System
innovative_summary: The program implements a targeted loan repayment initiative to attract and retain qualified teachers, which is a common approach but tailored to local needs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could directly impact child poverty by ensuring stable employment of qualified educators, potentially improving education quality.

Title: Department of Human Services - Children in Foster Care - Luggage
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Human Services to establish and maintain a decentralized supply of new luggage to be used to transport the personal belongings of a child in foster care; requiring the Department to provide new luggage to a child in foster care who is entering foster care, moving from one placement to another, or exiting foster care; prohibiting the Department from using disposable bags or trash bags to transport a child's belongings; and requiring the Department to maintain certain records.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Human Services to provide new, unused luggage to children in foster care, instead of disposable or trash bags, when transporting their personal belongings during placement changes. It also mandates record-keeping and annual reporting on the use of disposable bags.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children in foster care in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new approach to transporting belongings of foster children by providing new luggage and banning disposable bags, emphasizing dignity and proper care.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may improve the well-being and stability of foster children, which can contribute to poverty alleviation indirectly.

Title: Criminal Law - Sexual Extortion, Stalking, and Revenge Porn - Statute of Limitations and In Banc Review
Synopsis: Altering the statute of limitations applicable to the crime of sexual extortion to be 5 years; altering the statute of limitations applicable to the crime of stalking to be 10 years; providing that the State may institute a prosecution for revenge porn at any time; and providing that, for purposes of the Maryland Constitution, a person who commits revenge porn shall be deemed to have committed a misdemeanor whose punishment is confinement in the penitentiary and may reserve a point or question for a certain in banc review.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland criminal statutes to alter the statutes of limitations for crimes of sexual extortion and stalking, making them punishable as misdemeanors with potential confinement in the penitentiary, and removes time limits for prosecuting revenge porn. It defines new terms and increases penalties for related offenses.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Victims of sexual extortion, stalking, and revenge porn; general public; law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new definitions, penalties, and procedures for prosecuting crimes related to sexual extortion, stalking, and revenge porn, including measures to restrict access to court records for these cases.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is not focused on direct measures to reduce child poverty.

Title: Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program - Nancy Grasmick Public School Professional Award - Public School Nurses
Synopsis: Expanding the Nancy Grasmick Public School Professional Award within the Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program to include public school nurses who are licensed as registered nurses, provide health services in public schools, and are employed by a county school system or a local health department to provide health services through an agreement with a county board.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program to include loan repayment assistance for public school nurses and provides funding activities to recruit and retain nurses working in public schools in Maryland.
responsible_party: Office of Student Financial Assistance, Maryland Department of Higher Education
stakeholders: Public school nurses, public school students, public schools in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs loan repayment assistance as a strategy to attract and retain public school nurses, with targeted outreach and inclusion in a broader loan forgiveness initiative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program can help improve school health services and support low-income communities by maintaining a stable nursing workforce in underserved schools.

Title: Task Force on Responsible Use of Natural Psychedelic Substances
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force on Responsible Use of Natural Psychedelic Substances to study existing laws, scientific data, and practices related to the use of natural psychedelic substances; requiring the Task Force to make recommendations regarding any changes to State law, policies, and practices needed to create a program that enables broad, equitable, and affordable access to psychedelic substances; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before July 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force on Responsible Use of Natural Psychedelic Substances to study existing laws and practices, and to make recommendations on creating a Maryland program for responsible access, education, production, sale, and treatment involving natural psychedelic substances.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration for staffing, and the Maryland state government for overseeing the programs and recommendations.
stakeholders: Potential users of natural psychedelic substances, health care practitioners, policymakers, law enforcement, communities, and indigenous groups involved in spiritual use.
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, research-based approach to establish a regulated framework for natural psychedelic substances, including education, licensing, production, sale, and legal transition strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate, as the program may indirectly impact social determinants of health and access to treatment.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Automated Enforcement Citations and Notices - Mailing Addresses
Synopsis: Requiring that citations and notices issued as a result of automated enforcement under the Maryland Vehicle Law be sent to the current mailing address on file with the Administration or if a mailing address is not available, the current residential address on file with the Administration.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that all automated enforcement citations and notices for traffic violations issued in Maryland be sent to the current mailing address on file with the Maryland Vehicle Administration, including the registered owner's address or, if unavailable, the residential address.
responsible_party: Maryland Vehicle Administration and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Vehicle owners in Maryland subject to automated traffic enforcement citations
innovative_summary: The bill primarily standardizes and clarifies mailing procedures for traffic citations, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct or significant impact on child poverty.

Title: Sales and Use Tax Exemption - Aircraft Parts and Equipment - Repeal of Reporting Requirement and Extension of Sunset
Synopsis: Repealing a certain reporting requirement relating to an exemption from the sales and use tax for certain materials, parts, and equipment used to repair, maintain, or upgrade aircraft or certain aircraft systems; and extending the termination date of the exemption to June 30, 2030.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the sales and use tax exemption on materials, parts, and equipment used for repairing, maintaining, or upgrading aircraft and aircraft systems, which was originally set to end in 2025, now to end in 2030.
responsible_party: Maryland State Comptroller's Office or Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Aircraft repair industry, aviation businesses, aviation technicians, and the general public using or benefiting from aircraft maintenance services in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program involves a tax exemption extension without introducing new technologies or approaches, mainly a renewal of an existing tax policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has low direct impact on child poverty since it primarily involves tax policy extension for the aviation industry.

Title: Tree Expert Licenses - Application and Renewal Fee Alterations and Insurance Requirements
Synopsis: Specifying the maximum amounts of fees for a tree expert license established by the Department of Natural Resources by regulation; authorizing the Department to permanently revoke or temporarily suspend a tree expert license if the license holder fails to maintain liability, property, or workers' compensation insurance in a certain manner; and requiring the Department to prepare an annual report on the number of licenses issued and certain receipts and expenses and submit the report to the General Assembly by November 1 each year.
bill_summary: The bill establishes licensing, insurance, and fee regulations for tree experts and their businesses in Maryland. It requires licensed tree experts to carry proof of workers' compensation and liability insurance, and provides for license renewal, training, and disciplinary actions, including suspension or revocation.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Tree experts, licensed tree care businesses, and consumers of tree care services in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program employs standard regulatory approaches for licensing and insurance requirements without introducing entirely new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little to no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Special Chesapeake Bay and Coastal Sport Fishing License - Nonresidents - License Fee
Synopsis: Increasing the license fee for a special Chesapeake Bay and coastal sport fishing license for nonresident license applicants from $50 to $100.
bill_summary: This bill increases the fee for the special Chesapeake Bay and coastal sport fishing license for nonresidents from $50 to $100, effective October 1, 2024, and outlines related licensing provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Nonresident sport fishers, boat owners, and the general public interested in fishing in Chesapeake Bay and coastal waters
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies license fees and rules; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Correctional Services - Investigation of Suspected Homicide - Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of State Police to investigate any death of an incarcerated individual suspected to be a homicide that occurs while the individual is in the custody of the Division of Correction whether within or outside a correctional facility; and requiring the Department, by December 31 each year, to report to the Governor and the General Assembly the number of investigations completed and the number of cases referred by the Department for prosecution for the preceding calendar year.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Deaths in Custody Oversight Board to review and analyze deaths of incarcerated individuals, requiring investigations, reviews, and reporting to improve correctional facility practices and prevent future deaths.
responsible_party: Governorâ€™s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals, their families, correctional facilities, justice reform organizations
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated oversight board with clinical and administrative review processes for deaths in custody, integrating multiple review layers and public reporting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to impact child poverty by improving incarcerated individuals' health and safety, potentially reducing recidivism and aiding families.

Title: Maryland Online Data Privacy Act of 2024
Synopsis: Establishing generally the manner in which a controller or a processor may process a consumer's personal data; authorizing a consumer to exercise certain rights in regards to the consumer's personal data; requiring a controller of personal data to establish a method for a consumer to exercise certain rights in regards to the consumer's personal data; making a violation of the Act an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice that is subject to enforcement and penalties under the Maryland Consumer Protection Act; etc.
bill_summary: The Maryland Online Data Privacy Act of 2024 establishes regulations for how businesses in Maryland process consumer personal data, grants consumers rights over their data, and sets requirements for data security and transparency.
responsible_party: Maryland Division of Consumer Protection or equivalent agency
stakeholders: Consumers in Maryland, data controllers, and processors interested in online data privacy
innovative_summary: The bill employs comprehensive data rights for consumers, requiring data protection assessments and transparent practices, representing a significant advancement in data privacy regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily regulates data privacy practices.

Title: Higher Education - Credit Eligibility and Transfer of Credits - English as a Second Language Courses (Credit for All Language Learning (CALL) Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a public community college to consider a course or program for English as a second language or English language learner as eligible for world language or humanities credit toward an associate's degree if the course is not classified as remedial; requiring the transferability of world language credits earned by students who transfer from community colleges to institutions of higher education; and requiring institutions of higher education to review and consider the transfer of certain credits for language or humanities courses.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland public community colleges to consider English as a Second Language (ESL) courses as eligible for credit towards an associate's degree, and mandates that credits for language and humanities courses transfer freely between community colleges and other higher education institutions. It also aims to streamline credit transfer and increase recognition of ESL courses in degree pathways.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission and public community colleges
stakeholders: Students, especially English language learners and community college students
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined credit transfer process and recognizes ESL courses for credit, promoting equitable access and progressive learning pathways in higher education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to higher education for ESL students and facilitating degree completion.

Title: Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program - Modifications
Synopsis: Modifying provisions of law governing application, administration, and enforcement of the Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program, including provisions related to the payment of contributions, the calculation of the average weekly wage, the submission of claims for benefits, the application of the Program to self-employed individuals, the Family and Medical Leave Insurance Fund, the satisfaction of Program requirements through private employer plans or insurance, and the use of contributions or other funding.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program, including its application process, benefit calculations, funding, employer contributions, and the inclusion of self-employed individuals, to improve administration, extend coverage, and clarify rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees, self-employed individuals, employers, families, and service members in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs technology for electronic claims and filings, integrates information sharing, and allows community partnership grants, making it an innovative approach to public leave programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by supporting families through paid leave, particularly during early childhood and family placements.

Title: Citizens Committee for the Enhancement of Communities Surrounding Baltimore-Washington International Thurgood Marshall Airport - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Citizens Committee for the Enhancement of Communities Surrounding Baltimore-Washington International Thurgood Marshall Airport by increasing the total number of members from 11 to 12 and requiring the Committee to include one member each from legislative districts 12A and 12B instead of one member from legislative district 12.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the membership composition of the Citizens Committee for the Enhancement of Communities Surrounding Baltimoreâ€“Washington International Thurgood Marshall Airport, including increasing total members to 12 and adjusting appointment recommendations.
responsible_party: Secretary of Transportation of Maryland
stakeholders: Community associations in districts 12, 12A, 12B, 13, and 32 near BWI Airport, particularly those within or near the noise zone
innovative_summary: The bill is mainly a rule change to the committee structure and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at poverty reduction.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Victim Compensation - Alterations (Victim Compensation Reform Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board; altering certain duties, powers, and procedures for the Board to make awards to victims of crime; altering the powers and duties of certain employees; altering the amount and types of awards the Board is authorized to make to certain victims of crime; authorizing reconsideration and judicial review of decisions of the Board; authorizing the Governor to include certain funding in the annual budget bill for the Criminal Injuries Compensation Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances the Maryland Victim Compensation program by increasing eligibility, adjusting award limits, streamlining claim processes, and establishing a dedicated Criminal Injuries Compensation Fund to support victims of crimes.
responsible_party: Governorâ€™s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Victims of crime and their dependents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive, modernized approach to victim compensation, including online applications and potential digital improvements, and enhances confidentiality protections.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could have a positive impact on child poverty by providing financial and psychological support to victims and their families.

Title: Mental Health - Assisted Outpatient Treatment Programs
Synopsis: Authorizing each county to establish an assisted outpatient treatment program by July 1, 2026; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to establish an assisted outpatient treatment program in a county that does not opt to establish the program by July 1, 2026; requiring the Office of the Public Defender to provide representation in assisted outpatient treatment proceedings; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes assisted outpatient treatment programs for individuals with serious mental illness, allowing court-ordered outpatient treatment and defining procedures for emergency evaluations, involuntary admissions, and program operations in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with severe mental illness, mental health care providers, legal system, and affected families
innovative_summary: The program introduces court-ordered outpatient treatment, using multidisciplinary care teams, new legal procedures, and annual reporting to improve care adherence and outcomes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by improving mental health treatment for individuals with severe mental illness, which can stabilize families and reduce homelessness and homelessness-related hardships.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Study on the Establishment of a Homeless Shelter Licensing Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Study on the Establishment of a Homeless Shelter Licensing Program in the Department of Housing and Community Development; requiring the Study to review current habitability and admissions standards of homeless shelters in the State; and requiring the Study to report to a certain Assistant Secretary in the Department and certain committees in the General Assembly by July 1, 2025, its recommendations on habitability and admission standards and a plan to establish a program in the Department to license homeless shelters.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a study and a licensing program for homeless shelters in Maryland, including standards for operation and building safety, and authorizes the Department of Housing and Community Development to oversee the program.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Homeless individuals and shelter operators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured licensing and standards approach that combines operational and building standards to improve shelter quality and safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve shelter conditions and access, which can directly impact child poverty.

Title: Time to Serve Act of 2024
Synopsis: Increasing, from 15 to 30, the maximum number of days of disaster service leave for employees in the Executive Branch of State government; and increasing, from 15 to 30, the maximum number of days of paid leave the Secretary of Budget and Management may provide for uniformed services training or active uniformed services duty in a reserve unit of the armed forces or organized militia.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum number of days of disaster service leave for employees in the Maryland State government and allows employees in the executive branch to use more days for uniformed services duty or training. It also clarifies the leave policies related to jury service, attorney events, and other emergencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management
