stakeholders: State employees, including those in the executive branch, civil volunteers, and uniformed service members in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs an expanded leave policy for disaster and military service, with increased flexibility and days, but does not involve new technology or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty, but by supporting state employees and volunteers, it may contribute indirectly to community stability.

Title: State Government - Permits, Licenses, and Certificates - Processing (Transparent Government Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring each principal department and independent unit to create a  catalog of information relating to permits, licenses, and certificates issued by the department or independent unit and to submit the catalog to the Governor on or before October 1, 2024; requiring each department and independent unit to post certain completed information relating to permits, licenses, and certificates on the website of each department or independent unit by October 1, 2025; and establishing the Government Efficiency Commission.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a requirement for Maryland's state departments and independent units to create catalogs of permits, licenses, and certificates they issue, detailing their processes, timelines, fees, and other relevant information. It also creates the Government Efficiency Commission to monitor and recommend improvements for the efficiency of permit processing.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government (Departments and Independent Units), Office of the Governor, and the Government Efficiency Commission
stakeholders: Businesses, individuals, and organizations applying for permits, licenses, or certificates in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a systematic approach to transparency and efficiency by requiring detailed public catalogs and establishing a commission to monitor and recommend improvements, integrating transparency with performance oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to positively impact child poverty by streamlining government processes, reducing administrative barriers, and improving service delivery to families and communities.

Title: Economic Development - Entrepreneurial Innovation Programs - Establishment (Pava LaPere Legacy of Innovation Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing the Pava LaPere Innovation Acceleration Grant Program in the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to provide grants to technology-based start-up companies founded by students from institutions located in the Baltimore-Columbia-Towson Metropolitan Statistical Area; establishing the Baltimore Innovation Initiative Pilot Program within the Maryland Innovation Initiative of the Corporation; requiring certain appropriations for the programs to be included in the annual budget bill in certain fiscal years; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes two new entrepreneurial programs in Maryland. The Pava LaPere Innovation Acceleration Grant Program provides grants to early-stage technology startups founded by students or faculty in the Baltimore area, with grants of $50,000 each. The Baltimore Innovation Initiative Pilot Program offers incentives and funding to support the creation and growth of technology startups tied to eligible universities in the Baltimore region, with funding of $1.5 million for 2025 and 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation and the Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Technology startup founders, students and faculty at Baltimore-area universities, industry partners in the Baltimore region, local economies
innovative_summary: The programs employ targeted grants, university-industry collaboration, and focus on high-growth tech sectors with an emphasis on artificial intelligence and biotech, representing a modern approach to fostering regional innovation ecosystems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The programs could have a moderate impact on child poverty by fostering economic growth and new job opportunities in the Baltimore region.

Title: Center for Firearm Violence Prevention and Intervention - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Center for Firearm Violence Prevention and Intervention in the Maryland Department of Health to reduce firearm violence, harm from firearm violence, and misuse of firearms in the State by partnering with federal, State, and local agencies and affected communities to implement a public health approach to firearm violence reduction; requiring the Center to submit to the Governor and the General Assembly by May 1, 2025, a preliminary State Plan for a Public Health Approach to Reducing Firearm Violence; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Center for Firearm Violence Prevention and Intervention within the Department of Health. The center's goal is to reduce firearm violence and misuse by adopting a public health approach, collaborating with various agencies, experts, and communities, and developing strategic plans and programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Affected communities, public health professionals, law enforcement, and organizations involved in violence prevention
innovative_summary: The bill promotes a public health approach to firearm violence prevention, including strategic planning, training, community engagement, and data sharing, employing a comprehensive, multi-sectoral strategy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly impact child poverty by reducing firearm violence that can disproportionately affect children and communities in poverty.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Occupational Disease Presumptions - First Responders (Caring for Public Employees in the Safety Professions - CAPES Act)
Synopsis: Providing that certain firefighters, fire fighting instructors, rescue squad members, advanced life support unit members, and members of the Office of the State Fire Marshal who have thyroid, colon, or ovarian cancer are presumed, under certain circumstances, to have an occupational disease that was suffered in the line of duty and is compensable under workers' compensation law.
bill_summary: The bill provides occupational disease presumptions for first responders and certain law enforcement officers, including cancer and certain other diseases, making it easier for them to receive workers' compensation if they meet specific conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or relevant workers' compensation authority
stakeholders: First responders, law enforcement officers, firefighters, rescue squad members, and related public safety personnel in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs presumptions to streamline workers' compensation claims for occupational diseases among first responders, which is a notable approach but not employing new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly supports public safety workers but has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Protecting Election Officials Act of 2024
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from knowingly and willfully making a threat to harm an election official or an immediate family member of an election official because of the election official's role in administering the election process; and establishing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 3 years or a fine not exceeding $2,500 or both.
bill_summary: The bill criminalizes making threats to harm election officials or their immediate family members in Maryland, with penalties of up to 3 years in prison or a fine, to protect election officials and ensure the security of election processes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government / Maryland State Police or relevant law enforcement agency
stakeholders: Election officials and their immediate family members in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs standard legal measures to enhance security for election officials by criminalizing threats, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Weinberg Center/New Spires Arts Stages Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Altering the Class C (Weinberg Center) beer, wine, and liquor license in Frederick County to be the Class C (Weinberg Center/New Spires Arts Stages) beer, wine, and liquor license; expanding the licensed premises to include the New Spires Arts Stages; altering the officials who may sign a certain license application; authorizing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor at an event held by an outside group that has rented the Weinberg Arts Center or the New Spires Arts Stages; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the alcoholic beverage licensing rules for the Weinberg Center and New Spires Arts Stages in Frederick County, Maryland, allowing the license to include more facilities, expand permission for sale and consumption, and authorize sales at rented events, with an annual fee of $325 starting July 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Visitors and attendees of events at the Weinberg Center and New Spires Arts Stages in Frederick County, Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill mainly updates licensing rules and expands the scope of existing licenses; it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little to no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Manufacturer's Limited Beer, Wine, and Liquor Permit
Synopsis: Establishing a manufacturer's limited beer, wine, and liquor permit in Frederick County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue a permit to holders of certain manufacturer's licenses; establishing that the permit authorizes the holder to allow a licensed caterer or other contracted party to provide sealed beer, wine, and liquor products not manufactured by the holder during private events for on-premises consumption; and requiring the Board to adopt certain regulations.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new manufacturerâ€™s limited permit in Frederick County allowing license holders to conduct private events where sealed beer, wine, and liquor from other licensed providers can be served for on-premises consumption during private events, with certain restrictions and regulations.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol manufacturers, private event organizers, and consumers in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new permit allowing licensed manufacturers to host private events with externally supplied sealed alcohol, creating a novel way to offer products at private gatherings.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is not directly aimed at reducing child poverty but may have indirect effects through economic activity in the county.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Municipal Golf Course License
Synopsis: Authorizing the Frederick County Board of License Commissioners to issue a municipal golf course license to an official of the City of Frederick designated by the Mayor of the City of Frederick; and authorizing the Board to transfer the license to a different city official designated by the Mayor under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Frederick County Board of License Commissioners to issue a special alcohol license for municipal golf courses, allowing the sale of alcohol for on-site consumption, and permits the transfer of this license to designated city officials.
responsible_party: Frederick County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Golf course operators, municipal officials, and visitors to municipal golf courses in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized alcohol license for municipal golf courses, allowing for alcohol sales at these venues, which is a tailored approach for recreational settings.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Dorchester County - County Applicants - Polygraph Examination
Synopsis: Exempting applicants for employment as a paramedic or an emergency medical technician with Dorchester County or as a 9-1-1 specialist at the Dorchester County 9-1-1 Center from the prohibition on employers requiring or demanding that an individual submit to or take a polygraph examination as a condition of prospective employment.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain Dorchester County employment applicants, specifically those applying for roles within the Department of Emergency Services, from the prohibition on requiring polygraph examinations as a condition of employment.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation (or relevant oversight agency)
stakeholders: Applicants for employment with Dorchester County Department of Emergency Services, and related agencies in Dorchester County.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily makes administrative and legal changes to employment screening policies; it does not employ new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it primarily addresses employment screening protocols.

Title: Prince George's County - Judgeships - Circuit Courts
Synopsis: Altering the number of resident judges of the circuit courts by adding one additional judgeship in Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of resident judges in the Prince George's County circuit court from 24 to 25.
responsible_party: Circuit Court of Prince George's County
stakeholders: Residents and legal community in Prince George's County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or new approaches; it primarily makes a legal and organizational adjustment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Legal Advertisement or Legal Notice in Dorchester County - Publication in Newspaper or Newspaper in General Circulation - Digital Newspapers
Synopsis: Establishing for the publication of certain notices in Dorchester County that any required advertisement or notice be published and distributed through print and digital format; providing that if there is no print and digital publication meeting all the qualifications under the Act, the advertisement or notice may be placed in any digital publication that can be accessed in Dorchester County and that regularly contains local news and information for Dorchester County; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates the rules for publishing legal advertisements or notices in Dorchester County, allowing such notices to be published in digital newspapers that meet certain criteria, along with traditional print publications.
responsible_party: Dorchester County government or relevant local authority responsible for legal notices
stakeholders: Legal professionals, local residents, businesses, and the general public in Dorchester County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an innovative approach by explicitly including digital newspapers as a valid platform for legal notices, adapting to modern publication formats.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily changes legal publication procedures.

Title: Growing Apprenticeships and the Public Safety Workforce (GAPS) Act
Synopsis: Altering the Law Enforcement Cadet Apprenticeship Program in the Maryland Department of Labor to be the Public Safety Apprenticeship Program; expanding the purpose and scope of the Program to promote careers with certain public safety agencies; altering the eligibility criteria and the types of grants to be awarded under the Program; requiring the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to develop certain mental health wellness policies to be implemented in certain law enforcement agencies and correctional facilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands and modifies the Public Safety Apprenticeship Program in Maryland, including increasing funding, broadening eligibility, and establishing a workgroup to enhance recruitment and retention in law enforcement and correctional services. It also mandates mental health wellness policies for agencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission
stakeholders: Public safety agencies, law enforcement personnel, correctional workers, and young individuals interested in careers in public safety
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive approach combining apprenticeship programs, mental health policies, and a workgroup to actively improve recruitment and retention in public safety fields, leveraging cross-agency collaboration and targeted incentives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve employment opportunities and support for populations in poverty, particularly through targeted recruitment and mental health support.

Title: Discrimination - Military Status - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting discrimination based on military status with regard to housing and employment.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits discrimination based on military status in areas such as employment, housing, education, and public accommodations throughout Maryland. It also establishes enforcement mechanisms, defines key terms including 'military status,' and aims to ensure equal opportunity and fair treatment for individuals with military connections.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, Office of Civil Rights and Department of Labor
stakeholders: Individuals with military status, including service members, veterans, and their families, in various settings such as employment, housing, education, and public services.
innovative_summary: The bill integrates anti-discrimination protections specifically for military status across multiple sectors, employing a coordinated enforcement approach through existing civil rights and labor agencies, which is a comprehensive and inclusive approach to civil rights enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by ensuring non-discriminatory access to education and housing for military families, which can contribute to stability and opportunities for children.

Title: Maryland Community Investment Corporation - Establishment (Housing and Community Development Financing Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Community Investment Corporation as an independent unit to make investments and financial assistance available in certain low-income communities in the State; expanding the eligible uses of the Strategic Demolition and Smart Growth Impact Fund to include grants and loans for credit enhancement for certain projects; requiring that members of the investment committee to be geographically representative of the locations of low-income communities in the State; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Community Investment Corporation to invest in low-income communities and expand the use of existing funds for revitalization projects, including grants and loans for demolition, land assembly, and credit enhancement, while also coordinating with federal programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Community Investment Corporation and the Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Low-income communities and residents in designated revitalization areas of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new government-funded investment corporation that leverages federal tax credits and coordinates a range of grants, loans, and investments to stimulate community revitalization and economic development in low-income areas.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by revitalizing low-income communities and increasing investment and job opportunities.

Title: Street Racing and Exhibition Driving â€“ Prohibited Acts, Enforcement, and Penalties
Synopsis: Altering certain penalties and points assessments for certain motor vehicle violations related to participation in a race or speed contest; prohibiting a person from engaging in exhibition driving on any highway or private property that is used for driving by the public; establishing certain affirmative defenses to a certain charge of exhibition driving; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates penalties and points for illegal street racing and exhibition driving in Maryland. It also prohibits exhibition driving on any highway or private property used for public driving, and sets out defenses and regulations related to these acts, especially in designated 'special event zones'.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Motor vehicle drivers, law enforcement, public safety attendees at events, local communities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific definitions and zones for regulation of exhibition driving, and clarifies legal defenses, employing targeted designations such as 'special event zones' for better enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty appears minimal, focusing mainly on traffic violations and safety enforcement.

Title: Employment Discrimination â€“ Sexual Orientation
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law prohibiting employment discrimination on the basis of sex and gender identity to also prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland employment law to prohibit discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity, including in wages and employment opportunities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or similar state employment department
stakeholders: Employees and employers across Maryland, especially those identifying as LGBTQ+
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing anti-discrimination laws to explicitly include sexual orientation and gender identity, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may improve economic stability for LGBTQ+ employees, potentially impacting their families.

Title: Consumer Protection - Online Products and Services - Data of Children (Maryland Kids Code)
Synopsis: Requiring a certain entity that offers an online product reasonably likely to be accessed by children to complete a certain data protection impact assessment by April 1, 2026, under certain circumstances; requiring certain privacy protections for certain online products; prohibiting certain data collection and sharing practices; authorizing certain monitoring practices to allow a child's parent or guardian to monitor the child's online activity or location without providing an obvious signal to the child; etc.
bill_summary: The Maryland Kids Code requires online products likely accessed by children to conduct data protection impact assessments, implement privacy protections, and prohibit certain data practices to protect children's online privacy and well-being.
responsible_party: Division of Consumer Protection of the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Children and online service providers operating in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs an approach similar to safety standards for physical products, requiring impact assessments and specific design protections for online products accessed by children, integrating privacy by design principles.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by creating safer online environments and reducing risks of harm that can contribute to economic disadvantages.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Recreational Vehicle Dealer Agreements
Synopsis: Requiring recreational vehicle dealers to hold a dealer agreement with a recreational vehicle manufacturer to sell the manufacturer's recreational vehicles in the State; establishing licensing requirements for a recreational vehicle manufacturer, distributor, or factory branch; altering the required terms and conditions of a recreational dealer agreement; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes regulations and licensing requirements for recreational vehicle (RV) dealers, manufacturers, distributors, and factory branches in Maryland. It details license applications, dealer agreements, termination rules, and dispute resolution processes to enhance fairness and transparency in the RV industry.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Recreational vehicle manufacturers, dealers, distributors, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs comprehensive regulatory measures with detailed dispute resolution and licensing processes, promoting fairness and transparency in the recreational vehicle industry.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on fair business practices and dispute resolution could indirectly support economic stability for families involved in the RV industry but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Community Colleges - Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship - Requirements
Synopsis: Establishing that applicants for a Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship are not subject to certain requirements of the scholarship application process if the applicant enrolls in a noncredit vocational certificate program, enrolls in a sequence of noncredit courses leading to licensure or certification, or participates in a registered apprenticeship program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes eligibility requirements and clarifies that applicants enrolling in certain noncredit programs or apprenticeships at Maryland community colleges are eligible for the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship without needing to meet some of the standard GPA requirements, provided they are residents or graduates of Maryland high schools.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission or the Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Maryland residents, high school graduates, community college students enrolling in credit and noncredit programs, apprenticeships
innovative_summary: The bill introduces flexibility in scholarship eligibility by including students enrolled in noncredit vocational and certification programs and registered apprenticeships, which are relatively new approaches to expanding access to higher education and workforce training.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to education and workforce development for students from low-income backgrounds.

Title: Education - Public Libraries - Collective Bargaining (Library Workers Empowerment Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing employees of public libraries to form, join, and participate in an employee organization and engage in certain other activities related to collective bargaining; requiring employers and certified exclusive representatives to engage in good faith bargaining; establishing a collective bargaining process for employees of public libraries; prohibiting employers and employee organizations from engaging in certain actions regarding the exercise of an employee's rights under the Act; applying the Act prospectively; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes public library employees in Maryland to form, join, and participate in collective bargaining, establishing procedures for certification, negotiations, and dispute resolution, while prohibiting strikes, lockouts, and secondary boycotts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management or relevant county funding authorities
stakeholders: Public library employees, library management, and library users in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive public sector collective bargaining process specifically for public library employees, including formal certification, negotiation procedures, dispute resolution, and prohibition of strikes and work stoppages.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate to high impact on child poverty by potentially improving working conditions and pay for library employees, which may benefit the communities they serve.

Title: Electronic Transactions Protection Act - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the Electronic Transactions Protection Act.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the Electronic Transactions Protection Act in Maryland, effectively removing the legal protections it provided for electronic transactions.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Individuals and businesses engaging in electronic transactions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill removes a previously existing legal framework for electronic transactions, thus reducing regulatory protections rather than introducing new innovations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily changes legal protections for electronic transactions.

Title: Natural Resources - Recreational Catching of Oysters or Clams - Requirements
Synopsis: Altering certain authorizations to recreationally catch clams in the State; establishing a recreational oyster license; requiring an applicant for a recreational oyster license to be at least 16 years of age; requiring the Department of Natural Resources to use a part  of the application fees collected to replenish public fishery oysters bars; requiring the Department to issue complimentary or discounted recreational oyster licenses; authorizing certain individuals to catch oysters without a license under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a recreational oyster license, describing the application process, fees, and eligibility requirements, including free licenses for certain veterans and disabled persons. It authorizes agents to sell licenses and sets rules for license possession and transfer.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Recreational oyster harvesters, residents, veterans, disabled persons, property owners near tidal waters
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formalized licensing system for recreational oyster harvesting, including free licenses for certain groups and the possibility of agent-based sales.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty appears minimal as the bill mainly reflects regulatory and licensing changes for oyster harvesting.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Stadium License Annual Fee
Synopsis: Reducing the annual fee for a stadium beer, wine, and liquor license in Harford County from $10,000 to $7,000.
bill_summary: This bill reduces the annual license fee for a stadium alcohol license in Harford County from $10,000 to $7,000, and specifies rules about selling alcohol at stadiums, including sale hours and serving regulations.
responsible_party: Harford County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Owners, concession managers, and patrons of baseball stadiums in Harford County
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates licensing fees and regulations; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns licensing fees and alcohol sale regulations at stadiums.

Title: Consumer Reporting Agencies - Records of Criminal Proceedings - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting consumer reporting agencies from including in a consumer report certain records relating to a criminal proceeding involving a consumer; and prohibiting consumer reporting agencies from relying on  information in certain criminal proceedings concerning the consumer to make a determination of the creditworthiness of a consumer.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits consumer reporting agencies in Maryland from including certain criminal records, especially those involving false accusations, acquittals, exonerations, or expunged records, in consumer reports. It also bars these agencies from relying on such records when assessing a consumerâ€™s creditworthiness.
responsible_party: Consumer Reporting Agencies regulated under Maryland law
stakeholders: Consumers in Maryland, especially those with criminal records or previous legal issues
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted approach to improve fairness in consumer reporting by restricting the use of certain criminal records, focusing on accuracy and fairness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is primarily on credit reporting fairness and does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Next Generation Scholars of Maryland Program - Program Administrator - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the administrator of the Next Generation Scholars of Maryland Program to be the Maryland Higher Education Commission rather than the State Department of Education; and requiring the Department to assist the Commission with the review of applications and the selection of nonprofit organizations to administer the Program in local school systems.
bill_summary: The bill changes the administrator of the Next Generation Scholars of Maryland Program from the State Department of Education to the Maryland Higher Education Commission, clarifies program duties, funding, and reporting requirements, and outlines how the program is to be administered and evaluated.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students in Maryland, especially those from low-income backgrounds or qualifying for the Guaranteed Access Grant
innovative_summary: The program uses a collaborative approach with nonprofit organizations, higher education institutions, and community outreach, promoting data collection, mentorship, and targeted outreach to increase access to higher education for underrepresented students.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact on child poverty by increasing higher education access for low-income students.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Board of Trustees - Responsibilities and Duties
Synopsis: Clarifying the topics that may be included in certain training required for each trustee on the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System; providing that the Board of Trustees may satisfy a requirement to provide each member and retiree in the several systems with a personal statement that includes certain information about the several systems and the member's or retiree's benefits by providing each member and retiree the information through an online portal.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies training topics for trustees of the State Retirement and Pension System and updates how members and retirees receive benefit statements, allowing the use of an online portal for this purpose.
responsible_party: Board of Trustees of the State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Members and retirees of the State Retirement and Pension System
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of an online portal to deliver personal benefit statements to members and retirees, leveraging digital technology for improved access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on retirement system governance and member information dissemination.

Title: Health Occupations - Clinical Marriage and Family Therapists - Reciprocal Licensure Requirements
Synopsis: Altering the licensure requirements that the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists may waive, and the circumstances under which the requirements may be waived, for applicants for a license to practice clinical marriage and family therapy in the State who are licensed or certified to practice clinical marriage and family therapy in another state, territory, or jurisdiction.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the licensure requirements for clinical marriage and family therapists in Maryland, allowing applicants licensed in other jurisdictions to obtain licensure through reciprocity without meeting certain educational and examination requirements, provided they meet specific criteria.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists
stakeholders: Licensed clinical marriage and family therapists, applicants from other jurisdictions, and the general public seeking mental health services
innovative_summary: The bill employs a reciprocal licensure process to streamline the licensing of qualified therapists from other jurisdictions, reducing barriers to licensure without requiring applicants to pass additional exams.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact as increasing access to licensed therapists could improve mental health support for children and families in need.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Consumer Price Index - Definition
Synopsis: Updating the definition of "Consumer Price Index" to replace the 1967 index with the 1982-1984 index as the reference used by the State Retirement and Pension System for certain calculations.
bill_summary: This bill updates the definition of the 'Consumer Price Index' used by the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, changing the reference period from 1967 to 1982-1984.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Retirees and members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates a reference index, which is a standard process, not a new technology or approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Service Credit
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement for certain transfers of service to be calculated under a certain formula; correcting a reference to a contribution rate for transfers of service into the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System; and providing for eligibility and service credit in the Employees' Pension System for certain contractual employment by certain members.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain rules regarding transfer of service credit within Maryland's State Retirement and Pension System, corrects some references, and establishes eligibility criteria for contractual employees of the Department of Legislative Services to receive pension service credit, with a cap of 10 years. It also details contribution deposit requirements for those receiving credit.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: State employees, contractual employees of the Department of Legislative Services, and retirees receiving pension credits.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach for contractual employees to earn pension service credit based on prior employment, with specific contribution deposit requirements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily addresses pension credit rules for state employees.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Golf Simulator Facility
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County to issue a Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license to a golf simulator facility under certain circumstances; authorizing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption under certain circumstances; requiring the license holder to submit an annual gross sales report to the Board before a license may be renewed; and establishing an annual license fee of $1,500.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Harford County to issue a new type of alcohol license called the Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license. This license allows golf simulator facilities that meet certain criteria to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption, under specific conditions related to sales and food service.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Harford County
stakeholders: Golf simulator facilities, patrons of golf simulators, local businesses in Harford County
innovative_summary: The program creates a new license category specifically for golf simulator facilities, integrating alcohol sales with recreational golf activities, employing a specialized licensing approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is not primarily aimed at reducing child poverty, but could have indirect community benefits.

Title: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center â€“ Student Information â€“ United States Census Bureau
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governing Board of the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center to authorize the Center to send student information to the United States Census Bureau.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center to send certain student information to the United States Census Bureau and establishes protocols for sharing and protecting this data, including matching student data with tax information to generate aggregated income data.
responsible_party: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center and the Comptroller of Maryland
stakeholders: Students and educational institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs data sharing between state agencies and federal entities, utilizing secure protocols to enhance data analysis related to education and income.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by providing better data for policies addressing income and educational outcomes.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Performing Arts Nonprofit Organization License
Synopsis: Establishing in Harford County a performing arts nonprofit organization beer, wine, and liquor license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption at up to three locations designated at the time of application; requiring the holder of the license to comply with certain record-keeping and reporting requirements; establishing an annual license fee of $750; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new license in Harford County for nonprofit performing arts organizations, allowing them to sell or serve beer, wine, and liquor at specific locations during performances and related events, with certain record-keeping and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Harford County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Performing arts nonprofit organizations and their audiences in Harford County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized liquor license for nonprofit arts organizations, enabling on-site alcohol sales for performances, which is a targeted and creative approach to supporting the arts and local event programming.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has some potential to indirectly benefit children through supporting local arts and community events, but it does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Allegany County - Property Tax Credit - Evergreen Heritage Center
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Allegany County or a municipal corporation in Allegany County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on property that is owned by the Evergreen Heritage Center.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Allegany County to grant property tax credits to certain properties owned by specified entities, including the Evergreen Heritage Center Foundation, Inc., and Evergreen Heritage Center Holdings, LLC.
responsible_party: Allegany County government or municipal corporations within Allegany County
stakeholders: Property owners and organizations in Allegany County, including the Evergreen Heritage Center entities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted local property tax credit program for specific entities and properties, which is a common local tax incentive approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly benefit communities, but it does not specifically target child poverty reduction.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification - Police Auxiliary and Reserve Volunteers
Synopsis: Increasing, from $5,000 to $7,000, a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for an individual who is a qualifying police auxiliary or reserve volunteer.
bill_summary: This bill increases the income tax subtraction modification for Maryland residents who are qualifying police auxiliary or reserve volunteers. It clarifies qualifications and reporting requirements for these volunteers and adjusts the amounts of the tax benefit.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Comptroller and Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Qualifying police auxiliary and reserve volunteers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates qualification criteria and reporting procedures for existing tax benefits; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program potentially provides financial relief to volunteers, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited and indirect.

Title: Property and Casualty Insurance â€“ Pet Insurance â€“ Regulation
Synopsis: Establishing requirements and prohibitions for pet insurance policies that are issued to a resident of the State or are sold, solicited, negotiated, or offered in the State, including disclosure requirements and requirements and prohibitions related to wellness programs; and requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration, on or before June 1, 2025, to develop informational material about pet insurance policies that may be disseminated to and posted by veterinary practitioners.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations and disclosure requirements for pet insurance policies in Maryland, including prohibitions on marketing wellness programs as insurance and provisions on coverage exclusions, waiting periods, and claims procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Pet owners in Maryland, veterinary practitioners, pet insurers
innovative_summary: The bill primarily focuses on regulatory rules and transparency requirements, with no new innovative technologies or approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it pertains to pet insurance regulation and consumer disclosure.

Title: Labor and Employment - Equal Pay for Equal Work - Wage Range Transparency
Synopsis: Altering the requirement that an employer disclose certain wage information to an applicant for employment; requiring an employer to disclose certain wage information in certain postings and to certain employees at certain times; requiring an employer to set the wage range disclosed in good faith; requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry to develop and make available to employers a form that an employer may use to comply with certain wage disclosure requirements; prohibiting certain retaliatory action by an employer; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires employers in Maryland to disclose the wage range for job postings and to employees upon request, sets rules for setting this wage range in good faith, and prohibits retaliation against employees or applicants who exercise their rights under these rules. It also establishes recordkeeping and enforcement provisions related to wage transparency.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Industry
stakeholders: Employees and job applicants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive wage transparency requirement, including disclosure in postings and upon request, form development to facilitate compliance, and enforcement measures, representing a significant step towards transparency and equity in wages.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to directly impact child poverty by promoting wage transparency and fair pay practices, which can lead to higher earnings for workers and their families.

Title: Maryland Department of Labor - Report on Apprenticeship Mentoring Ratios
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report to the General Assembly that analyzes the apprenticeship mentoring ratio for all nontraditional apprenticeable occupations in the State; and requiring the Department to submit the report to the General Assembly by October 1, 2024, with recommendations for strategies to streamline the expansion of apprenticeship ratios for all newly registered nontraditional apprenticeship occupations for purposes of meeting the goals of the Apprenticeship 2030 Commission.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor to establish regulations setting a three-to-one apprentice-to-journeyperson ratio for nontraditional and newly registered apprenticeship occupations. It also mandates a report analyzing apprenticeship ratios, safety considerations, waiver requests, and strategies to expand apprenticeship ratios.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Apprentices, employers in nontraditional occupations, workforce development agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted approach to improve apprenticeship ratios in nontraditional and emerging occupations, potentially employing new data analysis and regulatory mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may indirectly reduce child poverty by promoting workforce development and expanding opportunities for economic advancement.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Beer, Wine, and Liquor Tasting Permit
Synopsis: Establishing a beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit in St. Mary's County; authorizing the Board to issue the permit only to a holder of a Class A license; authorizing the holder to allow the on-premises consumption of beer, wine, and liquor for tasting purposes only; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit in St. Mary's County, enabling holders of Class A licenses to allow on-premises tasting of alcoholic beverages for a limited number of days per licensing period, with specific fees and notification requirements.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol vendors and consumers in St. Mary's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new permitting process for alcohol tastings, allowing flexibility in tasting days and specific fee structures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but could support local economic activity indirectly.

Title: St. Maryâ€™s County â€“ Alcoholic Beverages â€“ Nonprofit Performing Arts Theater License
Synopsis: Establishing in St. Mary's County a performing arts theater beer and wine license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer and wine in certain performing arts theaters at retail for on-premises consumption; and establishing an annual license fee of $300.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new nonprofit performing arts theater beer and wine license in St. Maryâ€™s County, allowing eligible nonprofit theaters to sell or serve beer and wine for on-premises consumption during performances or fundraisers.
responsible_party: St. Maryâ€™s County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Nonprofit performing arts theaters and their audiences in St. Maryâ€™s County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized license for nonprofit theaters to sell alcohol, blending arts and alcohol licensing in a new way.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty.

Title: Large Family Child Care Homes and Child Care Centers - Child Care Teachers - Minimum Age
Synopsis: Requiring that certain regulations governing the registration and operation of large family child care homes and the licensing and operation of child care centers require that child care teachers be at least 18 years old.
bill_summary: The bill mandates minimum age requirements of 18 years for child care teachers in large family child care homes and child care centers in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Children in large family child care homes and child care centers, child care providers, parents
innovative_summary: The bill primarily sets minimum age requirements for child care teachers, which is a regulation change rather than an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: This bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes qualification rules for child care teachers.

Title: Court Personnel - Protection of Personal Information (Judge Andrew F. Wilkinson Judicial Security Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain protected individual or the Office of Information Privacy in the Administrative Office of the Courts to request that a governmental entity or person not publish personal information of the individual on the Internet, social media, or social networks or remove the information from any existing publication; specifying certain procedures for the protection of personal information of a protected individual; authorizing certain relief for a violation of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances protections for judicial officers and their families by allowing designated individuals to request the removal and non-publication of personal information, establishing a judicial address confidentiality program, and creating a task force to improve courthouse security.
responsible_party: Office of Information Privacy in the Administrative Office of the Courts and the Maryland judiciary
stakeholders: Judicial officers, their families, courthouse staff, and general public interested in judicial security
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive address confidentiality program and a dedicated task force to assess and improve courthouse safety measures, employing new legal protections and interagency coordination.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program - State Supplement
Synopsis: Lowering the minimum age from 62 to 60 years old that a member of a household must be for eligibility for a State-provided supplemental benefit under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program; and increasing the amount of the supplemental benefit that the State must provide from $40 to $50.
bill_summary: The bill lowers the minimum age for children to be eligible for a State supplement under the SNAP program, increases the supplemental benefit amount, and requires the State to provide a supplement to certain elderly households receiving less than a specified benefit. It also clarifies the administration of the program by local departments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Households eligible for SNAP, including elderly and low-income individuals
innovative_summary: The bill mainly makes regulatory changes and increases benefits; it does not introduce new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potentially reduces child poverty by increasing support for low-income households.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Sheriff - Salary
Synopsis: Making the salary of the Sheriff of Anne Arundel County equal to the salary of a captain in the Anne Arundel County Police Department at step 20 in the pay scale, beginning in calendar year 2025.
bill_summary: The bill increases the salary of the Sheriff of Anne Arundel County, setting it at a fixed amount through 2024 and then tying it to the salary of a police captain at a specific step starting in 2025.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Sheriff's Office or relevant county government department
stakeholders: Residents of Anne Arundel County and law enforcement officials
innovative_summary: This bill mainly updates salary levels based on predefined steps and salary comparisons rather than employing new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty, as it concerns sheriff salaries.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Benefits - Hearing Loss
Synopsis: Altering the frequencies in which industrial noise must be for an employer to be required to provide workers' compensation to a covered employee for hearing loss; altering the method used to determine the percentage of hearing loss deafness for purposes of workers' compensation; and altering the method used to determine the deduction required to be made to allow for the average amount of hearing loss from nonoccupational causes in the population for purposes of calculating workers' compensation benefits for occupational deafness.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's workers' compensation laws to update the criteria for determining hearing loss related to workplace noise, including frequencies involved, the calculation method for hearing loss percentage, and the consideration of tinnitus as part of hearing impairment.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Industry
stakeholders: Workers in Maryland who are exposed to industrial noise and potentially suffer hearing loss
innovative_summary: The bill employs updated standards and metrics for accurately assessing occupational hearing loss and includes tinnitus as part of the compensable damage, but does not introduce new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly updates workers' compensation assessment procedures for hearing loss.

Title: Right to Try Act - Individualized Investigational Treatments
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law authorizing certain activity by manufacturers of investigational drugs, biological products, or devices under the Right to Try Act to apply to manufacturers of certain individualized investigational treatments; altering the definition of "eligible patient" under the Right to Try Act to include individuals who have life-threatening or severely debilitating illnesses, rather than only individuals who have terminal illnesses; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Right to Try Act to include individualized investigational treatments based on a patient's genetic profile for individuals with life-threatening or severely debilitating illnesses. It repeals restrictions on manufacturer payments, allowing them to profit from such treatments, and mandates coverage of associated costs by insurance, third-party administrators, or government agencies. The bill also updates informed consent requirements and protections for healthcare providers and patients.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or relevant health agencies
stakeholders: Patients with life-threatening or severely debilitating illnesses seeking individualized investigational treatments and healthcare providers
innovative_summary: The program employs personalized medicine by using genetic profiles to develop and administer individualized investigational treatments, which is a relatively new approach in healthcare policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns access to investigational treatments for certain illnesses.

Title: Public Higher Education - Communities of Interest - Targeted Recruitment and Outreach Efforts
Synopsis: Altering certain principles of public higher education in the State to include a principle that public higher education in Maryland should be committed to promoting diversity and inclusion at certain institutions by attracting and graduating a diverse student body committed to service; requiring certain public senior higher education institutions to adopt a certain written policy related to targeted recruitment and outreach efforts in certain communities of interest; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain public higher education institutions in Maryland to adopt policies and conduct targeted recruitment and outreach efforts to increase diversity by engaging communities of interest. It mandates annual reports on these efforts and specifies strategies to attract students from underrepresented groups.
responsible_party: Public senior higher education institutions in Maryland
stakeholders: Underrepresented students, communities of interest, and public higher education institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a strategic approach for targeted recruitment and outreach efforts based on communities of interest, including partnerships, events, and dedicated services, which employs a comprehensive, community-focused approach to increasing diversity in higher education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to higher education for underserved communities, which can lead to long-term economic benefits.

Title: Environment - Nuclear Power Plants - Emergency Preparedness (Radiation and Emergency Preparedness and Protection Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Radiation Emergency Response Program in the Department of the Environment; requiring the Department to serve as an offsite response organization and the lead State agency for all nuclear incidents within the State; requiring the Department to prepare a technical emergency radiation response plan, respond to emergencies involving a nuclear power plant, participate in a certain federal program, and procure certain specialized equipment; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Radiation Emergency Response Program in Maryland, designates the Department of the Environment as the lead agency and off-site response organization for nuclear incidents, and creates a Radiation Emergency Response Fund funded by fees from nuclear power plant owners to support emergency preparedness and response activities.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Residents near nuclear power plants, emergency responders, state agencies involved in nuclear safety
innovative_summary: The program employs a dedicated specialized fund and integrates federal emergency management participation, representing an organized approach to nuclear incident preparedness in Maryland.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on emergency preparedness could have some indirect impact on child safety and community resilience, but it is not specifically targeted at child poverty.

Title: Economic Development - Maryland Aerospace and Technology Commission
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Aerospace and Technology Commission in the Department of Commerce to promote innovation in the fields of space exploration and commercial aerospace opportunities, including the integration of space, aeronautics, and aviation industries into the economy of the State; requiring the Commission to develop a strategic plan; requiring the Commission to designate aerospace and technology zones in the State; requiring the Commission to submit a certain report by October 1 each year; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Aerospace and Technology Commission within the Department of Commerce to promote innovation and growth in the aerospace sector, including space exploration, aerospace industry development, workforce training, and infrastructure. It creates the Maryland Aerospace and Technology Fund to support these initiatives and sets up the commission's structure, membership, roles, and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Aerospace industry, higher education institutions, government agencies, local communities involved in aerospace development
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an integrated approach to fostering aerospace industry growth through a dedicated commission, strategic planning, grant programs, and the designation of aerospace zones, employing modern public-private partnership strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The potential for direct impact on child poverty is moderate, as the program focuses on industry growth and educational opportunities which can eventually lead to economic opportunities for families.

Title: Maryland Historical Trust - Historical and Cultural Museum Assistance Program - Funding
Synopsis: Altering prohibitions on grants from the Maryland Historical Trust; authorizing the Governor beginning in fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter, to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Trust to be used to provide grants to museums under the Historical and Cultural Museum Assistance Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Historical Trust's funding program for museums, allowing the Governor to allocate $5 million annually starting in fiscal year 2025 to provide grants for museum activities, planning, and infrastructure improvements.
responsible_party: Maryland Historical Trust
stakeholders: Museums, museum visitors, cultural institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program improves museum support through structured grants, but it primarily follows traditional funding models without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited immediate impact on child poverty but supports cultural and educational development which can indirectly benefit children.

Title: Charles County - Adult Protective Services Review Board - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Adult Protective Services Review Board in Charles County to authorize the appointment of a physician's assistant or nurse practitioner in the field of psychiatry to serve on the board instead of a psychiatrist.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership criteria for the Adult Protective Services Review Board in Charles County, allowing a physicianâ€™s assistant or nurse practitioner in psychiatry to serve on the board instead of a psychiatrist.
responsible_party: Adult Protective Services Review Board in Charles County
stakeholders: Adult Protective Services, mental health professionals, residents of Charles County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a broader range of mental health professionals, such as physician assistants and nurse practitioners, into the review board, enhancing multidisciplinary input.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is limited, as it mainly adjusts the composition of an oversight board.

Title: Renters' Rights and Stabilization Act of 2024
Synopsis: Establishing the Office of Tenant and Landlord Affairs in the Department of Housing and Community Development to provide certain educational resources and information to tenants; requiring the Office to develop and publish a Maryland Tenants' Bill of Rights; requiring the most recently published version of the Maryland Tenants' Bill of Rights to be included as part of a residential lease; limiting the maximum security deposit required by a residential lease to 1 month's rent, except under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The Rentersâ€™ Rights and Stabilization Act of 2024 introduces measures to improve tenant rights, including establishing an Office of Tenants' Rights within the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, developing a Maryland Tenantsâ€™ Bill of Rights, limiting security deposits to one monthâ€™s rent, regulating landlord notices and voluntary property transfers, and increasing surcharges on certain civil cases to fund rental assistance and legal services. It also expands protections regarding purchase rights for tenants and data collection related to evictions.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residential tenants, landlord associations, legal aid organizations, local governments, and rental property owners
innovative_summary: The bill employs several new approaches, including establishing a dedicated Office of Tenants' Rights and a publicly accessible Maryland Tenantsâ€™ Bill of Rights, regulating voluntary property transfers with tenant first refusal rights, and implementing comprehensive data collection and reporting on eviction activities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving housing stability for families with children through expanded tenant protections and targeted rental assistance.

Title: Real Estate Brokers â€“ Commercial Transactions â€“ Buyerâ€™s Rights
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements and prohibitions for commercial real estate transactions related to a buyer's right to make certain title, settlement, and escrow selections.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements and prohibitions in commercial real estate transactions in Maryland. It gives buyers the right to choose their own title insurance company, settlement company, escrow company, and title lawyer, and prohibits sellers from requiring buyers to use a specific provider, as a condition of settlement. It also states that sellers cannot be prohibited from offering owner financing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing and Regulation (or relevant real estate regulatory agency)
stakeholders: Buyers and sellers involved in commercial real estate transactions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs transparency measures by requiring clear statements about buyers' rights and prohibitions against requiring specific service providers, which can modernize and streamline real estate transactions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on commercial real estate transaction rules.

Title: Election Law - Election Judges - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board to develop and implement a marketing campaign to recruit individuals to serve as election judges; authorizing a local board to supplement the marketing campaign implemented by the State Board; requiring that a county employee who serves as an election judge during hours that the employee is scheduled to work receive certain administrative leave and certain election judge compensation; requiring the State Board to adopt certain regulations related to service as an election judge; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Elections to develop a marketing campaign to recruit election judges, standardizes administrative leave and compensation for election judges, and allows public school students to earn service-learning hours and receive election judge compensation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Election judges, public school students, voters in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted marketing campaign and integrates election judge service with school service-learning programs, utilizing digital outreach and educational partnerships.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's direct impact on child poverty is limited but could be positive by providing employment opportunities and educational benefits to students.

Title: Wage and Hour Law - Minor League Baseball Players - Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting minor league baseball players who are compensated under the terms of a collective bargaining agreement that expressly provides for the wages and working conditions of employees from the Maryland Wage and Hour Law.
bill_summary: The bill exempts minor league baseball players who are compensated under a collective bargaining agreement that specifies wages and conditions from Maryland's Wage and Hour Law.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Minor league baseball players, baseball organizations
innovative_summary: The bill applies a targeted exemption for minor league baseball players based on collective bargaining agreements, reflecting a specialized approach to employment regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty because it primarily changes employment exemptions for a specific group of athletes.

Title: Licensed Real Estate Brokers - Branch Offices - Designation of Managers
Synopsis: Authorizing a licensed real estate broker to designate himself or herself as the manager of a branch office maintained by the licensed real estate broker.
bill_summary: This bill allows licensed real estate brokers in Maryland to designate themselves as the managers of their branch offices, simplifying management responsibilities. It clarifies the process for obtaining and renewing branch office certificates and the qualifications for managers.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Licensed real estate brokers and salespersons in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates regulatory procedures and qualifications without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Business Regulation â€“ Household Goods Movers â€“ Special Fund and Fees
Synopsis: Establishing the Household Goods Movers Registration Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund in the Maryland Department of Labor; requiring the Secretary of Labor to annually calculate certain costs; authorizing the Department to set by regulation certain fees based on certain calculations; prohibiting certain fees from increasing annually by more than 12.5% of certain existing and corresponding fees; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Household Goods Movers Registration Fund within the Maryland Department of Labor, sets rules for collecting and distributing fees from household goods movers, and authorizes the Department to set and adjust fees to cover the department's costs associated with regulating this industry.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Household goods movers and consumers of moving services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a funding mechanism based on industry-specific fees and annual cost calculations, integrating regulatory financing with industry activity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has low potential for direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Fishing and Hunting Licenses and Trout Stamps - Complimentary Licenses and Stamp Exemption - Veterans Determined to be Unemployable
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to issue certain complimentary fishing and hunting licenses to certain veterans who the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs determines are unemployable; and exempting certain veterans who the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs determines are unemployable from the requirement to obtain a trout stamp.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to issue complimentary fishing, hunting, and trout stamps licenses to veterans who are deemed unemployable by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, including former prisoners of war and 100% service-connected disabled veterans. It also sets limits on the number of complimentary licenses issued to out-of-state residents and government officials.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Veterans with disabilities, former prisoners of war, government officials, and anglers/hunters in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted initiative to support disabled veterans and former prisoners of war by providing them with complimentary licenses for fishing and hunting, recognizing their service and sacrifices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily provides benefits to disabled veterans.

Title: Carroll County â€“ Deputy Clerk or Deputy Sheriff â€“ Oath of Office
Synopsis: Requiring that every deputy clerk or deputy sheriff in Carroll County take and sign the oath or affirmation prescribed by the Maryland Constitution.
bill_summary: The bill requires that all deputy clerks and deputy sheriffs in Carroll County must take and sign the oath prescribed by the Maryland Constitution, similar to other counties.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly / Carroll County government
stakeholders: Deputy clerks and deputy sheriffs in Carroll County, the public served by these officials
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes oath requirements across counties, ensuring uniformity but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Office of the Attorney General - Rights of Residents of Health Care Facilities - Injunctive Relief
Synopsis: Authorizing the Attorney General to seek injunctive relief on behalf of the State on the basis of an imminent or ongoing violation of certain rights of residents of certain health care facilities; requiring that the resident bill of rights for assisted living program residents include certain rights; and prohibiting the Attorney General from duplicating certain corrective action by the Maryland Department of Health.
bill_summary: This bill enhances protections for residents of health care and assisted living facilities by granting the Attorney General authority to seek injunctive relief and impose penalties for violations of residents' rights, and updates regulations and standards for assisted living programs, including a new resident bill of rights.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Attorney General and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residents of health care and assisted living facilities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs an enforcement mechanism allowing the Attorney General to seek injunctive relief and impose significant penalties directly, an approach that enhances accountability and protection for residents. It also updates licensing and training standards for assisted living programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on protecting vulnerable residents and ensuring quality care may have an indirect positive impact on child poverty by improving community health and stability.

Title: Health Insurance - Qualified Resident Enrollment Program (Access to Care Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to establish and implement the Qualified Resident Enrollment Program to facilitate the enrollment of qualified residents in qualified plans; providing that the operation and administration of the Program may include functions delegated by the Exchange to a third party; and providing that the implementation of the Program is contingent on approval of a certain waiver application amendment.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to establish a 'Qualified Resident Enrollment Program' to facilitate health insurance enrollment for residents, including minors, regardless of immigration status, who are not eligible for other federal or state healthcare programs. The program aims to allow qualified residents to purchase health plans through the state exchange, contingent on federal waiver approval, and involves funding allocations and administrative protocols.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Qualified residents in Maryland, including minors and those ineligible for federal programs
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by expanding health insurance access to qualified residents regardless of immigration status through a state-specific enrollment program and federal waiver collaboration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by improving health insurance access for residents who may otherwise lack coverage, including minors.

Title: Baltimore City â€“ Control Over Powers of Police Commissioner
