Synopsis: Repealing a prohibition on certain Baltimore City ordinances or acts of certain municipal officials from conflicting, impeding, obstructing, hindering, or interfering with the powers of the Baltimore City Police Commissioner; and making a portion of the Act contingent on the passage and ratification, by a certain date, of a certain Baltimore City Charter amendment.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a prohibition that prevents Baltimore City ordinances or acts of municipal officials from conflicting with the powers of the Baltimore City Police Commissioner. It also makes the enactment of this change contingent on a forthcoming Charter amendment that clarifies the powers and duties of the Police Commissioner and Department, ratified in the 2024 election.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Government and Baltimore City Police Department
stakeholders: Residents and officials of Baltimore City, Law enforcement agencies, Baltimore City Police Department
innovative_summary: The bill appears to focus on clarifying powers and legal authority of existing municipal officials and law enforcement, without establishing new services or interventions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address issues related to child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Licensing Fees
Synopsis: Increasing certain licensing fees for alcoholic beverages in Baltimore City.
bill_summary: The bill updates the licensing fees for various classes of alcoholic beverage licenses in Baltimore City, increasing many of the fees.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol beverage license holders and businesses in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: This bill primarily changes fees and licensing rules, with no new services or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Slow Moving Vehicles - Right-Hand Lane
Synopsis: Repealing a certain provision of law that applies the requirement that slow moving vehicles drive in the right-hand lane or lanes only to certain highways in certain geographic areas; and altering the standards under which the State Highway Administration is required to inform drivers of the requirement.
bill_summary: The bill modifies laws related to slow moving vehicles in Maryland. It repeals the requirement that slow moving vehicles drive only in the right-hand lane on certain highways and updates how the State informs drivers about the rules, including signage and driver education.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Drivers of slow moving vehicles and other motorists in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates rules and signage regarding slow moving vehicles; it does not introduce new services or interventions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty or related programs.

Title: Business Regulation - Licensed Home Improvement Contractors - Liability Insurance
Synopsis: Increasing from $50,000 to $500,000 the amount of general liability insurance that an applicant for a home improvement contractor license or a licensed home improvement contractor must maintain.
bill_summary: The bill increases the minimum required general liability insurance for home improvement contractors in Maryland from $50,000 to $500,000.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Labor (implied as the agency overseeing contractor licensing)
stakeholders: Home improvement contractors and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it primarily changes legal requirements for insurance coverage.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Northwest Baltimore County Sports Tourism Facility - Feasibility Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Stadium Authority to conduct a certain feasibility study for developing, establishing, and operating a  sports tourism facility at Reisterstown Regional Park in northwest Baltimore County; requiring the Authority to consult with certain governments, stakeholders, and entities; and requiring the Authority to submit a final report of its findings, conclusions, and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Stadium Authority to conduct a feasibility study on establishing a sports tourism facility in northwest Baltimore County, including planning, economic impact, and funding sources, with a report due by December 31, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority
stakeholders: Local community, regional economy, sports tourism industry, government agencies, residents of northwest Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily focuses on a feasibility study and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty or specify interventions to impact it.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Stadium License
Synopsis: Authorizing the holder of a stadium license in Frederick County to sell liquor for on-premises consumption in addition to beer and wine; and increasing the annual license fee for a stadium license in the county from $2,000 to $2,500.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes a stadium license in Frederick County to sell liquor in addition to beer and wine, modifies the license fee, and specifies the rules for sale and consumption at stadium events.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Professional baseball stadium attendees and operators in Frederick County
innovative_summary: Enhances existing stadium alcohol license to include liquor sales and clarifies sale rules, using existing licensing framework without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting stadium alcohol sales policies.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Promoter's Permit
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue a promoter's permit to a certain for-profit organization under certain circumstances; authorizing a permit holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor at an event; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the promoter's permit in Frederick County to be a permit for on-sale beer, wine, and liquor, allowing certain organizations to sell alcohol at events, with specific regulations and fee structures.
responsible_party: Frederick County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Organizations, event organizers, and attendees in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined permit process for organizations to sell alcohol at events, with varying fees based on attendance, but does not employ new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty; it mainly changes permitting rules for alcohol sales at events.

Title: Corporations and Associations â€“ Definitions, Emergencies, and Outstanding Stock â€“ Revisions
Synopsis: Altering certain definitions as they relate to certain Maryland business entities; authorizing a corporation to adopt certain emergency bylaws; authorizing a corporation to take certain actions during an emergency; limiting the liability of certain persons for certain corporate acts taken during an emergency; and clarifying when certain stock is outstanding.
bill_summary: The bill revises definitions and provisions related to corporations in Maryland, including establishing emergency bylaws, actions during emergencies, and clarifying stock outstanding status, to enhance corporate governance and flexibility in crises.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Maryland corporations and their directors, officers, employees, and stockholders
innovative_summary: The bill introduces provisions for corporations to adopt emergency bylaws and take corporate actions during emergencies, employing a structured approach to crisis management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential for direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily governs corporate procedures and emergency protocols.

Title: Economic Development - Maryland Technology Development Corporation - Application and Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring an application for investment by the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to include an option for an applicant to provide certain demographic information of the applicant and the geographic area of the applicant's primary place of business; requiring the Corporation to submit a certain report to the Governor, the Maryland Economic Development Commission, and the General Assembly by October 1 each year concerning certain applicant and investment activities and certain demographic and geographic information; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to include an option for applicants to provide demographic information such as race, ethnicity, age, gender, disability status, and veteran status in their investment applications, and prohibits adverse actions against those who decline to provide this information. It also mandates a report on investment activities with demographic data to be submitted annually.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Technology-based businesses, applicants for investments, and the broader community impacted by economic development initiatives in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new approach to include voluntary demographic data collection in investment applications for a state economic development agency, enhancing transparency and inclusivity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on inclusive economic development may have an indirect positive effect on reducing child poverty by supporting diverse entrepreneurial activity and economic growth.

Title: State Board of Social Work Examiners - Board Membership and Certified Social Worker Licenses
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the State Board of Social Work Examiners; and repealing obsolete references to certified social worker licenses.
bill_summary: The bill updates the membership structure of the Maryland State Board of Social Work Examiners, clarifies licensing categories and requirements, and repeals obsolete references to certified social worker licenses.
responsible_party: State Board of Social Work Examiners
stakeholders: Licensed social workers, social work applicants, and the general public receiving social work services in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill focuses on regulatory updates; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly supports child poverty reduction by ensuring qualified social workers are available, but it does not target child poverty directly.

Title: General Provisions - State Flag - Casket of an Eligible Decedent
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of State to furnish a State flag to drape the casket of an eligible decedent; establishing the process for a State flag to be claimed after burial; providing that only one flag may be provided for the death of an eligible decedent; and prohibiting the Secretary of State from procuring a flag that is not wholly produced in the United States.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Secretary of State to provide a U.S.-made state flag to drape the casket of eligible deceased individuals, such as current or former officials, employees who died from work-related injuries, or individuals designated by the governor. It establishes procedures for requesting the flag and rules for claiming it after burial.
responsible_party: Maryland Secretary of State
stakeholders: Eligible deceased individuals and their families, public officials, and state agencies involved in funeral and memorial processes
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a process for providing official state flags to eligible deceased individuals, ensuring the flags are wholly produced in the United States, which emphasizes domestic manufacturing and a formalized procedure for requests and claims.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited potential to directly impact child poverty, as it primarily concerns funeral protocols for eligible individuals.

Title: State Board of Physicians - Supervised Medical Graduates and Cardiovascular Invasive Specialists (Bridge to Medical Residency Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing a supervised medical graduate to provide delegated duties under direct supervision in accordance with regulations adopted by the State Board of Physicians; prohibiting an individual from practicing as a supervised medical graduate for more than 2 years; and repealing the termination of certain provisions of law relating to delegation of duties by licensed physicians to cardiovascular invasive specialists.
bill_summary: The bill expands roles for supervised medical graduates by allowing them to provide delegated duties under direct supervision for up to 2 years, and clarifies delegation of duties to certain medical personnel and specialists, aiming to facilitate medical practice and improve healthcare workforce flexibility.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Medical graduates, physicians, healthcare facilities, and patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured supervised role for medical graduates, emphasizing direct supervision and delegation, which is a fairly innovative approach to expanding healthcare workforce capacity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to indirectly impact child poverty by increasing access to healthcare through workforce flexibility.

Title: Advanced Practice Registered Nurses - Professional Liability Insurance Coverage - Notification Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring advanced practice registered nurses practicing as an advanced practice registered nurse in the State to notify patients in writing if the nurse does not maintain professional liability insurance coverage or if the coverage has lapsed and not been renewed; requiring that the notification be provided at certain visits and as part of certain informed consents, signed by a patient at certain times, and retained as part of the advanced practice registered nurse's patient records; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires advanced practice registered nurses in Maryland to notify patients in writing about their professional liability insurance coverage status during visits and informed consent processes, and if they do not maintain such insurance, they must post the information publicly at their practice site.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Advanced practice registered nurses and their patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill introduces transparency requirements for healthcare providers regarding liability insurance, including public posting if coverage is lacking, which is a straightforward transparency initiative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on healthcare provider transparency has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Office of Legislative Audits - Local School Systems - Report
Synopsis: Requiring each local school system, on or before November 1 of the third year of a 6-year audit cycle, to submit a report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on the status of implementation of corrective actions to address repeat findings and recommendations identified by the Office of Legislative Audits in the most recent audit; and requiring each local school system to publish the report on its website.
bill_summary: The bill requires county boards of education to address repeat findings and recommendations from annual financial audits and other audits, submit a report on corrective actions taken, and publish it on their websites. It also mandates periodic audits of local school systems by the Office of Legislative Audits every six years, with exemptions possible upon request, and requires submission of progress reports on audit findings.
responsible_party: Office of Legislative Audits and Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Local school systems, county boards of education, students, and taxpayers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mandates transparency and accountability in school district financial oversight, with a focus on addressing repeat audit issues and public reporting, leveraging existing audit standards and processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty through improved school district financial management and accountability, which can lead to better resource allocation.

Title: Montgomery County - School Bus Stops MC 6-24
Synopsis: Prohibiting, beginning December 31, 2026, the location of a school bus stop on any highway with five or more undivided traffic lanes in Montgomery County unless a school crossing guard is posted or a certain traffic control device is placed at the school bus stop.
bill_summary: The bill directs that fines collected from violations enforced by school bus monitoring cameras on state highways in Montgomery County be used for roadway and pedestrian safety improvements at locations where violations occurred. It also prohibits placement of school bus stops on highways with five or more lanes unless a crossing guard or traffic signal is present, and restricts the use of school bus monitoring cameras by local jurisdictions without official authorization.
responsible_party: Montgomery County and the Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Students, school bus riders, pedestrians, local government agencies, state highway authorities in Montgomery County
innovative_summary: The bill employs existing technology like school bus monitoring cameras in a targeted manner to raise funds for safety improvements, and mandates specific safety measures for school bus stops on multi-lane highways, which introduces a coordinated approach to traffic safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on transportation safety and funding for roadway improvements.

Title: Montgomery County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B Beer, Wine, and Liquor License - Off-Premises Consumption MC 9-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the holder of a certain Class B beer, wine, and liquor license in Montgomery County to sell beer and wine in sealed containers with the manufacturer's original seal for off-premises consumption under certain circumstances; and authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Montgomery County to adopt certain regulations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain Montgomery County license holders to sell sealed containers of beer and wine for off-premises consumption, subject to conditions and regulations, including a requirement that the licensee's food sales account for at least 40% of their gross receipts.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Restaurant and hotel owners in Montgomery County, consumers of alcohol, local businesses
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new option for licensed establishments to sell sealed containers of beer and wine for off-premises consumption, with specific regulatory oversight, representing a moderate innovation in alcohol retail regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty as it primarily modifies alcohol sales regulations for businesses.

Title: Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the membership and operational timeline of the Maryland Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention, adding two Muslim community members, restructuring appointments, and establishing termination of the commission after June 30, 2027.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General, Maryland
stakeholders: Individuals and communities affected by hate crimes, including Muslim community, LGBTQ+, immigrant, and religious groups in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured, multi-year commission with a focus on strategic prevention and policy evaluation, including yearly reporting, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on hate crime prevention and community safety policies may indirectly benefit children in affected communities, but it does not specifically target child poverty.

Title: State Lottery Fund - Bus Rapid Transit Fund Distribution and Prince George's County Blue Line Corridor Facility Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing a certain limitation on the State Lottery Fund distribution  and allocating an amount equal to $27,000,000 each fiscal year to the Bus Rapid Transit Fund for bus rapid transit system grants; adding an authorized use for the Prince George's County Blue Line Corridor Facility Fund; requiring the Maryland Stadium Authority, by December 15, 2024, to submit to certain committees of the General Assembly a report on all public and private development activities currently under construction in the Blue Line Corridor; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reallocates funds from the State Lottery Fund to support bus rapid transit grants, the Prince Georgeâ€™s County Blue Line Corridor development, and various other state funds. It also establishes and modifies the administrative and financial framework for the Prince Georgeâ€™s County Blue Line Corridor Facility Fund, including its funding and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority
stakeholders: Residents and commuters in Prince Georgeâ€™s County, Baltimore City, Montgomery County, and users of Maryland transit systems
innovative_summary: The bill employs a sophisticated funding model, involving reallocations from the State Lottery Fund, bond proceeds, and dedicated grants to support transit infrastructure and development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by improving transportation access and local development, which can support economic opportunities.

Title: Property Tax - Credit for Hotel or Residential Development Projects
Synopsis: AuthorizingÂ the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant, by law, a tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is used for certain hotel or residential development projects; and altering eligibility for a certain property tax credit in Wicomico County against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is used for certain hotel or residential development projects.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local governments in Maryland to grant property tax credits for new hotel or residential development projects, including rehabilitation, with specific eligibility criteria, and modifies existing tax credit rules in Wicomico County.
responsible_party: Local governments in Maryland (Baltimore City, counties, municipal corporations)
stakeholders: Hotel owners, residential developers, local governments, residents in Maryland, especially those in affordable housing
innovative_summary: The bill promotes development through property tax incentives with specific requirements for affordability and revitalization, enhancing local economic growth and housing options.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by promoting affordable housing and revitalization in communities, but the direct effect is moderate.

Title: Calvert County - Roadside Solicitation of Money or Donations - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from standing in a roadway, median divider, or intersection to solicit money or donations from the occupant of a vehicle in Calvert County.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits individuals in Calvert County from standing in roadways, medians, or intersections to solicit money or donations from vehicle occupants, effective October 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Calvert County law enforcement or local government authorities
stakeholders: Vehicle occupants in Calvert County, individuals soliciting donations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward legal restriction without involving new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Judges' Retirement System - Special Death Benefit
Synopsis: Establishing a line-of-duty special death benefit for members of the Judges' Retirement System; providing for health benefits for a surviving spouse, child, or dependent parent who is receiving a special death benefit for the death of a member of the Judges' Retirement System; and providing for the retroactive application of the Act to any member of the Judges' Retirement System who is killed prior to the effective date of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a special line-of-duty death benefit for members of the Judges' Retirement System in Maryland, including health benefits for eligible survivors, and provides for retroactive application to members killed prior to the bill's enactment.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Judges' Retirement System members, survivors of killed judges, Maryland state government
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized death benefit in the context of the judges' retirement and pension system, with retroactive application, integrating death benefits and health coverage for survivors.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a limited potential to directly impact child poverty as it mainly provides death benefits and health coverage for survivors of judges.

Title: Human Services - Individuals With Disabilities and Service-Disabled Veterans Boating Fund
Synopsis: Establishing the Individuals With Disabilities and Service-Disabled Veterans Boating Fund to provide sailing, boating, kayaking, canoeing, and paddleboarding and surfing opportunities for individuals with disabilities and service-disabled veterans; requiring the Department of Disabilities to administer the Fund; prohibiting the Department from providing a grant of more than $40,000 in a fiscal year; and establishing the qualifications for certain nonprofit organizations to receive a grant from the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Individuals With Disabilities and Service-Disabled Veterans Boating Fund to provide grants for sailing, boating, and related water activities for individuals with disabilities and service-disabled veterans. It details eligibility, administration, funding, and the process for grants to nonprofit organizations.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities and service-disabled veterans interested in boating activities
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted grants to nonprofit organizations to improve access to boating and water activities for disabled individuals and veterans, leveraging existing nonprofit infrastructure with specific eligibility criteria.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential to impact child poverty through increased inclusion and access in recreational activities, but primarily focused on disabled individuals and veterans.

Title: Maryland Technology Development Corporation - Authority
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Technology Development Corporation, subject to a written agreement, to provide certain outside entities administrative services or support and to receive compensation for providing the services or support.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to provide administrative services or support to certain entities, with the ability to receive compensation, under a written agreement.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation
stakeholders: Entities receiving administrative services and support from the Maryland Technology Development Corporation
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal mechanism for the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to provide administrative support to other entities and be compensated, which is a new operational approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but facilitates organizational support that could indirectly impact various social outcomes.

Title: Competitive Sealed Proposals - Security Contracts
Synopsis: Providing that competitive sealed proposals is the preferred procurement method for a contract for security services with an expected value that is greater than $1,000,000.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the use of competitive sealed proposals as the preferred procurement method for certain security contracts with an expected value greater than $100,000, and for human, social, cultural, or educational services, with specific procedures for requesting, evaluating, discussing, and awarding proposals.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of General Services or relevant procurement agency
stakeholders: Government agencies, security service providers, vendors for human, social, cultural, or educational services
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes and emphasizes transparency and competitive procedures for procurement, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but could indirectly support social services through improved procurement processes.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Lighting - Privately Owned Vehicles
Synopsis: Authorizing certain members of a volunteer fire company to equip their privately owned vehicles with red and green or red and white lights or signal devices.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain members of volunteer fire companies in Maryland to equip their privately owned vehicles with red and white or red and green lights or signal devices, specifically for use when responding to emergencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant Maryland emergency services agency
stakeholders: Volunteer fire company officers, emergency responders, and their communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific allowance for volunteer fire officers and police to equip private vehicles with emergency lights, which is a targeted policy change rather than a technological innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it pertains mainly to emergency response protocols and vehicle equipment.

Title: Freedom to Read Act
Synopsis: Establishing a State policy that local school systems operate their school library media programs consistent with certain standards; requiring each local school system to develop a policy and procedures to review objections to materials in a school library media program; prohibiting a county board of education from dismissing, demoting, suspending, disciplining, reassigning, transferring, or otherwise retaliating against certain school library media program personnel for performing their job duties consistent with certain standards; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes state policies and standards for libraries and school library media programs in Maryland, requiring proper operation, development of objection review policies, and prohibiting retaliation against library staff acting in accordance with standards. It ties funding to adherence to these standards and creates oversight and governance structures for libraries and regional centers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Library Agency
stakeholders: Library systems, school personnel, students, library users, regional and state library organizations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to standardizing and overseeing library operations with integration of policies, funding contingencies, and oversight mechanisms, using policy requirements as leverage for adherence to standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by ensuring equitable access to quality library resources and services, which are important for educational and informational support.

Title: Health Occupations â€“ Limited License to Practice Dentistry â€“ Services for Adults
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Dental Examiners to waive certain education requirements for certain applicants for a limited license to practice dentistry who provide dental services for adults.
bill_summary: The bill allows the Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners to waive certain educational requirements for applicants for a limited license to practice dentistry, specifically for those providing dental services to adults in public health settings, thus enabling more dental professionals to serve underserved populations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Adults receiving dental services in public health settings, underserved populations, dental applicants fitting the program criteria
innovative_summary: The bill employs a flexible licensing pathway by waiving educational requirements for certain applicants, a relatively innovative approach to expanding access to dental care through targeted licensing adjustments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by improving access to dental care for underserved populations, but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Allegany County - Allegany Regional Recreational Economic Development Authority - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Allegany Regional Recreational Economic Development Authority in Allegany County to support the development and construction of regional recreation facilities to benefit residents and the economic development of Allegany County, including athletic fields, indoor athletic facilities, and other facilities for recreational tourism; and requiring the Authority to annually report its activities to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly beginning October 31, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Allegany Regional Recreational Economic Development Authority in Allegany County to support the development and construction of regional recreation facilities, such as athletic fields and indoor facilities, to benefit residents and promote economic development.
responsible_party: Allegany Regional Recreational Economic Development Authority
stakeholders: Residents of Allegany County, local governments, and businesses in Allegany County
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated regional authority focused on developing recreational infrastructure through collaborative management and reporting, which is a new approach to local economic development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may have a moderate impact on child poverty by improving recreational facilities and potentially encouraging community development, which can benefit children and families.

Title: Carroll County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of Carroll County to borrow not more than $29,800,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in Carroll County, and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Carroll County to issue up to $29.8 million in bonds to finance public facilities, water and sewer projects, and fire department facilities, including providing loans to volunteer fire departments for emergency-related equipment and facilities.
responsible_party: Carroll County government (County Commissioners of Carroll County)
stakeholders: Residents of Carroll County, including public facilities users and volunteer fire departments
innovative_summary: The program employs traditional bond financing methods for infrastructure and emergency facilities, which is standard practice; it does not involve new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially improve public safety and infrastructure, indirectly benefiting children by enhancing community resilience and services.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Committed Persons - Release Proceedings
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions of the Maryland Rules relating to discovery in civil matters apply in a certain administrative proceeding; requiring a court that receives a certain report to promptly notify counsel of record for the committed person; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to notify the court and certain persons if the Department receives a certain report; requiring a court to hold a hearing on request by any party after a certain application is made; etc.
bill_summary: This bill amends the procedures for release, conditional release, and reapplication for release of committed persons in Maryland, including notification processes and rules for hearings and evidence.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Committed persons undergoing release proceedings and the entities involved in their care and legal proceedings
innovative_summary: The bill refines existing legal procedures with specific notification and evidence rules, but does not introduce new technologies or fundamentally new approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions primarily focus on legal procedures for mental health commitments and releases, with no direct or immediate impact on child poverty.

Title: Cannabis - Licensee Locations - Restrictions
Synopsis: Altering the distance restrictions from 2000 feet to one-half mile applicable to a licensed cannabis dispensary; prohibiting a political subdivision from establishing certain zoning requirements that are more restrictive than certain zoning requirements that existed on June 30, 2023; authorizing at least 10 individuals who are residents, commercial tenants who are not holders of or applicants for a license, or real estate owners, and are located within 1,000 of the licensed premises to file a protest against a license; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies zoning restrictions and program procedures for licensed cannabis dispensaries and growers in Maryland, including distance requirements, protest procedures for license renewal, and certain zoning limitations for dispensaries and outdoor cultivation.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Cannabis licensees, cannabis consumers, local residents near dispensaries and cultivation sites
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured protest process for license renewals and updates zoning and distance restrictions, but does not employ new technological approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on zoning, licensing, and regulatory procedures.

Title: Physician Assistants - Revisions (Physician Assistant Modernization Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring that a physician assistant have a collaboration agreement, rather than a delegation agreement, in order to practice as a physician assistant; altering the scope of practice of a physician assistant; altering the education required for licensure as a physician assistant; authorizing physician assistants who are employees of the federal government to perform acts, tasks, or functions during a certain disaster; and requiring the State Board to review and update the list of duties for physician assistants.
bill_summary: The bill revises regulations for physician assistants in Maryland, including replacing delegation agreements with collaboration agreements, updating scope of practice, and establishing new oversight and prescribing rules.
responsible_party: State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Physician assistants and healthcare providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a collaboration-based model for physician assistants, replacing traditional delegation, and expands their roles, including prescribing authority, which is a significant modernization in healthcare regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially improves healthcare access and quality, which can help reduce child poverty through better health services.

Title: Natural Resources â€“ Submerged Aquatic Vegetation Surveys
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "aerial survey" for purposes of surveying submerged aquatic vegetation to include other surveys that encompass certain geographic areas and use certain methodologies; and requiring the Department of Natural Resources to study and report to the General Assembly on the implications and feasibility of using alternative methods other than an aerial survey to delineate SAV protection zones on or before December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the definition of aerial surveys for mapping submerged aquatic vegetation (SAV), authorizes the Department of Natural Resources to explore alternative methods for delineating SAV protection zones, and requires a study and report on the feasibility of these alternative methods, including their implications and frequency of use.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Environmental agencies, aquatic vegetation conservation efforts, Maryland residents, fishing and boating communities
innovative_summary: The bill encourages the exploration and potential adoption of new methods or technologies beyond aerial surveys for mapping aquatic vegetation, which represents a more progressive approach to environmental management and conservation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily focused on environmental management.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages â€“ Retail Delivery â€“ Local Delivery Service Permit
Synopsis: Establishing a local delivery service permit that authorizes the holder to deliver alcoholic beverages from a retail license holder that is authorized to deliver alcoholic beverages to purchasers in a certain jurisdiction under certain circumstances; authorizing retail license holders to deliver alcoholic beverages to purchasers in a certain jurisdiction through a third-party contractor, an independent contractor, or an agent that holds a certain delivery service permit under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new local delivery service permit allowing retail license holders to deliver alcoholic beverages through third-party contractors in Maryland, with regulations on eligibility, licensing, hours, and enforcement.
responsible_party: Maryland Local Licensing Boards and Alcoholic Beverages Authority
stakeholders: Retail alcohol license holders, delivery service operators, adult consumers of alcohol in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal permit system for third-party delivery of alcohol, incorporating regulation and oversight for such services, which is a relatively new approach to alcohol retail.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily regulates alcohol delivery services for adults.

Title: Members of Boards, Committees, Commissions, Task Forces, or Workgroups â€“ Removal or Suspension
Synopsis: Providing that a member of a board, committee, commission, task force, or workgroup created by State law may be removed or suspended for misconduct, incompetence, neglect of duties, or other good cause by the individual or entity that appointed the member under certain circumstances; authorizing the removal or suspension of an appointed member only after consultation with the chair of the board, committee, commission, task force, or workgroup and the member has been given an opportunity to be heard regarding the removal or suspension; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes procedures for the removal or suspension of members of boards, committees, commissions, task forces, or workgroups created by Maryland state law, including requirements for notice, hearing, and consultation.
responsible_party: Maryland State government agencies responsible for appointing members to boards, committees, etc.
stakeholders: Members of state-created boards, committees, commissions, task forces, or workgroups, and their appointing entities.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, due process approach to member removal or suspension, emphasizing fairness and procedural safeguards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but improves governance procedures.

Title: Criminal Law - Rapid-Fire Activator - Switch/Auto-Sear
Synopsis: Altering the term "rapid fire trigger activator" to be "rapid fire activator"; adding "switch/auto-sear" to the definition of "rapid fire activator" for purposes of certain prohibitions on rapid fire activators; and prohibiting a person from transporting a rapid fire activator into the State or manufacturing, possessing, selling, offering for sale, transferring, purchasing, or receiving a rapid fire activator with a certain exception.
bill_summary: This bill criminalizes the possession, sale, transfer, or manufacture of switch/auto-sears and rapid fire activators, and establishes penalties for offenses involving certain assault weapons and devices that increase firing rate. It also details regulated firearms and related devices.
responsible_party: Maryland State Police and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals and entities involved in firearm ownership, sales, and transfer within Maryland, including gun owners and dealers.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates and enforces existing firearm laws, incorporating definitions and restrictions on new types of devices, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily addresses firearm restrictions and does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Higher Education - Financial Well-Being Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Financial Well-Being Pilot Program at the University of Maryland, College Park Campus and Morgan State University to provide comprehensive financial guidance and coaching to help students who may benefit from financial coaching services; requiring by August 1, 2024, each participating institution to hire one full-time financial well-being coach; requiring each financial well-being coach to create a document with best practices and guidance for other institutions to use to create a financial well-being program; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Financial Well-Being Pilot Program at the University of Maryland, College Park Campus and Morgan State University to provide financial guidance, support, and coaching to students who face personal financial burdens, loan debts, or lack financial literacy.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department or relevant higher education governing entities (specific agency not explicitly specified)
stakeholders: Students at the University of Maryland, College Park Campus and Morgan State University who need financial coaching
innovative_summary: The program employs personalized financial coaching integrated into higher education support systems, incorporating behavior and emotional aspects of financial management, and documenting best practices for future expansion.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to positively impact child poverty by improving students' financial skills and stability, though it is primarily focused on college students.

Title: Triâ€“County Council for Southern Maryland â€“ Southern Maryland Agricultural Development Commission â€“ Funding
Synopsis: Increasing from $900,000 to $1,000,000 the amount of an appropriation that the Governor is required to include in the annual budget bill each year for the Tri-County Council for Southern Maryland from the Cigarette Restitution Fund; repealing the termination of certain provisions of law that require the Governor to include the appropriation in the annual budget bill each year and the Council to use the appropriation to fund the activities of the Southern Maryland Agricultural Development Commission; etc.
bill_summary: This bill increases the annual appropriation for the Tri-County Council for Southern Maryland from $900,000 to $1,000,000, to be funded from the Cigarette Restitution Fund, and extends the program's effective period until June 1, 2025.
responsible_party: State of Maryland, Department of Economic Development (implied)
stakeholders: Residents and agricultural stakeholders in Southern Maryland, including the Southern Maryland Agricultural Development Commission
innovative_summary: The bill primarily focuses on funding allocation and extension rather than employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is not directly targeted at reducing child poverty but supports regional agricultural development, which may indirectly benefit the local economy.

Title: Juvenile Law - Reform
Synopsis: Altering the jurisdiction of the juvenile court over a child of a certain age alleged to have committed a certain offense; altering certain provisions relating to the taking of a child into custody by a law enforcement officer; expanding certain provisions of law relating to the entry onto certain school or other property by, and the education of, certain sex offender registrants; altering certain provisions relating to the Commission on Juvenile Justice Reform and Emerging and Best Practices; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes reforms to juvenile law in Maryland, including creating a Governor's Office for Children, a Children's Cabinet, and a Commission on Juvenile Justice Reform. It expands jurisdiction of juvenile courts over certain ages and offenses, improves procedures for juvenile intake, custody, detention, and assessment of juvenile services, and enhances monitoring and reporting on juvenile justice issues.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Juvenile Services and related agencies
stakeholders: Children involved in or at risk of entering the juvenile justice system, their families, and community organizations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, multi-agency approach integrating new technology for monitoring and reporting, creation of new offices and commissions, and expansion of data collection and analysis to improve juvenile justice services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on juvenile services, prevention, diversion programs, and the reduction of recidivism has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving outcomes for at-risk youth.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Issuance of License Near a Place of Worship or School PG 307-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to issue an alcoholic beverages license for an establishment that is within 500 feet of a place of worship or 1,000 feet of a school building if a license of the same class had been issued and was held by the same person seeking the new license and was in effect for the establishment before the place of worship or school building was built.
bill_summary: This bill modifies rules in Prince George's County regarding the issuance of alcoholic beverage licenses near places of worship and schools, allowing certain licenses to be issued even if the establishment is within restricted distances if the license was held before the building was constructed.
responsible_party: Prince Georgeâ€™s County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Establishments seeking alcohol licenses, residents near places of worship and schools in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill provides specific exceptions to existing alcohol licensing distance restrictions, offering a tailored approach rather than employing new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily involves licensing rules for alcohol establishments.

Title: State Finance â€“ Catastrophic Event Account and Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund â€“ Noncivilian Federal Employees
Synopsis: Altering the purposes of the Catastrophic Event Account and the Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund to provide financial assistance to noncivilian federal employees.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the purposes of the Catastrophic Event Account and the Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund to include providing financial assistance to noncivilian federal employees affected by a federal government shutdown in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Noncivilian federal employees in Maryland affected by government shutdowns, State and local government units
innovative_summary: The bill creates a program providing no-interest loans directly to noncivilian federal employees in Maryland affected by shutdowns, with procedures for application, payment, and repayment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty by helping federal employees maintain income during shutdowns, thereby supporting families.

Title: Prince George's County - Student Support - Specialist Networks and Success Action Plans (Student Supports and Success Act) PG 502-24
Synopsis: Establishing a Student Support Specialist Network consisting of certain school-based personnel at each public high school in Prince George's County; requiring the Prince George's County Board of Education to develop a certain template using certain guidelines by December 31, 2024; and requiring each Student Support Specialist Network in the county to develop, complete, and implement a certain plan, subject to review and approval by the Prince George's County Board of Education.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Student Support Specialist Network in each public high school in Prince Georgeâ€™s County, requiring the development, approval, and implementation of a Student Support Success Action Plan using a standardized template that includes specific metrics and strategies to improve student mental health, discipline, and overall school climate.
responsible_party: Prince Georgeâ€™s County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, school staff, mental health providers, law enforcement, and community organizations in Prince Georgeâ€™s County
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated network approach with standardized metrics and strategies, integrating multiple support roles into a comprehensive plan to improve student well-being, which is a relatively innovative approach for educational support services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to behavioral and mental health supports, reducing disciplinary measures, and fostering supportive school environments.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Employed Individuals With Disabilities
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to provide Maryland Medical Assistance Program services for qualified applicants who are at least 16 years old and for existing Program recipients under the Employed Individuals with Disabilities Program in accordance with certain requirements; prohibiting the Department from limiting eligibility to receive services under the EID Program based on certain criteria; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to better serve employed individuals with disabilities by expanding eligibility criteria, eliminating restrictions based on assets or income, and establishing a new Employed Individuals with Disabilities (EID) Program that provides healthcare services. It also requires program monitoring and a report on its fiscal and operational impacts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities, employed persons with disabilities, and potential program applicants in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new approach to healthcare support for employed individuals with disabilities by ensuring eligibility without asset or income restrictions, and by engaging with disability advocates regularly, which reflects innovative policy adaptation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to directly reduce child poverty by providing healthcare access and supporting employment for individuals with disabilities, which can contribute to economic stability for families.

Title: Fire Protection and Prevention - Residential Rental Property - Requirements (Melanie Nicholle Diaz Fire Safety Act)
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements relating to the installation of certain fire safety equipment in residential rental high-rise buildings and certain other property; authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant, by law, a certain property tax credit; establishing the Workgroup to Develop Fire Safety Best Practices for Pre-1974 High-Rise Apartment Buildings; requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations by December 31, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes fire safety requirements for high-rise buildings, including installation of smoke alarms, fire sprinklers, and emergency lighting, and creates programs to promote fire safety improvements and funding sources for retrofitting older buildings.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development, in coordination with the State Fire Marshal and Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Residents of high-rise rental buildings, building owners, fire safety agencies, and local governments
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach including new safety requirements, a workgroup to develop best practices, and funding source identification, combining regulation with technological and strategic innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by improving safety and stability in high-rise housing, particularly for vulnerable populations.

Title: Libraries - Regional Resource Centers - Governing Board Membership
Synopsis: Increasing, from one member to two members, the number of public members from each area served by the participating library systems on the governing board for each regional resource center.
bill_summary: This bill increases the number of public members on the governing boards of regional resource centers for libraries in Maryland, changing the maximum from one to two members.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Public library users and local library systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly adjusts governance structures and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Insurance Administration â€“ Professional Employer Organizations â€“ Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration to study professional employer organizations in the State to review certain regulations, histories, health plans, requirements, and regulatory structures in other states and to address any potential impacts of proposed statutory changes in the State relating to the offering of health coverage by professional employer organizations on the small group market in the State; and requiring the Administration to report to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Insurance Administration to conduct a study on professional employer organizations (PEOs) in the state, focusing on regulation, industry history, health plans, and the impact of proposed changes on the small group health insurance market. The study aims to inform potential regulatory or legislative actions.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Professional employer organizations, small employers, employees, health insurance consumers
innovative_summary: The bill involves a regulatory study rather than the creation of a new program or technology, thus not employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not specifically target child poverty or include direct measures to reduce it.

Title: General Provisions - Damages or Losses - Definition
Synopsis: Defining "damages" or "losses" in statutory causes of action to protect civil rights or consumer rights and providing that "damages" or "losses" includes reasonable nominal damages.
bill_summary: The bill defines 'damages' or 'losses' in legal actions related to civil rights or consumer rights as including both monetary compensation for loss or injury and reasonable nominal damages, aiming to protect access to remedies.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly / Maryland courts
stakeholders: Individuals seeking civil rights or consumer protections in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes the inclusion of reasonable nominal damages in legal remedies for civil rights and consumer protections, reinforcing access to justice.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not specifically target child poverty, but strengthening civil rights protections can have indirect benefits for vulnerable populations including children.

Title: Parents in Substance Use Disorder Treatment - Children in Need of Assistance and Treatment Facilities
Synopsis: Establishing a presumption that placement with a child's parent is in the best interest of the child, the child is receiving proper care and attention, and there is not a certain emergency situation if the child's parent is receiving certain substance use disorder treatment and the child is in the presence of the child's parent for the duration of the child's parent's treatment; authorizing the Behavioral Health Administration to require a facility providing certain treatment to provide beds and services to the patient's children; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a presumption that a child is in the best interest of placement with a parent if the parent is receiving substance use disorder treatment and the child is present for the duration of the treatment. It also requires treatment facilities to provide beds and services for children of patients and allows children to be in the presence of their parent during treatment.
responsible_party: Behavioral Health Administration and Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children of parents receiving substance use disorder treatment, families, treatment facilities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy presumption favoring in-family placement during parent substance use disorder treatment, along with requirements for treatment facilities to accommodate children, employing a child-friendly approach within substance use treatment settings.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to impact child well-being by maintaining family unity during parent treatment, potentially reducing adverse effects on children associated with removal or neglect.

Title: Calvert County - Ethics - Conflict of Interest and Commissioner Expulsion
Synopsis: Requiring that the conflict of interest provisions enacted by Calvert County include certain provisions relating to judicial relief for certain violations of the county's conflict of interest provisions; requiring the ethics provisions enacted by Calvert County to include a provision requiring the Calvert County Ethics Commission to make public any recommendation it makes to expel a Commissioner; and requiring Calvert County to enact a law or regulation that authorizes the removal of a county elected official for certain violations.
bill_summary: The bill requires Calvert County to include specific provisions in its conflict of interest laws, including public disclosure of expulsion recommendations by the ethics commission and procedures for removing elected officials for conflicts of interest.
responsible_party: Calvert County Government
stakeholders: Calvert County elected officials and government employees
innovative_summary: The bill introduces transparency measures and specific removal procedures within county ethics frameworks, enhancing accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but aims to promote ethical conduct among county officials.

Title: Calvert County - Procurement - Local Preference
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Commissioners of Calvert County to enact an ordinance that establishes a local percentage preference for certain procurement contracts; and requiring the County Commissioners to comply with certain provisions of law under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill allows Calvert County to create local procurement preferences, giving a percentage advantage to resident businesses in contract bidding, to promote local economic activity.
responsible_party: Calvert County Commissioners
stakeholders: Resident and nonresident businesses in Calvert County
innovative_summary: The bill employs a local preference policy for procurement contracts, which is a common but strategic approach to support local businesses.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily focusing on local economic preferences.

Title: Prince George's County Family Child Care Home Expansion Grant Program - Establishment PG 505-24
Synopsis: Establishing the Prince George's County Family Child Care Home Expansion Grant Program in the Prince George's County public school system; providing that the purpose of the Program is to increase the number of registered family child care providers, registered family child care homes, and registered large family child care homes in low-income communities in the county; requiring a local school system to develop a certain application process; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Prince George's County Family Child Care Home Expansion Grant Program to increase registered family child care providers and homes in low-income areas within Prince George's County. The program provides training, technical, and financial assistance to individuals intending to become providers, focusing on low-income communities, and allocates an annual budget starting at $500,000 from FY 2026 onward.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Public School System, Division of Early Childhood Development
stakeholders: Individuals in Prince George's County seeking to become child care providers, low-income families in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The program uses targeted grants to nonprofit organizations to enhance training and support for new child care providers, especially in low-income communities, employing a community-based approach rather than a technologically innovative one.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The initiative has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing affordable child care options in low-income communities.

Title: Carroll County - Contracts and Purchasing
Synopsis: Increasing from $25,000 to $50,000 the cost of a public work or improvement or the purchase price of supplies or equipment for which the County Commissioners of Carroll County may enter into a contract; and requiring that when the cost of a public work or improvement or the purchase price of supplies or equipment in Carroll County exceeds $50,000 under certain conditions, the Procurement Officer for the County Commissioner shall advertise for bids for at least 1 week in a media accessible to the general public.
bill_summary: The bill increases the contract threshold in Carroll County for public works, improvements, and purchases from $25,000 to $50,000, and modifies the procurement procedures including public notice requirements for amounts exceeding this new threshold.
responsible_party: Carroll County Government
stakeholders: Carroll County residents and local government agencies involved in public contracting
innovative_summary: The bill primarily enhances existing procurement procedures with a focus on transparency and efficiency, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty or specify impacts on child poverty.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Annual Vehicle Shows - Motor and Trailer Homes
Synopsis: Altering the number of annual vehicle shows in which motor and trailer home dealers, and salesmen employed by dealers, may participate.
bill_summary: The bill relaxes restrictions on the number of annual vehicle shows that motor and trailer home dealers and salesmen employed by them can participate in, especially for certain classes of vehicles such as Class M motor homes and Class G trailers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant vehicle regulation authority
stakeholders: Motor and trailer home dealers, salesmen, and consumers interested in vehicle shows
innovative_summary: The bill does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches; it mainly adjusts existing rules regarding vehicle show participation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily pertains to vehicle industry regulations.

Title: Income Tax - Individual Income Tax Credit Eligibility Awareness Campaign
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller to implement and administer a certain individual income tax credit eligibility awareness campaign to identify and encourage individuals to apply for certain individual income tax credits; authorizing the Comptroller to enter into a certain data sharing agreement with other State agencies to carry out the awareness campaign; and requiring, in each of fiscal years 2026 through 2030, the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $300,000 for the awareness campaign.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Comptroller to implement a campaign to increase awareness of and encourage the application for specific individual income tax credits, especially targeting underserved populations, through data sharing and outreach efforts.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Underserved individuals eligible for income tax credits in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs data sharing between state agencies and targeted outreach to underserved populations to increase tax credit claims, representing a modern approach to government outreach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by increasing the number of families claiming tax credits they are eligible for.

Title: State Investment Portfolio and Local Government Investment Guidelines - Investment Standards
Synopsis: Requiring the Treasurer to consult with governmental entities prior to proposing certain regulations; repealing the limitations on investment in certain assets in which the Treasurer may invest or reinvest certain unexpended or surplus funds; authorizing the Treasurer to retain investments made prior to the effective date of the Act until the investments have reached their respective maturity dates; authorizing the Treasurer and governmental entities to invest or reinvest in certain surplus funds under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's investment standards for the state's investment portfolio and local government investments. It requires the Treasurer to consult with government entities when proposing regulations, repeals restrictions on certain assets, adopts new regulations specifying permissible asset classes and thresholds, and improves transparency and communication with local governments about investment standards and updates.
responsible_party: Maryland State Treasurer
stakeholders: Maryland state and local government entities responsible for managing public funds
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive updating of investment standards with new regulations and enhanced communication protocols, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches that are highly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on investment policies and standards; it does not directly address child poverty but may indirectly affect funding for public services through better management of state and local funds.

Title: State Procurement - Small Business Preference Procurement
Synopsis: Requiring each procurement unit to establish a price preference for small businesses; and designating the Board of Public Works as the regulatory authority for the Small Business Preference Program.
bill_summary: The bill requires each procurement unit in Maryland to establish a price preference for small businesses, designates the Board of Public Works as the regulatory authority for the Small Business Preference Program, and sets goals for procurement awards to small businesses, including specific preferences for veteran- and disabled veteranâ€“owned small businesses.
responsible_party: Board of Public Works (Maryland)
stakeholders: Small businesses in Maryland, especially veteran- and disabled veteranâ€“owned small businesses
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes a structured small business preference program with specific percentage preferences and targets, employing a systematic approach to promote small business participation in government procurement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly through supporting small businesses, employment, and economic growth, but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Shellfish Aquaculture - Harvest Hours
Synopsis: Repealing a restriction which prohibited the harvesting of shellfish between the hours of sunset and sunrise from certain areas leased for aquaculture; and requiring the Department of Natural Resources to establish by regulation the hours for harvesting shellfish within leased areas.
bill_summary: This bill repeals existing restrictions on harvesting hours for shellfish in leased aquaculture areas and requires the Department of Natural Resources to establish new harvest hours through regulation.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Shellfish aquaculture leaseholders, shellfish harvesters, environmental regulators
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a regulatory process for establishing harvesting hours, allowing flexibility and tailored management of shellfish harvesting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily involves shellfish harvesting regulations.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Community Action Boards
Synopsis: Requiring certain community action boards to meet certain federal requirements for tripartite boards; and repealing certain requirements relating to the composition of community action boards.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the requirements for community action boards in Maryland, including meeting certain federal tripartite board requirements, and repeals previous composition rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Low-income community members and local communities served by community action agencies
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal requirements for community action boards to align with federal standards, without introducing new or innovative programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially improves community action boards that can lead to better targeted programs for low-income populations, thereby potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: Energy Efficiency and Conservation Plans
Synopsis: Requiring each electric company, each gas company, and the Department of Housing and Community Development to develop a plan for achieving certain energy efficiency, conservation, and greenhouse gas emissions reduction targets through certain programs and services and superseding certain existing energy efficiency and conservation goals; requiring the Public Service Commission to establish a working group to study and make recommendations on extending certain program assistance to certain moderate-income households; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland utility companies and the Department of Housing and Community Development to develop and implement comprehensive energy efficiency, conservation, and greenhouse gas emissions reduction plans. It establishes programs and targets to promote energy savings, renewable energy, and emissions reductions, particularly focusing on low- and moderate-income communities, and sets up oversight, funding, and reporting mechanisms.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Maryland residents, especially low- and moderate-income households, utility companies, environmental groups, and the Department of Housing and Community Development
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, integrated approach combining regulatory mandates, programs, and funding to achieve significant greenhouse gas reductions and energy efficiency improvements, leveraging multiple stakeholders and funding sources.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by reducing energy costs and supporting housing affordability in low-income communities.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and Health Insurance - Coverage for Prostheses (So Every Body Can Move Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide certain coverage related to prostheses; establishing that certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations must comply with certain provider network requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain private health insurance providers to cover orthoses and prostheses, including regulations on provider network requirements, coverage specifics, and reimbursement policies, starting January 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Individuals needing orthoses and prostheses, health insurers, healthcare providers, and Medicaid recipients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs an integrated approach to ensure coverage, provider network diversity, and oversight, including reporting and evaluation of utilization and costs, which reflects a comprehensive and potentially innovative strategy for healthcare coverage regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate to high impact on child poverty by improving access to essential medical devices that can enhance mobility and participation in daily activities.

Title: Business Regulation - Detached Catalytic Converters - Record-Keeping Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring records of junk dealers, scrap metal processors, and automotive dismantlers and recyclers to include certain information about the vehicle from which a detached catalytic converter, or part of a detached catalytic converter, was obtained from a person.
