Synopsis: Establishing the Frederick County Soil Conservation District to include the Catoctin Soil Conservation District and the Frederick Soil Conservation District.
bill_summary: The bill alters the boundaries of the Frederick County Soil Conservation District to include the Catoctin Soil Conservation District and the original Frederick Soil Conservation District, effectively expanding the district within Frederick County.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Landowners and water management entities within Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill employs a boundary adjustment approach to improve resource management, which is a standard practice and not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's primary focus on boundary adjustment does not directly address child poverty or its causes.

Title: Washington County - Public Facilities Bonds
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of Washington County to borrow not more than $50,000,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in Washington County and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Washington County to issue up to $50 million in bonds to finance public facilities, water and sewer projects, and volunteer fire department improvements, with funds also for land easements. It details borrowing, issuing, and repayment procedures, including tax exemptions and refunding provisions.
responsible_party: Washington County government
stakeholders: Residents of Washington County, volunteer fire departments, public utility users, landowners with easements, community members benefiting from public facilities
innovative_summary: The program primarily involves bond issuance and financing for public infrastructure and fire departments, which follows standard local government finance practices; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on infrastructure development and supporting volunteer fire departments may indirectly benefit communities, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County and Montgomery County - The Washington Suburban Transit Commission Reform Act PG/MC 103-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of Transportation's designee to attend meetings of the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority Board of Directors on behalf of the Secretary when the Secretary is not available; authorizing the Washington Suburban Transit Commission to reappoint a certain appointee to be a principal member of the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority Board of Directors; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms the governance and powers of the Washington Suburban Transit Commission in Montgomery and Prince George's Counties, including reappointing certain members and clarifying their powers to make contracts and attend meetings.
responsible_party: Washington Suburban Transit Commission
stakeholders: Residents of Montgomery County and Prince George's County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly clarifies governance and operational rules rather than establishing new services or using new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, focusing on transit governance.

Title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - Connection Pipe Emergency Replacement Loan Program - Expansion PG/MC 101-24
Synopsis: Expanding the Connection Pipe Emergency Replacement Loan Program to include certain sewer pipes and diagnostic actions; altering the maximum amount of a loan that may be made under the Program from $5,000 to $10,000; altering the total amount of loans that the Program may provide or have outstanding from $1,000,000 to $2,000,000; and increasing to $200,000 the amount of funding through fiscal year 2034  which the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission must include for the Program in the Commission's budget.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission's Connection Pipe Emergency Replacement Loan Program to include sewer pipes and diagnostic actions, raises the maximum loan amount to $10,000, and increases the total loan program cap to $2,000,000. It also modifies program funding and management details.
responsible_party: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission
stakeholders: Residential customers of the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, particularly those with malfunctioning water or sewer pipes.
innovative_summary: The program employs a loan-based approach with property liens for funding pipe replacement and diagnostics, leveraging existing utility billing systems and land records for enforcement, which is a relatively traditional but effective approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could improve health and living conditions by facilitating pipe repairs, which may reduce health-related costs and improve sanitation.

Title: Armed Forces - Support of Military Families and Addition of Space Force
Synopsis: Adding the Space Force to certain provisions of law related to the armed forces; authorizing military spouses and residents of the State who are members of the National Guard of another state or a reserve component of the armed forces to terminate certain contracts at any time after the date the service member receives certain military orders to relocate; altering the definition of a "military-connected student" for purposes of the Purple Star Schools Program; and authorizing the Governor to make certain posthumous awards.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland laws to include the Space Force in military-related legal provisions, clarifies rights for military spouses regarding contract termination upon military orders, expands the definition of military-connected students to include Space Force members, and allows for posthumous military promotions and awards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services (Adjutant General for military matters)
stakeholders: Military families, veterans, military-connected students, and military personnel in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates the Space Force into existing military legal and educational frameworks and enhances rights for military spouses, representing an update to legislative language to reflect modern military structures and needs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit military families and children through improved support and recognition.

Title: Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment Workgroup
Synopsis: Establishing the Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment Workgroup to study certain standards related to EV charging stations; and requiring the Workgroup to report its framework and recommendations to the Senate Education, Energy, and the Environment Committee and the House Economic Matters Committee on or before November 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Comptroller to adopt regulations for the retail use of electric vehicle supply equipment, establishes a workgroup to develop standards and report recommendations, and sets specific operational, reporting, and reliability standards for EV charging stations.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller in consultation with the Public Service Commission and other agencies
stakeholders: Electric vehicle owners, EV service providers, and the general public utilizing EV charging stations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs comprehensive standards and reliability requirements for EV charging infrastructure, including innovative reporting, certification, and monitoring mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to improve access and reliability of EV charging stations, indirectly supporting economic mobility and reducing transportation costs for low-income households.

Title: Highways â€“ Tourist Area and Corridor Signage Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Tourist Area and Corridor Signage Program to create a system of supplemental guide signs to direct motorists to eligible individual attractions by directing the motorists first to groups of attractions; requiring the State Highway Administration and the Department of Commerce to develop standards and procedures for determining the eligibility of an attraction for a sign; requiring the Administration to notify certain committees of the General Assembly at least 30 days before amending the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Tourist Area and Corridor Signage Program, which creates a system of signs directing motorists to eligible attractions along Maryland highways, with a focus on promoting tourism and local attractions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Tourists, local attractions, Maryland residents, tourism industry
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured process for attractions to qualify for signage and leverages traffic control standards, but it primarily builds on existing infrastructure and standards rather than employing entirely new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited potential for a direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly promotes tourism and local attractions.

Title: Baltimore City Sheriff - Staffing
Synopsis: Increasing from one to three the number of assistant sheriffs required to be appointed by the Baltimore City Sheriff; authorizing the Baltimore City Sheriff to appoint social workers and any additional sworn or civilian personnel if the funding for the personnel is provided in the ordinance of estimates or any other source; and applying the Act to all full-time sworn law enforcement officers who are deputy sheriffs at the rank of lieutenant or below and court security officers.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of assistant sheriffs required to be appointed by the Baltimore City Sheriff, authorizes the Sheriff to appoint additional staff, and regulates collective bargaining rights for sworn law enforcement officers and court security officers within the Baltimore City Sheriff's Office.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Sheriff's Office
stakeholders: Sworn law enforcement officers, court security officers, Baltimore City government, residents of Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces formal collective bargaining processes and arbitration procedures for Baltimore City law enforcement officers and court security officers, which is a structured approach to labor negotiations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct potential to impact child poverty, as it primarily concerns staffing and labor negotiations within law enforcement, with no specific programs targeting child poverty.

Title: Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services to identify reentry services in the State, develop a plan to establish a new division within the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, and develop a plan to expand certain services for individuals after release from incarceration; and requiring the Task Force to submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the General Assembly on or before December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force to create a Division of Returning Citizens and expand reentry services for individuals leaving incarceration in Maryland. The task force will assess current services, identify gaps, develop plans for new division and expanded services, and submit a report by December 31, 2025.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Returning citizens, their families, reentry organizations, community programs, and government agencies involved in reintegration services
innovative_summary: The bill proposes creating a dedicated division within the Department of Public Safety to coordinate and expand reentry services, and employs a comprehensive assessment and planning approach to improve reintegration outcomes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to impact child poverty by improving reentry outcomes and stability for individuals reentering society, which can positively influence their families.

Title: State Agency Workforce Policy for the 21st Century Act
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement that an appointing authority send a copy of the selection plan and job announcement to the Secretary of Budget and Management at least 1 week before posting a job announcement; and repealing the requirement that the appointing authority wait until after the close of a position announcement to review qualified applicants.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's state employment laws by prohibiting discrimination based on education levels, streamlining recruitment processes, updating classification and job title procedures, and enhancing active recruitment efforts within state agencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: State government employees and applicants, Maryland state agencies
innovative_summary: The bill enhances existing recruitment and classification practices, promoting fairer employment policies and active outreach, but it does not employ new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential for impact on child poverty through improved employment opportunities for qualified individuals.

Title: Consumer Protection â€“ Selfâ€“Administered Sexual Assault Evidence Collection Kits
Synopsis: Providing that a party in a criminal trial involving an allegation of sexually assaultive behavior may not introduce information that physical evidence of sexually assaultive behavior was obtained using certain materials; providing that selling, offering for sale, or distributing a certain self-administered sexual assault evidence collection kit is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice; establishing the Forensic Nurse Examiner Training Grant Program and the Forensic Nurse Examiner Training Grant Program Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the sale, offer for sale, or distribution of self-administered sexual assault evidence collection kits, establishes a grant program to fund training for forensic nurses, and provides penalties for violations, aiming to improve evidence collection and aid victims of sexual assault.
responsible_party: Governorâ€™s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault, forensic nurses, nonprofit entities providing resources for sexual assault victims
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates a new specialized grant program and imposes legal restrictions on the sale and distribution of evidence collection kits, representing an innovative approach to victim support and evidence integrity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may have an indirect impact on child poverty by improving victim support services, but its primary focus is on evidence collection and legal regulation.

Title: Behavioral Health Advisory Council and Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the membership and terms of members of the Behavioral Health Advisory Council; altering the membership of the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access; and requiring the Commission, in coordination with the Council, to make recommendations regarding the continuation of the State's behavioral health carve-out and the financing structure and quality oversight necessary to integrate somatic and behavioral health services and ensure compliance with the Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act.
bill_summary: The bill revises the structures and mandates of Maryland's Behavioral Health Advisory Council and the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access. It alters membership, enhances collaboration, and directs assessment and strategic planning for behavioral health services, including integration with physical health, workforce, and funding strategies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with behavioral health disorders, their families, health providers, and state health agencies
innovative_summary: The bill promotes coordinated assessment, planning, and reporting on behavioral health services, workforce, and integrations, including potential participation in federal Medicaid health innovation models, employing comprehensive and integrated approaches to behavioral health.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact as improved behavioral health services can reduce barriers to stability and well-being among children and families.

Title: Maternal Health â€“ Assessments, Referrals, and Reporting (Maryland Maternal Health Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing requirements on local health departments and certain health care providers and facilities regarding maternal health, including requirements regarding prenatal risk assessment forms and postpartum infant and maternal referral forms; requiring hospitals and freestanding birthing centers to participate in the Severe Maternal Morbidity Surveillance Program to identify risk factors and causes of Severe Maternal Morbidity; requiring the Program to report its findings and recommendations by December 1, 2025;  etc.
bill_summary: The Maryland Maternal Health Act of 2024 establishes new requirements for local health departments, hospitals, and birthing centers regarding maternal health, including prenatal risk assessments, postpartum referrals, and the development of a report card for birthing facilities that evaluates various quality metrics.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health, in collaboration with the Maryland Health Care Commission and local health departments
stakeholders: Pregnant women, new mothers, hospitals, birthing centers, and local health departments in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a comprehensive report card for birthing facilities, integrating data collection, public reporting, and continuous quality improvement, which employs data-driven and transparent approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a potential to reduce child poverty by improving maternal and infant health outcomes, which can contribute to breaking cycles of poverty linked to poor health.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 46th Alcoholic Beverages District - Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a total of 10 new Class B-D-7 licenses and a total of 2 new Class A-7 licenses within a certain bounded area; providing that, in the 46th alcoholic beverages district in Baltimore City, a certain license may be issued and an existing license may be moved to a building that is within 300 feet of a place of worship or school under certain circumstances; prohibiting the Board from authorizing a license to a recipient of a certain State grant; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises rules governing alcoholic beverages licenses in Baltimore City, including the issuance and transfer of licenses within the 46th Alcoholic Beverages District, as well as adjustments to licensing hours and special provisions for certain license holders.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, residents, businesses, and community organizations within Baltimore City, especially in the 46th Alcoholic Beverages District
innovative_summary: The bill employs existing licensing frameworks with specific geographic restrictions and temporary provisions, rather than introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly adjusts licensing rules.

Title: State Board of Nursing - Executive Director Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for the executive director of the State Board of Nursing.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to create a stakeholder workgroup to study and make recommendations on the qualifications for the executive director of the State Board of Nursing. It also temporarily modifies the qualifications for the executive director position and sets a timeline for the study and potential changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Nursing professionals, State Board of Nursing, healthcare regulators, public health officials
innovative_summary: The bill is primarily about policy review and recommendations rather than implementing a new or innovative program or technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board of Pharmacy - Prohibition on Discrimination Against 340B Drug Distribution
Synopsis: Prohibiting a 340B manufacturer from taking certain direct or indirect  actions to limit or restrict the acquisition or delivery of a 340B drug; making a violation of the Act an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice within the meaning of the Consumer Protection Act; and requiring the Maryland Prescription Drug Affordability Board to conduct a study of the 340B Program and report its findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by July 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits certain actions by 340B drug manufacturers and related entities that restrict the distribution of 340B drugs, establishes penalties for violations, and mandates a study by the Maryland Prescription Drug Affordability Board on the 340B program in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Prescription Drug Affordability Board and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Covered entities, 340B drug manufacturers, pharmacies, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal and regulatory approach to enhance transparency and fairness in the distribution of 340B drugs, including study and enforcement components.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact on child poverty through increased access to affordable medications for vulnerable populations.

Title: Carroll County â€“ Sheriff â€“ Salary
Synopsis: Increasing the annual salary of the Sheriff of Carroll County to $191,078.10 beginning in 2026 and $212,309 beginning in 2027.
bill_summary: The bill increases the salary of the Carroll County Sheriff over time, with specific increases in 2023, and from 2026 onward, the salary is tied to the salary of a Department of State Police Lieutenant Colonel, with adjustments every four years.
responsible_party: Carroll County government
stakeholders: Residents of Carroll County, law enforcement community, local government officials
innovative_summary: The program links the Sheriff's salary to the salary of a State Police Lieutenant Colonel, employing a performance-related, dynamic salary adjustment approach based on a state-level pay scale.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may have indirect effects through improved law enforcement funding.

Title: Criminal Organizations - Underlying Crime
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "underlying crime" that is applicable to certain prohibitions against participation in criminal organizations.
bill_summary: The bill establishes laws targeting criminal organizations by defining participation and underlying crimes, setting civil and criminal penalties, and creating procedures for forfeiture of property connected to criminal activities, including vehicles, real estate, and money.
responsible_party: Maryland law enforcement and judiciary agencies, including the Attorney General and local law enforcement units
stakeholders: Individuals and communities affected by criminal organization activities, property owners involved in forfeiture proceedings, law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The program employs comprehensive legal strategies including civil and criminal proceedings, forfeiture laws, and enhanced investigative and enforcement powers to dismantle criminal organizations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit children through reduction of organized crime and increased community safety.

Title: Income Tax Subtraction Modification â€“ Death Benefits â€“ Law Enforcement Officers and Fire Fighters
Synopsis: Allowing a subtraction under the Maryland income tax for the payment of a death benefit under a collective bargaining agreement to a spouse or beneficiary of a law enforcement officer or fire fighter whose death arises out of the course of employment; and applying the Act retroactively to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2021.
bill_summary: This bill allows a Maryland income tax subtraction for payments made to the surviving spouse or beneficiary of a deceased law enforcement officer or firefighter, related to death benefits from employment during the course of duty.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Survivors of law enforcement officers and firefighters, state taxpayers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a tax subtraction for specific death benefit payments, mainly a rule change without the use of new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily affects tax treatment for surviving spouses and beneficiaries.

Title: Public Safety - Maryland Entertainment District Security Grant Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Entertainment District Security Grant Program to assist community organizations, nonprofit entities, and local governments in funding security operations during times of high pedestrian traffic in certain entertainment districts; establishing the Maryland Entertainment District Security Grant Program Fund; authorizing the Governor, beginning in fiscal year 2026 and each fiscal year thereafter, to include up to $1,000,000 in the annual budget bill for the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Entertainment District Security Grant Program to fund security operations in entertainment districts with high pedestrian traffic and reported crime, with funds collected and allocated by the state.
responsible_party: Governorâ€™s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Community organizations, nonprofit entities, local governments, residents and visitors of entertainment districts
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted grants and state-managed funds to enhance security in entertainment districts with high crime and pedestrian activity, using data-driven eligibility criteria.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on security in entertainment districts, not specifically on economic support or poverty reduction.

Title: Income Tax - Opportunity for Filers to Register to Make Anatomical Gift
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller to implement procedures to offer certain income tax return filers the opportunity to register to make an anatomical gift in accordance with the Maryland Revised Uniform Anatomical Gift Act through a hyperlink to the anatomical gift donor registry.
bill_summary: The bill allows Maryland income tax filers to register as organ donors by indicating their decision on their tax return, and requires the Comptroller to facilitate this process and cooperate with the organ registry organization.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller and the Stateâ€™s designated organ registry organization
stakeholders: Maryland income tax filers and potential organ donors
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new method for registering as an organ donor through the state income tax filing process, employing electronic registration and data transfer technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but potentially can increase awareness and support for organ donation, which indirectly benefits public health.

Title: Workgroup for the Deaf, Deafblind, and Hard of Hearing - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup for the Deaf, Deafblind, and Hard of Hearing to study and make recommendations regarding certain services, programs, advocacy, outreach efforts, and other items to improve the quality of life of individuals who are deaf, deafblind, or hard of hearing; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by June 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Workgroup and a Commission for the Deaf, Deafblind, and Hard of Hearing to study and recommend improvements in services, accessibility, and quality of life for these communities in Maryland.
responsible_party: Office of the Deaf and Hard of Hearing, Maryland State Government
stakeholders: Deaf, Deafblind, and Hard of Hearing individuals in Maryland and the Washington, D.C. area
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative task force including community representatives and government officials to study and improve services, which is a common approach but well-structured.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential for a direct impact on child poverty exists through improved access to educational, employment, health, and social services for individuals including children in these communities.

Title: Health Insurance - Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Benefits - Sunset Repeal and Modification of Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Altering certain reporting requirements on health insurance carriers relating to compliance with the federal Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act; altering requirements for certain analyses of nonquantitative treatment limitations required of health insurance carriers; establishing certain remedies the Commissioner may use to enforce compliance with the Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act and related reporting requirements; repealing the requirement that a certain form be used for the reporting requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises reporting requirements for health insurance carriers regarding compliance with the Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act, including analysis of nonquantitative treatment limitations and enforcement remedies.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Health insurance carriers, mental health and substance use disorder beneficiaries, policyholders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes standardized reporting and analysis using federal and national tools, with enhanced oversight and public disclosure, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily improving oversight of mental health benefits.

Title: Education - Blind and Visually Impaired Students - Textbook Equity
Synopsis: Establishing requirements for each county board of education regarding provision of the instructional materials that will be used in the upcoming school year for students with individualized education programs; requiring the county board to coordinate with the Instructional Resources Center to provide the materials in a specialized format to blind or visually impaired students; requiring, beginning January 1, 2025, certain textbook publishers to provide an electronic file of pupil edition textbooks; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes requirements for Maryland county boards of education to ensure blind and visually impaired students have access to instructional materials in specialized formats, coordinated through the Instructional Resources Center, including provisions for timely delivery, publisher responsibilities, and reporting.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Instructional Resources Center
stakeholders: Blind and visually impaired students in Maryland, their families, and educators
innovative_summary: The bill employs coordinated efforts between the Department of Education, publishers, and the Instructional Resources Center to improve access to educational materials in specialized formats, leveraging standardized digital files like NIMAS for efficiency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce disparities in educational access for visually impaired children, which can contribute to lowering child poverty.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Remote Ultrasound Procedures and Remote Fetal Nonstress Tests
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to provide remote ultrasound procedures and remote fetal nonstress tests if the patient is in a residence or a location other than the office of the patient's provider and the provider follows the same standard of care that the provider would follow when providing the services on-site.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to provide remote ultrasound procedures and remote fetal nonstress tests for eligible pregnant women, including guidelines for provider standards, use of digital technology, and reimbursement policies.
responsible_party: Maryland Medical Assistance Program
stakeholders: Pregnant women eligible for Medicaid, healthcare providers, and technology companies providing digital health solutions.
innovative_summary: The program employs remote digital health technology to expand access to prenatal testing services, utilizing secure electronic data transmission and FDA-approved monitoring solutions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving prenatal care for low-income pregnant women and potentially reducing health disparities.

Title: Public Safety - Automatic License Plate Readers - Captured Plate Data Storage and Upload
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "historical data" to include automatic license plate reader data stored by cloud computing; establishing that certain captured automatic license plate reader data is the property of a certain law enforcement agency and may not be sold for any purpose; establishing that certain captured automatic license plate reader data may be uploaded to the Maryland Coordination and Analysis Center; and extending certain penalties for a violation of the Act to a vendor contracted by a law enforcement agency.
bill_summary: The bill regulates the use, storage, and sharing of automatic license plate reader data by law enforcement, including the prohibition of selling such data and restrictions on uploading it to other agencies or entities. It also requires the adoption of procedures for its operation and safeguards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police and law enforcement agencies using automatic license plate reader systems
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, data subjects (public), and vendors involved in license plate data handling
innovative_summary: The bill employs existing technology with new rules for data ownership, restrictions on data trading, and procedural safeguards for data access and breaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to directly impact child poverty.

Title: Blueprint for Maryland's Future Implementation - Funding for Implementation Coordinators
Synopsis: Requiring for each fiscal year each county board of education to provide $150,000 for the salary and benefits of the Blueprint for Maryland's Future implementation coordinator in the county; and requiring the implementation coordinator's salary and benefits to be paid for by the State and the county in a certain proportion.
bill_summary: The bill requires county boards of education in Maryland to fund the salary and benefits of the Blueprint implementation coordinator, with the state covering a proportion of the costs. It also extends requirements for independent evaluations of the Blueprint's progress and introduces reporting timelines to assess implementation and outcomes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, teachers, and education officials in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces coordinated implementation efforts with funded coordinators and independent evaluations, employing technological and organizational strategies to improve oversight and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a significant potential to improve educational outcomes and close achievement gaps, thereby directly impacting child poverty.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages - Class 4 Limited Winery License - Requirements and Authorizations
Synopsis: Altering certain cultivation or production requirements applicable to a holder of a Class 4 limited winery license by basing them on certain agricultural products instead of grapes and other fruit; and altering the standards for the purchase of certain wine by a license holder.
bill_summary: The bill alters requirements and standards for the Class 4 limited winery license in Maryland, including allowing the use of Maryland-grown agricultural products other than grapes or fruit in winemaking, adjusting production exemptions, and clarifying licensing and sale regulations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Wine producers, Maryland farmers, consumers of Maryland wine
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a broader definition of Maryland-grown agricultural products for winemaking and adjusts licensing rules, reflecting a more flexible and farm-integrated approach to wine production.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect and minimal, focusing primarily on wine industry regulations.

Title: Compensation for Individuals Erroneously Convicted - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain benefits that a certain individual who has been erroneously convicted of a crime is entitled to receive; requiring the State to notify a certain individual of certain information in writing under certain circumstances when the State intends to reduce or prevent an award of compensation to the individual; and repealing obsolete provisions of law relating to the filing of a certain petition for compensation.
bill_summary: This bill revises the laws regarding compensation and benefits for individuals who have been erroneously convicted of crimes in Maryland. It expands the types of benefits provided, clarifies procedural and notification requirements, and adjusts eligibility criteria and timelines.
responsible_party: Board of Public Works, Office of Administrative Hearings, State of Maryland
stakeholders: Individuals wrongfully convicted and their estates, Maryland taxpayers, criminal justice system actors
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive approach to compensating wrongfully convicted individuals, including expanded benefits and structured payment plans, but does not employ new technologies or radically new methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly through potential benefits to wrongfully convicted individuals and their families.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B Beer, Wine, and Liquor Licenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a Class B beer, wine, and liquor license in a certain area; and establishing the requirements for a holder of the license.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to issue a specific Class B alcohol license to certain restaurants in the Downtown Management District, with requirements related to food sales and health classifications. It limits new licenses after June 30, 2028, but allows renewals.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Restaurants in Baltimore City's Downtown Management District and local economy
innovative_summary: The program introduces a localized licensing opportunity with specific conditions for food and health classifications, focusing on promoting food-focused establishments and economic activity in a specified district.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting restaurant licensing and local economic activity.

Title: 9-1-1 Trust Fund - Purposes - Training in Telecommunications Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation
Synopsis: Altering the purposes of the 9-1-1 Trust Fund to including funding the costs of telecommunications cardiopulmonary resuscitation training.
bill_summary: The bill expands the purposes of the Maryland 9-1-1 Trust Fund to include funding for telecommunications cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) training for public safety answering point personnel, and requires the Maryland 9-1-1 Board to establish training standards for such CPR training.
responsible_party: Maryland 9-1-1 Board
stakeholders: Public safety answering point personnel, emergency responders, and the general public who receive emergency services
innovative_summary: This bill incorporates high-quality telecommunications CPR training into public safety emergency protocols, emphasizing nationally recognized guidelines and ongoing training, utilizing advanced protocols and standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on emergency response training for personnel.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Human Relations Commission - Subpoena Enforcement
Synopsis: Authorizing the Human Relations Commission of Anne Arundel County to apply to a circuit court in any county to seek relief if a party fails to comply with a subpoena.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Anne Arundel County Human Relations Commission to seek court enforcement when a person fails to comply with a subpoena, including applying for court orders and issuing body attachments to compel compliance.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Human Relations Commission
stakeholders: Residents and individuals subject to subpoenas by the Anne Arundel County Human Relations Commission
innovative_summary: The bill enhances subpoena enforcement procedures for the County Human Relations Commission through court orders and body attachments, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or employment programs.

Title: State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners - Veterinary Technicians and Veterinary Assistants
Synopsis: Authorizing a veterinary assistant to perform certain tasks under the immediate or direct supervision of a veterinary practitioner or a veterinary technician under the direct supervision of a veterinary practitioner; and authorizing a veterinary technician to perform certain procedures, including certain emergency procedures and euthanasia, if the veterinary practitioner determines the veterinary technician is qualified to perform the procedures.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes veterinary assistants to perform certain tasks under supervision, expands the roles of veterinary technicians, and establishes a pathway for veterinary assistants to become veterinary technicians by 2027.
responsible_party: State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners
stakeholders: Veterinary assistants, veterinary technicians, veterinarians, animal patients
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new licensing pathway for veterinary assistants to become veterinary technicians, employing regulatory and assessment frameworks.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty but may improve veterinary access and animal health services.

Title: Standing - Environmental and Natural Resources Protection Proceedings (Clean Water Justice Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Providing certain persons standing in environmental and natural resources protection proceedings; authorizing persons that meet standing requirements to bring certain civil actions under certain circumstances; requiring a plaintiff, under certain circumstances, to give certain notice and provide certain documentation to the Department of the Environment and the Attorney General and to file a certain affidavit; authorizing a court to grant certain relief, award certain costs, and impose certain civil penalties; etc.
bill_summary: The bill, called the Clean Water Justice Act of 2024, expands standing rights for individuals, associations, and other entities to bring civil actions and intervene in environmental and water resource protection proceedings. It establishes procedures for notice, litigation costs, civil penalties, and scope of actions related to water quality violations in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Individuals, associations, environmental groups, and communities concerned with water quality and natural resource protection in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program introduces enhanced legal standing rights and procedural protections for citizens and groups to enforce water quality standards, representing a proactive legal approach to environmental protection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially supports child poverty reduction indirectly by promoting healthier environments and water quality, which can improve public health and well-being.

Title: Miriam Kelty Aging and Senior Social Connection Hub and Spoke Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Miriam Kelty Aging and Senior Social Connection Hub and Spoke Pilot Program in the Maryland Department of Aging; establishing that the purpose and the goals of the Pilot Program are to support the "village" concept of local, volunteer-led organizations that aim to provide certain services to community members who choose to age in place and to expand those services to more residents in the geographic region; and requiring the Montgomery County Village Consortium to establish a certain plan and submit certain reports.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a 3-year pilot program called the Miriam Kelty Aging and Senior Social Connection Hub and Spoke Program, aimed at supporting senior social connection and aging in place through a hub and spoke model managed by the Montgomery County Village Consortium and funded by Maryland state appropriations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Aging and Montgomery County Village Consortium
stakeholders: Senior citizens and local volunteer-led organizations supporting aging in place in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a hub and spoke model to coordinate resources, centralize administration, and expand social services for seniors using a new organizational approach within community villages.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by strengthening senior services, fostering social connections, and supporting multigenerational communities, but its primary focus is on seniors.

Title: Advanced Practice Registered Nurses - Certification Requirement and Exceptions
Synopsis: Requiring an individual, subject to certain exceptions, to be certified as an advanced practice registered nurse before practicing advanced practice registered nursing in the State.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that individuals must be certified as advanced practice registered nurses before practicing in Maryland, with certain exceptions, and updates licensing regulations and practices for registered nurses and practical nurses.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Advanced practice registered nurses, licensed nurses, healthcare providers, and patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes certification requirements for advanced practice nurses and clarifies licensing and practice rules, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The billâ€™s impact on child poverty is indirect and limited, mainly affecting healthcare workforce regulation.

Title: Maryland Intrastate Emergency Management Assistance Compact - City of Frederick
Synopsis: Authorizing the City of Frederick to participate in the Maryland Intrastate Emergency Management Assistance Compact.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the City of Frederick to participate in the Maryland Intrastate Emergency Management Assistance Compact, which facilitates mutual aid and cooperation among jurisdictions in emergency management.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Jurisdictions within Maryland, including Frederick, Baltimore City, Annapolis, Bowie, Laurel, Ocean City, and other counties and cities involved in emergency management
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a formal interstate mutual assistance agreement for emergency management, emphasizing coordinated communication and resource sharing among jurisdictions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty, focusing on emergency management cooperation.

Title: County Boards of Education â€“ Budgets â€“ Notice (Transparency in Education Spending Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Education to adopt a process for the uniform and timely reporting of certain county board of education budget information to a county governing body; requiring a county board to post certain budget information on the county board's public-facing website, in an easily identifiable location; requiring a certain audit to be sent to the county council or the county commissioners; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Education to develop a uniform process for timely reporting of county school district budgets to county governments, mandates that county boards publish their budgets and related reports on their websites, and sets standards for audits and financial reporting of school districts.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, parents, school districts, county governments in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs digital transparency initiatives by requiring all school budgets and reports to be posted online in an accessible manner, promoting transparency and public engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by improving transparency and accountability in education funding, which can lead to better resource allocation.

Title: Business Regulation - Restaurants and Traders - Licensing Requirements
Synopsis: Altering an exception for licensed restaurants to the requirement that a person who does business as a trader or an exhibitor have a trader's license to apply only to restaurants that generate 10% or less of their annual sales from nonfood items.
bill_summary: The bill amends licensing requirements for traders and restaurants by establishing an exception for certain restaurants. Specifically, it requires a trader's license only for restaurants that generate more than 10% of their annual sales from nonfood items, reducing licensing requirements for restaurants with lower nonfood sales.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Business Regulation
stakeholders: Restaurants, traders, and exhibitors in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted exemption for small nonfood sales in restaurants, simplifying licensing and potentially increasing flexibility for small businesses.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a significant direct impact on child poverty as it mainly addresses licensing rules for businesses.

Title: Landlord and Tenant - Failure to Repair Serious and Dangerous Defects - Tenant Remedies (Tenant Safety Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing that a landlord that offers a residential dwelling unit for rent is deemed to warrant the dwelling fit for human habitation; authorizing multiple tenants to join as plaintiffs in a civil action against a landlord and authorizing a court to issue an order for separate trials or other orders necessary to prevent delay or avoid prejudice; providing that a court may order certain relief in civil actions relating to the breach of warranty of habitability, including actual damages, abatement of rent, and lease termination; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new tenant remedies and protections related to the landlord's failure to repair serious and dangerous defects in residential dwellings, including mold hazards. It clarifies that landlords warrant the habitability of rental units and sets procedures for tenants to report defects, with legal actions available for non-compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Tenants in Maryland, especially those living in properties with serious or dangerous defects
innovative_summary: The bill employs legal mechanisms to enforce habitability standards and provides clear procedures for tenant action, including rent escrow and damages; it modernizes tenant protections through clarified legal recourse.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill can potentially reduce child poverty by ensuring safe and habitable housing, thus reducing health risks and housing instability for vulnerable families.

Title: Harford County â€“ Alcoholic Beverages â€“ Performing Arts Theater License
Synopsis: Altering eligibility for a performing arts theater license in Harford County by altering the definition of "performing arts theater" and authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County to issue the license to a certain for-profit theater, rather than a nonprofit theater; authorizing the holder of the license to sell liquor for on-premises consumption in addition to beer and wine; and altering the license fee from $500 to $1,500.
bill_summary: The bill permits Harford County to issue a new performing arts theater liquor license to for-profit theaters, allowing the sale of beer, wine, and liquor at the venue, with modifications to standards, fees, and sale times.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Harford County
stakeholders: Performing arts theaters, theater patrons, the local community in Harford County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new type of license allowing for-profit theaters to sell all types of alcohol, which is a novel approach to licensing for arts venues.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing and sales regulations for theaters.

Title: Maryland Health Care Commission â€“ Nursing Homes â€“ Acquisitions
Synopsis: Requiring a person, at least 60 days before the closing date of the acquisition of a nursing home, to submit a request for acquisition to the Maryland Health Care Commission and provide certain notice to residents, resident representatives, and employees of the nursing home; establishing requirements regarding the approval or denial of a request for acquisition of a nursing home; providing for judicial review of a final decision of the Commission regarding a request for acquisition of a nursing home; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new requirements and approval processes for the acquisition of nursing homes in Maryland. It mandates submission of acquisition requests to the Maryland Health Care Commission, sets timelines for review, and introduces regulations to improve oversight and quality standards following acquisitions.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Nursing home residents, staff, owners, and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured regulatory oversight framework with detailed review, reporting, and quality improvement measures, integrating regulatory processes with quality standards post-acquisition.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on improving nursing home quality and oversight can have a positive impact on vulnerable populations, including children of residents, but its primary impact is on elderly and nursing home populations.

Title: Certified Nursing Assistants - Licensing Requirements and Administrative Updates
Synopsis: Exempting an individual who practices as a certain nursing assistant for less than 4 months under federal regulations from the State's certification requirement; altering the designation of, and licensure requirements for, certified nursing assistants and geriatric nursing assistants; requiring an applicant for certification as a certified nursing assistant to complete a nursing assistant competency evaluation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates licensing requirements for certified nursing assistants in Maryland, including exemptions for short-term practice, new designation of Certified Nursing Assistantâ€“I and II, the requirement for competency evaluations, and program updates.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Nursing and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Nursing assistants, healthcare facilities, and residents in Maryland who receive care from certified nursing assistants.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new classifications of nursing assistants and updates training and competency evaluation requirements, employing a structured approach to workforce qualification.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may indirectly impact child poverty by improving healthcare and support services but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Sexual Assault Forensic Examinations Conducted Through Telehealth - Reimbursement and Study
Synopsis: Authorizing the reimbursement of a sexual assault forensic exam conducted through peer-to-peer telehealth under certain circumstances; requiring the Maryland Sexual Assault Evidence Kit Policy and Funding Committee to conduct a study on the feasibility of a telehealth program that includes a pilot program for conducting sexual assault forensic examinations through telehealth; and requiring the Committee to report its findings and recommendations to the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes reimbursement for sexual assault forensic exams conducted via telehealth, and requires a study on the feasibility of implementing a telehealth pilot program for such exams in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Sexual Assault Evidence Kit Policy and Funding Committee
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault, healthcare providers, hospitals, and law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The program introduces the use of peer-to-peer telehealth technology to conduct sexual assault forensic examinations, which is a novel approach to improve access and efficiency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could potentially improve access to specialized forensic exams, which may benefit vulnerable children, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Labor and Employment â€“ Workforce Development â€“ Talent Innovation Program and Fund
Synopsis: Establishing the Talent Innovation Program in the Maryland Department of Labor to increase access to high-quality job training by using innovative and sustainable talent financing mechanisms to help meet skill needs in the State's prominent and emerging industry sectors; and requiring the Department, beginning on January 1, 2025, and each January 1 thereafter, to report to the Governor, the President of the Senate and Speaker of the House on Program activities and use of the Talent Innovation Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Talent Innovation Program and Fund within the Maryland Department of Labor to support high-quality job training in emerging and prominent industries such as cybersecurity, health care, biotechnology, manufacturing, and artificial intelligence. It creates financing mechanisms like pay-it-forward models and pilot projects to enhance talent development and allocates funding to support these initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Workers and residents in Maryland seeking high-quality training in advanced industries
innovative_summary: The program employs innovative financing mechanisms such as pay-it-forward revolver models and pilot initiatives focused on emerging technology sectors, representing a new approach to workforce funding and development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to significantly impact child poverty by increasing access to high-quality job training, which can lead to better employment opportunities for families.

Title: Hospitals and Related Institutions â€“ Residential Treatment Centers â€“ Accreditation
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "accredited residential treatment center" for certain provisions of law governing hospitals and related institutions to include residential treatment centers accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities or the Council on Accreditation.
bill_summary: The bill updates the definition of 'accredited residential treatment center' to include centers accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities or the Council on Accreditation, aligning it with existing accreditation definitions and emphasizing the importance of accreditation for residential treatment centers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residential treatment centers, patients receiving care at these centers, regulatory agencies
innovative_summary: The bill broadens accreditation standards for residential treatment centers to include additional accrediting bodies, promoting higher quality and consistent standards across facilities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially improves access to quality residential treatment, which may contribute to better overall well-being and stability for children in need, thus having a moderate impact on child poverty.

Title: Growing Family Child Care Opportunities Pilot Program â€“ Permanent Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Growing Family Child Care Opportunities Pilot Program as a permanent program; and extending the appropriation that the Governor is required to make in the annual budget bill to the Program to fiscal year 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Growing Family Child Care Opportunities Program as a permanent initiative to support family child care providers through grants, technical assistance, and outreach, especially targeting areas with high poverty and unemployment.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education, in partnership with the Maryland Child Care Resource Network
stakeholders: Family child care providers and families, especially in areas with high poverty and unemployment
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted, collaborative approach to expanding family child care supply, utilizing grants, technical support, and partnerships with local organizations to promote sustainability and quality.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to affordable child care in underserved areas.

Title: Emergency Medical Services - Maryland Emergency Department Wait Time Reduction Commission - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Emergency Department Wait Time Reduction Commission to address factors throughout the health care system that contribute to increased emergency department wait times; authorizing the Commission to request data from certain entities; and requiring the Commission, beginning November 1, 2025, to report annually to the Governor and General Assembly on its activities and findings including updates on the development, impact and, implementation of the recommended programs on emergency department wait times.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Emergency Department Wait Time Reduction Commission to develop strategies, protocols, and technological solutions aimed at reducing emergency department wait times across the state. It includes provisions for data sharing, monitoring, and annual reporting, and sets a timeframe from July 1, 2024, to June 30, 2027.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health (implied through the responsible agencies and commission structure)
stakeholders: Hospital emergency departments, healthcare providers, patients in need of emergency services, hospital administrators
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive and coordinated approach that includes developing advanced real-time technology solutions, standardized protocols, staff training, and data-driven monitoring, making it an innovative effort to improve emergency healthcare efficiency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by improving emergency healthcare access and reducing delays, which may indirectly benefit vulnerable children and families.

Title: Environment - Playground Surfacing Materials - Prohibitions
Synopsis: Prohibiting, on or after October 1, 2024, a person from installing, supplying, selling, soliciting, or offering for sale playground surfacing materials that contain a certain concentration of lead or a component product, material, or substance to which PFAS chemicals were previously intentionally added for certain purposes; prohibiting a county, municipality, or unit of local government from adopting any ordinance, rule, or regulation related to playground surfacing materials that is less stringent than of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the use, sale, or installation of playground surfacing materials in Maryland that contain high levels of lead, PFAS chemicals, or PAHs, starting October 1, 2024. It also requires manufacturers to provide compliance certificates for these materials.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Manufacturers, vendors, and consumers of playground surfacing materials in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill implements health and safety standards for playground surfacing materials, including mandatory compliance certification, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The potential to directly impact child poverty is low, as the bill focuses on material safety standards rather than economic or social programs.

Title: Maryland Uniform Disposition of Abandoned Property Act â€“ Maryland 529 Program â€“ Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting certain accounts under the Maryland 529 Program from the provisions of the Maryland Uniform Disposition of Abandoned Property Act.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain accounts under the Maryland 529 Program from the Maryland Uniform Disposition of Abandoned Property Act, specifically clarifying application rules and effective date.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly / Maryland Department of Commerce (implicitly responsible for Maryland 529 Program)
stakeholders: Account holders of the Maryland 529 Program and related entities
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies legal exemptions and does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty; it focuses on legal and procedural considerations regarding account disposition.

Title: Environment â€“ Water Pollution Control â€“ Protecting State Waters From PFAS Pollution (Protecting State Waters From PFAS Pollution Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to identify significant industrial users that currently and intentionally use PFAS chemicals by July 1, 2026; requiring the Department to develop certain PFAS monitoring and testing criteria for certain significant industrial users by January 1, 2025; requiring the Department by June 1, 2025, to develop PFAS action levels for addressing PFAS contamination from industrial discharge for pretreatment permits; requiring the Department to develop mitigation plans by September 1, 2025; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes limits and regulations for PFAS chemicals in industrial water discharges in Maryland. It requires significant industrial users to identify, monitor, reduce, and eliminate PFAS chemicals from their discharges by specified deadlines, and authorizes the Department of the Environment to enforce these standards and update action plans.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Significant industrial users, environmental agencies, and the public water systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs new regulatory standards and combines monitoring, testing, elimination, and replacement strategies for PFAS chemicals, integrating federal and state regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is limited as it mainly focuses on environmental regulation and industrial practices.

Title: Hospitals - Opioid Overdose and Opioid-Related Emergency Medical Conditions - Treatment
Synopsis: Requiring hospitals to establish and maintain certain protocols and capacity related to the treatment of patients who are being treated for an opioid-related overdose or opioid-related emergency medical condition; requiring hospitals to make a referral for patients who are diagnosed with opioid use disorder or administered or prescribed medication for opioid use disorder to an appropriate provider to voluntarily continue treatment in the community and work with peer support professionals for a certain purpose; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland hospitals to establish protocols and ensure capacity for treating patients with opioid-related emergencies, including providing medication-assisted treatment and referrals for ongoing care. It also establishes a fund to support various substance abuse prevention and treatment initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Hospitals, patients with opioid use disorder, community health providers, and high-risk populations
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach including hospital protocols, referrals, peer support, and funding for community-based prevention and treatment, integrating healthcare and community resources to combat opioid overdose and disorder.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to significantly reduce child poverty by reducing opioid overdose deaths and improving access to treatment, which stabilizes families and communities.

Title: Grow Your Own Educators Grant Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Grow Your Own Educators Grant Program to provide grants to local school systems for employees who pledge to fulfill a certain service obligation as a full-time teacher in the State; requiring the State Department of Education to administer the Program and to take certain actions to develop and implement the Program; establishing the eligibility for certain teacher candidates in the Program and requiring teacher candidates to be paid a certain rate and offered certain benefits under the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Grow Your Own Educators Grant Program in Maryland, providing grants to local school systems to support employees interested in becoming full-time teachers, especially in high-need areas, with a service obligation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Noncertified education support professionals, provisional teachers, and students in high-need schools in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to diversify the teaching workforce and creates a structured pathway for noncertified staff to become teachers with support from partnerships with higher education institutions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by increasing qualified teachers in high-need areas, improving educational outcomes.

Title: State Government â€“ Attorney General â€“ Reports
Synopsis: Altering certain reporting requirements for the Attorney General; and requiring the Attorney General to publish certain documents on the website of the Attorney General.
bill_summary: This bill modifies reporting requirements for the Maryland Attorney General, including the publication of reports and opinions on the Attorney General's website, and details on investigations and legal actions related to federal government activities affecting Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland and the Maryland State Government
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes transparency by requiring the direct publication of reports and opinions on the Attorney General's website, enhancing government openness and accessibility to the public.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but aims to improve accountability and transparency in government actions.

Title: 9-1-1 Specialist Recruitment and Retention Workgroup
Synopsis: Establishing the 9-1-1 Specialist Recruitment and Retention Workgroup to identify and examine recruitment and retention challenges that affect 9-1-1 specialists in the State; and requiring the Workgroup to submit an interim report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024, and a final report on or before December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a workgroup to examine recruitment and retention challenges faced by 9-1-1 specialists in Maryland, including salary, benefits, training, and career advancement, and to make recommendations to improve the workforce.
responsible_party: Department of Emergency Management and the Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: 9-1-1 specialists, emergency response agencies, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative, research-based approach to improve workforce recruitment and retention among emergency communication professionals, considering innovations in incentives and integration into pension systems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program aims to improve emergency response workforce stability, which can indirectly benefit vulnerable populations, including children, but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: State Department of Education - Division of Rehabilitation Services - Funding
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill a certain appropriation to the Division of Rehabilitation Services in the State Department of Education to ensure the State match amount for the Division is met as required by certain federal acts.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Governor to include in the annual budget a funding allocation to the Division of Rehabilitation Services within the Maryland State Department of Education, to meet the state's matching funds requirements under federal acts related to rehabilitation services.
responsible_party: State Department of Education
stakeholders: Individuals requiring rehabilitation services, state government, federal agencies
innovative_summary: The bill's approach is primarily administrative, enabling funding to be included in the budget to meet federal matching requirements, rather than introducing new technologies or innovative models.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is limited as it mainly concerns funding coordination and does not specify direct services or programs for children.

Title: Watershed, Stream, and Floodplain Restoration - Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Restoration and Stream and Floodplain Restoration Funding (Whole Watershed Act)
Synopsis: Requiring, in each fiscal year from 2026 through 2030, up to $100,000 from the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays 2010 Trust Fund to be used to fund certain operations grants at a rate of $20,000 per project sponsor each fiscal year; authorizing the use of the Waterway Improvement Fund for projects that involve the beneficial use of dredged material and for certain water quality monitoring; prohibiting the Department of the Environment from reducing certain monitoring requirements for certain projects; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a licensing board for stream restoration contractors, creates regulations and procedures for registration and licensing, and sets standards for performance and public engagement in stream restoration projects. It also authorizes funding, oversight, and reporting for watershed and habitat restoration efforts in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and related environmental agencies
stakeholders: Stream restoration contractors, environmental agencies, local communities, and residents near restoration projects
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach integrating licensing, public engagement, environmental considerations, and funding coordination for stream and watershed restoration using new regulatory structures and oversight mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potentially high, as watershed restoration can improve environmental health, which supports community well-being and economic opportunities impacting child poverty.

Title: Maryland Center for School Safety - Secure Schools Emergency Response Grant Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Secure Schools Emergency Response Grant Program to be administered by the Maryland Center for School Safety to provide funds to improve emergency notification systems and communications between public elementary and secondary school personnel, a public safety answering point, and a public safety agency during emergency events; requiring the Center to ensure that the Program is operating and available to each county board by September 1, 2026; and authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation in the annual budget bill.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Center for School Safety's Secure Schools Emergency Response Grant Program to improve emergency notification and communication systems in public schools, including implementing a secure emergency alert platform with panic buttons, and mandates the program's implementation in all public schools by September 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Center for School Safety
stakeholders: Public school students, staff, first responders, and public safety agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs new technology by requiring the procurement and implementation of a sophisticated emergency communication platform with features like panic buttons, automated alerts, and integration with public safety systems, representing an innovative approach to school safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by improving school safety and emergency response.

Title: Human Remains - Alkaline Hydrolysis and Natural Organic Reduction (Green Death Care Options Act)
Synopsis: Establishing a regulatory system for reduction operators and reduction facilities; establishing requirements and prohibitions related to the performance of alkaline hydrolysis and natural organic reduction and the disposition of hydrolyzed or soil remains by certain facilities; requiring the Director of the Office of Cemetery Oversight and the Director of the State Board of Morticians and Funeral Directors to adopt regulations governing the performance of natural organic reduction; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a regulatory framework and standards for new death care options, alkaline hydrolysis and natural organic reduction, including licensing, safety, and disposal procedures, and clarifies restrictions on the use of remains and soil remains.
