responsible_party: Office of Cemetery Oversight and the State Board of Morticians and Funeral Directors
stakeholders: Individuals seeking alternative death care options, funeral service providers, regulatory agencies, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces innovative environmental-friendly death care approaches employing new technologies and regulatory standards for safety and disposal.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty by promoting environmentally sustainable death care options which could reduce costs and environmental impacts.

Title: Nonprescription Drugs and Devices â€“ Provision by Registered Nurses and Sale of Contraceptives Through Automatic Devices
Synopsis: Prohibiting the sale of natural membrane condoms, rather than all nonlatex condoms, through a vending machine or other automatic device; excluding the violation of a certain provision of the Act from certain penalties; and authorizing registered nurses to provide, without a prescription, nonprescription drugs and devices in a local health department under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill modifies regulations on vending machine sales of certain contraceptives and nonlatex condoms, allows registered nurses in local health departments to provide nonprescription drugs and devices without a prescription under specific conditions, and updates related penalties and oversight provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Registered nurses, local health departments, consumers seeking nonprescription drugs and contraceptives, minors in schools
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an innovative approach by allowing registered nurses to directly provide nonprescription drugs and devices without prescriptions in certain settings, utilizing expanded roles and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has significant potential to improve access to health services and contraceptives, particularly benefiting underserved populations and reducing barriers likely to have a positive impact on child poverty.

Title: Video Lottery Facility Operations - Crimes of Moral Turpitude and Value of Table Game Chips - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission is required to disqualify an applicant who committed a certain crime involving moral turpitude from holding a video lottery employee license; and altering the definition of "value" as it relates to crimes involving theft to include the face value of a chip designated for use in table games.
bill_summary: This bill alters the rules for disqualifying individuals from obtaining a video lottery employee license in Maryland, especially concerning crimes of moral turpitude and the value of table game chips, including how the face value of chips is determined.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Applicants for video lottery employee licenses, gaming operators, and the state of Maryland's gaming industry
innovative_summary: The bill updates the criteria for license disqualifications, including specific definitions for the value of table game chips, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes licensing rules for gaming industry employees.

Title: Child Care Providers - Anaphylactic Food Allergies - Guidelines and Indemnity (Elijah's Law)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health to develop guidelines to reduce the risk of exposure to anaphylactic major food allergens in child care settings; requiring the State Department of Education to create a certain model policy; requiring certain large family child care homes and child care centers to adopt a policy to reduce the risk of exposure to anaphylactic major food allergens; and providing that certain child care providers and employees are immune from civil liability.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland's Department of Education and Department of Health to develop guidelines and a model policy for child care settings to reduce the risk of exposure to anaphylactic food allergies. Child care providers are to adopt policies based on these guidelines, and providers responding in good faith to an allergic reaction are immune from civil liability.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Child care providers and children with food allergies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, collaborative approach to managing anaphylactic food allergies in child care through guidelines, policies, training resources, and legal immunity for responders, integrating health and education departments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty; its focus is primarily health and safety protocols for food allergies.

Title: Baltimore City â€“ Alcoholic Beverages â€“ 40th Alcoholic Beverages District â€“ Revisions
Synopsis: Establishing a Class M-F (Municipal Family Fun Center) alcoholic beverages license in the 40th alcoholic beverages district in Baltimore City; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a certain Class B beer, wine, and liquor license to a restaurant in a certain location; and authorizing a certain Class A license issued for a certain location to remain unexpired until the end of July 1, 2025, for the purpose of renewal.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the issuance and regulation of specific types of alcoholic beverage licenses in Baltimore City, including a new Class M-F license for a municipal family fun center and a new Class B license for a restaurant on West 29th Street, along with adjustments to license renewal and expiration rules.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City
stakeholders: Businesses such as restaurants, entertainment venues, and community organizations in Baltimore City, residents, and visitors of Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new license types tailored to specific community and entertainment needs, and modifies existing license regulations and renewal policies, employing a targeted approach to alcohol licensing in Baltimore City.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The billâ€™s impacts on child poverty are likely indirect, mainly through enabling local economic activity and community development.

Title: Transportation - MobilityLink Paratransit Service Improvements - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transportation Institute at the University of Maryland to conduct a study to identify methods to improve the Maryland Transit Administration's ADA MobilityLink paratransit service; requiring the Institute to submit a report on its findings and recommendations to the Governor, the General Assembly, and certain  officials by July 1, 2025; and authorizing the Governor in fiscal year 2026 to include in the annual budget bill at least $150,000 for the study.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Transportation Institute at the University of Maryland to conduct a study to identify ways to improve the Maryland Transit Administrationâ€™s ADA MobilityLink paratransit service, compare it with similar services nationwide, analyze costs, performance metrics, workforce metrics, and develop recommendations for service improvements.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Institute at the University of Maryland
stakeholders: Paratransit riders, individuals with disabilities, Maryland Transit Administration, Maryland residents outside fixed routes
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach including a detailed study that compares nationwide ADA services, incorporates public input, and provides tailored recommendations, using data analysis and performance metrics.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve transit services for individuals with disabilities, which may contribute to reducing barriers faced by low-income families dependent on transit; however, it is indirect.

Title: Economic Development - Strategic Infrastructure Revolving Loan Program and Tax Increment Financing
Synopsis: Establishing the Strategic Infrastructure Revolving Loan Program in the Maryland Economic Development Corporation to make loans for targeted investments in real estate and infrastructure projects located in sustainable communities, priority funding areas, and transit-oriented development areas; establishing the Strategic Infrastructure Revolving Loan Fund; authorizing the Corporation, with certain approval of a certain governing body, to pledge certain revenues generated within a certain area for certain purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Strategic Infrastructure Revolving Loan Program and Fund, managed by the Maryland Economic Development Corporation, to provide loans for targeted real estate and infrastructure projects aimed at transforming underutilized assets, supporting transit-oriented development, and fostering inclusive economic growth.
responsible_party: Maryland Economic Development Corporation
stakeholders: Communities and developers involved in real estate and infrastructure projects in designated areas such as priority funding areas, sustainable communities, and transit-oriented development zones
innovative_summary: The program employs a revolving loan fund managed by a government corporation to support targeted investments, leveraging public and private funds for strategic development projects.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by stimulating economic development and job creation in targeted areas.

Title: Allegany County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class BWLT Beer, Wine, and Liquor Tasting Permit
Synopsis: Authorizing a Class BWLT beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit to be issued by the Board of License Commissioners for Allegany County.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a new Class BWLT beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit in Allegany County, allowing license holders to permit on-premises tastings of alcoholic beverages. The permit involves a fee structure and notification requirements.
responsible_party: Allegany County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders and consumers in Allegany County attending tastings
innovative_summary: The bill creates a specific tasting permit for alcoholic beverages, which is a targeted approach to regulate and promote tastings locally.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland-Ireland Trade Commission - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland-Ireland Trade Commission in the Department of Commerce to study and make recommendations regarding bilateral trade relations and investment opportunities between Maryland and Ireland; and requiring the Commission by December 1 2025, to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Marylandâ€“Ireland Trade Commission within the Department of Commerce to study and promote trade relations between Maryland and Ireland. It details the composition, responsibilities, and reporting requirements of the commission, and sets its duration from October 1, 2024, to September 30, 2026.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Maryland businesses, Irish-American community, academic institutions, and government agencies involved in trade and economic relations with Ireland.
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated commission to study and promote international trade relations using a formal, collaborative approach involving government, businesses, and community representatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty indirectly through economic development and international trade promotion.

Title: Employees' and Teachers' Retirement and Pension Systems - Reemployment of Retirees
Synopsis: Repealing a certain exemption from certain reemployed retiree earnings offsets for certain retirees of the Employees' and Teachers' Retirement and Pension Systems; repealing certain requirements that certain participating employers pay certain offsets under certain circumstances; establishing an exemption from a reemployed retiree earnings offset for retirees of the Teachers' Pension System who are reemployed by certain employers if the retiree's salary is funded from certain sources; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies rules regarding reemployment of retirees in Maryland's Employeesâ€™ and Teachersâ€™ Retirement Systems. It introduces exemptions from the usual offsets applied to retirees who return to work under certain conditions, particularly when their salaries are funded from non-State sources or through joint employer agreements, retroactive to January 1, 2021, with some provisions expiring at the end of 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Retired employees of the Employeesâ€™ and Teachersâ€™ Retirement Systems, public school employees, local school systems, and state agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted approach to allow retirees to return to work with specific funding sources, potentially reducing restrictions and bureaucratic oversight, which reflects a more flexible and innovative employment policy for retired personnel.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The potential to directly impact child poverty appears limited, as the policy primarily concerns retirement and reemployment rules for specific government employees.

Title: State Retirement Agency - Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion and Governance Program
Synopsis: Establishing that the Executive Director of the State Retirement Agency shall employ a Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion of the State Retirement Agency; requiring the Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion to identify and minimize barriers to ensure access and opportunities to underrepresented groups; requiring the Executive Director to terminate the Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion within the Maryland State Retirement Agency and creates a governance program within the Investment Division to promote diversity and incorporate environmental, social, and governance considerations into investment decisions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Employees and beneficiaries of the Maryland State Retirement System, underrepresented groups, investment managers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion leadership role and integrates environmental, social, and governance factors into the state's investment decision-making process, which is a progressive approach for a public pension system.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce barriers to access and ensure more equitable opportunities for underrepresented groups, potentially alleviating child poverty indirectly.

Title: Baltimore County - Sheriff - Salary
Synopsis: Altering the annual salary of the Sheriff of Baltimore County.
bill_summary: This bill adjusts the annual salary of the Sheriff of Baltimore County, setting specific salary amounts for certain years and authorizing the salary to be set annually by the county council thereafter.
responsible_party: Baltimore County government
stakeholders: Sheriff of Baltimore County, residents of Baltimore County, law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill mainly establishes salary levels and rules for their adjustment, which does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty; it focuses on salary adjustments for the sheriff.

Title: Public and Nonpublic Middle and High Schools - Venue-Specific Emergency Action Plans for Athletic Facilities (The Bailey Bullock Act)
Synopsis: Requiring that each public middle school and high school alter the venue-specific emergency action plan for athletic facilities to incorporate a cardiac emergency response plan; requiring each nonpublic middle school and high school that receives State funding to develop a venue-specific emergency action plan for athletic facilities; specifying the contents of a nonpublic venue-specific emergency action plan; and requiring that the emergency action plans be reviewed and updated annually.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland public middle and high schools to develop and implement a comprehensive cardiac emergency response plan, especially for athletic facilities. Nonpublic schools receiving state funding are encouraged to do the same. The plans include team activation procedures, coordination with emergency services, training, and equipment such as defibrillators.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, school staff, coaches, parents, and emergency responders
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated approach integrating evidence-based practices, training, and equipment placement to improve emergency response in schools, utilizing national guidelines and partnerships with health organizations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially improves school safety and health outcomes, which can reduce barriers related to health crises among children, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Condominiums - Mandatory Insurance Coverage - Detached Units
Synopsis: Altering the types of elements and units for which a council of unit owners is required to maintain certain property insurance; requiring the council of unit owners to annually notify, in writing, owners of detached units of certain property insurance obligations; limiting instances when an owner of a detached unit within a condominium is required to carry homeowners insurance on the entirety of the unit; and authorizing a council of unit owners to carry homeowners insurance on the entirety of all units located within a certain condominium.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that condominium councils in Maryland must maintain property insurance for attached, multifamily, and detached units within the condominium, and requires them to notify owners of detached units annually about insurance obligations. The bill also specifies when owners of detached units need homeowners insurance and grants councils authority to insure all detached units collectively.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Condominium unit owners, detached unit owners within condominiums, property insurers, and condominium management
innovative_summary: The bill employs an integrated approach to insurance notification and coverage for condominium units, including mandatory annual notices and potential collective insurance coverage for detached units, enhancing existing condominium insurance regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential for a direct impact on child poverty as it mainly addresses insurance regulations for condominiums.

Title: Consumer Protection - Telephone Solicitation - Exemptions and Remedies
Synopsis: Establishing that certain provisions of law that prohibit a person from making or causing to make a certain telephone solicitation that involves using a certain automated system or playing a recorded message do not apply to a noncommercial telephone solicitation for public opinion research; authorizing a certain called party who is aggrieved by a person who violates certain provisions of law to bring an action to enjoin further violations and to recover certain damages; etc.
bill_summary: The bill relaxes certain restrictions on telephone solicitations by exempting noncommercial calls for public opinion research from certain regulations, clarifies enforcement and damages provisions, and prohibits waivers of specific requirements and remedies.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department responsible for telecommunication regulation and enforcement (implied to be the Public Utilities Commission or similar agency)
stakeholders: Callers and recipients of telephone solicitations in Maryland, including businesses, organizations conducting public opinion research, and consumers
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies existing laws on telephone solicitations by providing specific exemptions and enforcement provisions; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it is focused on regulation of telephone solicitations.

Title: Public Health - Kratom Consumer Protection Act
Synopsis: Requiring a retailer that prepares, distributes, sells, or exposes for sale a kratom product to disclose the factual basis on which the representation is made; establishing prohibitions related to the preparation, distribution, and sale of kratom products, including prohibitions related to the sale of kratom to individuals under the age of 21 years and the marketing of kratom to minors; establishing certain penalties for violations of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for kratom products in Maryland, requiring disclosures on labeling, prohibiting sale to minors, and restricting certain advertising practices. It also mandates reporting on adverse health events related to opioid-like substances, including kratom.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health in collaboration with the Maryland Hospital Association
stakeholders: Consumers of kratom, minors, healthcare providers, and public health officials in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive regulatory approach to control the sale, labeling, advertising, and monitoring of kratom, including collaboration with hospitals for adverse event reporting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a limited potential to directly impact child poverty but can improve public health safety.

Title: Public Health - Tianeptine Consumer Protection Act
Synopsis: Prohibiting a retailer from distributing, selling, exposing for sale, or advertising for sale a tianeptine product to an individual; and establishing a penalty for a retailer who violates the Act of a fine of up to $5,000 or imprisonment for up to 90 days or both.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations to protect consumers from unregulated tianeptine products, including disclosure requirements, age restrictions on sales, restrictions on advertising to minors, and penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Consumers, especially minors and individuals purchasing or selling tianeptine products in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs new legal restrictions and advertising guidelines to control the sale and marketing of tianeptine products, particularly focusing on consumer protection and minors.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on consumer protection and regulation of a specific substance, with limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - Fisheries - Oyster Management
Synopsis: Repealing a provision of law prohibiting the Department of Natural Resources from taking any action to reduce or alter the boundaries of certain oyster sanctuaries until the Department has developed a certain updated fishery management plan for oysters; requiring the fishery management plan to end the overfishing of oysters in all areas and regions of the Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries where overfishing has occurred; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates oyster management policies in Maryland, including developing a new fishery management plan to end overfishing, increase oyster populations and habitat, and support sustainable harvests. It also permits power boat dredging in Eastern Bay's public oyster fishery areas in Queen Anne's and Talbot counties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Oyster fisheries, local fishermen, environmental groups, and the general public interested in marine resources
innovative_summary: The bill employs a science-based modeling tool and stakeholder engagement to develop a consensus-driven oyster management plan, integrating environmental science and public input in a comprehensive sustainable fishery strategy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could impact child poverty indirectly by promoting a sustainable oyster fishery, supporting local economies, and preserving marine ecosystems that benefit community well-being.

Title: Baltimore City â€“ Alcoholic Beverages â€“ License Extensions
Synopsis: Extending until July 1, 2025, the expiration date of certain alcoholic beverages licenses in Baltimore City that are issued for certain areas for certain transferal and renewal purposes under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill extends the expiration dates of certain alcohol licenses in Baltimore City until July 1, 2025, allowing transfers and renewals under specific conditions, including community agreements and safety measures.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcohol Licensing Authority or relevant local government agency
stakeholders: Businesses holding alcohol licenses, local community members, Baltimore City residents and visitors
innovative_summary: The bill employs community-based agreements and safety measures to regulate license transfers and operations, integrating community input into licensing processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Low; the bill does not directly address child poverty but may indirectly impact local community stability.

Title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Academic Program Approval and Institutional Mission Statements - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor, the Department of Commerce, and the Maryland Higher Education Commission to each have a certain staff member who performs certain duties related to defining, identifying, and compiling data regarding the workforce needs in the State; requiring the Commission to establish a Program Review Process Advisory Council; authorizing the Commission or an institution of higher education to file an objection to implementation of a proposed online program under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland Higher Education Commission and related agencies to improve data collection and collaboration on workforce needs, establish a program review process, and develop a set of guidelines for academic program and mission statement approvals. It emphasizes the development of new graduate programs, especially those addressing emerging workforce needs, through a grant fund to promote collaboration among higher education institutions.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Higher education institutions, students, and the state's workforce development sector
innovative_summary: The bill introduces structured collaboration, a grant fund, and a review process for online and emerging workforce programs, integrating data-driven approaches and promoting inter-institutional cooperation, which are relatively innovative approaches to higher education governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's focus on aligning higher education with workforce needs, including innovative online programs and collaboration grants, has the potential to increase employment and economic stability for students, thereby potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: Electricity â€“ Tariffs, Distributed Energy Resources, and Electric Distribution System Support Services (Distributed Renewable Integration and Vehicle Electrification (DRIVE) Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a certain electric company to file certain time-of-use tariffs with the Public Service Commission by July 1, 2025; requiring a certain electric company to attempt to achieve a certain enrollment target for certain tariffs by January 1, 2028; authorizing the Commission to require the automatic enrollment of certain customers in a time-of-use tariff on an opt-out basis; requiring the Commission to certain adopt regulations on or before May 1, 2025; etc.
bill_summary: This bill mandates the Maryland Public Service Commission to develop transition plans for electric companies to shift customers to time-of-use tariffs, encourages adoption of renewable energy and electric vehicles, and establishes pilot programs and regulations to support distributed energy resources and system support services.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Electric utility customers, low- and moderate-income households, renewable energy and electric vehicle stakeholders, electric utilities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining transition to time-of-use rates, incentivizing renewable on-site generation, and establishing pilot support services programs utilizing advanced distributed energy resources and vehicle integration, leveraging new performance-based remuneration mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to impact child poverty by enabling low- and moderate-income households access to renewable energy incentives, improved electricity resilience, and equitable rate transitions.

Title: Health Insurance - Breast and Lung Cancer Screening - Coverage Requirements
Synopsis: Including image-guided breast biopsy in the definition of "supplemental breast examination" for the purpose of certain provisions of law requiring insurers, health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for supplemental breast examinations; clarifying that coverage requirements for lung cancer screening apply to follow-up diagnostic imaging; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that health insurance plans in Maryland cover certain breast and lung cancer screenings without requiring prior authorization or cost-sharing, including image-guided breast biopsy and follow-up diagnostic imaging for lung cancer, starting from January 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or insurance regulatory agencies
stakeholders: Individuals with health insurance in Maryland, particularly those at risk for breast and lung cancer
innovative_summary: The program adopts a comprehensive coverage requirement for breast and lung cancer screening procedures, including specific diagnostics and biopsy procedures, promoting proactive healthcare.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses insurance coverage for screenings.

Title: Clean Water Commerce Account - Contracts for the Purchase of Environmental Outcomes
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment, in entering into a certain contract under the Clean Water Commerce Account for the purchase of an environmental outcome, to allow for nonuniform payment schedules for certain purposes; and authorizing the Department to require a certain payment or certain financial protections for contracts of a certain size to ensure certain outcomes.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the 'Clean Water Commerce Account' to purchase environmental outcomes, specifically nitrogen load reductions, to support Chesapeake Bay restoration efforts. It details contract requirements, payment schedules, and financial protections for projects that reduce water pollutants, with a focus on projects that have a long-term, measurable impact.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Water quality projects, environmental agencies, project owners, and the public benefiting from improved Chesapeake Bay health.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces flexible, performance-based payment schedules and financial protections for environmental projects, allowing for nonuniform payments that align with milestone achievements, and encourages innovative financing approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program directly improves water quality and environmental health, which can contribute to healthier living conditions and communities, potentially reducing child poverty impacts through Environmental Justice.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages - License Applications - Notice
Synopsis: Altering a certain notice requirement before the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County may approve an application for an alcoholic beverages license; and authorizing the Board to fulfill the notice requirement by posting online notice of an application hearing for an alcoholic beverages license at least 14 days before the application hearing date.
bill_summary: This bill allows the Baltimore County licensing board to fulfill the notice requirement for alcohol license applications by posting online a notice at least 14 days before the hearing, in addition to or instead of newspaper notices.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Applicants for alcohol licenses and residents of Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of online posting as a new method to fulfill legal notice requirements, making the process more accessible and potentially more efficient.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty, as it mainly changes notification procedures for alcohol licensing.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Manufacturers and Dealers - Delivery of Vehicles
Synopsis: Establishing that certain requirements for motor vehicle manufacturers, distributors, and factory branches to deliver new motor vehicles to licensed dealers apply after receipt of an electronic order.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules for motor vehicle manufacturers, distributors, and factory branches regarding the delivery of new motor vehicles to licensed dealers, including requirements for delivery after receiving an electronic order or allocation acceptance, and mandates fairness in vehicle allocation systems.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration or relevant transportation regulatory agency
stakeholders: Motor vehicle dealers, manufacturers, distributors, and factory branches in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill implements a fair and transparent system for vehicle allocation and delivery based on electronic orders and allocations, emphasizing disclosure and fairness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty; it mainly addresses vehicle delivery rules.

Title: Economic Development - Tourism Zones - Designation and Benefits
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipality to designate, by law, an area within that political subdivision as a tourism zone under certain circumstances; providing that the designation of an area as a tourism zone may not preclude the area from also being designated as an arts and entertainment district; authorizing a county or municipality to exempt from the admissions and amusement tax gross receipts from certain admissions or amusement charges levied in a tourism zone; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the designation of tourism zones within Maryland counties and municipalities, allowing for tax incentives such as sales tax exemptions and property tax credits for qualifying tourism-related enterprises.
responsible_party: Maryland local governments (cities, counties) and the Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Tourism businesses, local governments, visitors, and residents in designated tourism zones
innovative_summary: The program employs tax incentives as a tool to promote tourism development in designated zones, which is a common approach rather than a new technology-based innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on economic development and tourism zones may indirectly benefit communities, but it does not specifically target child poverty.

Title: School Leadership Training Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the school leadership training program developed by the State Department of Education and the Accountability and Implementation Board to require that the State Superintendent, county superintendents, and the chair and vice chair of the State Board, a county board, and the Accountability and Implementation Board complete the training; combining two leadership trainings into a single training; and providing for the content of the school leadership training.
bill_summary: This bill mandates that beginning July 1, 2024, the contracts for the State Superintendent, county superintendents, and the Chief Executive Officer of Baltimore City schools include a requirement to complete a school leadership course or program. It establishes a comprehensive school leadership training program for top education officials, which must be completed at least once, and merges two leadership training initiatives into a single program. The bill details the content, duration, delivery methods, and participants of this training, aimed at improving school leadership and administration in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: School superintendents, school principals, education board members, and school leaders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a modern, evidence-based, cohortâ€“based, and flexible virtual/in-person approach to leadership training, integrating research on effective teaching, leadership, and equity, which is a relatively innovative approach in government educational programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving school leadership, which can lead to better educational outcomes for students from diverse and disadvantaged backgrounds.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Public Education Campaign on Prostate, Lung, and Breast Cancer Prevention
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to develop and implement a 3-year public education campaign on prostate, lung, and breast cancer prevention that targets communities disproportionately impacted by prostate, lung, and breast cancer on or before December 1, 2026; requiring the Department to implement the public education campaign on or before January 1, 2027; requiring the Governor to appropriate, in certain fiscal years, certain funding to the Department for the public information campaign from the Cigarette Restitution Fund; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to develop and implement a three-year public education campaign focused on the prevention of prostate, lung, and breast cancer, targeting communities disproportionately impacted by these cancers. The campaign will include educational information, promotion of screenings and clinical trials, and collaboration with healthcare providers and organizations. Funding for the campaign is allocated from the Cigarette Restitution Fund, with a total of up to $2,000,000 over several fiscal years.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Communities disproportionately impacted by prostate, lung, and breast cancer in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted public education strategies with partnerships across healthcare and community organizations to address health disparities, using a dedicated cancer prevention campaign funded through a state restitution fund.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may indirectly reduce child poverty by improving health outcomes and access to preventive healthcare among at-risk communities.

Title: Electricity - Offshore Wind Projects - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Public Service Commission to open a revised Round 2 proceeding on June 1, 2024, to evaluate certain offshore wind projects; prohibiting the Commission from approving an application for an offshore wind project unless the application includes commitments for in-State expenditures and investments; requiring the Commission to develop a certain plan to include a schedule of offshore wind energy procurements and proposed amounts of offshore wind energy for procurement through 2031; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the evaluation and facilitation of offshore wind projects aiming for 8,500 megawatts by 2031, including establishing procurement processes, project approvals, and specific financial and environmental standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and Maryland Department of General Services
stakeholders: Offshore wind project developers, Maryland residents, environmental groups, local businesses, labor organizations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive, state-led procurement and approval process for offshore wind projects, emphasizing environmental costs, community benefits, and project revisions, employing a systematic approach to renewable energy development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty through economic development, job creation, and environmental benefits that may improve public health.

Title: Cosmetologists - Esthetic Services - Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "provide esthetic services" to include certain services and to provide that it does not include the diagnosis of illness, disease, or injury or performing ablation of the dermis or hypodermis.
bill_summary: The bill alters the definition of 'provide esthetic services' to include certain new skin and beauty procedures while explicitly excluding medical diagnoses and certain invasive procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists (implied)
stakeholders: Licensed and aspiring estheticians, cosmetologists, and individuals receiving esthetic services
innovative_summary: The bill updates the legal definition of esthetic services to include a broader range of cosmetic procedures, aligning regulations with current practices in the industry.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty as it mainly defines the scope of esthetic services.

Title: Maryland Department of Health and Department of Aging - Earned Income Tax Credit - Distribution of Information and Training
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to develop a process for providing information about the availability of the State's earned income tax credits to individuals enrolled or participating in certain programs or services, or potential enrollees in certain programs, administered by the Maryland Department of Health; and requiring the Department of Aging to provide training to the Maryland Access Point network to increase awareness of the availability of the State's earned income tax credit.
bill_summary: This bill requires various Maryland health and social service programs to distribute information about the availability of the state's earned income tax credit to individuals enrolled or participating in these programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Department of Aging
stakeholders: Participants in health and social service programs receiving information about the tax credit
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward approach of information distribution and training to increase awareness of the tax credit, without employing new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to impact child poverty by increasing awareness of the tax credit among vulnerable populations, which could result in increased financial resources for families.

Title: Real Property - Recordation of Instrument With False Information - Penalties and Actions to Quiet Title
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from recording a deed or other instrument that the person knows contains false information; establishing a 3-year limitation on when a prosecution for a violation of the Act may be commenced; establishing a fine not to exceed $500 for a violation of the Act; and authorizing a court to award certain costs and attorney's fees in an action to quiet title if the action or a defense to an action is based on the alleged recordation of a deed containing false information.
bill_summary: The bill criminalizes recording a deed or other property document with false information, establishes a 3-year statute of limitations for offenses related to false recordings, and provides procedures for quiet title actions, including potential cost awards.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Property owners, buyers, sellers, and legal professionals involved in real estate transactions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces stricter penalties and procedures related to false property recordings, with some elements involving court-ordered actions and cost awards, but does not employ new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, mainly affecting property record accuracy and legal procedures.

Title: Land Use - Southern Maryland Code Counties - Subdivision Regulations - Property Dedication and Fee
Synopsis: Authorizing a Southern Maryland code county to provide in the county's subdivision regulations for a dedication of real property for recreation, or the payment of a fee in lieu of dedication, to be used by the county for the purchase, development, and improvement of real property for recreational facilities.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Southern Maryland counties to include provisions in their subdivision regulations that allow for the dedication of real property or the payment of a fee in lieu of property dedication for recreational purposes.
responsible_party: Southern Maryland counties' subdivision regulatory authorities
stakeholders: Residents and developers in Southern Maryland counties, especially those interested in recreational facilities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a flexible approach for counties to manage land development for recreational use by allowing either land dedication or fees, which is a common practice but tailored specifically for Southern Maryland counties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may contribute indirectly through improved recreational facilities and community development.

Title: Division of Parole and Probation â€“ Private Home Detention Monitoring â€“ Earned Compliance Credits
Synopsis: Authorizing individuals under supervision by a private home detention monitoring agency to receive earned compliance credits; requiring a private home detention monitoring agency to provide a report of an individual's compliance to the Division of Parole and Probation during the monitoring period; and establishing certain minimum elements to be included in the report.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes individuals under private home detention supervision to earn compliance credits that can reduce their supervision period, introduces monitoring and reporting requirements for private home detention agencies, and clarifies procedures for supervision and abatement.
responsible_party: Division of Parole and Probation, Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Supervised individuals on probation, parole, or detention; private home detention agencies; the criminal justice system in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches by integrating earned compliance credits into supervision management and establishing automated tracking systems, along with enhanced monitoring and reporting protocols for private agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has significant potential to impact child poverty by promoting successful reintegration of supervised individuals, reducing incarceration durations, and supporting community stability.

Title: Allegany County - Alcoholic Beverages - Underage Employees
Synopsis: Lowering, from 18 to 16 years of age, the minimum age of an individual that may be employed by a license holder in Allegany County.
bill_summary: This bill amends laws in Allegany County to allow individuals as young as 16 to be employed by license holders and specifies age requirements for selling or serving alcohol.
responsible_party: Allegany County licensing authorities
stakeholders: Underage individuals seeking employment and alcohol license holders in Allegany County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a lower minimum employment age for certain alcohol-related jobs, which is a somewhat novel approach to youth employment regulation in this context.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential for a modest increase in employment opportunities for youth, which could impact child poverty levels.

Title: Public Health - Maryland Commission on Health Equity and Commission on Public Health - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Commission on Health Equity to develop and monitor the statewide health equity plan required under a cooperative grant funding agreement with the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation; requiring the Maryland Commission on Health Equity to coordinate with the Maryland Department of Health and the Health Services Cost Review Commission when establishing a certain advisory committee; and altering the reporting requirements for the Commission on Public Health.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Commission on Health Equity as the main body responsible for developing and monitoring a statewide health equity plan, coordinating with other state agencies, and setting goals to improve health outcomes and reduce disparities across the state.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission on Health Equity and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, especially underserved communities and minorities affected by health disparities
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, collaborative approach integrating social determinants of health and data collection to address health inequities, with a focus on developing a statewide health equity plan.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by reducing health disparities that contribute to economic hardship and poor health outcomes among children in underserved communities.

Title: Housing and Community Development â€“ Continuing the CORE Partnership Fund â€“ Extension
Synopsis: Repealing the termination of the Continuing the CORE Partnership Fund; and requiring the Governor to include an appropriation in the annual budget bill for fiscal year 2026 and each fiscal year thereafter of $50,000,000 to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill extends the existence of the Continuing the CORE Partnership Fund, which helps remove blighted property in Baltimore City, and increases the annual funding to $50 million starting from fiscal year 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore City, urban development agencies, local government, housing organizations
innovative_summary: The bill maintains a targeted government intervention focusing on removing blighted properties to improve urban infrastructure and community health.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By revitalizing blighted areas, the program can indirectly improve conditions for children and families, potentially reducing child poverty over time.

Title: Health Insurance - Appeals and Grievances Process - Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring carriers to report additional data on the number of members entitled to health care benefits under a policy, plan, or certificate and the number of clean claims for reimbursement processed by a carrier to Maryland Health Commissioner.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance carriers in Maryland to report additional data on members and claims and establishes a workgroup to study the appeals and grievances process of health insurance claims. The workgroup will analyze current reporting, accessibility, consumer awareness, and use of artificial intelligence, and will report findings and recommendations by December 31, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration and the Office of the Attorney Generalâ€™s Health Education and Advocacy Unit
stakeholders: Health insurance consumers, carriers, and the Maryland state government
innovative_summary: The program involves establishing a workgroup that will analyze and make recommendations on the appeals and grievances process, including the use of artificial intelligence and consumer accessibility, which employs a collaborative and research-driven approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but could improve insurance appeals processes for families, potentially benefiting children indirectly.

Title: Howard County Agricultural Preservation Advisory Board - Term Length - Alteration Ho. Co. 15-24
Synopsis: Limiting the term of a member serving on the agricultural preservation advisory board in Howard County to 3 years; and authorizing members currently serving on the agricultural preservation advisory board in Howard County to complete their terms.
bill_summary: This bill changes the term length for members of the Howard County Agricultural Preservation Advisory Board to three years, and allows current members to complete their existing terms. It also specifies the appointment and duties of the advisory board.
responsible_party: Howard County government
stakeholders: Farmers and land preservation entities in Howard County
innovative_summary: The bill is primarily administrative, focusing on the structure and term length of a land preservation advisory board. It does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on land preservation advisory structures.

Title: Health Insurance - Hearing Aids for Adults - Coverage
Synopsis: Requiring insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations that provide certain health insurance benefits under certain insurance policies or contracts to provide certain coverage for certain hearing aids for adults; authorizing a limit on the benefit payable of $1,400 per hearing aid every 36 months; and authorizing an insured or enrollee to choose a certain hearing aid and pay a certain amount for the hearing aid without financial or contractual penalty to the provider of the hearing aid.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance plans in Maryland to include coverage for hearing aids for both minors and adults, with specific provisions for coverage limits and patient choices.
responsible_party: Insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations in Maryland
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland who need hearing aids, including children and adults
innovative_summary: The program standardizes coverage for hearing aids and allows consumers to choose more expensive options without penalty, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could improve access to hearing aids for children, potentially reducing barriers related to affordability and thereby impacting child well-being.

Title: Wicomico County - Alcoholic Beverages - Monopoly of Liquor Control Board and Dispensary - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the monopoly of the Liquor Control Board for Wicomico County and its dispensaries on the sale and distribution of certain liquor at wholesale in the county; authorizing the holders of certain alcoholic beverages licenses to purchase alcoholic beverages from a dispensary or a wholesaler; repealing the prohibition on delivery of certain liquor by certain wholesalers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the monopoly of the Wicomico County Liquor Control Board on certain liquor sales, allows license holders to purchase alcohol from dispensaries or wholesalers, and makes various changes to licensing, sales, and distribution rules for alcoholic beverages within Wicomico County starting July 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Wicomico County Liquor Control Board and Maryland State Alcoholic Beverages Administration
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, dispensaries, wholesalers, and residents of Wicomico County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a significant change to the local alcohol sales system by ending the county's liquor monopoly and enabling license holders to purchase from multiple sources, which is a notable shift in the alcohol distribution approach in the area.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is likely minimal, as it primarily changes alcohol sales regulations.

Title: Wicomico County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B Beer, Wine, and Liquor Licenses - Purchases From Licensed Wholesalers and Self-Distribution
Synopsis: Authorizing a Class B beer, wine, and liquor license holder to purchase liquor for retail sale from a licensed wholesaler; and authorizing a Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant license holder that has been issued a Class 9 limited distillery license to sell certain products manufactured under the distillery license in a manner consistent with the underlying Class B license for on- and off-premises consumption.
bill_summary: The bill amends alcoholic beverage laws in Wicomico County, Maryland, authorizing certain licenses to purchase liquor from licensed wholesalers and allowing a specific license holder to sell products from a limited distillery in a manner consistent with their existing license.
responsible_party: Wicomico County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol retailers, distillery license holders, and consumers in Wicomico County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the ability for license holders to sell products from a licensed distillery in a manner consistent with their existing license, which is a variation of existing licensing practices but not a completely new approach or technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target programs to reduce child poverty or have a significant impact on it.

Title: Howard County - Payment in Lieu of Taxes Agreements - Moderate Income Housing Ho. Co. 8-24
Synopsis: Authorizing certain owners of real property and the governing body of Howard County to enter into payment in lieu of taxes agreements for maintaining a certain number of moderate income housing units at the property; requiring the County Executive of Howard County to publish on the county's website the methodology used to calculate the negotiated payment amount under a payment in lieu of taxes agreement authorized under the Act and to reevaluate the methodology at least once every 5 years; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Howard County to enter into agreements with property owners to provide tax exemptions in exchange for maintaining a certain number of moderate income housing units. It requires the County Executive to publish and periodically review the methodology for calculating negotiated payment amounts and ensures agreements are based on the most recent methodology.
responsible_party: Howard County Government, County Executive
stakeholders: Moderate income housing residents, property owners in Howard County, local government
innovative_summary: The program employs a transparent and periodically reviewed methodology for negotiating payments in lieu of taxes for affordable housing, promoting clarity and adaptability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve access to moderate income housing, which can help reduce child poverty by increasing affordable living options.

Title: Natural Resources - Gwynns Falls State Park - Focus Group, Advisory Committee, and Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources and Baltimore City to convene focus group meetings on the establishment of the Gwynns Falls State Park with community members and stakeholders that reside or operate in the vicinity of the proposed State park; requiring the Department and Baltimore City to establish a stakeholder advisory committee; and requiring the Department to submit a report to the General Assembly by December 1, 2025, on properties suitable for inclusion in the State park and certain funding requirements.
bill_summary: The bill establishes Gwynns Falls State Park as a partnership between the Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Baltimore City, including conducting surveys, focus groups, and forming an advisory committee to improve and develop the park.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Baltimore City
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore City, local community organizations, environmental and historic preservation organizations, and park visitors.
innovative_summary: The program employs community engagement through surveys, focus groups, and advisory committees, alongside a new public-private partnership approach for park management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve community access to natural spaces and opportunities for recreation and learning, which can positively impact child well-being.

Title: State Board of Cosmetologists - Membership - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the State Board of Cosmetologists by adding one licensed esthetician and decreasing the number of consumer members from two to one.
bill_summary: The bill amends the composition of the Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists by changing the number of consumer members from two to one and clarifies the qualifications and restrictions for consumer members.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation
stakeholders: Cosmetologists, estheticians, cosmetology educators or owners, and consumers of cosmetology services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly modifies the composition of the existing State Board of Cosmetologists and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Brewery and Distillery Licenses
Synopsis: Establishing in Frederick County a Class DBR brewery license and a Class DDS distillery permit; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue to the holder of a certain brewery license a Class DBR license to sell certain amounts of beer for on-premises consumption; authorizing the Board to issue to the holder of a certain distillery license a Class DDS permit to sell certain amounts of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new licensing options in Frederick County for breweries and distilleries, including Class DBR brewery licenses and Class DDS distillery permits, which allow for the sale of food and nonalcoholic beverages along with alcoholic beverages for on- and off-premises consumption.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Breweries, distilleries, and consumers in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new license classes that integrate food and beverage sales with alcoholic beverage sales, and streamlines on-site consumption permits, representing a new approach to licensing in the region.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on licensing and commercial alcohol sales in Frederick County suggests a limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Education - School Employee Antibias Training - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to develop guidelines for an antibias training program for school employees; requiring each county board of education to offer training based on the guidelines;  requiring each county board, every other year, to provide antibias training to each public school employee whose job duties include frequent interaction with students; requiring that antibias training be job-embedded, paid professional development training that is provided during nonteaching time; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates annual antibias training for school employees and certain nonpublic school staff in prevention of antisemitism and Islamophobia. It also requires institutions of higher education to include specific training for cultural awareness and bias reduction, and commissions an independent study on Holocaust education effectiveness in schools.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: School employees, students, higher education institutions, and nonpublic schools participating in state-funded programs
innovative_summary: The bill promotes inclusive antibias training and a comprehensive, evidence-based approach grounded in cultural awareness, with periodic updates and stakeholder consultation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by fostering inclusive school environments and reducing discrimination and bias that can hinder student success.

Title: Labor and Employment - Noncompete and Conflict of Interest Clauses for Veterinary and Health Care Professionals and Study of the Health Care Market
Synopsis: Applying to certain veterinary and health care professionals certain provisions of law stating that certain noncompete and conflict of interest provisions in certain employment contracts are null and void as being against the public policy of the State; establishing certain prohibitions regarding noncompete and conflict of interest provisions for certain health care employment contracts and similar documents and agreements; and requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to study certain issues related to the health care market in the State.
bill_summary: The bill restricts noncompete and conflict of interest clauses in employment contracts for veterinary and health care professionals based on salary and job role, and requires a study on the effects of private equity on the healthcare market in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Veterinary and health care professionals, patients, healthcare providers, the healthcare market in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs legal restrictions and commissions a study to analyze the healthcare market, incorporating policy restrictions with an economic analysis approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions do not directly target child poverty but aim to improve healthcare employment practices and market conditions.

Title: Public Schools - Public School Construction - Funding and Administration
Synopsis: Establishing that the State share of eligible costs for certain school construction projects that meet certain criteria is 100%; repealing the provision of law that would have repealed the School Safety Grant Program on June 30, 2026; reducing the appropriation for the Nancy K. Kopp Public School Facilities Priority Fund to $70,000,000 annually beginning in fiscal 2027; altering the uses of the Fund, giving the highest priority to schools with a severe facility issue; establishing the Workgroup on the Assessment and Funding of School Facilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various changes to Maryland's public school construction funding, including establishing a new State share for certain projects, repealing the School Safety Grant Program, and creating the Workgroup on the Assessment and Funding of School Facilities to improve funding decisions.
responsible_party: Interagency Commission on School Construction
stakeholders: Public schools, students, and local education agencies in Maryland, especially in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill employs data-driven assessment approaches and incorporates new governance structures, such as a workgroup on school facilities, to modernize funding prioritization.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to significantly improve school facilities, which can directly benefit children in poverty through safer, better learning environments.

Title: Electric System Planning - Scope and Funding
Synopsis: Altering the scope of certain policy goals with regard to energy systems; requiring the Public Service Commission to report on certain projects relating to certain goals; altering the scope of certain funds that may be used for certain projects; requiring the Commission to adopt regulations to require investment in certain demand-side reliability and efficiency improvement methods; requiring that certain regulations adopted and orders issued by the Commission by December 31, 2025, be developed in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill primarily focuses on enhancing electric system planning in Maryland to support goals such as reducing greenhouse gases, advancing renewable energy, increasing resilience and efficiency, and promoting equitable community involvement. It mandates reporting, encourages federal funding pursuit, and sets standards for project labor practices.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Electric utilities, policymakers, vulnerable communities, and residents involved in electric system projects in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill promotes integrated planning with a focus on leveraging federal funds, expanding demand-side management, and fostering stakeholder participation, which reflects a comprehensive and technologically forward approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by promoting equitable access to clean energy infrastructure and economic opportunities through targeted workforce and community development initiatives.

Title: Civil Rights - Discrimination Based on Protected Characteristics and Reproductive Freedom
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law prohibiting discrimination based on certain protected characteristics to include prohibitions on discrimination based on sexual orientation, gender identity, race, religious beliefs, marital status, and disability; and withdrawing and repealing Chapter 244 of the Acts of the General Assembly of 2023.
bill_summary: The bill expands laws to prohibit discrimination in various aspects of public and private life based on race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, age, and national origin. It repeals a prior chapter from 2023 and introduces new non-discrimination provisions across multiple sectors such as employment, housing, education, health, and government contracting, effective October 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Multiple state agencies and departments responsible for enforcement of non-discrimination laws, including the Maryland Department of Labor, Maryland Department of Housing, Maryland State Department of Education, Maryland Department of Health, Maryland Office of the Attorney General, and others.
stakeholders: Individuals facing discrimination based on protected characteristics, including racial minorities, religious groups, LGBTQ+ persons, persons with disabilities, older adults, and residents participating in state programs.
innovative_summary: The bill employs comprehensive anti-discrimination measures across multiple sectors, utilizing new legal prohibitions and enforcement mechanisms to promote equality and prevent discrimination in various facets of public and private life.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce child poverty by addressing discrimination that can lead to economic and social disadvantages, especially for marginalized groups and children in affected communities.

Title: Montgomery County â€“ Stateâ€™s Attorneyâ€™s Office Personnel â€“ Application of County Personnel Laws and Collective Bargaining MC 12â€“24
Synopsis: Establishing the right of certain employees of the Office of the State's Attorney in Montgomery County to organize and collectively bargain in accordance with certain personnel law governing county employees; establishing that employees of the Office of the State's Attorney are subject to the county merit system law and personnel regulations; establishing certain requirements related to collective bargaining for employees of the Office; etc.
bill_summary: This bill allows employees of the Montgomery County Stateâ€™s Attorneyâ€™s Office to organize and bargain collectively for employment terms, including wages, benefits, and hours, under the same laws that govern county employees. It designates the County Executive as the employer for certain matters and the Stateâ€™s Attorney for others, ensuring a streamlined collective bargaining process. The bill also specifies the rights and responsibilities of the parties involved and aligns the office's employment rules with county personnel laws.
responsible_party: Montgomery County government and the Office of the Montgomery County Stateâ€™s Attorney
stakeholders: Employees of the Montgomery County Stateâ€™s Attorneyâ€™s Office and the Montgomery County government
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive collective bargaining framework specifically for the Stateâ€™s Attorneyâ€™s Office, integrating it with county personnel laws and procedures, thereby streamlining labor relations in a specialized government office.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially improves working conditions and benefits for employees, which could indirectly benefit families and children through increased job stability and improved services.

Title: Dorchester County - Definition of Public School Employee - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "public school employee" to include supervisory noncertificated employees in Dorchester County for purposes of collective bargaining.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of 'public school employee' in Dorchester County to include supervisory noncertificated employees for collective bargaining.
responsible_party: Dorchester County School System or relevant local education authority
stakeholders: Supervisory noncertificated employees and the local education system in Dorchester County
innovative_summary: This bill updates employment definitions to include supervisory noncertificated staff for collective bargaining, which is a standard policy update rather than a new technological approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The potential for direct impact on child poverty is low, as the bill primarily changes labor definitions and bargaining rights.

Title: Education - Blueprint for Maryland's Future - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Department of Education to award funding for a new Judy Center or Family Support Center for planning and development under a certain circumstance; requiring the State Board to approve certain specifications for teachers and administrators relating to time spent in the classroom and time spent on other teacher activities; altering certain requirements relating to student-to-classroom personnel ratios and funding timelines for the Prekindergarten Expansion Grant Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's education system by authorizing new funding and programs for early childhood education, implementing new teacher career ladder rules, establishing evaluation and monitoring of the Blueprint for Marylandâ€™s Future, and adjusting program timelines and funding, including expansion of Judy Centers, prekindergarten, and dual enrollment pathways.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Young children, students, educators, families, and local school systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new models for early childhood education, expands dual enrollment pathways, and incorporates comprehensive program evaluations and phased implementation strategies, integrating technology and new approaches to education and government accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's programs, such as Judy Centers and prekindergarten expansion, are designed to significantly reduce child poverty by increasing early education access and supporting families.

Title: Emergency Services - Funding
Synopsis: Increasing the motor vehicle registration emergency medical system surcharge for certain motor vehicles; providing for the distribution of revenues derived from the surcharge; altering certain provisions of law related to the Maryland Trauma Physician Services Fund; increasing the fines for certain violations related to driving while impaired; requiring the Governor, beginning in fiscal year 2026, to include an annual appropriation to the Senator William H. Amoss Fire, Rescue, and Ambulance Fund of at least $16,500,000; etc.
bill_summary: This bill increases funding for trauma centers and emergency medical services in Maryland. It raises the motor vehicle registration surcharge and fines related to impaired driving, directs proceeds to trauma and emergency service funds, and establishes grants for trauma centers. It also includes provisions for budget allocations and reporting requirements about the trauma system.
responsible_party: Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Trauma patients, trauma centers, emergency medical services, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill uses increased surcharges and fines to fund trauma and emergency services, and establishes grants for trauma centers, employing a combination of funding strategies and reporting to invest in system improvements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could have a moderate impact on child poverty by improving trauma care and emergency services, indirectly benefitting children in trauma-related emergencies.

Title: Howard County Public Schools - Differences in Capital Budget Proposals - Report Ho. Co. 16-24
Synopsis: Requiring the Howard County Board of Education, under certain circumstances, to publish on the website of the Howard County public school system a report that details the differences between the Howard County Superintendent of Schools' proposed capital budget and the capital budget approved by the Howard County Board of Education and the detailed rationale for each difference; requiring the Howard County Board of Education to submit the report to the General Assembly; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Howard County Board of Education and Superintendent to publish reports and submit them to the General Assembly whenever there are significant differences between proposed and approved capital budgets and capital improvement programs for Howard County public schools.
responsible_party: Howard County Board of Education and Superintendent
stakeholders: Howard County public school students, staff, and residents
innovative_summary: The bill promotes transparency by mandating online publication of budget difference reports and formal reporting to the General Assembly, enhancing accountability in school district budgeting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on budget transparency and oversight, which may indirectly influence resource allocation impacting children, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Early Childhood Education - Publicly Funded Prekindergarten Programs - Alterations
