Synopsis: Altering staff qualifications in eligible prekindergarten programs; authorizing a county board to apply for funding to lease space for  prekindergarten programs; establishing an early childhood educator career ladder; requiring the Department of Education to establish prekindergarten provider hubs; requiring the Department to distribute a list of eligible private prekindergarten providers; requiring the Governor to appropriate in fiscal year 2026 an amount that is at least equal to the amount appropriated in fiscal year 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates the rules, qualifications, and program structure for publicly funded prekindergarten programs in Maryland, including establishing a career ladder for early childhood educators, increasing private provider slots, and creating support hubs and funding incentives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Prekindergarten children, early childhood educators, private and public prekindergarten providers, families
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new structured career ladder for early childhood educators and establishes provider hubs and a phased increase in private participation, incorporating innovative approaches to educator development and program delivery.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to quality prekindergarten for low-income children and integrating socioeconomic considerations into provider placement.

Title: Howard County Task Force to Study Revenue Options for School Capital Needs Ho. Co. 18-24
Synopsis: Establishing the Howard County Task Force to Study Revenue Options for School Capital Needs to identify capital needs of Howard County Public Schools and study options for closing any identified funding gaps; requiring the Howard County Council to submit a resolution to the Howard County Delegation to the General Assembly if the county council makes a certain determination; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Howard County members of the House of Delegates and the Senate by October 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Howard County Task Force to Study Revenue Options for School Capital Needs, which will identify capital needs, project future funding, identify funding gaps, and study revenue options to address those gaps for Howard County Public Schools through 2035.
responsible_party: Howard County government and the Howard County Department of Finance, Howard County Budget Office
stakeholders: Howard County Public Schools, Howard County residents, local government officials
innovative_summary: The program employs data analysis and revenue strategy studies to help improve funding for school infrastructure, incorporating potential new revenue sources.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is primarily focused on infrastructure funding and does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Arts Incubator Workgroup - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Arts Incubator Workgroup to study how arts and cultural institutions can support local artists; requiring the Workgroup to submit to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 1, 2025, a preliminary report on its findings, including research, case studies, and examples of approaches used to support artists in other areas; and requiring the Workgroup to submit a final report by October 1, 2025, with recommendations on any necessary budget, facilities, or in-kind services to support local artists.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Arts Incubator Workgroup to study how arts and cultural institutions can support local artists, and requires it to submit preliminary and final reports with recommendations and findings.
responsible_party: Maryland State Arts Council
stakeholders: Local artists, arts and cultural institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated workgroup for strategic study and recommendations on supporting local artists, facilitating collaboration and policy development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on arts support and does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Soil Conservation Districts - Small Ponds - Plan Review Fees
Synopsis: Authorizing a soil conservation district to recommend a fee system to cover the cost of reviewing plans for small ponds; establishing that any fees collected under the Act shall be supplemental to county and State funds; requiring a soil conservation district, in developing a fee system for small pond plans, to determine for the succeeding year the reasonable cost of reviewing the plans; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes soil conservation districts to recommend fee systems to cover the costs of reviewing plans for small ponds and sediment control plans, and establishes procedures for local government to enact these fees, improving funding for plan review processes.
responsible_party: Soil Conservation Districts and local governing bodies in Maryland
stakeholders: Landowners, soil conservation districts, local governments, and environmental agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured fee system for plan review that is enacted through local government, supporting fiscal sustainability but using existing technologies and government approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on environmental management and funding processes.

Title: Professional and Volunteer Firefighter Innovative Cancer Screening Technologies Program - Funding
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor, beginning in fiscal year 2025, to include at least $500,000 in the annual budget for the Professional and Volunteer Firefighter Innovative Cancer Screening Technologies Program.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes funding for the Professional and Volunteer Firefighter Innovative Cancer Screening Technologies Program, increasing budget allocations from at least $100,000 annually for 2021-2024 to at least $500,000 annually starting in 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government (appropriate agency unspecified)
stakeholders: Professional and volunteer firefighters, particularly those at risk for cancer
innovative_summary: The program focuses on implementing innovative cancer screening technologies for firefighters, which may involve adopting new medical or technological approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program does not directly target child poverty but aims to improve firefighter health.

Title: State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists - Appointment of Members
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to appoint the licensed audiologist members to the State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists from a list submitted by the Maryland Academy of Audiology rather than by the Board.
bill_summary: This bill requires that the Governor appoint licensed audiologist members to the State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speechâ€“Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists from a list submitted by the Maryland Academy of Audiology rather than directly by the Board.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Licensed audiologists and other professionals on the Board, public seeking audiology services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new process where the appointment of audiologist members is based on recommendations from a professional organization, rather than direct appointment by the Board, integrating a professional organization into the appointment process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Uninsured Driving Penalties - Funding for the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund, Driver Education, and Transportation to Field Trips
Synopsis: Altering the penalty for failing to maintain certain required security for certain motor vehicles and the distribution of the revenue derived from the penalties; establishing the Driver Education in Public High Schools Grant Program to provide grants to public high schools and nonprofit organizations to assist public schools in offering driver education courses; establishing the State-Aided Institutions Field Trip Grant Program to assist public schools in transporting students to field trips at State-aided educational institutions; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes programs to fund driver education courses in public high schools and transportation to school field trips at stateâ€“aided educational institutions, funded through penalties for uninsured vehicle security lapses.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Public high school students, uninsured vehicle owners, schools, nonprofit organizations, and students participating in field trips
innovative_summary: The bill employs a funding model that channels penalties from uninsured vehicle security lapses into targeted educational and transportation programs in public schools, leveraging existing legal penalties to support student education and activities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The programs aim to support education and transportation access for students, particularly those from low-income families, which could help reduce child poverty.

Title: Maryland Entertainment Council - Alterations
Synopsis: Reestablishing the Maryland Entertainment Council to be the Maryland Entertainment Industry Council within the Department of Commerce to assess the State's existing assets, study certain existing State programs, agencies, and offices, and make recommendations on the development of a strategic plan for Maryland's future in the entertainment industry; and requiring the Council to submit an annual report by January 1 each year and a report of certain recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill reestablishes and expands the Maryland Entertainment Council into the Maryland Entertainment Industry Council within the Department of Commerce. The Council will study Maryland's entertainment industry assets, opportunities, and strengths, and make recommendations to develop a strategic plan to position Maryland as a leader in film, television, and entertainment. It will also assess infrastructure, workforce, incentives, and potential growth strategies, and report regularly to the Governor and General Assembly.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Maryland's film, television, and entertainment industry professionals, independent creators, and related businesses
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative government-industry approach with strategic assessment and recommendation processes, incorporating emerging technologies and industry trends, but does not explicitly involve new technological innovations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty; its primary focus is on industry development and economic growth.

Title: Education - Armed Services Vocational Aptitude Battery - Student Information
Synopsis: Requiring public schools in the State to notify students taking the ASVAB and parents or guardians of students taking the ASVAB of the option to prohibit the release of a student's ASVAB test scores to military recruiters; and repealing the requirement that certain schools provide certain notice to certain individuals regarding the release of student information and ASVAB test scores.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland public schools to notify students and parents about the option to prevent the release of student information to military recruiters when the student takes the ASVAB. It also mandates notification about the option to later authorize or prohibit release of scores and personal information to military and related organizations.
responsible_party: Maryland public schools and county boards of education
stakeholders: Students taking the ASVAB, parents or guardians, military recruiters, and educational institutions
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes and enhances communication to students and parents about their rights regarding the release of personal and test score information to military recruiters, but does not employ new technologies or methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal potential to directly impact child poverty as it mainly focuses on information rights and notification procedures.

Title: State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners - Scope of Practice, Reinstatements, and Examinations by Health Care Providers
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "practice massage therapy" to include, subject to certain education and training requirements, instrument-assisted soft tissue manipulation techniques that enhance or imitate manual techniques; altering the circumstances under which the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners is required to reinstate a license or registration; and requiring the Board to require a licensee or an applicant to submit to an examination by a health care provider under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill broadens the scope of massage therapy to include techniques like cupping, muscle scraping, and vibration therapy, and introduces procedures for license reinstatement and examinations by health care providers if there is suspicion of harm.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners
stakeholders: Licensed massage therapists, massage therapy applicants, and the public receiving massage therapy services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces mandated examination procedures by health care providers for licensees suspected of potential harm, and expands scope of practices with certain new techniques, reflecting a more integrated and health-focused approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty, but could impact health and well-being of massage therapy clients, including potentially vulnerable populations.

Title: State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners - Aiding or Abetting Unauthorized Practice - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from aiding or abetting the unauthorized practice of massage therapy; and providing penalties for a first violation of the Act of a fine of up to $5,000 or imprisonment not to exceed 1 year and for a subsequent offense, a fine of up to $20,000 per day or imprisonment not to exceed 5 years.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits aiding or abetting the unauthorized practice of massage therapy in Maryland, increasing penalties for violations, and clarifying legal consequences. It also establishes rules for licensing and enforcement.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners
stakeholders: Massage therapists, potential violators, legal authorities, and public health officials
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates legal penalties and enforcement rules regarding massage therapy practice; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on legal and enforcement issues does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Government - Office of Legislative Audits - Performance Audits
Synopsis: Altering the frequency of certain performance audits of the Board of Liquor License Commissioners for Baltimore City to once every 6 years instead of 4 years, and the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to at least once every 6 years instead of 3 years that are required to be conducted by the Office of Legislative Audits.
bill_summary: The bill changes the schedule of performance audits for the Boards of Liquor License Commissioners in Baltimore City, Prince George's County, and Annapolis, increasing the frequency of audits from every 3 years to every 6 years.
responsible_party: Office of Legislative Audits, Maryland State Government
stakeholders: Liquor license boards, local governments, and the public in Baltimore City, Prince George's County, and Annapolis
innovative_summary: The bill primarily alters audit frequency and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Election Law - Campaign Finance Activities - State Treasurer
Synopsis: Prohibiting, during a regular session of the General Assembly, the State Treasurer and a person acting on behalf of the State Treasurer, as to a candidate for federal, State, or local office or certain campaign finance entities, from receiving a contribution, conducting a fund-raising event, soliciting a contribution, or depositing or using any contribution of money that was not deposited prior to the session.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland State Treasurer and persons acting on their behalf from participating in certain campaign finance activities during the regular session of the General Assembly.
responsible_party: Maryland State Treasurer or relevant campaign finance authority
stakeholders: Maryland State Treasurer, campaign finance entities, candidates, general public interested in election integrity
innovative_summary: The bill enforces restrictions on campaign finance activities by high-level state officials during legislative sessions to reduce undue influence and improve transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal to no direct impact on child poverty as it mainly addresses campaign finance rules for officials.

Title: Transportation - Major Change in Bus Service - Publication on Website
Synopsis: Altering the information that the Maryland Transit Administration is required to publish on its website before holding a public hearing on a major service change to include certain demographic information, a summary of any publicly available minutes, records, or documents related to the service change, and a brief statement explaining the reason for the service change; and requiring the Administration to distribute the report to certain officials and entities, including each member of the General Assembly whose district would be impacted.
bill_summary: This bill enhances transparency and community involvement in major bus service changes in Maryland by requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to compile reports on the impacts of proposed service reductions or cancellations. These reports include demographic and community data, must be published on the website, and distributed to relevant officials before public hearings and final decisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Bus riders, local communities, government officials, and affected organizations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive approach combining demographic analysis, community outreach, transparency through published reports, and structured public engagement for transit service changes, employing technology for information dissemination.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate to high impact on child poverty by ensuring accessible transportation for students and families, reducing transportation barriers, and improving community mobility.

Title: Baltimore Regional Water Governance Model Workgroup - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Baltimore Regional Water Governance Model Workgroup to study the regional water governance approach in the Baltimore region; requiring the Governor to include an appropriation of $500,000 in the annual budget bill for the Workgroup; and requiring the Workgroup to report, on or before June 30, 2027, its findings to the Mayor of Baltimore City, the County Executive of Baltimore County, the Governor, and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Water Governance Model Workgroup in the Baltimore region to study regional water governance options, analyze impacts on equity, finances, workforce, and operations, and report findings by June 30, 2027.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Residents, water ratepayers, and employees in Baltimore City and surrounding counties
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach with independent consultants to analyze and recommend regional water governance models, emphasizing equity and operational improvements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty through equity analysis and programs for vulnerable residents, but its primary focus is on governance and operational issues.

Title: Forest Conservation Act â€“ Modifications
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "qualified conservation" for purposes of provisions of law related to forest mitigation banks; requiring the Department of Natural Resources to update a certain model local government ordinance by July 1, 2025, and adopt certain regulations relating to forest conservation on or before July 1, 2026; providing that a solar voltaic facilities granted a certificate of public convenience and necessity before July 1, 2023, may not be subject to certain afforestation requirements; etc.
bill_summary: This bill makes modifications to the Maryland Forest Conservation Act, including redefining 'qualified conservation', specifying forest retention priorities, adjusting afforestation and reforestation requirements, and delaying certain program implementation dates. It also updates procedures for forest mitigation banks and requires the Department of Natural Resources to update technical manuals and regulations accordingly.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Developers, local governments, conservation organizations, and residents in Maryland impacted by forest conservation policies.
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates new definitions, priorities for forest retention, and updates for forest mitigation banking, using existing frameworks with targeted improvements and delayed implementation to enhance conservation efforts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but can have long-term environmental and community benefits through improved forest conservation.

Title: Bay Restoration Fund - Use of Funds - Municipal Wastewater Facilities - Sunset Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the termination date for certain provisions of law that expand the authorized uses of the Bay Restoration Fund to include certain costs associated with the connection of a property using an on-site sewage disposal system to a certain existing municipal wastewater facility.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the sunset clause on provisions that expanded uses of the Bay Restoration Fund, allowing it to include costs for connecting properties with on-site sewage systems to municipal wastewater facilities that meet nutrient removal standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Property owners with on-site sewage disposal systems, local governments, environmental agencies, and residents in environmentally sensitive areas
innovative_summary: The program utilizes targeted funding to upgrade sewage treatment, including innovative approaches to nitrogen removal and connecting properties to municipal systems, with emphasis on environmental and public health benefits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program potentially reduces child poverty by improving public health and environmental conditions, which can indirectly benefit low-income communities.

Title: Real Property Assessments - Notice of Change in Value or Classification - Time Period
Synopsis: Increasing, for taxable year 2024, the time period after which a failure to send a notice of change in value or classification creates an irrebuttable presumption that the prior value or classification of certain real property has not changed.
bill_summary: The bill increases the time frame for which the failure to send a notice of change in real property assessment creates a presumption that the value or classification has not changed, from 30 days to May 1, 2024, for the year starting after June 30, 2024, but before July 1, 2025. It aims to streamline the notification process and strengthen the legal presumption regarding property assessment changes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Real property owners in Maryland, property assessors, local government
innovative_summary: The bill employs a temporary legal presumption to address notification timing, reducing disputes over property assessment changes, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact or target child poverty but could influence property tax assessments and local funding indirectly.

Title: Maryland Children's Health Program - Eligibility and Administration
Synopsis: Altering the eligibility requirements for the Maryland Children's Health Program; and repealing the requirement that the Program be administered, based on the family income of eligible individuals, through the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and managed care organizations or the MCHP premium plan.
bill_summary: The bill relaxes the eligibility criteria for the Maryland Childrenâ€™s Health Program, raising the family income eligibility threshold from 200% to 300% of federal poverty guidelines, and modifies administration and outreach strategies to increase enrollment and coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Children under age 19 and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive outreach and enrollment strategy including school-based programs and data-driven mechanisms to identify eligible children, making it a proactive approach to expand health coverage.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact by increasing access to health coverage for children and families earning up to 300% of the federal poverty level, which could lead to a reduction in child poverty.

Title: Horse Racing - Racing Facility Ownership and Construction - Racing Operations
Synopsis: Altering the location, type, and ownership of horse racing facilities that the Maryland Stadium Authority is authorized to finance; increasing the amount of debt that the Maryland Stadium Authority may issue for certain purposes in connection with certain racing facilities; requiring the Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority to prepare certain financial statements; requiring the Authority to submit a copy of any lease of the Pimlico racing facility to the Legislative Policy Committee for review and comment; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the financing, construction, and operation of horse racing facilities and associated community development projects in Maryland, including the transfer of ownership of Pimlico Race Course, and establishes financial, regulatory, and organizational structures to support thoroughbred racing.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority and Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority
stakeholders: Thoroughbred racehorses, horse racing industry participants, local Maryland communities near Pimlico, Laurel Park, and Bowie Race Course, and Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The program employs new organizational structures, public-private partnership arrangements, and financial mechanisms to support the renovation and operation of horse racing facilities, integrating community development and economic revitalization approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by supporting community development, workforce training, and economic revitalization around racing facilities.

Title: Maryland Stadium Authority - Camden Yards Football Sports Facility Special Funds - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Camden Yards Football Sports Facility Capital Works Fund and the Camden Yards Football Sports Facility Emergency Repair Fund as special, nonlapsing funds to be administered by the Maryland Stadium Authority; providing that the purpose of the funds is to enable the Authority to pay all expenses related to capital improvements and repairs at the Camden Yards football sports facility; and requiring the transfer of certain amounts from a certain source into the funds.
bill_summary: The bill establishes two funds, the Camden Yards Football Sports Facility Capital Works Fund and the Camden Yards Football Sports Facility Emergency Repair Fund, to finance capital improvements, repairs, and emergency repairs at the Camden Yards football stadium. It allocates $5 million from the proceeds of bonds issued in 2023 to each of these funds.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority
stakeholders: Fans, local community, and government involved in the Camden Yards football stadium operations
innovative_summary: The program creates dedicated funds with specific purposes and financial management structures to support stadium maintenance and emergency repairs, which is a structured financial approach to stadium management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on stadium infrastructure.

Title: Maryland Protecting Opportunities and Regional Trade (PORT) Act
Synopsis: Establishing the Fallen Transportation Workers Scholarship Program and the Fallen Transportation Workers Scholarship Fund; authorizing the Secretary of Labor to exempt an individual from the requirement to be actively seeking work for unemployment insurance benefits eligibility; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor and the Department of Commerce to establish certain temporary relief programs to provide assistance to individuals and certain entities impacted by a certain closure of the Port of Baltimore; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Fallen Transportation Workers Scholarship Program and Fund to provide tuition assistance to dependents and spouses of transportation workers who died after January 1, 2022, and addresses relief efforts related to the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge impacting the Port of Baltimore. It also sets up temporary relief programs for individuals, businesses, and organizations affected by reduced operations at the Port, especially after the bridge collapse, and authorizes funding transfers and legal actions to recover damages.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Dependent or surviving spouses of fallen transportation workers, students, local businesses, and organizations impacted by reduced port operations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces targeted educational grants and coordinated temporary relief programs utilizing state and federal funds, with provisions for legal recovery and transparency, representing a comprehensive government response employing existing data-sharing and funding mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by providing educational opportunities and financial relief to families of transportation workers killed in the line of duty, thereby supporting household stability and income.

Title: Electricity and Gas - Retail Supply - Regulation and Consumer Protection
Synopsis: Altering a certain charge that may be assessed to a public service company; providing for the recovery of certain costs through rates; establishing an energy salesperson license for certain persons that offer or sell electricity supply agreements or gas supply agreements to customers in the State; establishing an energy vendor license for certain persons that provide energy sales services in the State; prohibiting a certain electricity supplier from marketing electricity as green power unless certain conditions are met; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's regulations for electric and gas utility providers, including licensing, consumer protections, marketing rules, green power standards, and the creation of a new division within the Public Service Commission to handle violations and complaints.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Electric and gas utility providers, consumers, renewable energy producers, and government regulators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specialized licensing and educational programs for energy salespersons and vendors, creates a new division within the PSC for enforcement, and establishes detailed standards for green power marketing, employing a comprehensive regulatory approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential for impact by enhancing consumer protection and transparency in energy markets, potentially reducing energy costs for vulnerable households.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Expungement - Vendor Contracts
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to include system upgrades required to allow for automated expungement of charges and partial expungement of charges in any vendor contracts being negotiated at a certain time.
bill_summary: The bill allows eligible individuals to file petitions for partial expungement of charges, even if other charges from the same incident are not eligible. It requires upgrades to the state's systems for automated partial expungement and restricts procurement related to the central repository and judicial case management systems to support these changes.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Individuals with criminal charges, legal system, public safety agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs new system upgrades and automation to streamline partial expungements, enhancing efficiency and access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce barriers for individuals with criminal records, which can positively impact their employment and economic stability, thus potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: Failure to Pay Rent Proceedings - Shielding of Court Records
Synopsis: Requiring the District Court to shield all court records within 60 days after the final resolution of a failure to pay rent proceeding that did not result in a judgment of possession; authorizing the District Court, on motion of a tenant, to shield all court records relating to a failure to pay rent proceeding that results in a judgment of possession under certain circumstances; requiring the Maryland Judiciary to develop and publish on its website a certain form; etc.
bill_summary: This bill limits landlords' ability to increase rent based solely on failure to pay rent judgments and implements procedures to shield court records related to failure to pay rent proceedings, particularly those that did not result in a judgment of possession, to protect tenants' records.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Tenants involved in failure to pay rent proceedings in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new mechanism for shielding court records related to failure to pay rent proceedings, including procedural forms and timelines, to protect tenants' records and reduce long-term adverse effects.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially reduces long-term barriers for tenants, which could help prevent or alleviate child poverty, especially among tenants facing eviction proceedings.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Board of License Commissioners
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor, rather than the Mayor and the President of the City Council of Baltimore City, to appoint the members of the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City with the advice and consent of the Senate; authorizing the Governor, rather than the Mayor and the President of the City Council of Baltimore City, to remove a member of the Board for certain infractions; requiring certain members of the Board to be residents of the City or to have served in City government for a minimum of 5 years immediately preceding the appointment; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms the appointment, removal, and operation of the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners, including changing the appointment authority from the Mayor and City Council President to the Governor, and sets residency and service requirements for certain officials and staff.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Department of Alcoholic Beverages and Cannabis or the Governor's Office
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore City, local government officials, businesses involved in alcohol licensing and sales
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a significant change in governance structure by centralizing appointment powers with the Governor and setting specific residency and service requirements, as well as aligning ethics and conflict of interest policies with state standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty, but improved local governance may contribute to broader community benefits.

Title: More Opportunities for Careerâ€“Focused Students Act of 2024
Synopsis: Requiring each public high school to inform students of certain employment and skills training opportunities in the same manner the school informs students of postsecondary educational options; requiring, when informing certain students about certain career opportunities, each public high school to highlight opportunities in high-skilled careers that do not require completion of a college degree and are in high demand; and requiring a county board to assist public high schools in completing the requirements of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill promotes career-focused education by recognizing vocational certificates, industry certifications, and apprenticeships as equivalent to postsecondary education. It requires high schools to inform students about employment and skills training opportunities and facilitates student information sharing with registered apprenticeship sponsors and employers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and local county school boards
stakeholders: Public high school students in Maryland, apprenticeship sponsors, employers, parents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a platform for students to authorize the release of their information to apprenticeship sponsors and employers, and emphasizes high-demand skilled careers without requiring college degrees, promoting an integrated career pathway approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by expanding access to high-demand skilled careers and vocational training.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - License Renewal
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to extend the deadline by which a holder of an alcoholic beverages license must file an application for renewal; and extending the expiration date for certain licenses issued by the Board to July 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners to extend renewal deadlines for alcoholic beverage licenses and to consider certain lapsed licenses unexpired until July 1, 2025, allowing renewal if fees are paid and requirements are met.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a flexible extension process for license renewal deadlines and conditions for renewing lapsed licenses, accommodating delays.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns license renewal procedures.

Title: Hospitals - Care of Infants After Discharge (Safe Sleep Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring a hospital to take certain actions relating to the care of infants as soon as practicable before the hospital discharges an infant after the birth of the infant, including providing oral and written educational resources to the parent or legal guardian on how to provide a safe sleep environment and providing a list of resources available for an infant's parent or legal guardian; requiring each hospital, by January 1, 2025, to establish a process for providing and confirming the receipt of the educational resources; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates a public awareness campaign and educational requirements for hospitals regarding safe sleep environments for infants. It establishes the Maryland Safe Sleep Certification Program for child care centers, hospitals, and birthing centers, and sets certification standards and evaluation protocols.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Infants, parents, guardians, child care providers, hospitals, birthing centers
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining education, certification, and public awareness strategies, including collaborations with various organizations and the use of media and educational materials.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child mortality related to unsafe sleep environments, indirectly impacting child poverty by improving health outcomes.

Title: Legally Protected Health Care - Gender-Affirming Treatment
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "legally protected health care" to include certain gender-affirming treatment, including medications and supplies, for the purposes of certain provisions of law that prohibit health occupations disciplinary actions and certain actions in criminal and civil proceedings and the use of certain resources in furtherance of certain investigations and proceedings related to legally protected health care.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland laws to include gender-affirming treatment within the definition of legally protected health care, ensuring protections against disciplinary actions, legal proceedings, and resource use related to such treatments. It also clarifies legal standards and restrictions related to gender-affirming care in various legal and professional contexts.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Health and relevant licensing boards
stakeholders: Transgender individuals receiving gender-affirming treatments, healthcare providers, legal and regulatory agencies, and related stakeholders
innovative_summary: The bill formalizes protections for gender-affirming treatments across legal, healthcare, and government processes, aligning Maryland laws with current clinical standards and safeguarding provider practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill mainly provides legal and professional protections for gender-affirming healthcare, with no direct focus on child poverty reduction.

Title: Office of the Correctional Ombudsman - Establishment and Funding
Synopsis: Establishing the Office of the Correctional Ombudsman; authorizing the Justice Reinvestment Oversight Board to make a recommendation for the distribution of money from the Performance Incentive Grant Fund to the Office for fiscal year 2025 only; requiring the Office to conduct investigations, reviews, and assessments of administrative acts taken by the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, by the Department of Juvenile Services, or in relation to individuals confined by either department; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Office of the Correctional Ombudsman within the Maryland Office of the Attorney General, assigns it investigative and oversight duties related to correctional facilities and juvenile justice facilities, creates an advisory board, and transfers staffing and funding from existing units. It mandates investigations, reviews, reports, and coordination with other agencies to improve transparency and accountability in correctional and juvenile detention systems.
responsible_party: Office of the Correctional Ombudsman, Maryland Attorney General
stakeholders: Individuals confined or under supervision in correctional and juvenile justice facilities, their families, correctional staff, juvenile justice staff, and the general public interested in correctional oversight.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive oversight model including investigations, site inspections, audits, and a newly established advisory board, leveraging transparency, collaboration, and conflict resolution, which represents a new approach to correctional oversight in Maryland.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving conditions and oversight in juvenile facilities, thus supporting child welfare and rights.

Title: Workgroup to Study Funding for the Westernport Wastewater Treatment Facility - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup to Study Funding for the Westernport Wastewater Treatment Facility to identify and examine existing funding sources that support the Facility and study whether increased funding could enhance operations at the Facility, the funding sources of comparable facilities in the region, and available and potential federal, State, and local funding sources for the Facility; and requiring the Workgroup to report, on or before December 1, 2024, its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a workgroup to study funding options for the Westernport Wastewater Treatment Facility, including current funding sources, potential improvements, and federal, state, or local funding opportunities. The workgroup will report its findings by December 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Westernport Wastewater Treatment Facility, Allegany County, regional water treatment stakeholders
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated workgroup to comprehensively study funding sources and potential improvements for a specific wastewater treatment facility, employing a collaborative and analytical approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, primarily focusing on infrastructure funding and regional public health.

Title: Teachers' Retirement and Pension Systems - Reemployment
Synopsis: Clarifying a certain exemption from a certain reemployment offset for retirees of the Teachers' Retirement System and Teachers' Pension System who are reemployed by a local school system under certain conditions; and providing for the retroactive application of the Act to certain retirees who were reemployed by the Harford County Board of Education.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies rules around reemployment of retirees from Maryland's Teachers' Retirement and Pension Systems, including the number of retirees that can be rehired and the conditions under which their retirement allowance is not reduced. It also retroactively applies to certain retirees reemployed after January 1, 2020.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Retired teachers from the Teachers' Retirement System and Teachers' Pension System, local school systems, and the Maryland School for the Deaf
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies and adjusts existing reemployment rules for retirees and does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly affecting retired teachers' reemployment rules.

Title: Qualifying Nonprofit Organizations - Training and Reentry Services - Funding
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $1,000,000 in the annual budget bill for fiscal years 2026 through 2028 to provide operating grants to certain qualifying nonprofit organizations for the purpose of providing training in automotive repair to incarcerated or formerly incarcerated individuals; and requiring the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to administer the grant funds.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland government to include a $1,000,000 annual appropriation from 2026 to 2028 in the budget to fund grants to nonprofit organizations that provide automotive repair training and reentry services to incarcerated and formerly incarcerated individuals, with a focus on employment outcomes.
responsible_party: Governorâ€™s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated and formerly incarcerated individuals, nonprofit organizations providing reentry services, automotive repair industry, and employment services.
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to improve employment outcomes for formerly incarcerated individuals through specific automotive repair training and certification programs, funded by government grants.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving employment opportunities for formerly incarcerated individuals, thereby increasing household incomes.

Title: Prince George's County - Public School Employees Property Tax Credit and Office of Integrity and Compliance PG 503-24
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Prince George's County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on dwellings that are owned by certain eligible employees of the Prince George's County Public School System; requiring the Prince George's County government to submit a certain report concerning the credit to certain persons on or before a certain date; providing that the Office of Integrity and Compliance is an independent unit within the school system; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to grant a property tax credit to eligible employees of the Prince George's County Public School System and establishes an Office of Integrity and Compliance within the school system to oversee integrity, accountability, and anti-fraud measures.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government and the Prince George's County Public School System
stakeholders: Employees of the Prince George's County Public School System, local government, and residents of Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an independent Office of Integrity and Compliance to oversee accountability within the school system, employing standard governmental oversight practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is limited as it focuses on accountability and tax credits for employees.

Title: State Procurement - Preferred Provider Requirements - Waiver
Synopsis: Authorizing the Pricing and Selection Committee for Preferred Providers to grant a waiver from a certain requirement to use a certain preferred provider for the procurement of supplies and services under certain circumstances; requiring the Committee to review a certain request for a certain waiver to the State or a State aided or controlled entity under certain circumstances; and requiring Maryland Correctional Enterprises to report the length of time between each order and delivery of supplies and services for each fiscal year.
bill_summary: The bill modifies procurement rules for Maryland state entities to allow waiver of mandatory use of certain preferred providers under specific circumstances, and establishes a committee to oversee and manage procurement from state-preferred providers, with a focus on employment of individuals with disabilities and oversight of such programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of General Services
stakeholders: State entities, Maryland Correctional Enterprises, individuals with disabilities, community service providers
innovative_summary: The program employs a specialized oversight committee, market verification processes, and a focus on employment opportunities for disabled individuals, integrating service provision with employment and procurement strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by promoting employment for individuals with disabilities and supporting community-based employment initiatives.

Title: Department of Aging - Caregiver Expense Grant Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Caregiver Expense Grant Program in the Department of Aging to award grants to certain caregivers for up to 30% of the qualified expenses that exceed $2,000 paid or incurred by the caregiver to provide care or support to certain qualified family members; and authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of up to $5,000,000 to the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Caregiver Expense Grant Program in Maryland's Department of Aging, providing grants to certain caregivers for qualified expenses paid or incurred in caring for qualified family members. It details the eligibility criteria, types of expenses covered, and the funding limits.
responsible_party: Department of Aging
stakeholders: Caregivers and their qualified family members in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a financial grant system to support caregivers using a tax credit and direct grants, potentially leveraging targeted financial assistance to improve caregiver support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program can directly support families in need of caregiving assistance, which may help reduce child and family poverty by alleviating financial burdens related to caregiving.

Title: University System of Maryland - Board of Regents - Membership
Synopsis: Requiring that certain appointing officials in making appointments to the Board of Regents of the University System of Maryland ensure that one member of the Board is a graduate of a historically Black college or university in the University System of Maryland; and applying the Act only after the next vacancy occurs on the Board of Regents after July 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires that when appointing members to the Board of Regents of the University System of Maryland, at least one member must be a graduate of a historically Black college or university in the system. It also outlines the composition and appointment process of the Board.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland
stakeholders: Members of the University System of Maryland, historically Black colleges and universities in Maryland, students, and the general public interested in higher education governance
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted diversity inclusion approach by requiring at least one member of the Board to be a graduate of an HBCU, which is a specific and intentional measure to promote representation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on improving governance and diversity in higher education may indirectly benefit child poverty by promoting equitable opportunities and inclusive policies.

Title: Economic Development â€“ Maryland Economic Development Commission â€“ Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain requirements relating to industry representation on the Maryland Economic Development Commission and the purpose of the Commission; repealing a requirement that the Office of International Trade make a certain report to the Commission; and repealing a requirement that the Maryland Tourism Development Board submit certain plans to the Commission.
bill_summary: The bill makes alterations to the Maryland Economic Development Commission by changing industry representation requirements, repealing some reporting requirements related to international trade and tourism, and clarifying the roles of the Commission and related entities. It also sets new program and reporting guidelines for agencies involved in economic development and tourism.
responsible_party: Maryland Economic Development Commission and associated state agencies
stakeholders: Businesses, industry sectors, and residents across Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates the structure and operations of the Maryland Economic Development Commission with emphasis on regional and industry diversity, strategic planning, and streamlined reporting, but does not introduce new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty is minimal, as the bill primarily focuses on governance and planning for economic development and tourism.

Title: Emergency Medical Services - Paramedics - Immunization Administration - Effective Date
Synopsis: Delaying the effective date to January 1, 2030, of certain provisions of law that repeal the authority of paramedics to administer influenza and COVID-19 immunizations under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill delays the revocation of paramedics' authority to administer influenza and COVID-19 immunizations, extending the effective date of the law from 2025 to 2030.
responsible_party: Maryland State EMS Board and related health departments
stakeholders: Paramedics, public health agencies, and adult individuals receiving immunizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly extends an existing authority without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Military Installation Council - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Military Installation Council to include the Maryland Secretary of Labor or a designee, the State Superintendent of Schools or a designee, and the President of the Military Alliance Council of Charles County; and increasing the number of members selected by the Governor from 5 to 6 and requiring that at least one is a spouse of a service member.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership structure of the Maryland Military Installation Council, including adding a new member who is a spouse of a service member, and clarifies appointment processes. It does not establish a new program or service.
responsible_party: Maryland Military Installation Council
stakeholders: Community members, military personnel, veterans, and military families in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill mainly updates membership rules for an existing council without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty; it focuses on military community representation.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Failure to Insure - Penalties
Synopsis: Increasing, from $10,000 to $25,000, the cap on penalties for an employer's failure to secure required workers' compensation insurance or comply with an order of the State Workers' Compensation Commission regarding an employer's failure to secure required workers' compensation insurance.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland laws concerning penalties for employers that fail to secure required workers' compensation insurance. It increases the maximum penalties to $25,000, clarifies procedures for hearings and enforcement, and makes corporate officers and LLC members liable if they knowingly fail to comply.
responsible_party: Maryland Workers' Compensation Commission
stakeholders: Employers, employees, and the Uninsured Employersâ€™ Fund in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates penalties and enforcement procedures under existing laws; it does not introduce new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct or immediate impact on child poverty.

Title: Senior Prescription Drug Assistance Program â€“ Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending to December 31, 2030, the termination date of the Senior Prescription Drug Assistance Program.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date of the Senior Prescription Drug Assistance Program in Maryland, ensuring it continues to provide subsidies for prescription drugs to eligible seniors enrolled in Medicare Part D, with a transition plan from an earlier program and a termination date set for December 31, 2030.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Medicare-eligible seniors in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a traditional subsidy approach based on federal guidelines and state funding, with a structured transition from an older program but does not employ new technology or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program targets seniors, some of whom may be at risk of poverty, and helps reduce their medication costs, potentially alleviating financial strain and impacting poverty indirectly.

Title: State Board of Environmental Health Specialists â€“ Quorum, Examination, and Apprenticeships
Synopsis: Clarifying that a quorum of the State Board of Environmental Health Specialists consists of a majority of appointed members; altering the circumstances under which an applicant for licensure is qualified to take the examination by adding completion of an apprenticeship approved by the Board as an alternative to obtaining experience in an environmental health specialist-in-training program; and authorizing the Board to approve an examination provider to administer the examination.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the composition of the State Board of Environmental Health Specialists, allows apprenticeships as an alternative to training programs for licensure, modifies examination administration procedures, and sets regulations for training programs and apprenticeships.
responsible_party: State Board of Environmental Health Specialists
stakeholders: Applicants seeking environmental health specialist licensure, environmental health professionals, and the public health system
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an apprenticeship program as an alternative pathway to licensure, which is a new approach compared to traditional training and experience requirements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has some potential to impact child poverty by ensuring better environmental health services, but direct effects are limited.

Title: Cemeteries - Burial-Transit Permits - Required Information
Synopsis: Requiring a person in charge of a cemetery to write on a burial-transit permit, the date of final disposition, the name and physical address of the cemetery, the burial, inurnment or scattering section and the lot and space number, or if the body or fetus was cremated and a certain authorizing agent takes control of the cremains, the name and address of the authorizing agent and the authorizing agent's relationship to the deceased or fetus.
bill_summary: The bill amends regulations related to burialâ€“transit permits, including what information a cemetery must record and how permits are used for final disposition, disinterment, and reinterment of human remains in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Cemeteries, funeral homes, and families involved in final disposition of human remains
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it mainly updates existing legal requirements and procedures for burial permits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is focused on procedural and regulatory updates without direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Occupational Safety and Health Advisory Board â€“ Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the Occupational Safety and Health Advisory Board in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to June 1, 2034, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the termination date of the Occupational Safety and Health Advisory Board to July 1, 2034, effectively continuing its operation.
responsible_party: Occupational Safety and Health Advisory Board
stakeholders: Workers and employers in Maryland concerned with occupational safety and health
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing advisory board's statutory lifespan; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Acupuncture Board â€“ Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Acupuncture Board in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date of the State Acupuncture Board in Maryland from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2030, thereby continuing its existence and authority.
responsible_party: Maryland State Acupuncture Board within the Department of Health
stakeholders: Acupuncturists and individuals seeking acupuncture services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends existing statutory authority without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2030.
responsible_party: Maryland Department (unspecified)
stakeholders: Residential child care professionals and children in residential care programs in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing board's authority; it does not introduce new programs or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns certification oversight.

Title: State Board of Dietetic Practice â€“ Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Dietetic Practice in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Dietetic Practice from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2028, and then further to July 1, 2030, ensuring the continuation of the Board's authority and regulation of dietetics in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Dietetic practitioners and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory board's sunset date; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Occupational Therapy Practice â€“ Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Occupational Therapy Practice in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date of the State Board of Occupational Therapy Practice from 2025 to 2028, and further to 2030, continuing its authority and functions.
responsible_party: State of Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Occupational therapists and the public receiving occupational therapy services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a standard legislative process to extend a regulatory board's authority, with no new technologies or novel approaches involved.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns the continuation of a regulatory board.

Title: State Board of Examiners in Optometry â€“ Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Examiners in Optometry in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Examiners in Optometry in Maryland, delaying its termination to July 1, 2030.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Health or Board of Examiners in Optometry
stakeholders: Optometrists, patients requiring eye care, and the general public seeking optometry services in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill employs a standard legislative practice of extending the operational period of a regulatory board, which is not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board of Examiners of Psychologists - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists from 2025 to 2028, with a further extension to 2030, ensuring the board's continued operation.
responsible_party: State of Maryland, Department of Health or related agency overseeing the board
stakeholders: Psychologists, mental health professionals, and the public seeking psychological services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily prolongs the existing regulatory structure without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or introduce targeted programs impacting child poverty.

Title: State Board of Social Work Examiners - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Social Work Examiners in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Board, by December 1, 2024, to report to certain committees of the General Assembly information from the preceding 6-month period on processing times for license issuance and renewal, complaint resolution times, and the rate of compliance with certain requirements.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Social Work Examiners to July 1, 2030, and requires the board to report on licensing and complaint resolution statistics to legislative committees.
responsible_party: State Board of Social Work Examiners
stakeholders: Social workers, licensing applicants, and consumers of social work services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly extends existing regulations and reporting requirements, with no new innovative approaches or technologies introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but supports the regulation of social workers, which may indirectly benefit vulnerable populations.

Title: State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists - Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee within the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2026, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Committee.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee within the Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists to July 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists
stakeholders: Behavior analysts, therapists, and related mental health professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly extends an existing advisory committee's sunset date without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Community Health Resources Commission â€“ Sunset Extension and Program Evaluation
Synopsis: Adding the Maryland Community Health Resources Commission to the governmental activities and units subject to the Maryland Program Evaluation Act; and extending the termination date to June 30, 2035, for certain provisions of law related to the Commission.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the Maryland Community Health Resources Commission from 2025 to 2035 and mandates an evaluation of the Commission by 2025 to assess its effectiveness in increasing access to healthcare through community resources.
responsible_party: Maryland Community Health Resources Commission within the Department of Health
stakeholders: Residents seeking access to healthcare and community health resources in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly extends an existing commission's operational period and mandates an evaluation, rather than establishing new programs or employing innovative technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential to impact child poverty through increased access to healthcare services for children and families, but direct impact is not explicitly specified.

Title: County Public Libraries - Minors, Children, and Teens - Prohibited Practices
Synopsis: Prohibiting a county public library from charging a fine for overdue library materials borrowed by a minor or intended for children or teens; prohibiting a county public library from charging a reserve fee for library materials reserved by a minor or intended for children or teens; prohibiting a county public library from prohibiting the borrowing of library materials by a minor or the borrowing of library materials intended for children or teens because of previous overdue library materials; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits Maryland county public libraries from charging fines, reserve fees, or replacement fees to minors for overdue or reserved library materials intended for children or teens. It also prevents libraries from restricting borrowing privileges of minors due to overdue materials and mandates fee waivers and refunds under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Public Library System or local library boards
stakeholders: Minors, children, and teens who borrow library materials and the public libraries serving them.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy of eliminating fines and fees for minors' overdue and reserved library materials, promoting more accessible library services for youth.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve access to educational and recreational resources for children and teens, which could help reduce barriers related to fines and fees.

Title: Public Safety - 9-1-1 Trust Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the 9-1-1 Trust Fund to authorize the use of certain allocated funds for the payment of the salary of certain personnel.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland 9â€“1â€“1 Trust Fund statutes to allow allocated funds to be used for paying the salaries of certain personnel involved in 9â€“1â€“1 services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety or designated authorities managing the 9â€“1â€“1 Trust Fund
stakeholders: Public safety answering points, emergency response personnel, and residents relying on 9â€“1â€“1 services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies funding rules for existing 9â€“1â€“1 system enhancements and operations, without creating new services or using innovative technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has low potential to directly impact child poverty as it focuses on operational and staffing funding for emergency services.

Title: Public Safety - Volunteer Company Assistance Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Transferring certain duties relating to the Volunteer Company Assistance Fund from the Military Department to the Maryland Department of Emergency Management.
bill_summary: The bill transfers responsibilities related to the Volunteer Company Assistance Fund from the Military Department to the Maryland Department of Emergency Management, and establishes reporting and oversight requirements for grants and loans made to volunteer emergency companies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Volunteer ambulance, fire, or rescue companies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces enhanced oversight and reporting requirements for grants and loans to volunteer emergency companies, but does not introduce new technology or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The programâ€™s impact on child poverty is likely minimal, as it mainly involves administrative oversight of grants and loans to emergency volunteer companies.

Title: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners, delaying its termination from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2028, and then further to July 1, 2030.
responsible_party: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners within the Department of Health
stakeholders: Physical therapists and related healthcare professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill mainly involves extending the existing sunset date for a licensing board and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Department of General Services - State Buildings and Facilities - Energy Conservation and Greenhouse Gas Emissions Reductions
Synopsis: Altering the State's goals for reducing energy consumption in State buildings; requiring the Maryland Green Building Council to update the High Performance Green Building Program to ensure that the Program aligns with certain greenhouse gas emissions reduction goals; requiring the Department of General Services to identify State-owned facilities that are potential candidates for energy performance contracts; etc.
bill_summary: The bill sets new energy efficiency and greenhouse gas emissions reduction goals for Maryland State buildings, updates green building programs to align with net-zero emissions goals by 2045, mandates audits and performance contracts, and requires annual reporting and implementation of energy-saving measures across state agencies.
responsible_party: Department of General Services in coordination with the Maryland Green Building Council, Maryland Energy Administration, and other state departments.
stakeholders: State agencies, employees, and occupants of state-owned buildings, as well as the general public through improved environmental sustainability.
innovative_summary: The program employs comprehensive audits, data tracking, and performance-based energy savings measures, integrating green building standards and greenhouse gas reduction goals, utilizing technology for data management and reporting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact on child poverty through the promotion of healthier, more sustainable public buildings and potential cost savings that can benefit public services.

Title: State Board of Barbers - Sunset Extension and Report
