Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Barbers in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2027, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2025, with information regarding the Board as determined by the Committee.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunsetting date of the State Board of Barbers from 2024 to 2027 and requires a report on the board to be submitted by the Maryland Department of Labor by July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Barbers and barbershop industry in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly makes administrative adjustments to the sunset date of an existing board and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal or no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board of Cosmetologists - Sunset Extension and Report
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Cosmetologists in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2027, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a certain report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Cosmetologists from 2024 to 2027, requiring a report from the Maryland Department of Labor by 2025 on the board's activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Cosmetologists and the public interested in cosmetology regulation
innovative_summary: This bill mainly extends an existing regulatory body and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Program - Enforcement
Synopsis: Altering the enforcement and after-the-fact application approval procedures required as minimum elements of a local jurisdiction's Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Program to apply to all critical area violations; repealing the 30-day waiting period with which the Chair of the Critical Area Commission for the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays must comply before referring certain enforcement matters to the Attorney General; and expanding the authority of the Attorney General to take certain equitable actions.
bill_summary: The bill updates enforcement procedures and the authority of the Attorney General regarding violations of the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Program, including expanding enforcement options and clarifying procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Attorney General and local jurisdictions responsible for implementing the Critical Area Program
stakeholders: Local governments, land developers, environmental protection agencies, residents within the critical areas
innovative_summary: The bill mainly clarifies enforcement procedures and expands enforcement authority; it does not introduce new technology or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions are focused on environmental enforcement and do not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Adult Protective Services - Review Boards - Membership and Terms
Synopsis: Altering provisions relating to the membership of, and the terms of members appointed to, adult public guardianship review boards.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the membership composition, appointment process, and terms of adult public guardianship review boards in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Family Law (implied as the overseeing body for adult protective services)
stakeholders: Adults under guardianship, review board members, and adult protective services.
innovative_summary: The bill mainly changes rules and structures for existing review boards; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Election Law - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the information that clerks of the circuit court for each county and administrative clerks for each District Court are required to report to the State Administrator of Elections to include the names and addresses, if available, of individuals convicted of a felony in the respective court and sentenced to imprisonment with commitment papers; requiring the State Board of Elections to adopt regulations establishing an appeals process regarding certain requests to use public buildings as early voting centers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes several revisions to Maryland's election laws, including requirements for reporting information about individuals convicted of felonies, rules for the use of public buildings as early voting centers including an appeals process for public officials, and changes to the roles incumbent candidates for party offices can hold within their central committees.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, public officials, political candidates, and local election authorities in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an appeals process for public officials regarding the availability of public buildings as early voting centers, involving multiple levels of review and public hearings, which is a structured approach to resolving disputes in election logistics.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on election procedures and does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State and Local Correctional Facilities - Operation of Unmanned Aircraft - Image Recording and Delivery of Contraband
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from intentionally operating an unmanned aircraft over a correctional facility to record images of the facility without the authorization of the managing official of the correctional facility or the Secretary of Public Safety and Correctional Services; prohibiting a person from using an unmanned aircraft to deliver contraband to a person detained or confined in a place of confinement; and requiring a correctional facility to post signage warning of the prohibitions in a visible area on the exterior of the property.
bill_summary: This bill bans the operation of unmanned aircraft over correctional facilities to record images or deliver contraband, and establishes penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: correctional facilities, inmates, general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs modern technology (unmanned aircraft) regulation to enhance security and operational integrity at correctional facilities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on correctional facility security measures.

Title: Notarial Acts - Protest Form Requirement - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement that a notary public use a certain protest form.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement that a notary public must use a specific protest form when performing certain notarial acts.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government (specifically the Comptroller's Office)
stakeholders: Notaries Public in Maryland and entities involved in notarial acts
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies existing legal requirements by removing the mandated protest form, streamlining notarial procedures without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is minimal as it mainly changes procedural requirements for notaries.

Title: Homeowners' Property Tax Credit - Application - Attestation of Gross Income
Synopsis: Authorizing an applicant for the homeowners' property tax credit to attest to gross income on an application in lieu of providing an income tax return to the State Department of Assessments and Taxation under certain circumstances; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes applicants for the Maryland homeowners' property tax credit to attest to their gross income on their application instead of providing an income tax return, under certain circumstances, to simplify the application process.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and the Comptroller of Maryland
stakeholders: Homeowners in Maryland applying for the property tax credit
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an innovative approach by allowing applicants to attest to their gross income instead of providing detailed income documentation, streamlining the application process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential to slightly reduce barriers for low-income homeowners in applying for property tax credits, which may indirectly aid child poverty.

Title: State Board of Individual Tax Preparers - Sunset Extension and Report
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Individual Tax Preparers in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2027, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a certain report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date of the State Board of Individual Tax Preparers from 2026 to 2027 and requires the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report on the board by July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Individuals involved in tax preparation and regulation in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill primarily involves extending an existing regulatory body and reporting requirements, with no new innovative technologies or approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, but may influence tax preparation services.

Title: State Department of Assessments and Taxation - Office of the Director - Administrative Expenses
Synopsis: Increasing from 5% to 15% the percentage of the administrative expenses of the Office of the Director of the State Department of Assessments and Taxation that the Department may pay from a certain fund.
bill_summary: This bill amends the law regarding the fund used by the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to increase the percentage of administrative expenses that can be paid from 5% to 15%. It clarifies the purpose of the fund and its management, and states the effective date as July 1, 2024.
responsible_party: State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Taxpayers and property owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches; it primarily adjusts existing fund usage limits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Certified Local Farm and Fish Program - Annual Waiver Reports - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the annual deadline, from July 31 to October 31, for the Office for the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program to submit to the Board of Public Works a report of waivers requested and waivers granted under the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program; and altering the annual deadline, from October 1 to December 31, for the Board of Public Works to submit to certain standing committees a copy of a record of information regarding any waivers requested under the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the deadlines and reporting requirements for the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program in Maryland, specifically changing the deadlines for waiver reports and record submissions from October 31 to December 31.
responsible_party: Office for the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program and Board of Public Works
stakeholders: Local farms, fish providers, Maryland state agencies, and stakeholders involved in procurement and local food sourcing
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates administrative deadlines and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly affects procurement reporting processes.

Title: State Government - Deputy Secretary of State - Title
Synopsis: Altering the title of the Assistant Secretary of State to be "Deputy Secretary of State".
bill_summary: The bill changes the title of the 'Assistant Secretary of State' to 'Deputy Secretary of State' and clarifies the responsibilities and delegation authority related to this position.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government and Secretary of State
stakeholders: State government officials and the Secretary of State's office
innovative_summary: The bill mainly clarifies titles and delegation rules within the state's government structure, which does not employ new technology or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty or related programs.

Title: Department of Planning - Inventory Responsibilities
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the Department of Planning prepare and periodically revise inventory lists of the natural resources of the State and certain public works and facilities.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the requirement for the Maryland Department of Planning to prepare and regularly update inventory lists of the state's natural resources and significant public works and facilities.
responsible_party: Department of Planning
stakeholders: State agencies and the general public interested in resource and infrastructure data
innovative_summary: This bill reduces the administrative duties of the Department of Planning and does not introduce new programs or innovations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board for Professional Land Surveyors - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board for Professional Land Surveyors in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2027, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a certain report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill extends the termination date of the State Board for Professional Land Surveyors to July 1, 2027, and requires the Maryland Department of Labor to report on the Board by July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Professional land surveyors and related industries in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly modifies sunset provisions and reporting requirements; it does not introduce new programs or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board for Professional Engineers - Engineer Members - Qualifications
Synopsis: Reducing from 12 to 10 the number of years that an engineer member of the State Board for Professional Engineers must have practiced engineering.
bill_summary: This bill reduces the required years of engineering practice for engineer members on the State Board for Professional Engineers from 12 to 5 years.
responsible_party: State Board for Professional Engineers in the Department of Maryland
stakeholders: Professional engineers and the public served by engineering oversight
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward change to qualification requirements, which is a standard regulatory update without new technology or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Electricians - Licensing - Penalties
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Electricians to impose a civil penalty of up to $5,000 instead of or in addition to reprimanding a licensee or suspending or revoking a license for certain violations; requiring the Board to consider certain factors to determine the amount of a penalty imposed under the Act; and requiring by October 1, 2024, the Board to submit to certain committees of the General Assembly a report, covering years 2018 through 2023, on the Board's practices and processes for the timely resolution of complaints against licensees.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Electricians to impose civil monetary penalties alongside or instead of traditional disciplinary actions for certain violations, requires the Board to consider specific factors in penalty amounts, and mandates a report on the Board's complaint resolution practices.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Electricians
stakeholders: Electricians licensed in Maryland and the public receiving electrical services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach allowing civil penalties for violations, which enhances regulatory flexibility and enforcement efficiency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's impact on child poverty is likely minimal as it primarily concerns licensing enforcement procedures.

Title: Coast Smart Council - Duties and Authority
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Coast Smart Council to include the development of eligibility criteria, standards, and procedures for categorical exemptions from the application of the Coast Smart requirements for proposed capital projects that have been designed to include adaptation and resiliency features to prevent or mitigate damage to the maximum extent practicable; and authorizing the Council to recommend certain regulations for adoption by the Secretary of Natural Resources.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the duties of the Coast Smart Council to include developing criteria and procedures for exemptions from certain requirements for projects that include adaptation and resiliency features for coastal flooding and sea level rise. It also allows the council to recommend regulations to implement these provisions.
responsible_party: Coast Smart Council
stakeholders: Projects related to coastal construction and infrastructure, local government agencies, environmental and climate change stakeholders, property owners in coastal areas
innovative_summary: This initiative introduces a structured approach for categorical exemptions from Coast Smart requirements for projects designed with adaptation and resiliency features, integrating climate change considerations into construction planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on climate resilience and coastal safety indirectly benefits vulnerable populations by reducing risks associated with flooding and coastal hazards.

Title: Natural Resources - Wildland Areas - Belt Woods Wildland
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources, with prior approval of the Maryland Historical Trust and after an internal departmental review, to authorize within the Belt Woods Wildland archeological inventories, studies, and research that involve surface examination or limited subsurface sampling, salvage and excavation of archeological sites, and stabilization and restoration of historic structures existing as of December 1, 1985; etc.
bill_summary: This bill designates the Belt Woods area in Prince George's County as a wildland area and establishes activities related to managing, restoring, and researching archaeological sites and historic structures within that area, as well as ecological management.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Ecologists, archeologists, historians, local community, and conservationists involved with Belt Woods
innovative_summary: The bill allows for archeological inventories, research, salvage, and restoration activities within a designated wildland area, which includes procedures for ecological management and heritage preservation, integrating ecological and archaeological conservation approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is focused on ecological and archaeological preservation, with no direct focus on child poverty.

Title: Aquaculture - Placement of Shellfish, Bags, Nets, and Structures on Submerged Aquatic Vegetation - Extension
Synopsis: Extending to June 30, 2027, the authorization of a leaseholder of certain aquaculture leases to, with prior written approval from the Department of Natural Resources, place shellfish, bags, nets, and structures on submerged aquatic vegetation, subject to certain requirements; and requiring, on or before June 1, 2025, and each June 1 for the next 2 years thereafter, the Department to report certain information to the Aquaculture Coordinating Council, the Chesapeake Bay Program, and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill extends the authority for aquaculture leaseholders in Maryland to place shellfish, bags, nets, and structures on submerged aquatic vegetation with prior approval from the Department of Natural Resources, and extends the duration of this authority until June 2027. It also requires the Department to report on the impacts of these activities on submerged vegetation and leaseholders over the next three years.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Aquaculture leaseholders, environmental conservation agencies, submerged aquatic vegetation in Maryland waters
innovative_summary: The program incorporates adaptive management and regular environmental reporting to balance aquaculture activities with conservation efforts, which is a relatively innovative approach to sustainable aquaculture management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on aquaculture regulation and environmental management.

Title: Aquaculture - Definition of Shellfish - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "shellfish" as it relates to certain provisions of law governing aquaculture to include live bivalves and bivalve shells.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to expand the definition of 'shellfish' in aquaculture regulations to include live mollusks, molluscan bivalves, and bivalve shells, and sets rules around importing shellfish from outside the state.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Aquaculture industry, shellfish farmers, environmental agencies
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal definitions and import rules regarding shellfish in aquaculture, without employing new technological approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly involves regulatory definitions and import rules for shellfish.

Title: Public Safety - Board of Boiler Rules - Membership, Sunset Extension, and Report
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Board of Boiler Rules to include a representative with at least 10 years of experience in constructing, installing, and repairing boilers and pressure vessels; extending the termination date for the Board to July 1, 2029; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a certain report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill extends the membership and the termination date of the Maryland Board of Boiler Rules, changes its membership composition, and requires the Department of Labor to submit a report about the Board.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Owners, users, manufacturers, insurers, engineers, and consumers of boilers and pressure vessels in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program mainly involves extending the existing board's term and composition and requiring a report; it does not involve new technology or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Department of Planning - State Repository and Clearinghouse for Federal and State Financial and Technical Assistance
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the Department of Planning serve as a repository and clearinghouse for information concerning federal and State grants, loans, and other financial and technical assistance; repealing a requirement that the Department adopt certain regulations and publish certain information in the Maryland Register; and altering a requirement that the Department publish certain information concerning State financial and technical assistance offered through State assistance programs.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain requirements for the Maryland Department of Planning to serve as a repository and publisher of information regarding federal and State grants, loans, and technical assistance, and modifies how the State publishes information on financial assistance programs.
responsible_party: Department of Planning
stakeholders: State government agencies and entities seeking information on financial assistance programs
innovative_summary: The bill streamlines the process by removing the Department of Planning's role as a central repository and publisher of financial assistance information, focusing instead on public online accessibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty but may improve access to funds and assistance for programs that benefit children and families.

Title: Property Tax - Credit for Hotel or Residential Development Projects
Synopsis: AuthorizingÂ the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant, by law, a tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is used for certain hotel or residential development projects; and altering eligibility for a certain property tax credit in Wicomico County against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is used for certain hotel or residential development projects.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local governments in Maryland to grant property tax credits for hotel and residential development projects that are new, rehabilitated, or revitalized, with specific eligibility criteria such as project size and affordability requirements.
responsible_party: Local governments in Maryland (Baltimore City, counties, and municipal corporations)
stakeholders: Developers of hotel and residential projects, local communities, affordable housing populations
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a flexible, local-option property tax credit program for urban development projects, incentivizing revitalization and affordable housing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by promoting affordable housing and urban revitalization.

Title: Transportation - Vision Zero - Implementation
Synopsis: Establishing certain standards and requirements for implementing the Vision Zero program under the Maryland Department of Transportation.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Vision Zero program within the Maryland Department of Transportation aimed at reducing vehicle-related deaths and injuries to zero by 2030. It creates standards for implementing the program, designates a coordinator, forms an advisory commission, mandates quarterly public meetings, and requires annual progress reports.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Drivers, bicyclists, pedestrians, local and state transportation agencies, law enforcement, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs data-driven strategies and public engagement through quarterly meetings and transparency measures such as live streaming and recording meetings, which utilizes modern technology to improve government accountability and traffic safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's primary focus on traffic safety and reducing fatalities can indirectly benefit low-income communities by making roads safer, potentially reducing injuries and fatalities among vulnerable populations.

Title: Budget Bill (Fiscal Year 2025)
Synopsis: Making the proposed appropriations contained in the State Budget for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2025, in accordance with Article III, Section 52 of the Maryland Constitution; etc.
bill_summary: The bill is an appropriations act that allocates funds for various state agencies, programs, and capital projects for fiscal years 2024 and 2025, with specific provisions for grants, reimbursements, infrastructure, and operational expenses across numerous departments and initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management; Maryland Department of Transportation; Maryland Department of Health; various other state agencies and commissions
stakeholders: State government agencies, public institutions of higher education, local governments, nonprofit organizations, businesses, and Maryland residents benefiting from public programs and infrastructure.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily allocates funds and makes policy adjustments; it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill allocates funds to programs that may impact child welfare, education, and community development, but it does not establish new direct interventions targeting child poverty.

Title: Creation of a State Debt - Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2024, and the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023
Synopsis: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $1,845,046,000, the proceeds to be used for certain necessary building, construction, demolition, planning, renovation, conversion, replacement, and capital equipment purchases of the State, for acquiring certain real estate in connection therewith, and for grants to certain subdivisions and other organizations for certain development and improvement purposes, subject to certain matching fund requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes multiple series of bonds and loans for Maryland's capital projects, including infrastructure, educational, health, and community development projects across various counties and cities, with specific allocations for each project.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Public Works and Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Maryland residents, local governments, educational institutions, health facilities, community organizations, and infrastructure projects
innovative_summary: The bill primarily focuses on the issuance and management of bonds and funding allocations, with standard procedures and oversight, not employing new technologies or radically new approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: While the bill funds projects that could indirectly impact child poverty through education, health, and community improvements, it does not directly target child poverty eradication.

Title: Budget Reconciliation and Financing Act of 2024
Synopsis: Altering or repealing certain required appropriations; authorizing the use of certain funds for certain purposes; altering, from December 1, 2024, to January 15, 2027, the date by which the Accountability and Implementation Board has to conduct and submit a certain independent evaluation; altering the sales and use tax rate on certain electronic smoking devices; repealing a certain small business relief tax credit; requiring interest earnings for certain special funds to accrue to the General Fund of the State during certain fiscal years; etc.
bill_summary: This bill is a comprehensive annual budget and finance law that makes numerous changes to appropriations, revenue allocations, and funding mechanisms across various state programs, including education, transportation, health, and public safety initiatives. It adjusts funding levels, sets new program requirements, and authorizes transfers and allocations of funds for specific projects and agencies.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, including departments such as Education, Transportation, Health, Public Safety, and others involved in the specified programs.
stakeholders: State agencies, local governments, schools, healthcare providers, trauma centers, transportation agencies, and residents of Maryland benefiting from the targeted programs and services.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a broad range of innovative approaches including new funding allocations for behavioral health, trauma care, transportation enhancements, and programs supporting low-income communities, along with implementing new revenue streams like impact fees and adjusting interest allocations for state funds.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to impact child poverty by funding early childhood education, behavioral health supports, and other social programs directly benefiting children and low-income families.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Military Service Credit - Eligibility
Synopsis: Repealing a limitation for members of the State Retirement and Pension System to receive certain service credit for active duty with the commissioned corps of the Public Health Service, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, or the Coast and Geodetic Survey.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a restriction that prevented members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System from earning service credit for active duty with certain federal services, including the Public Health Service, NOAA, or the Coast and Geodetic Survey.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System who have military service with the specified federal agencies
innovative_summary: The bill removes a legal barrier to earning pension service credit for certain types of federal military-related service, updating existing laws to recognize more types of service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Personal Care Aides - Wage Reports
Synopsis: Requiring residential service agencies to submit certain reports to the Maryland Department of Labor regarding wage rates for personal care aides by September 1 each year, beginning in 2025; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to report to the Senate Finance Committee and the House Health and Government Operations Committee by the 180th day after the release of the final federal Ensuring Access to Medicaid Services rule on an overview of the final rule and plans or steps that the Department will take to operationalize the rule.
bill_summary: The bill requires residential service agencies to report wage data for personal care aides to the Maryland Department of Labor and mandates the Department of Health to report on Medicaid reimbursement rates and related regulations, including an overview of the federal rule on Medicaid services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Personal care aides, residential service agencies, Medicaid recipients, policymakers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a systematic data collection and reporting process for wage and reimbursement data, along with analysis of federal Medicaid rules, with potential use of state and federal data in policymaking.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by influencing wages and Medicaid services that benefit vulnerable populations.

Title: State Contracts - Prohibited Provisions
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain provisions from being included in State contracts; specifying that certain provisions are void if included in a State contract; specifying the applicable law and interpretation of State contracts; exempting a State contract relating to the purchase, redevelopment, or operation of a racing facility or training facility site from the prohibitions; and applying the Act prospectively to State contracts executed on or after October 1, 2024, and to the renewal or extension of a State contract on or after October 1, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits certain provisions from being included in Maryland state contracts, declares those provisions void if included, and specifies rules for interpreting state contracts, with some exceptions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of General Services or relevant state procurement agency
stakeholders: Maryland state government and contractors involved in state contracts
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal framework to prevent certain unfavorable provisions in state contracts, ensuring contracts adhere to state law and policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on legal provisions in state contracts.

Title: Higher Education - University of Maryland School of Medicine and MPowering Joint Steering Council - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include $5,000,000 in the annual budget for the University of Maryland School of Medicine to provide clinical care at the University of Maryland Capital Region Medical Center; and requiring the Governor to include in the budget for the the MPowering Joint Steering Council to use exclusively on the University of Maryland Institute for Health Computing appropriations of $1,500,000 in fiscal year 2026, $3,000,000 in fiscal year 2027, $4,500,000 in fiscal year 2028, and $6,000,000 in fiscal year 2029 and after.
bill_summary: The bill allocates state funding to support the University of Maryland School of Medicine's clinical care at the Capital Region Medical Center and establishes funding for the MPowering Joint Steering Council's initiatives, including new funding for the University of Maryland Institute for Health Computing.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Governor and the Maryland State Budget Office
stakeholders: University of Maryland students, faculty, healthcare providers, and the general public benefitting from improved medical services and health computing innovations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces significant dedicated funding for advanced health computing and collaborative academic programs, indicating a focus on innovative healthcare technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program potentially impacts child poverty by improving healthcare services and workforce development which can indirectly benefit children in the community.

Title: Task Force to Study Crime Classification - Renaming, Membership, and Duties
Synopsis:
Extending the Task Force to Study Crime Classification and renaming it to be the Task Force to Study Crime Reclassification and Penalties; requiring the Task Force to study the penalties for crimes and civil offenses under State law, the potential need for reclassification of certain crimes, the alteration of penalties, and whether certain changes should be made to crimes lacking an explicit mens rea; and
requiring the Task Force to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill expands and renames an existing Task Force to study the reclassification of crimes and their penalties. It changes the members, duties, and focus of the Task Force to review penalties, reclassify crimes, and assess the need for changes to criminal law statutes, with a report due by the end of 2025.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Legal system, criminal offenders, victims, the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive review process with a focus on reclassification and penalties, potentially utilizing data analysis for law reform.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty through criminal justice reforms that may reduce incarceration or improve legal protections.

Title: Catalytic Revitalization Project Tax Credit - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the amount of a certain credit against the State income tax that certain persons may claim for certain construction and rehabilitation costs for certain catalytic revitalization projects in the State; repealing a certain limitation on the number of initial tax credit certificates the Secretary of Housing and Community Development may award within a 2-year period; prohibiting the Secretary from revoking a tax credit certificate awarded on or before July 1, 2024, except under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the rules and funding limits for the Maryland Catalytic Revitalization Project Tax Credit, including changes to the amount of credit, issuance procedures, and application limits, as well as regulations for project approvals.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Individuals, nonprofit organizations, and business entities involved in catalytic revitalization projects in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates existing tax credit rules; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on revitalization projects and tax credits, with indirect potential impacts on communities, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Correctional Training Commission - Membership - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Correctional Training Commission; requiring certain members of the Commission appointed by the Governor to represent certain geographic regions; etc.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership structure of the Maryland Correctional Training Commission by requiring certain members appointed by the Governor to represent specific geographic regions of the state.
responsible_party: Maryland Correctional Training Commission
stakeholders: Correctional officers, correctional facilities, and local correctional jurisdictions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill's approach to regional representation in a correctional training commission is a straightforward governance change with no new technology or novel methods involved.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or have a direct impact on it.

Title: Election Administration - State Administrator, Local Boards, and Election Directors
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections to evaluate the performance of the State Administrator of Elections; requiring the State Administrator to provide a performance evaluation of the election director of each local board of elections to the local board; requiring each local board to confer with the State Administrator in appointing an election director, maintain a warehouse, and provide for early voting center expenses; requiring, rather than authorizing, election directors to take certain actions; etc.
bill_summary: The bill restructures election administration in Maryland by establishing evaluation and oversight procedures for the State Administrator of Elections, clarifying roles and responsibilities of local election boards and directors, including appointment processes, and setting annual performance evaluations for the State Administrator and local election directors.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters and election officials in Maryland, including local election boards and the State Board of Elections
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal performance evaluation process for the State Administrator and local election directors, and emphasizes the use of technology and cybersecurity in election management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on election administration improvements is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Seed Community Development Anchor Institution Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Expanding the purpose and use of the Seed Community Development Anchor Institution Fund administered by the Department of Housing and Community Development to include providing grants and loans to anchor institutions for a certain purpose in sustainable communities; and repealing a requirement that certain matching funds be from a private source.
bill_summary: The bill expands the use and purpose of the Seed Community Development Anchor Institution Fund to include providing grants and loans to anchor institutions for community development projects in sustainable communities and blighted areas, and makes technical updates to definitions and procedures related to sustainable communities.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Anchor institutions, residents of sustainable communities and blighted areas in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates a focus on designated sustainable communities and blighted areas, encouraging coordinated community development efforts and supporting local reinvestment, which represents an innovative approach to targeted economic and community development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce child poverty by supporting community development and revitalization in underserved areas, thereby improving living conditions and opportunities.

Title: Real Property - Recordation - Procedures
Synopsis: Requiring a county treasurer, tax collector, or director of finance to provide a certificate enumerating certain taxes, assessments, and charges against a property and to establish certain procedures to facilitate the issuance of a certificate; requiring a collecting agent presented with a certificate to endorse a deed on payment of transfer and recordation taxes and all charges stated in the certificate and establishing that this endorsement is sufficient authority for a transfer on the assessment books; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates procedures related to the recording of real estate transactions in Maryland, including the requirement for counties to issue certificates of taxes owed, the endorsement of deeds after tax payments, and the facilitation of electronic document processing and tax payments.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation, Clerk of the Circuit Court, and county treasurers, tax collectors, or directors of finance
stakeholders: Property owners, buyers, real estate professionals, county tax authorities, and government agencies involved in property transfers in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches by requiring the electronic processing of documents and payments, and coordinating between multiple agencies to streamline real estate transaction procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a low potential for direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses administrative procedures for property recording.

Title: Garrett County Alcoholic Beverages Act of 2024
Synopsis: Establishing a resort beer license, a resort beer and wine license, and a beer, wine, and liquor festival license in Garrett County; altering the hours of sale for alcoholic beverages on Sundays for certain licenses; altering the residency requirements for certain applicants for an alcoholic beverages license in the county to require that at least one of the applicants be a resident of the State; prohibiting alcoholic beverages from being brought into places of adult entertainment and consumed or transferred; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new alcohol licensing options, authorized festival permits, and revised rules for alcohol sales hours in Garrett County. It also sets penalties for bringing alcohol into adult entertainment venues.
responsible_party: Garrett County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants, festival organizers, and residents of Garrett County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specialized resort and festival alcohol licenses, allowing for large-scale events and business-specific licensing, which employs innovative licensing approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not explicitly target child poverty, but facilitates alcohol sales and events that could indirectly impact community well-being.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Protestant Episcopal Church, Diocese of Washington
Synopsis: Repealing uncodified provisions of law relating to the Protestant Episcopal Church, Diocese of Washington, commonly known as the "Vestry Act"; and providing for the governance of religious corporations in union with the Protestant Episcopal Church, Diocese of Washington.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for religious corporations in Maryland that are in union with the Protestant Episcopal Church in the Diocese of Washington, including recognition and governance structures, and repeals previous laws and reports on property held in trust by the United Methodist Church.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Religious organizations in Maryland, particularly those in union with the Protestant Episcopal Church and the United Methodist Church
innovative_summary: The bill modernizes the governance and legal recognition of religious corporations and involves state agencies in recording and certifying church property, employing legal and administrative updates rather than new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Community Health and Safety Works Grant Program and Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Community Health and Safety Works Grant Program in the Department of Housing and Community Development to support certain eligible projects that improve the quality of life within and economic potential of Maryland communities by making targeted investments in crime prevention strategies to address certain concerns in certain areas; establishing the Community Health and Safety Works Grant Program Fund to provide financial assistance in the form of grants under the provisions of the Program for eligible projects; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Community Health and Safety Works Grant Program in Maryland, creating a dedicated fund to provide grants for projects aimed at improving public safety, enhancing community spaces, and reducing crime and violence through targeted investments.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Maryland communities, residents, local organizations, law enforcement, and vulnerable populations affected by violence or crime
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, multi-faceted approach to community safety by integrating physical improvements, technology, and violence prevention strategies with dedicated funding and collaboration with public agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to significantly reduce child exposure to violence and improve neighborhood safety, thus helping to diminish child poverty indirectly.

Title: Education - State Library Resource Center - Funding
Synopsis: Altering the calculation of certain funding for the State Library Resource Center for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter.
bill_summary: The bill adjusts the calculation of funding for the State Library Resource Center, increasing the per resident funding amounts for fiscal years 2024 through 2031 and beyond.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education or relevant library authority (not explicitly specified in the text)
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland who use the State Library Resource Center
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves updating funding formulas and does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Family Law - Victims of Domestic Violence Program - Certification and Grant Fund
Synopsis: Requiring a victims of domestic violence program to be certified by the federally recognized State domestic violence coalition as a comprehensive domestic violence program; establishing the Victims of Domestic Violence Program Grant Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund in the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services;  requiring interest earnings of the Fund to be credited to the Fund; and authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a program to assist victims of domestic violence and their children across Maryland, requiring certification of the program by a federally recognized coalition, and creates a grant fund to support these programs.
responsible_party: Governorâ€™s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Victims of domestic violence and their children in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a certification requirement for domestic violence programs and creates a dedicated grant fund, integrating certification and funding but not employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact as it provides support services directly to victims and their children, who are often at risk of poverty.

Title: Commission to Study African American Civil War Soldiers in Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Study African American Civil War Soldiers in Maryland to study the history of the African American soldiers who fought for the Union Army in Maryland and to make findings and recommendations regarding the funding, design, construction, and location of an appropriate memorial dedicated to the African American Civil War soldiers; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Commission to Study African American Civil War Soldiers in Maryland to research their history and recommend the creation of memorials to honor them, with a report due by December 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans Affairs, in coordination with multiple Maryland state agencies and organizations
stakeholders: African American Civil War soldiers and Maryland residents interested in history and memorials
innovative_summary: This program employs historical research and inter-agency collaboration to recognize and memorialize African American Civil War soldiers, integrating cultural, historical, and memorial initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The programâ€™s focus on historical recognition and memorialization has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Courts - Prohibited Liability Agreements - Recreational Facilities
Synopsis: Establishing that a provision in a contract or agreement relating to the use of a recreational facility that purports to limit the recreational facility's liability, or release the recreational facility from or indemnify or hold harmless the recreational facility against liability, for injury caused by or resulting from the negligence or other wrongful acts of the recreational facility or its agents or on-duty employees is void and unenforceable under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill makes agreements that try to limit a recreational facility's liability for injuries caused by negligence or wrongful acts void and unenforceable, and protects the public from waivers that reduce recreational safety.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and legislative agencies implementing the new liability regulations
stakeholders: Public using recreational facilities, recreational facility operators, legal and insurance industries
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal approach to prohibit liability waivers in recreational settings, reinforcing existing safety and liability standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Criminal Law - Private Home Detention Monitoring - Notification
Synopsis: Requiring a private home detention monitoring agency to notify the court within 24 hours after a defendant subject to home monitoring as a condition of pretrial release has violated a condition of home detention monitoring; requiring a private home detention monitoring agency to notify the Division of Parole and Probation within 1 hour after an individual subject to home monitoring as a condition of probation violated a condition of home detention monitoring; etc.
bill_summary: This bill enhances the notification requirements for private home detention monitoring agencies, requiring them to report violations such as absences, tampering with monitoring equipment, or entering prohibited areas within specific timeframes to the courts and the Division of Parole and Probation. It also authorizes civil penalties for non-compliance and establishes a workgroup to examine licensing, regulation, and oversight processes for home monitoring in Maryland.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals under private home detention monitoring, law enforcement, courts, and oversight agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs enhanced tracking and reporting technologies for monitoring individuals and establishes a dedicated workgroup to recommend streamlined oversight processes, reflecting a modern approach to home detention management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by ensuring better management of detention and monitoring, which could improve family stability.

Title: Certificate of Public Convenience and Necessity and Related Approvals - Definition of Generating Station (Critical Infrastructure Streamlining Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Altering and establishing the definition of "generating station" for the purpose of exempting the construction of certain generating facilities used to produce electricity for the purpose of on-site emergency backup and certain test and maintenance operations from the requirement to obtain a certificate of public convenience and necessity or certain other related approvals under certain circumstances; and altering the distribution of income tax revenue from corporations that is attributable to certain data centers.
bill_summary: The bill redefines 'generating station' to exempt certain small and emergency backup electricity facilities from needing certificates, establishes reporting and oversight requirements for emergency backup generators at critical infrastructure sites, and adjusts the distribution of tax revenue from data centers to fund energy programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Operators of emergency backup power systems, critical infrastructure facilities, data centers, and the general public benefiting from enhanced energy security and infrastructure resilience.
innovative_summary: The bill employs enhanced reporting requirements and targeted tax revenue allocation to promote energy resilience and innovation in backup generation technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may contribute indirectly through improved infrastructure and energy stability.

Title: Families Serve Act of 2024
Synopsis: Authorizing employers to grant a preference in hiring and promotion to spouses of eligible service members; and requiring the appointing authorities in the Executive Branch of State government to apply a credit of 10 points on any selection test for eligible spouses and veterans of certain uniformed services.
bill_summary: The Families Serve Act of 2024 authorizes additional hiring and promotion preferences for military spouses, veterans, and related individuals, including applying a points-based credit on some employment tests and providing hiring preferences.
responsible_party: Maryland state government agencies and departments responsible for employment and human resources
stakeholders: Military spouses, veterans, and military service members in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a points-based preference system and legal allowances for hiring preferences for military families, which are standard practices rather than employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially improve economic stability for military families, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Governor's Office for Children - Engaging Neighborhoods, Organizations, Unions, Governments, and Households (ENOUGH) Grant Program (ENOUGH Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Establishing the Governor's Office for Children and the Special Secretary of the Governor's Office for Children as the head of the Office; requiring the Special Secretary to chair the Children's Cabinet; requiring the Office to staff the Children's Cabinet; requiring the Children's Cabinet to meet not less than four times each year; requiring the Accountability and Implementation Board, in consultation with certain departments, to submit a certain recommendation to the General Assembly by December 1, 2025; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the ENOUGH grant program to fund place-based strategies aimed at reducing child poverty and improving outcomes for children and families in Maryland. It sets up a dedicated grant fund, requires program evaluations, and involves community engagement.
responsible_party: Governorâ€™s Office for Children
stakeholders: Children, youth, and families in high-poverty neighborhoods in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a place-based, community-driven approach, leveraging partnerships across sectors and creating a centralized database for resources, which is a relatively innovative approach to addressing child poverty.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by funding community-driven strategies that target high-poverty neighborhoods.

Title: Education - Child Care Career and Professional Development Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for an award from the Child Care Career and Professional Development Fund to include a service obligation to work in an approved child care setting for at least 20 hours per week; requiring the Office of Child Care to prioritize grant awards to certain applicants; requiring award recipients who do not perform the service obligation to repay certain award funding except under certain circumstances; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the qualifications and conditions for awards from the Maryland Child Care Career and Professional Development Fund, including adding a service obligation for recipients and clarifying repayment conditions if the service obligation is not fulfilled.
responsible_party: Office of Child Care
stakeholders: Child care workers, prospective students in early childhood education, and child care providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates eligibility criteria and service obligations for existing grant programs, without implementing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve workforce stability and quality in child care, which can contribute to reducing child poverty indirectly.

Title: General Assembly - Committee Chairs and Vice Chairs - Gender-Neutral Language
Synopsis: Altering certain terminology that refers to chairs and vice chairs of committees of the General Assembly to be gender-neutral.
bill_summary: This bill alters the terminology used to refer to chairs and vice chairs of committees of the Maryland General Assembly to be gender-neutral.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland General Assembly and the legislative process
innovative_summary: The bill employs gender-neutral language in official titles within the legislative process, which is a language and policy update rather than a technological or innovative service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact programs or policies related to child poverty; it mainly updates language.

Title: Cecil County â€“ Annual Financial Report â€“ Filing Date
Synopsis: Altering the date by which Cecil County is required to file a certain financial report with the Department of Legislative Services.
bill_summary: The bill amends the deadline for Cecil County to file its annual financial report with the Maryland Department of Legislative Services, changing it from October 31 to December 31 starting in 2024.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Cecil County and Maryland state agencies that receive financial reports from counties
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates reporting deadlines; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Commercial Law â€“ Consumer Protection â€“ Sale and Resale of Tickets
Synopsis: Requiring the listing for a ticket and each step of a transaction to purchase a ticket to disclose certain information, including the total price of the ticket; repealing the exceptions to the prohibition against a reseller selling or offering to sell speculative tickets; prohibiting a secondary ticket exchange from providing a marketplace for the resale of a ticket that violates the Act; and requiring a ticket issuer, secondary ticket exchange, or reseller to provide a refund under certain conditions.
bill_summary: The bill regulates the sale and resale of tickets in Maryland, requiring disclosure of complete transaction details, limiting resale prices, and prohibiting restrictive transfer practices. It establishes rules for secondary ticket exchanges, mandates refunds under certain conditions, and directs a review of the ticket market.
responsible_party: Consumer Protection Division of the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Consumers purchasing tickets for entertainment events in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs technological regulations for ticket resales, requiring transparent disclosures, price limits, and banning certain restrictions to protect consumers in the digital resale market.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential for a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Real Estate Brokers - Brokerage Agreements - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring items to be included in a brokerage agreement between a real estate broker and a seller or lessor or a buyer or lessee.
bill_summary: The bill updates the requirements for brokerage agreements between real estate brokers and clients (sellers, buyers, lessors, lessees). It specifies what must be included in these agreements, such as termination dates, compensation details, and cancellation provisions, and clarifies the duties of licensees after termination.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Commission or Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation
stakeholders: Real estate brokers, sellers, buyers, lessors, and lessees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly clarifies and updates legal and contractual requirements for real estate brokerage agreements, rather than introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily addresses legal standards for real estate agreements.

Title: Procurement â€“ Construction Contingency Fund
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the Secretaries of Budget and Management and General Services may request the Board of Public Works to authorize a certain expenditure from the Construction Contingency Fund to include consideration of price adjustments for material price fluctuations of identified eligible project-specific materials.
bill_summary: The bill allows the Maryland state government to include a clause in construction contracts that permits contract modifications when there are substantial fluctuations in the price of materials, up to 10%, due to factors like delays, hazardous conditions, or force majeure events such as pandemics.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of General Services and the Maryland State Board of Public Works
stakeholders: State construction contractors and public infrastructure projects
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a provision for contract modifications based on material price fluctuations, including pandemic-related events, which is a new approach to managing construction costs during unforeseen circumstances.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by enabling more flexible and efficient management of public construction projects, possibly leading to cost savings or project improvements.

Title: Real Estate Brokers - Licensing - License Renewals and Continuing Education
Synopsis: Repealing certain processes regarding the expiration of certain licenses for real estate brokers, associate real estate brokers, and real estate salespersons; requiring that certain licenses expire on a staggered basis; modifying and setting certain time frames for certain processes regarding the expiration of certain licenses; authorizing the State Real Estate Commission to set a certain fee under certain circumstances; altering certain regulatory requirements for conducting certain continuing education courses; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates licensing and continuing education rules for real estate professionals in Maryland. It modifies license expiration dates, updating renewal procedures and deadlines, sets the license expiration to be staggered, and clarifies continuing education requirements and course delivery methods.
responsible_party: Maryland State Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate brokers, associate brokers, salespersons, and the general public seeking real estate services in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates modern technology by allowing remote and online continuing education courses, and streamlines the process for course submission and verification.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Primary and Secondary Education - Breakfast and Lunch Programs - Universal Expansion Report
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education, on or before December 1, 2024, to report to the General Assembly on a cost estimate for providing free breakfast and lunch to all students in public schools in the State; and requiring the Department, as part of its report, to compile research completed in other states that have established universal meal programs and prepare a summary of any findings presented in those reports.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that starting in fiscal year 2026, all public school students in Maryland must be offered free breakfast and lunch if their school participates in federal nutrition programs, and it requires the State to report on the costs of providing free meals to all students. It also sets reimbursement rates and prohibits schools from charging students for these meals going forward.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach to offer free meals to all students, integrating federal and state programs, and explores the costs and benefits of universal meal provision. It also involves research on model programs in other states.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly reduce child poverty by eliminating meal costs and improving nutrition for students in need.

Title: Sales and Use Tax - Nonprofit Organizations Maintaining Memorials - Exemption
Synopsis: Providing that the sales and use tax does not apply to a sale by a nonprofit organization that maintains a memorial on property that is owned by the State if the proceeds of the sale are used to maintain a memorial on property that is owned by the State.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain nonprofit organizations from sales and use tax when they sell items on property owned by the State, provided the proceeds are used to maintain a memorial on State property.
responsible_party: State of Maryland tax authorities or Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations maintaining memorials on state-owned property, state government, and potentially the public benefiting from memorials
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific tax exemption for nonprofit organizations maintaining memorials on State property, which is a targeted policy adjustment rather than a novel technological approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily pertains to nonprofit organizations maintaining memorials on State property.

Title: Public School Construction Program - Maryland School for the Blind - State and Local Cost-Share
Synopsis: Altering the State and local cost-share formula for the Public School Construction Program for the Maryland School for the Blind to set the State share at 100%.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a program allowing the Maryland School for the Blind to access funds from a state school construction loan fund, which previously did not include specialized schools. It also sets funding amounts for the fund over several years and clarifies the role of the Interagency Commission in administering and prioritizing loans.
responsible_party: Interagency Commission and Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: The Maryland School for the Blind, local governments, and school systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a dedicated funding pathway for specialized schools like the Maryland School for the Blind within an existing school construction loan system, incorporating targeted priority and eligibility criteria.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting the development of specialized educational facilities that can improve educational access and quality.

Title: Procurement - Minority Business Participation - Real Property Title Insurance Services Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring certain reporting relating to minority business participation in State procurement by industry type to include real property title insurance services, including commercial real property title insurance services; and prohibiting the Special Secretary for the Governor's Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs from waiving a certain reporting requirement related to real property title insurance services.
bill_summary: The bill requires reporting by Maryland state agencies on minority business participation in procurement, including a new category for real property title insurance services, and prohibits waiver of this reporting requirement.
responsible_party: Governorâ€™s Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs
stakeholders: Minority business enterprises and State procurement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces detailed reporting requirements, including a new industry category, and enhances oversight and accountability in minority business contracting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could indirectly support economic opportunities for minorities, potentially impacting child poverty.

Title: General Provisions - Commemorative Days - Maryland Veterans Suicide Prevention Day
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to annually proclaim September 30 as Maryland Veterans Suicide Prevention Day.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Governor of Maryland to annually proclaim September 30 as Maryland Veterans Suicide Prevention Day, a day dedicated to remembering veteran suicides, destigmatizing mental health issues, and encouraging veterans to seek help.
responsible_party: Maryland Governor's Office or Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Veterans, their families, service members, and the general Maryland public
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes an annual day of reflection and action focused on veteran suicide prevention, employing a public awareness approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program aims to support mental health among veterans, which could indirectly impact family stability and child well-being.

Title: Maryland Self-Service Storage Act - Sale of Personal Property in Satisfaction of Liens - Means of Advertising
Synopsis: Authorizing an operator or a manager of a self-service storage facility to advertise in a newspaper, by electronic mail, or on a website the sale of the personal property in a self-service storage unit to satisfy a certain lien without the occupant's prior written authorization in the storage agreement; and altering a certain statement that must be contained in a self-service storage facility rental agreement.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland law to allow operators or managers of self-service storage facilities to advertise sales of stored personal property to satisfy liens without prior written permission from the occupant, and specifies permissible advertising methods.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce (implied) or self-service storage operators
stakeholders: Self-service storage facility tenants and operators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of online websites and electronic mail as authorized advertising methods for storage unit sales, modernizing the process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns storage sale procedures.

Title: Public Information Act - Surveillance Images - Illegal Dumping in Baltimore City
Synopsis: Altering a requirement that a custodian deny inspection of certain surveillance images of illegal dumping in Baltimore City to allow inspection by employees or agents of the Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development; and authorizing the Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development to publicly disseminate a surveillance image as part of an investigation.
bill_summary: The bill modifies laws concerning the inspection and dissemination of surveillance images related to illegal dumping in Baltimore City. It allows certain city officials and employees to inspect and publicly disseminate these images under specific circumstances.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore City, city officials, and agencies involved in illegal dumping enforcement
innovative_summary: This bill primarily changes rules about access and sharing of surveillance images, rather than establishing new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Department of Juvenile Services â€“ Report on Shootings (Department of Juvenile Services Transparency Act of 2024)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Juvenile Services to report to the Commission on Juvenile Justice Reform and Emerging and Best Practices and the General Assembly, on or before December 1, 2024, and each December 1 thereafter, certain information regarding shootings of and by juveniles under the supervision of the Department and the actions the Department took after the shooting incidents, including the timeline of the actions.
